27,tech project manager,/en/job/data-ai-architect-9379908,9379908,Data & AI Architect,False,False,9000,11000,SGD,NTT Data Singapore Pte. Ltd.,29-Mar-22,False,,,199304080C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,Raffles Place,"<div>

NTT DATA Group provides its clients world-class IT solutions. Its vast experience in end-to-end solutions for diverse industries, on many different platforms, allows them to deliver measurable results that meet or exceed every expectation. Its IT service portfolio includes business consulting, design, implementation and operation & maintenance support.  NTT DATA’s solution portfolio extends to Industrial package implementation, SAP, Business Intelligence, Financial Service, Cloud Service and Public infrastructures such as custom clearing, geographical information system and etc.

NTT DATA is actively hiring career minded professionals who want to grow with the company that believes in the success of our clients and our employees.  If you are interested, visit us at www.nttdata.com to discover more about us.  We invite qualified applicants for the following position.

","

Responsibilities:

  • The Technical Manager will be leading a team of tech lead, data engineers, BI developers, data scientist and machine learning (ML) developers. The Technical Manager shall be the Subject Matter Expert that would be able to envision, articulate/design, build, deploy and operationalise Big Data + AI / ML solutions, and he/she will be accountable for the overall technology strategy.
  • In this role, the technical manager will be responsible for detailed solution design and technical accelerators such as Proof of Value (POV)/Proof of Concept (POC) projects. He/She will direct technical resources from the team to design and scale cohesive solutions.
  • The technical manager will also work closely with the Sales team to close deals, supporting the team through the full sales process of solutions engineering and presentation, standard and/or customised solutions demonstration, customer workshop, development of proposals and work with the sales team to address RFI/RFP-related queries from customers. In addition, he/she will act as a consultant to the delivery team for development and deployment of solutions so as to ensure smooth transition from post-sales implementation to Go-live stage.

Requirements:

  • Expert level skills in big data technologies like Cloudera Hadoop, SQL Big Data Cluster, HDFS, components of Hadoop like Sqoop/ Hive/ Pig/ Ranger & Spark.
  • Understanding of Cloud technologies for Big Data.
  • Able to create POC projects with limited tools in short time to showcase the intended solution for the client.
  • Have good understanding and hands on for ML development, and possess experience in AI/ML integration to the overall IT infrastructure.
  • Experienced level skills with Design Thinking, Agile and MLOps method.
  • Able to conduct research and development in Computer Vision, Speech Recognition, Natural Language Processing and other related fields.
  • Ability to drive workshop with customer during pre-sales and in-project stages.
  • Able to design and review data architecture, and to create and/or improve algorithm/model performance.
  • Ability to work collaboratively and productively with team.
  • Ability to manage ambiguity, yet producing tangible results.
  • Ability to effectively manage challenging situations without loss of focus when under pressure.

Technical and Professional Expertise:

  • At least 5+ years of relevant industry experience in architecting and solutioning Big Data + AI/ML technologies.
  • Preferably possess a master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence or related discipline.
  • At least completed 3 Big Data + AI/ML projects.
  • At least one major Cloud Certification.
  • Proficiency in at least 1 or more languages such as: R, Python, SPSS.
  • Proficiency in at least 1 or more BI tools such as: PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik.
  • Knowledge of various software technologies, methodologies and applied software engineering practices/standards.
  • Manage critical client impacting events related to solution and engage with delivery, transition etc.

Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

column2: Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Visit www.activate.sg for more info of what we do.","

Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.

We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.

We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.

If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.

Role Summary

The Senior Human Resource (HR) Manager provides HR consulting to the business. He/She liaises with line managers to understand critical requirements, projects future skills demand and collaborates with hiring managers to prioritise requirements. He/She influences business leaders to support the assimilation of new hires into the organisation effectively. He/She guides learning managers to focus on learning programmes to bridge staff capability gaps and build new skills. He/She partners the business in the identification and management of high-potential talent, and the implementation of succession plans. He/She advises on non-monetary benefits options for compensation to align it with workforce needs. He/She manages employee issues and supports line managers in recruitment, onboarding, offboarding and retirement processes.

As the main point of contact between HR and the business, the Senior HR Manager is an excellent communicator who aligns interests among various stakeholders to promote a cooperative and collaborative work environment. He/She adopts a service excellence mindset and is passionate about addressing organisational and employees' needs and issues.

What you will do:

  • Develop plan to deploy organisation's workforce to maximise productivity in pursuit of company's objectives, mission, strategy and plans in consultation with stakeholders
  • Collaborate with line managers to project future skills demand and supply
  • Advise line managers on resource planning options
  • Engage senior management to support organisation development and change interventions
  •  Liaise with employees to evaluate effectiveness of organisation development and change interventions
  • Oversee the HR Team in areas of HR Operations, Internships and programs, Talent Acquisition.
  • Ensure all policies and processes are aligned to the growth and direction of the company’s objectives
  • Recommend sourcing channels to source the right candidates in line with business needs
  • Prioritize critical open positions to be filled in consultation with line managers
  • Guide hiring managers in selection of candidates with right competencies, experience and culture fit through effective screening and assessment processes
  • Advise hiring managers on the principles of fair and unbiased employment selection practices
  • Provide advice to business leaders and managers to position the organisation as an employer of choice to secure candidates
  • Secure involvement of business leaders in the onboarding processes to assimilate new hires effectively
  • Guide onboarding managers to enhance effectiveness of orientation, induction and assimilation programmes
  • Champion the Employee wellness program and ensure it is embedded as bedrock of the company culture
  • Define learning and development needs based on business and staff capability needs
  • Involved in the development of the skills competency and career pathing framework for all job families.
  • Coach employees to refer to career development policy, framework and programmes for career progression in the organisation
  • Guide line managers in their understanding and usage of performance management policy, framework and processes
  • Coach line managers to cascade key performance indicators and performance goals to employees aligned to business requirements
  •  Facilitate talent review sessions with line managers to identify and manage high-performing individuals for mission-critical roles within the organisation
  • Guide senior management to implement succession plans to identify and groom individuals to take over leadership roles within the organisation

What we are looking for:

  •  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human Resources Management or Business
  • At least 8 years of working experience as a Senior HR Manager in High Tech companies
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in HR administration, talent management, compensation & benefits, staff development and HR Systems.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability influence key decision makers
  • Strong sense of responsibility in handling sensitive, confidential matters
  • Demonstrates Empathy and able to balance the needs of the company as well as the employees.
  • Strong Advocate in Employee wellness and wellbeing in the workplace
  • Forward thinking and able to see the big picture
  •  A natural tenacity, resiliency and determination.

What we offer

Benefits:

  • Fun Working Environment
  • Flexi benefits that covers medical, gym, sports and wellness.
  • Employee Wellness Program

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.GovTech is seeking a seasoned Technical Programme Manager to develop the roll-out and adoption strategy for core components of the SG Tech Stack including API and data exchange components. The Programme Manager will engage other related programme/project managers to formulate an overall roll-out and adoption strategy for agencies to adopt the SG Tech Stack. The Programme Manager should have sufficient technical knowledge and strong communication skills to be able to consider various options for incentivising the adoption of the SG Tech Stack.

This opportunity with CODEX, a strategic national project, is an exciting role where you can contribute to the betterment of development capabilities in the Government.

What you will be working on:
  • Think strategically about how many different types of initiatives should be managed and coordinated, and highlight the interdependencies between the projects
  • Create and manage an efficient and agile programme roadmap to deliver SGTS capabilities in a progressive manner
  • Focus on shipping capabilities early and fast to seek customer feedback across multiple projects
  • Seek alignment with central function towards the programme vision whilst taking into consideration of central functional goals and objectives
  • Establish standards for reporting on initiative progress, improve processes to drive efficiency or scale growth
  • Manage stakeholders across technical and non-technical domains, especially around setting delivery expectations of quality and scope and communicating progress
  • Align deliverables to the programmme’s outcome
  • Understand risks to programme delivery and manage them to lower the overall risks
  • Acquire and manage financing and resourcing of the programme to allow delivery to flow seamlessly
  • Lead scrum of scrum teams
  • Define programme KPIs and corresponding measurements
  • Resolve interdependent projects’ higher scope issues / conflict resolution

The role offers a unique opportunity to create pathway for success for Singapore, its citizens and residents.

What we are looking for:

A proven Technical Programme Manager with a track record of leading large-scale programme involving about thirty stakeholders or more across multiple job functions and business divisions. Possess leadership to direct teams along during periods of uncertainty towards delivery targets, and has the ability to balance proactive, strategic thinking with crisp execution and delivery. Likely to have excellent stakeholder management skills. Critical competencies required but are not limited to:

  • Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering, Information Technology, Electronics Engineering or technical discipline equivalent
  • Experience in leading a large-scale technology programme with significant number of stakeholders across multiple functions and divisions
  • Strong stakeholder management balancing both the analytical aspect and the people aspects
  • Excellent communicator in articulating plan at both the executive level and the working level and is an attentive listener to understand needs and issues
  • Strategic, technical thinker to understand and manage the complexity of people and technology
  • Seasoned practitioner of Agile methodologies with a deep appreciation of the software craft and engineers engaging in the craft.
  • Strong business acumen to understand priorities and the business drivers of the priorities
  • Broad awareness and experience in software development following DevOps principles and production support are preferred
  • Experience in project accounting and seeking funding and financing for a programme is a plus

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. ","
Job Description

Team Manager, Identity and Access Management and Automation, Tech Services, Technology and Operations - (WD29027)

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
The suitable candidate will lead and manage a team of engineers and operations specialists in the support of DBS’ enterprise identity and access provisioning infrastructure and operations. He/She will be responsible for the end-to-end strategizing, planning, deployment, operations and development of the bank’s access provisioning framework, infrastructure, processes, and integration with other systems. This individual will manage a team in support of the administration and support of the systems.
Responsibilities
  • Provides vision for identity and access provisioning services, enables innovation, and aligns with industry trends and continuous improvements that enhances the security posture of the bank with regards to identity and access management.
  • Responsible for budgeting, project management, deployment and operations support of new initiatives.
  • Drive the automation and integration of access provisioning infrastructure to other systems to achieve straight through processing and reduce manual work.
  • Responsible for the day-to-day support, monitoring, upgrades, patching, configuration and management of the infrastructure.
  • Provide on-going operations support including management reporting and operations dashboards relating to the governance oversight of privileged accounts and passwords.
  • Identify automation opportunities, drive operational efficiencies and convert such opportunities to initiatives to their implementation.
  • Responsible for overseeing and managing robotic process automation (RPA) initiative for access provisioning.
Requirements
The ideal candidate must be 'hands-on', well organised, risk and compliance focused, and self-driven as this is a fast-paced and highly technical environment. Someone wanting to learn and grow with an organisation will thrive in this role. The role requires excellent prioritisation, responsiveness, along with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Requires 10 or more years of related technical experience in OneIdentity Identity Manager or other similar identity and access provisioning systems, including deployment, configuration, management and support infrastructure components.
  • Experience in .NET language and customization of scripts and code.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise identity and access management, risk management, compliance, governance and control.
  • Strong understanding of key platform OS/databases e.g. Windows, Unix, MSSQL, MariaDB. Prior experience in administering such key platforms is preferred.
  • Prior experience in managing and demonstrated ability to handle all audit matters relating to access management, including internal/external audit and regulators across the region.
  • Knowledge of program and project management methodologies and tools; track record of success in managing IT projects; effective problem-solving abilities; motivated to develop creative solutions to common processes or problems.
  • Able to present complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
  • Prior experience in developing project plans, resource requirements and project cost estimates; ability to deliver projects within budget.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and supervising staff including hiring, performance management, development and counselling.
  • Experience in working in banking environment is preferred.
  • Possess the verbal and written communication skills to work effectively with technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organisation.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Engineering (or similar) OR combination of relevant professional experience and education.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

31,tech project manager,/en/job/associate-program-manager-operations-excellence-4873871/origin/my,4873871,"Associate Program Manager, Operations Excellence",False,False,,,SGD,Flexport Asia Ltd.,13 hours ago,False,,30 days,,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

At Flexport, we believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make it easy and accessible for everyone. We’re shaping the future of a $8.6T industry with solutions powered by innovative technology and exceptional people. Today, companies of all sizes—from emerging brands to Fortune 500s—use Flexport technology to move more than $19B of merchandise across 112 countries a year. 

The recent global supply chain crisis has put Flexport center stage as we continue to play a pivotal role in how goods move around the world. At a valuation of $8 billion, we’re experiencing record growth and are proud to have the support of the best investors in the game who believe in our mission, solutions and people. Ready to tackle global challenges that impact business, society, and the environment? Come join us.

","

The opportunity:

The role of the Associate Program Manager in Operations Excellence is a critical part of making Flexport’s mission a reality. You will play a pivotal role in building and improving the future operating model at Flexport: allowing us to effectively scale to achieve our mission of making global trade easier for everyone. You will be the champion to implement business strategies via leading and managing complex operational projects across multiple function teams, business lines and locations.

You Will:

  • Be the part of a team that is planning, executing, and delivering projects to further ongoing initiatives within the Operational Excellence (OE) team. 
  • Analyze data sets to drive insights making it easier for decision makers to see and understand trends, outliers, and patterns
  • Understand key operational metrics of the business and build appropriate driver based models with the team
  • Become an expert on the project and serve as a trusted advisor to global business stakeholders across the business. 
  • Identify and resolve roadblocks that impede achievement of Flexport goals within the project by collaborating with regional stakeholders and escalating when necessary
  • Learn the business needs and/or workflows involved in your projects (e.g., process and technology requirements, data sources, metrics, mechanisms, risks, key dependencies, any automation/tools, etc.)
  • Design business processes and workflows for a project by independently conducting workshops, user interviews and secondary research using process mapping tools (e.g. Lucid charts)
  • Work closely with the product team to build the product vision for the workstream you are involved in and conduct interviews understand how users interact with product and provide feedback on how to implement technology improvements
  • Measure and monitor each project from inception to delivery, including tracking and communicating status, identifying and tracking cross-functional dependencies, proposing options to mitigate risk and drive issues to resolution

You should have:

  • Experience in business consulting, operational excellence roles or worked in a business operations role in a fast growing tech startup
  • 2+ years of program management experience 
  • Knowledge or experience in supply chain or logistics experience preferred
  • You have the ability to design, develop and implement continuous improvement roadmaps for operating businesses
  • Bachelor’s in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain or Business Degree preferred (Master’s degree a plus)
  • You are data driven and have the ability to accurately assess key business metrics and situations (Experience in SQL or tools like Looker a plus)
  • You are an excellent communicator and have the ability to drive program and project management through your team as well as able to influence change 
  • Experience in translating business requirements into product roadmaps 
  • Proven ability to work with stakeholders across functions to initiative and drive changes.
  • Growth mindset. Courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it.See something broken? Fix it

32,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-program-manager-for-ai-singapore-9428871,9428871,Senior Program Manager for AI Singapore,False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,23 hours ago,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI). 

The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore's AI efforts.

We are looking for a seasoned program marketing professional to develop and run initiatives to grow AI literacy and proficiency amongst students and working professionals in Singapore.  

You must be confident working across multiple stakeholders and agendas, and able to thrive in a hybrid corporate start-up environment and get things done.

  • Design and execute Talent and Certification programs
  • Build leads with public and private organizations to adopt programs
  • Drive partnerships and close deals
  • Create marketing automation enabled campaigns to grow LearnAI subscribers
  • Create metrics and dashboards to demonstrate impact
Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • At least 5 years of experience in business development and portfolio management
COVID-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Office of the Deputy President(Res&Tech)

Department : AI Singapore

Employee Referral Eligible: No

Job requisition ID : 8960

column2: We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!","
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
OVERALL ROLE
The Project Manager is responsible to lead, plan, coordinate and execute projects in interior design and fit-out works for client. Prepare and manage project schedule to ensure delivery of quality projects, within timeline and budget. He will develop, get approval, and ensure implementation of the projects assigned.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Responsible for the planning and co-ordination of renovation, upgrading and refurbishment projects.
  • Liaison with relevant stakeholders (i.e. client, main contractors, design consultants, M&E consultants, etc)
  • Responsible for entire tender process including scoping, tendering, evaluation and awards
  • Coordination for work implementation schedule
  • Execution of contracts on behalf of client,
  • Submission of progress reports and
  • Handling all payment matters related to the projects.
  • Develop and maintain a detailed project schedule which includes administrative tasks and all sites involved in the project.
  • Coordinate and attend meetings with various stakeholders – Business Unit Representatives, contractors and other contractor trades associated with the works concerned.
  • Sites include offices and associated facilities.
  • Prepare budget and tender specs.
  • Maintain good communication with site FM teams, technicians and contractors to assure timely and efficient completion of jobs, proper communication of issues, and proper documentation of the entire process at each job site.
  • Process monthly reports to ensure all schedules run smoothly, all jobs are completed as prescribed, and all invoicing is processed in a timely fashion.
  • Process customer schedules and reports to ensure we are meeting all appropriate customer needs and expectations.
  • Plan, arrange and monitor all delivery arrangements through to fulfillment.
  • Work with Managers to arrange contractors, permits and other special arrangements as needed.
  • Work with Managers to maintain billing, scope, materials, and other job templates.
  • Source and manage contractors for specific sites and projects. This includes, locating, assigning work orders, sending scope and monitoring performance to assure successful completion and proper billing.
  • Schedule project follow up meetings as needed.
CANDIDATE SPECIFICATION:  KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
Ideal Experience
  • A recognised Degree in Project Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture or any equivalent.
  • A minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in project management for the build environment ideally working on projects in financial institution fit out, upgrading and refurbishment.
  • Effective communication skills
  • Team player and ability to adapt in a fast paced environment.

34,tech project manager,/en/job/compliance-manager-9395501,9395501,Compliance Manager,False,False,5000,7000,SGD,ECXX Global Pte Ltd,27-Mar-22,False,,13 days,201833887K,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

ABOUT US

ECXX Global Pte Ltd operates a digital asset exchange platform designed for both professional traders and retail investors. The platform allows users to buy, sell, and store digital assets.

By running on its own in-house proprietary system, ECXX Global is able to run an ecosystem for digital assets with high-liquidity.

With its vision to be the World''s Leading Digital Asset Exchange, the group aims to deliver trustable and secured digital asset trading services, which ensures discretion by protecting client assets with a world-class multi-layer security system.

","

Job scopes

  •  Responsible for overall compliance with the Securities and Futures Act & Payment Services Act, subsidiary legislations, notices and guidelines
  • Review project listings for security token exchange and cryptocurrency exchange are done in accordance with relevant rules and regulations
  • Prepare the suspicious transaction report (STR) for transactions that should be reported
  • Advise stakeholders on AML/CFT process and perform sample review to ensure that different departments such as customer facing functions, operations are performing AML / CFT duties in accordance with relevant rules and regulations
  • Perform ongoing monitoring process and provide AML / CFT trainings
  • Be the contact point for all correspondence with and prepare and submit required reports to regulators 
  • Work closely with the tech team to ensure compliance with MAS technology management guidelines and perform enterprise risk assessment, and report to the senior management 
  • Work closely with the senior management to implement compliance culture and set the tone from the top

Requirements:

  • Degree holder in Business, Finance, Law or related disciplines
  • Minimum 5 years in compliance with a financial institution
  • Must have good working knowledge of regulations such as Securities and Futures Act and/or Payment Services Act and relevant MAS notices and guidelines
  • Experience in liaison with the regulators preferred
  • Experience in different areas of compliance preferred to set up procedure and framework
  • Experience working in digital assets exchange is a plus
  • Professional certificates such as Graduate Diploma in Compliance and AML, CAMS certified

35,tech project manager,/en/job/av-project-manager-9312082,9312082,AV Project Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Rahi Systems Pte. Ltd.,22-Mar-22,False,,14 days,201403281H,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

Rahi Systems delivers solutions and services that maximize the performance, scalability and efficiency of today’s integrated environment. Our team has deep expertise in data center infrastructure, compute, storage, networking and security technologies, as well as end-user computing, A/V and cloud solutions. Founded in 2012 by entrepreneurs with deep understanding of the needs of global enterprises, the company has grown through a solutions- oriented approach, outstanding support and a culture of customer success. Rahi is headquartered in Fremont, Calif., with offices in the U.S., Canada, India, China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Japan, Korea, Singapore, Ireland, the Netherlands, Germany, Turkey and the United Kingdom.

​Interested candidates, kindly click on the “apply now” button. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

","

Rahi Systems is looking to expand our team of motivated, committed, and diligent Audio Video Project Managers. As the mastermind of the project, you will be intimately familiar with the scope, design, labor needs and project schedule. As the enthusiastic and knowledgeable face of the company you will drive project meetings and work with client contacts and trades to ensure dependencies are resolved or on schedule. Internally, you will disseminate information, and coordinate teams to provide the logistics, design, labor, and engineering to make sure your projects run as smoothly and efficiently as possible. 

Even the best plans require contingencies and adaptation and you will thrive in this position if you can think on your feet, and quickly come up with solutions to mitigate challenges and roadblocks. As a proven project leader, you will earn the respect of the team and work closely with your peers and tech leads to drive their teams and projects to success. 

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly become acquainted with the project scope of work, budgets, construction schedules, system designs, and how they drive your project’s needs
  • Read, understand, markup Audio Video (AV) and video teleconferencing (VTC) system drawings and Architectural plan sets and execute accordingly
  • Coordinate the relevant resources for your project by utilizing internal teams (Operations, Logistics, Engineering), Effective communication and engagement with external vendors, clients, and colleagues
  • Generate and manage the internal project schedule, communicate changes with appropriate teams and adjust resources accordingly
  • Obtain site progress reports from field teams, identify issues, and update internal and client teams on status and action items
  • Facilitate client sign off with foremen, tech leads, and engineering as necessary and maintain and develop strong relationships with customer
  • Maintain and distribute project documentation through internal tools
  • Travel to various job sites to meet with clients, attend meetings, and expedite the resolution of escalated issues
  • Resolve all project team questions in a timely manner, delegating, or escalating as necessary
  • Conduct project post-mortems
  • Ensure post-installation documentation is delivered to the customer, for example, user-acceptance tests, sign-offs, inventories, and ‘as-built-drawings and schematics
  • Play a proactive role in the shaping, review and improvement of workflows, internal processes, and procedures to support project and service delivery
  • Strong applicants should be proven leaders, personable, dependable, self-motivated, and strong critical thinkers

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years demonstrated project related experience
  • Proven management of AV-related projects
  • PMP Practitioner or expertise in other similar types of methodologies
  • Understand AV system functionality and installation processes and techniques
  • Comprehension of technical schematics and construction documents (plan sets, symbols, Line Diagrams, Gantt charts)
  • Demonstrate time management skills with attention to detail
  • Effective verbal and written communication with clients, colleagues, and employees; including meeting notes, and action items
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and teams
  • Superb coordination and delegation ability – ensure teams are successful without attempting to do everything themselves
  • VISA and/or Work permit authorizing you to work in the APAC region
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and handle multiple priorities
  • Proficient in: Google Suite, Word, Excel, Outlook, MS Project, Acrobat, and other web-based tools
  • Fluency in English is essential
  • Travel throughout the APAC region is required.
  • The ability to travel between job sites is integral to job performance.

Desirable: 

  • PMP Certification is an advantage
  • CTS certified (CTS-I and CTS-D preferred) is preferred
  • Knowledge and understanding of Current Audio Video Standards
  • Other IT/Networking/Data Center Experience
  • Any current Audio or Video manufacturer certifications
  • Safety Certifications
  • ITIL Foundation or similar qualification
  • 3+ years’ experience as a Project Manager in the construction or technology industries is strongly preferred
  • AV field experience – especially related installation or troubleshooting audio and control systems
  • Service delivery management experience
  • A 2nd language is desirable

VP/AVP, Project & Delivery Manager (Payments), Future Ready Technology, Technology and Operations - (WD28311)
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
What we are looking for

To manage the delivery of complex multi-disciplinary projects within agreed time and budget constraints. To work with users and stakeholders as well as cross-function teams, to determine and manage effective solutions to facilitate the delivery of IT Delivery projects.
Key Accountabilities
  • •Deliver initiatives and/or projects in DBS across all countries
  • Strategic Project GovernanceWork closely with and manage indirect teams from each domain, team members, tech, and stakeholders to monitoring, develop and execute project plans and associated project content.
  • Track project milestones and deliverables. Implement and track key milestones & relevant KPIs to measure success of projects.
  • Keep management and project sponsors abreast of project developments – set up periodic reviews and prepare relevant documents to communicate progress.
Drive project and program delivery
  • Responsible for ensuring project delivery on time on schedule and with quality
  • Effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
  • Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the program, projects and project management community and with other stakeholders if necessary.
  • Resolve issues at the project or line level and escalate issues which cannot be resolved in a timely and accurate manner.
Manage key stakeholders and business and technology leads
  • Manage and communicate effectively with domain leads at senior level and working level teams.
  • Responsible for ensuring project steering committee meetings, cross function meetings and other key project meetings are effective and achieve objectives on a consistent manner.
Change management
  • Ability to drive the adoption of agile methodology across teams
  • Able to work with users to drive changes within the organization for projects implementation
  • Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management. Ensure utilization of standards and practices across all projects.
Job Duties & responsibilities:
  • Work closely with stakeholders and manage both internal and external relations through the project timeline;
  • Analyse requirements and define scope of project as well as objectives to ensure that they are technically feasible;
  • Negotiate with users and stakeholders as necessary;
  • Perform financial management and budgeting for projects;
  • Allocate resources including internal manpower and external vendors for the delivery of the project;
  • Track project progress according to milestones and goals, and manage possible risks;
  • Ensure quality assurance in the software engineering process;
Requirements:
  • At least 5 years of Technical Project Manager experience with gradually increasing responsibilities and a demonstrated understanding of Project Management processes, artifacts and tools
  • A track record as a coach, mentor, and developer of talent
  • Ability to independently manage the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serves as liaison between project management and project team
  • An ability to drive to big picture goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to detail
  • An ability to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints
  • Demonstrated ability in people management, strategic planning, risk management, change management, project management
  • Excellent judgment, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in business process mapping or operational redesign / improvement
  • Experience working with quality management approaches, techniques, and principles to ensure quality
  • Full understanding of software development lifecycle best practices
  • Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project management
  • Self-motivated individual that possesses excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, relationship building skills and ability to achieve results without direct reporting relationshipsStrong oral and written communication skills and the ability to present a polished, professional, and diplomatic image to all stakeholders
  • Strong sense of personal responsibility and accountability for delivering high quality work.

column3: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

column1:
","

Responsibilities

[About ByteDance]

Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

[About the Team]

The Datacenter Infrastructure Engineering team supports the company's fast growth by building and operating hyperscale datacenters. The team manages the end to end lifecycle of server fleet, providing cloud solutions and various infrastructure services ensuring that they are scalable and are reliable.

[Responsibilities]

As a technical program manager on the infrastructure engineering team, you will drive critical infrastructure initiatives in partnership with business stakeholders and across ByteDance engineering organizations. You see programs through from inception to the hands of the customer ensuring effective communication and timely, high quality delivery.

  • Drive strategic, cross-functional initiatives.
  • Drive all aspects of program management (planning incorporating dependencies, key milestones and deliverables, data gathering, analysis, communication, risk management and mitigation, status tracking and reporting, implementation, monitoring, execution, and delivery of the initiative/program.
  • Influence and collaborate across organizations including engineering, product, security, legal, compliance, finance, and more to effectively build commitment with execution teams, negotiate competing requirements, ensure alignment and program progress, and improve processes.
  • Communicate program plans and risks and issues to stakeholders.
  • Partner with leadership to identify and solve cross-functional challenges.

Qualifications

[Minimum Qualifications]

  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical field with 5+ yrs of relevant project management experience driving complex, cross functional technical programs
  • Experience with project management tools including Confluence, Jira, and Asana
  • Familiar with infrastructure technologies including cloud, datacenter, networking, etc.
  • Strong ability to influence and partner with stakeholders across multiple organizations to ensure alignment, mitigate risks, manage competing priorities, and allocate resources
  • Excellent oral and written communication

[Preferred Qualifications]

  • Experience in software development
  • Experience in improving operational efficiencies
  • Independent, critical thinking to navigate through ambiguity from a vague problem to a detailed solution.
  • Self-motivated and proactive with a proven ability to adapt well in a fast paced tech company and collaborate closely with teams on different operating cadences.
  • Detail-oriented and able to understand the bigger picture by using your technical expertise and problem solving abilities to prioritize and manage key challenges.

About our group:
The CSG material group focuses on integrated material management, timely monitoring all aspects level components dynamic changing to fulfill the end-customer requirement. We aim to build a solid material base with professional material insights. Our team possesses a strong cohesive and optimistic mind to embrace challenges in the fast-changing market.
We are looking for an experienced Materials Manager to manage inventory and components supply management at suppliers in addition, to other supplies. The Materials managers would be a specialist in supply chain and inventory control. They play an integral part by providing excellent analysis and record-keeping skills; meticulous with the ability to problem-solve looking from a big picture in terms of overall planning to minor details. The ultimate goal is to ensure our operations would be best supported with an adequate flow of the materials needed.

We welcome seasoned Material Managers to apply as this is a new team setup that plays a critical role in the success of the company’s future strategies as SCM holds significant importance in this everchanging new norm. The High-tech industry has seen a significant focus on SCM in the new-norm, this proves many growth opportunities with Seagate.
About the role - you will:
  • Initiate & manage programs and projects leading to structural supply chain improvements
  • Define the risks of the project and develops scenarios to overcome these risks
  • Act as a Supply Chain Business Process Expert, supporting and sharing knowledge/Best Practices with cross-functional team
  • Automate various analysis reports through active excel formulas like (macros, vLookUp, & etc...)
  • Using the above, develop insightful recommendations and actions through the active collection of market data & analysis.
  • Manage and direct external resources (e.g., subcontractors).
About you:
  • A degree holder in related fields or disciplines
  • 5 years’ experience in production planning, logistics, inventory management, etc.
  • The candidate must be able to communicate effectively with Mandarin Speaking counterparts.
  • The ideal candidate must be proficient in MS Excel (Macros, vLookUp & etc...)
Your experience includes:
  • Strong Planning/Organizing/Analytical skills, leadership experience in supply chain management
  • Strong experience with supply chain improvement projects
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills and leadership
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Organized and disciplined.
Location:
The Shugart site (named after Seagate’s founder, Al Shugart) is a research and design center. Easily accessible from the One-North MRT Station, many employees choose to take mass transportation to work. Ample free on-site parking is also available. Being a purpose-built building, The Shugart has excellent employee recreational facilities. Take an active break at our badminton courts, table tennis tables, in-house gym, and recreation rooms. Our yoga and Zumba classes are very popular. We also offer classes and interest groups in photography, gardening, and foreign languages, and have various on-site celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.

column3: APBA TG Human Resource Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of the TG Group)

TG Group (“TG”) is a global workforce solutions provider with an international reach in over 50 markets across the globe. Headquartered in Singapore with Shanghai Foreign Service (Group) Co Ltd (""FSG"") as a strategic shareholder, TG delivers a comprehensive suite of innovative human capital solutions to help our clients achieve greater business success.

TG adopts a future-centric approach where we aspire to be at the forefront of the evolution of the future of work. We believe that human capital is the greatest asset to any institution. With a wealth of experience in the Human Resources (HR) industry, we combine our international expertise and local know-how to deliver bespoke and innovative workforce solutions.

Our diverse portfolio of client-centric workforce solutions includes Contingent Workforce Management (CWM), Business Process Outsourcing (BPO), Permanent Placements, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO), Professional Employer Organisation (PEO), and Payroll Process Outsourcing (PPO).
We deliver workforce solutions in over 50 countries.

SunningdaleTech Ltd is a leading precision tooling, plastics injection moulding and precision assembly company providing a broad spectrum of capabilities that include product & mould designs, mould fabrications, ultra-precision high cavitations toolings, precision injection moulding with finishing processes like spray painting and laser etching, through to precision assembly of complete products.

Boosting a strong presence in Singapore, Malaysia, China, Indonesia and Mexico, Sunningdale Tech has a total factory space of more that 1.6 million sq feet, with more than 550 injection molding machines and a tooling capacity of 2,500 molds per year; we are focusing on serving four key business segments including Automotive, Consumer/IT/Environment, Healthcare and Tooling.

We believe that our employees are our most important asset.  As an employee, you’ll benefit from an environment of engaged colleagues, thought leadership, and opportunities for career advancement and recognition.
Be part of the leading high-precision engineering and manufacturing technologies!

43,tech project manager,/en/job/business-development-lead-9330844,9330844,Business Development Lead,False,False,,,SGD,Hubble.sg,29-Mar-22,False,,,201606906Z,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div>

Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources.

Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.

Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come.
Visit us at www.hubble.sg to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

","

Who are we looking for:

We are looking for a tech savvy Business Development Lead with at least 8 years experience in enterprise B2B solutioning sales. You think digital first and have deep experiences in software products. You are positive, high energy, and possess exceptional relationship building skills.  You are an expert in the sales process and strategy of enterprise B2B SaaS companies and have deep knowledge of CAC/CLV/MRR/ARR and love diving deep into cohort analysis. You have existing relationships with channel partners and can quickly scale up our channel distribution networks. You are both a strategic thinker and a hands on executor who leads by example. Most importantly, you have a proven track record in achieving individual revenue targets and managing a team to achieve the team revenue targets. You should feel comfortable and aspire to be a hunter NOT a farmer.

What will you be doing:

To succeed in this role you will need to be an independent self-starter. You will be in charge of all commercial and contract negotiations as well as establishing and managing channel partners. You must be comfortable in doing product demonstrations and presenting to large audiences. You must be an expert in preparing written proposals and doing up presentations to win the deals.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with our clients, proposing innovative solutions to improve their operations and empower data-driven management decisions through strategic use of technology
  • Take charge of client acquisition and create new business opportunities to maintain the company’s relevance and competitive edge
  • Further Hubble’s growth by exploring potential prospects, pursuing new leads, and taking charge of deal-making, repeat-sales and partnerships
  • Conduct market share analysis to develop revenue growth strategies
  • Develop a comprehensive understanding of client pain points and communicate user requirements to improve our product offerings
  • Contribute to defining and establishing Hubble as a leading regional company
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships with key partners and executive sponsors
  • Develop and establish key channel partners in target areas.
  • Managing and growing key customer accounts, and coordinating the management of all other accounts.

What we need from you:

  • Eligible to work in Singapore without sponsorship
  • At least 8 years of experience in enterprise B2B sales and have demonstrated ability to navigate complex multiple stakeholder deal environment
  • Bachelor's degree with good academic results preferred
  • Ability to generate leads and identify strategic areas for growth 
  • Independent, focused and driven
  • Excellent at developing proposals and presentation slide
  • Expertise in CRM such as Hubspot, Salesforce etc
  • Enjoy solving complex problems with technology

About Hubble

Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources.

Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform.

Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come.

What Hubble will give you:

Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you.

Who will you be working with:

If you connect with any of the description below, please apply immediately:

  • Purpose driven
  • Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated
  • Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy
  • Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny
  • Determined, perseverance, and hard working
  • Creative, innovative, out of the box

Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble.

Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

AVP/Senior Associate, Program Manager, Regional Operations Transformation & Communications, Technology & Operations - (WD31692)

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities:
  • Drive Operations Journey Program Strategy (Regulatory & Internal Reporting employee journey etc) and institute strong Journey Thinking culture and mindset through effective communication, collaboration and engagement with all internal & external stakeholders
  • Oversight of Operations Reporting Journey program management & governance to ensure Journey progresses through the 4D phases in accordance to agreed timeline and outcomes
  • Drive adoption and implementation of Employee Journey (EJ) design standards, reusable architecture and employee digital experience framework for employee workbenches and workflows
  • Cross-functional collaboration with Ops, Tech, EJ Council & SG COO to drive key programs (Reporting, Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP), SG Go-To-Model etc) outcomes across locations (when applicable)
  • Organize and lead Reporting Journey cadences & ensure regular sponsor updates on Reporting Journey progress
  • Close partnership and collaboration with Group Transformation, Data Steward community, Report Owners and the CDO Data Management Team in the formation of Regulatory Reporting Project Steering Committee to identify regulatory report inventory / landscape opportunities and drive alignment of platform backlogs to book of work for strong delivery of regulatory reporting project outcomes
  • Establish a golden source of truth to ensure required Ops data for reporting is integrated into Control Tower for actionable insights as part of Ops DDOM construct
  • Play the role of a Journey lead/coach to drive synergies and best practice sharing of Journey thinking across operation regional functions
  • Co-ordinate and gather the required support from the requisite resources and SMEs across Ops functions to contribute to regulatory report solutioning
  • Ensure regular communication of Journey progress & outcomes to T&O community regionally as part of T&O employee obsession agenda
Requirements:
  • Degree holder with minimum 5-6 years of experience in managing Customer/Employee Journeys as Journey lead and/or Journey Coach
  • Experience in running AGILE sprints and knowledge in Ops reporting (Internal & Regulatory) is preferred
  • Familiarity with Institutional Banking Operations, Consumer Banking Operations, Treasury & Markets Operations will be an advantage
  • Self-starter, meticulous and analytical. Excellent program management skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skill and the ability to understand a broad range of operational issues
  • Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word
  • Good team player with strong inter-personal and communication skills
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements.

Adecco is partnering with a leading American technology multinational company.

The Talent

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4+ years' experience in marketing communications, event management or cross-cultural communications.
  • Excellent project management skills.
  • Experience in B2B hybrid (physical and digital) events management and working with multiple vendors / event management agencies across regions will be preferred.

The Opportunity

  • Oversee company's developer marketing events across Southeast Asia, Australia and New Zealand.
  • Provides strategy for marketing events and collaborate with cross-functional teams and event agencies to deliver high quality developer outreach events, with the responsibilities including but not limited to:

  • Pre-event planning
  • Physical and digital event flow design
  • Event promotion

Job Description

The project manager is overall responsible for planning and to oversee the entire project from inception to completion by ensuring the necessary co-ordination with various stakeholders.

This includes also maintaining and forecasting project budgets to closing the final account.

  • Liaise with internal and external project stakeholders, like main-contractors or owners and sub-contractors, safety departments as well as complying to BCA / MOM regulations.

Siemens is a global technology powerhouse that has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality, reliability and internationality for more than 165 years. The company is active in more than 200 countries, focusing on the areas of electrification, automation and digitalization; and employs around 360,000 employees.

Established in Singapore since 1908, Siemens is one of the largest European companies here with five companies and employs around 2,000 people. We have contributed to many of the country’s key infrastructure projects, and have been setting the pace of growth and development for this island-nation with cutting-edge solutions and technologies. Please visit our website for more information – www.siemens.com.sg

At Siemens, we are on a constant search for bright and innovative minds to fill our ranks. If you are a fast learner, creative, able to work with multi-cultural and multi-discipline teams and have a strong desire to be a winner, we dare you to test your limits with Siemens. We are currently looking for:

","
Responsibilities:
Review project specifications, drawings, and project-specific documents to establish project intent.
Develop and maintain a project schedule and coordinate needs with the project team. Identify time-sensitive installation needs.
Manage the requisition of supplies and materials to complete projects.
Review plans and specifications and participate in project cost reviews.
Able to shortlist and contract of subcontractors’ scope.
Conduct an orientation for project technicians and provide all necessary project documentation, including scope of work, drawings, applicable specifications, application-engineered drawings, project contacts, etc.
Track resources and project progress.
Document project events that impact the schedule, scope of work, and project efficiency.
Pursue project-specific change-order opportunities.
Coordinate and pursue project-specific billing, coordinate with Commercial team.
Schedule project-specific commissioning resources and provide commissioning documentation.
Expedite the return of project-specific mark-ups for as-built development.

Required Education and Experience:

Knowledge and understanding Digital Engineering processes, Management of Common Data Environment and Data Standard; ability to read and understand IT network topology.
Knowledge of industry-standard communication protocols such as Ethernet, Modbus, and BACnet
Ability to work in a team environment providing dedicated support to our customers
Proficient in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project
Good verbal and written communication skills in English
Travelling in ASEAN when require.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

column3: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Responsibilities

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

The TikTok Creator Marketplace is the official platform for brand and creator collaborations on TikTok under TikTok Creator Marketing Solutions. This role is part of the regional Growth Strategy function which drives overall health of the business as it scales product/services with GTM operations in the region; involving growth marketing, performance management, budgeting, strategic initiatives, and overall program management.

Responsibilities

  • Cultivate business and performance reporting framework for APAC markets with emphasis on regional impact, and opportunities for client facing teams.
  • Initiate insights and goal setting from demand and supply perspective for the Creator Marketplace to own business reviews at a regular cadence.
  • Publish regional competitor/aggregator landscape report across all APAC markets with actionable insights and learnings to drive a global GTM operational approach.
  • Institute program management frameworks for our newly formed APAC team to drive efficient stakeholder collaboration and decision-making on large-scale projects.
  • Support GTM initiatives from a regional operations stand-point to launch and scale creator first product/services.
  • Support growth marketing campaigns, budgeting, and strategic finance deal desks.

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of experience in Business Analytics, Project Management, Strategic Finance or similar disciplines. Experience working in Tech or Consulting will be preferred.
  • Comfortable with large data sets, dashboarding and BI tools.
  • A builder mindset with an ability to be attention to detail, analytical and output driven.
  • Demonstrated ability to be adaptable in early stage set-ups while being effective in collaborating with multiple cross-functional teams.
  • Passion for creator economy, marketplace platforms, and project management to scale processes.

column2:
TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.","

About Us

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, Moscow, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

We are looking for an Talent Acquisition Program Manager who is eager to help ensure our processes are compliant internally and externally, wants to be part of the piece to improve our operational efficiency, and can commit to a 1 year contract.

Responsibilities

- First-tier support for administrative tasks and execution of HR related matters.

- Assist in the preparation of documentation and recruitment data/reports

- Exercise judgment and discretion to determine appropriate actions or solutions to problems.

- Partner with recruiters and sourcers to ensure a deep understanding of fullcyle recruitment and find ways to value add to the processes.

- Identify opportunities for processes to be improved and enhanced for efficiency

- Any other general administrative duties/ad-hoc projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Minimum Qualifications

- Experience in a fast-paced, high growth Tech company.

- Understanding of Singapore employment hiring practices

- 1+ years of People Operations/Human Resources related experience.

- Fast learner, and ability to digest instructions and connect the dots with logical thinking

- Experience with HRIS systems will be an added advantage

- Experience as an HR Generalist.

- Basic knowledge of excel formulas and data processing and analysis

- Ability to cope well with ambiguity and change in a dynamic environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Responsibilities

About ByteDance

Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

About the Team

The Datacenter Development team is responsible for site selection, acquisition and delivery. As the Data Center and Network Business Development Manager, you would be responsible for the following:

Responsibilities

  • Formulating of our Data Center site selection strategy.
  • Working with our Data Center tech team, network team, finance/legal/tax and policy team to perform data center capacity planning, network procurement, design, evaluation, construction and project management.
  • Work with external stakeholders and vendors to support feasibility discussions and contract negotiations with power grids, economic development agencies, public utility companies.
  • Responsible for backbone networks and internet business development, including but not limited to private line, peering, IPT, anti-ddos.
  • Responsible for sourcing and maintaining relationship with carriers, Data Center suppliers; focuses on commits in contract and SLA, expanding or creating agreements to maintain and expand existing data center size, network size.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in any relevant field.
  • 4+ years of total experience in OTT, Cloud or Communications industry, with prior experience working in Data Centers or Carriers.
  • Experienced in related industry + familiar with market trends and business practices of data center, cloud computing, cloud storage, backbone, cross-border network.
  • Prior experience working with data centers and carriers in the APAC region in a commercial or business development capacity.
  • Proven experience in business analysis ability, finance/cost analysis ability, have contract negotiation experience.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Excellent cross functional stakeholder management and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong logical ability, structured and detailed though process.
  • Strong organization and coordination skills with excellent problem solving ability.
  • Self-motivated and able to work under high pressure and constraint time, committed and process oriented
