column1: 74,tech project manager,/en/job/manager-special-projects-9416747,9416747,"Manager, Special Projects",False,False,3500,5000,SGD,Carro Singapore,26-Mar-22,False,,1 day,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

CARRO is looking for a resourceful and driven individual who is unafraid of challenges, endeavours to break the mould and dares to venture into uncharted waters. If you are audacious enough to go

against the grain and push beyond limits, you’d be a great fit for our team!

WHO WE ARE

As Southeast Asia's largest tech-driven automotive marketplace,CARRO offers an all-rounded, full-stack, innovative and technology-driven car ownership service. Being one of the most funded

automotive startups in the region, CARRO relentlessly disrupts industry conventions, reimagining business models that enhance the needs of constantly evolving car consumers.

WHAT WE DO

CARRO Singapore’s Marketplace includes but is not limited to:

C2B - Helping car owners get the best value for their cars

● Connecting car sellers seamlessly to both individual buyers and industry dealers, facilitating as a conduit through which both parties can achieve maximum value for their car goals

B2C - Buying a car made convenient and contactless

● Bringing car viewing and purchase out of the conventional car dealership showroom and into the realm of everyday convenience for customers through our latest Lock / Unlock technology

via #ShowroomAnywhere

LEAP - An accessible and affordable alternative to car ownership

● Empowering customers with financial flexibility through a commitment-free and affordable alternative to car ownership in Singapore

UBI (Usage Based Insurance) with NTUC Income - A new normal for car insurance

● Providing greater transparency and ensuring fairness in car insurance payments for drivers as they are only charged based on their exact usage

WHY JOIN US

Always at the forefront of the automotive industry, we’re constantly looking to challenge the conventional ways of car ownership with novel ideas fuelled by our expertise in technology.

With grit and a passion for cars and technology, we’re always on the lookout for changemakers to join our team of dynamic individuals who thrive on taking on challenges and delivering results!

If you’re a go-getter with grit and tenacity, join us for an adventure that might bring you to our offices in Southeast Asia (Malaysia, Indonesia and Thailand) and perhaps even beyond!

At CARRO, you’ll be offered a plethora of opportunities for learning/unlearning, growth, execution and development. If you want to participate in an environment that values your opinion, seeks to develop

and stretch your professional capacity, apply now!

Responsibilities

  • Innovate, implement and execute strategies to accelerate business expansion
  • Collaborate well in a team and across cross-functional teams within CARRO to scope product requirements, bridging gaps and aligning all teams involved
  • Play a crucial role in managing timelines and mitigating risks in the line of business, while building a remarkable reputation for our brand
  • Establish key business strategy processes and frameworks to meet stipulated KPI
  • Develop and motivate high-performing teams through coaching, challenging opportunities and recognizing the impact made by team members
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest automotive trends and devise innovative technological solutions to incorporate into new or existing products and services
  • Report directly to and work closely with the Head of Business, Singapore

Requirements

  • Interested applicants must send over a mandatory cover letter with a resume
  • Multi-faceted, highly adaptable and goal oriented with a tenacious drive to succeed
  • Able to convince relevant stakeholders
  • Able to work independently and take charge of objectives to deliver results
  • Excellent attention to detail and responsibility towards ownership of deliverables
  • Outstanding communication, presentation, organizational and time management skills
  • Able to work in a dynamic and fast paced environment, comfortable delivering exceptional work within tight deadlines
  • Highly resourceful, business savvy and consumer focused with strong analytical and strategic thinking skills
  • Some experience would be ideal, but a clear and effective communication of ideas and translation of concepts is a non-negotiable requirement

column3: Noel Gifts International Ltd (Noel Gifts) is the leading hampers, flowers and gifts company with an extensive offering of chic floral arrangements and gifting ideas for the stylish and discerning.

Over the past 42 years, the company has been Bringing People Closer with premium quality gift selections for all occasions. Since its inception in 1975, the company began business under the name ""Noel Commerce"" as a year-end hamper packaging company. In 1982, the company expanded to incorporate a flower business and was renamed ""Noel Hampers and Gifts Pte Ltd"" a year later. In 1993, the company was renamed ""Noel Gifts International Ltd"" due to steady growth of the business. In the same year, the company also became a public listed company on the second board of Singapore Stock Exchange, SESDAQ. In 2008, Noel Gifts was listed on the SGX Mainboard.

As testament of our distinct marketing efforts to build a consistent Noel brand image, we have won the Singapore Prestige Brand Award (SPBA) 2012 – Heritage Brands category, which seeks to recognise time-honored home-grown brands that have displayed exceptional brand practices for more than 30 years. This latest win also recognises Noel for winning the award for three consecutive years and hence inducted Noel to the SPBA Hall of Fame. Entries for the SPBA 2012 – Heritage Brands award category were judged based on factors such as brand heritage and identity. It focuses on background information and history of the brand; brand strategic blueprint, which is about the brand’s ideology, vision and mission, its promise; and brand development and performance over the years. A total of 49 brands were recognised in various categories in the SPBA 2012. The categories include the Promising Brands, Established Brands, CIMB Regional Brands, Special Merit and Heritage Brands awards. Noel joined 10 other brands that were honored in the Heritage Brands category.

In 2015, Noel Gifts was honoured with two National Projects. We were the official vendor for the SG50 Baby Jubilee Gift project, a community initiative spearheaded by National Population and Talent Division. Noel Gifts contributed to the design, packaging, distribution and sourcing of materials for the Gifts. We were also appointed by Monetary Authority of Singapore as the exclusive marketing agent to design the packaging and market the SG50 Numismatic Currency Collection.

column2:
Till today, Noel Gifts remains true to its core values, and continues living its vision of Bringing People Closer, Making Everyday Better.","

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

VP/AVP, Regional Digital Product Manager, Consumer Banking Group (CBG) - (WD34271)

Business Function 
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. 
Responsibilities
  • As a Digital Product Manager, this role will be part of the Regional Consumer Investments Product team, looking to launch digital portfolio solutions in our regional markets, as well as continue to develop and grow our robo-investing solutions in Singapore. Candidate will work closely with investment product teams across the region to understand and tailor the solution to the local regulatory environment / customer needs, as well as channels, delivery and technology teams to build and launch digital portfolios and other enhancements around the region.
1. Project management and implementation
  • Launch new initiatives / enhancements to market by acting as business project manager – work with key stakeholders in Product, Technology, Compliance, Finance, Operations, Digi, UX, etc.
  • Act as Agile product owner to define and prioritise product features, develop business requirements, facilitate user story elaboration and backlog grooming.
  • Lead engagement of cross-functional teams (whether business or tech) where there are product dependencies (interfaces, data, clarification, etc).
  • Report on project progress, problems, solutions to stakeholders.
2. Product development
  • Develop deep knowledge of the competitor landscape (both direct and indirect competitors) to develop competitive advantage and continuously refine our product proposition for each of the markets.
  • Work with in-country product managers to design the product proposition, incorporating local flavour and regulatory requirements.
3. Customer proposition
  • Drive customer journey development and improvements.
  • Work with other stakeholders on customer engagement including developing a data-driven operating model and customer life cycle engagement.
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree with at least 5 years of experience in project management and implementation.
  • Understands Technology well and has worked closely with Tech teams.
  • Experienced in working with, or an interest in Agile methodology.
  • Possesses strong interpersonal, influencing and problem solving skills, with a collaborative mind-set and ability to manage both external and internal stakeholders.
  • Passionate about the customer experience and our mission of making investments accessible, simple, cost-effective and convenient.
  • Experienced in the investments / product management is a plus, with a keen understanding of investment. products and/ or portfolio management, customers’ investment needs, legal / regulatory requirement.
Apply Now
  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of more than $20 billion and approximately 75,000 employees globally. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, deliver medicines to market and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services – we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive services.
Position Summary:
  • The Installation Project Manager (IPM) is responsible for planning and execution of system installations of Electron
  • Microscopes in a region and supports the regional organization with his project management skills.
  • The IPM oversees all systems under install in a region and makes sure each has followed the steps of the installation process.
  • He/She takes ownership of the end-to-end order fulfillment from PO, until the customer sign-off and start of warranty.
  • On occasion also customer interaction is part of the (bigger) projects.
  • For the execution he/she is supported by the Regional Service team who provide the resources for the projects. Also 3rd party items are under control of the overall planning and execution.
  • The IPM is responsible for the financial DIR targets as well as the Installation related KPI’s. Also acts as main contact person (spider in the web) for the region and go to person for all installation related items.
  • The IPM reports to the Global Manager Installations and has a dotted line to the regional Field Service director in his region, actively working with the Field Service Managers/Supervisors
Key Responsibilities:
Together with the regional executers he/she makes sure every project follows the steps of the Installation Process and ensures all steps are done. This consist of:
  • Setting and maintaining the installation plan per project including status updates
  • Interaction with all involved parties in installation
  • Site readiness
  • Creates clear understanding in expectations with customers. (Start with the end in sight)
  • Config Check’s (incl NSR’s) and align these with needed resources.
  • TDA’s Management
  • Triggers Region on training skills for FSE’s on upcoming projects
Installation Margin P&L
  • Secures the service installation margin by controlling costs per project
  • Escalates projects on Margin loss
DIR management per Quarter
  • Setting Forecast and manages to achieve this
  • Supports escalation on technical issues
  • Escalates commercial mismatches to Sales and BU’s timely
Controls the I&W KPI’s with a region
  • Escalated and drives RCCM’s
  • Feedback to CIP teams on needed improvements
  • Customer Allegiance Score responsible for installations
Requirements/Experience:
  • The ideal candidate has a technical bachelor’s degree with +/- 5 years’ experience in the high-tech industry and preferably the service business.
  • Proven experience and background in Project management preferably with courses/degree in project management. (IPMA, etc)
  • Excellent written en verbal skills in English, other languages are a plus. (for APJ Mandarin is preferred)
  • Ability to effectively communicate with and managing the deliverables cross functional and cross-cultural teams, with customers and/or other involved parties in a project.
  • Builds trust and encourages respect to internal teams as well as customers.
  • Possess problem solving skills. Can influence others and negotiates to solutions.
  • Quick learner in understanding business processes and in the customers business. Flexible attitude, always ready to jump into operational issues which pop -up and needs solutions.
  • Highly motivated and driven to achieve goals, does not take “no” as an answer.
  • Looks critical to processes and can improve these.
  • Computer skills CRM, MS Projects MS Office
  • Travel on occasion to customers and internal TFS offices. (10-15%)

78,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-manager-r-d-innovations-devices-9430904,9430904,"Senior Manager, R&D Innovations (Devices)",False,True,,,SGD,,5 hours ago,False,,,,,,,,,"
A company that was incorporated in 2009 and commenced operations in Singapore, with our core business in sales and distribution of FMCG products.
In line with the business expansion program, we are now seeking for qualified and dynamic professional to join our family and grow with us!
Our MISSION statement
1. To make a difference through our people, working together across boundaries.
2. Be righteous by upholding the highest standards of integrity in all our actions.
3. We encourage development and reward performance.
","
JOB SUMMARY;
Incumbent assists and reports to the Product Development Director / assigned Senior Management in the day-to-day product development research and testing activities including document its processes documentation.

Design electronic components, software, products, or systems for commercial, FMCG products and its applications. The person will design, plan, test and develop applications, modifications for electronic properties used in parts and systems to improve technical performance as well as supervising production process in ensuring its performance and quality.

Incumbent is responsible for the planning and coordination of the entire research & development process from managing staffing, coaching, and training, scheduling R&D prototypes runs, ensure adequate materials are available, and ensuring electrical components are in good working condition in supporting of demand/delivery schedules.
JOB RESPONSIBLITIES;
  • Lead and coach a team of Engineers in oversee the R&D laboratory and inventory management controls
  • Spearhead new innovations, research & development in technology advancement and excellence.
  • Evaluates and enhance electrical systems, products, components, and applications
  • Designing and conducting research programs; applying knowledge of electricity and materials
  • Confirms system's and components' capabilities by designing testing methods, testing properties.
  • Develops electrical products by studying requirements; research, testing and assembly methods.
  • Assures product quality by designing electrical testing methods, testing finished products, products capabilities, and customers users experience
  • Prepares product reports by collecting, analysing, summarizing information and trends
  • Provides engineering information and solutions for devices.
  • Establish workshop/laboratory process, workflow, processes and materials inventory controls
  • Maintains product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations
  • Keeps equipment operational by establishing manufacturer's instructions
  • Established procedures; to end user for requesting repair services
  • Develop improvements to system level risk analysis to ensure system risks are identified and mitigated at the earliest opportunity
  • Assume responsibility to identify and implement preventive measures to improve product effectiveness
  • Ensure relevant priorities, schedules, goals for the business unit, ensure functional expectations are met
  • Lead new product development lifecycle per design control procedures.
  • Assume prime responsibility for product transfer tasks and projects and lead continuous improvement and sustaining projects.
  • Completes projects by providing training and guidance to technicians as well as provide technical guidance and training supports to cross-functional teams
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
  • Able to adopt a philosophy of continual improvement and constantly identify / propose higher efficiency and enhance quality of the finished product.
  • Ability to troubleshoot any problems that occur in the production process.
  • Any other ad hoc responsibility tasked by Senior Management
JOB REQUIREMENTS; 
  • Degree in Engineering (Mechanical/Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent
  • At least 8 years of experience at similar capacity in leading an engineering team
  • Proven knowledge and experience in project management and technology development
  • Strong leadership with ability to drive, execute, and problem-solving abilities to meet engineering, operational and business goals.
  • Strong experience with electrical and electronic components and devices
  • Multi-national corporations work exposure with strong ability to work with regional and headquarter team for results
  • Strategic long-term thinking developed through continued expansion of engineering capability and growth in the business by aligning with the company strategy
  • Excellent working knowledge of product development processes and tools - design reviews, PLC, NPI processes, Engineering Change Management, Documentation etc.
  • Proven experience as a research & development manager with good supervisory and teamwork skills in a fast faced and challenging environment
  • An inquiring mind, intense curiosity, and strong desire to innovate in electrical devices/related field
  • Have good knowledge in Electronics/Electrical Troubleshooting, Electronic testing, and Design
  • Project Management, Quality Focus, Database Design, analysing information etc.
  • Efficiency in reporting research results, attentive to detail, emphasizing excellence in Innovation
  • Able to multi-task, meet deadlines with demonstrated ability to drive improvement and innovation from research to production prototypes.
  • Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills
",[],Senior Manager,,8 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9430904&advertisement_id=9429275&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70170,Central,sg

The company focuses on promoting its Business-to-Business portfolio, such as in the field of energy solutions, whilst maintaining solid Business-to-Consumer growth, in line with the group’s global direction.

The region has 45 manufacturing sites, which hold as a key hub for Panasonic’s global production activities supporting the consumer, solutions and components and devices business. Panasonic Asia Pacific will continue to promote green innovation and reduce its regional carbon dioxide emissions footprint in support of Panasonic’s global eco initiatives.

81,tech project manager,/en/job/manager-nhris-digital-technology-9423826,9423826,"Manager, NHRIS Digital Technology",False,False,4800,9600,SGD,National Heart Centre Singapore,29-Mar-22,False,,,199801148C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

The National Heart Centre Singapore (NHCS) is a national and regional referral centre for cardiovascular diseases. It provides one-stop comprehensive preventive, diagnostic, therapeutic and rehabilitative cardiac services for heart patients.

Each year, NHCS handles over 120,000 outpatient consultations, 9,000 interventional and surgical procedures and 10,000 inpatients. Its clinical outcomes for heart attack treatment, balloon angioplasty with stenting and coronary bypass surgery have been shown to be equivalent to international standards.
Established in 1998, NHCS is the pioneer in cardiovascular care in Singapore.

","

This role will support and manage the current MedTech and Digital Tech projects in the Cardiovascular Engineering Technologies Theme and Data, Digital Tech & AI Core in National Heart Research Institute Singapore (NHRIS). This will include project planning, experiments and research work, applying and managing research funds, publications, presentations and intellectual property (IP)/agreement matters.

The applicant will be involved in the design, development and evaluation of MedTech solutions, and are required to assist and support NHRIS’s research & development work. Job scope will also include attending to meetings and responsibilities to NHCS and SingHealth innovation initiatives, working with rest of the NHRIS Scientific Cores and Themes, SingHealth, external parties and industry for current or new projects. The selected candidate will be offered employment on 2-year renewable contractual terms.

Requirements: 

  • Bachelor Degree in Engineering with at least 4 years’ MedTech/innovation related experience
  • Strong understanding of the Biodesign methodology and medical device product development cycle, especially in the cardiovascular and peripheral space
  • Demonstrated strong capability and clear understanding of international innovation and local research funding landscapes
  • Basic understanding and experience with machine learning/AI in clinical setting and data science projects
  • Meticulous and demonstrated strong documentation, technical writing and oral communication skills
  • Highly motivated with strong problem-solving, organisational, analytical and critical thinking skills
  • A team player and able to work in a fast-paced environment

Description

A globally-recognised institution is seeking a people-oriented individual at the group level to lead in their system integration and transition to a one-stop system, ensuring a seamless user journey. To be successful, you will become the conduit between the various departments and their internal tech team.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the senior management of the Group, you will become a partner to both the tech project management team and heads of the departments/ business units. From your close understanding of the department needs along with understanding of the end-user, you will steer project schedule, budget, activities and resources to ensure the project is delivered on time and within budget. Following the launch, you would be responsible in optimising the platform, maintaining its' relevance to the business changing needs.

Requirements
The successful candidate will have at least 10 years' experience, overseeing system transition or system integration. You will be eloquent with excellent stakeholder management skills, working with diverse counterparts. Importantly, you have the ability to translate between business/ user needs into technical requirements, vice versa. Individuals may have experience with any form of electronic record database or management system, from patient record/ patient management system in the healthcare industry, to human resources information system (HRIS), and student management system.

To Apply
To apply, please submit your resume (in English and in MS Word format) to Kelly Bowerbank (Chua), quoting KC22497 at kc@kerryconsulting.com. Due to the high volume of applicants for this role, we regret that only shortlisted candidates

The Sales Support Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for providing a range of sales support activities including advisory on sales tool usage, sales tool project management, controls testing and product sales management, in coordination with the Sales and Product teams The overall objective of this role is to provide support/ancillary services to investment product managers and sales people (for banking account opening).
Responsibilities:

  • Review and provide training material to sales and operations/conduct trainings for branch users.
  • Maintain of account opening forms & T&Cs
  • Assist in account opening tech enhancement projects
  • Participate in grooming sessions, FR and test cases validation
  • Organize and perform FUT (production sanity tests)  for project releases-  Perform regression testing
  • Manage the sending out of investments client communications
  • Assist in Investment products set up
  • Maintain investment product Masterlists
  • Monitor controls based on regulatory and reporting requirements - Assist to conduct quarterly MCA and DMT dispositions and manage product risk synchronisation with  Regional IPR system
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience
  • Previous banking/analytics experience preferred
  • Proficient computer skills with a focus on Microsoft Office applications
  • Working knowledge of related industry practices and standards
  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Education:

column3: Touching Lives, Transforming Care
We are IHH, one of the world’s largest healthcare networks, with 80 hospitals in 10 countries.
We believe that making a difference starts with empathy and putting our patients’ needs first to build lasting relationships based on trust.
From everyday care to the little acts that warm the heart, we always deliver our best with genuine compassion – one patient, one family, one touch at a time.

With our unique reach and scale, we strive to continuously raise the bar in healthcare across multiple geographies and create synergies throughout our network. We offer our patients a full spectrum of integrated healthcare services across our portfolio of trusted healthcare brands.
As we build on what we do well and share our strengths and resources globally, we are making healthcare better, faster, easier and more affordable for our patients.

column1:
","

The Role

Reporting to Vice President & Head, Corporate Real Estate Services 1. Provide full secretarial support to Vice President & Head, Corporate Real Estate Services 2. Track completion of key projects 3. Respond to key stakeholder queries in a timely and professional manner 4. Work closely with the Finance and CRES functions for budgetary and spent 5. Appropriately handle highly confidential materials when interfacing with the business and functions. 6. Budget tracking, project tracking, preparing correspondence, data verification, analytics 7. 1st level review of paper submitted by department heads 8. Gathers, compiles, and verifies information and enters it accurately into documents such as reports, presentations; and office systems such as databases or spreadsheets 9. Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of different audiences' unique needs of different audiences 10. Planning and prioritising work to meet commitments aligned with departmental and organisational goals 11. Meetings, reports, and presentation preparation 12. Constructs a tale of the business problem, root cause, solution options, and opportunities through illustrating data visually, including reports and dashboards 13. Interprets information relying on knowledge of business or functional frameworks and leverages analytical problem-solving tools to draw conclusions and communicate meaningful patterns that drive business insights; assesses the quality of data as an initial step of the analysis 14. Work with HR (Human Resources) and College to coordinate and develop training program (external and internal) for Corporate Real Estate Services 15. Support and coordinate partners networking and team bonding events for CRES functions

Key accountabilities

1. Secretariat support to Vice President & Head, CRES 2. Project and Team administration 3. Budget and project progress reporting 4. Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.

Qualifications & Experience

1. Degree holder (Business or Real Estate Degree) 2. Real estate Finance experience is a plus. 3. Able to adapt to a fast pace working environment. 4. Mature, Tech-savvy, independent and accustomed to hybrid working environment. 5. Team player and able to organise team-building activities. 6. Able to sense the latest industry trend in the domain of Corporate real estate, PropTech etc.

Additional Information

SunningdaleTech Ltd is a leading precision tooling, plastics injection moulding and precision assembly company providing a broad spectrum of capabilities that include product & mould designs, mould fabrications, ultra-precision high cavitations toolings, precision injection moulding with finishing processes like spray painting and laser etching, through to precision assembly of complete products.

Boosting a strong presence in Singapore, Malaysia, China, Indonesia and Mexico, Sunningdale Tech has a total factory space of more that 1.6 million sq feet, with more than 550 injection molding machines and a tooling capacity of 2,500 molds per year; we are focusing on serving four key business segments including Automotive, Consumer/IT/Environment, Healthcare and Tooling.

We believe that our employees are our most important asset.  As an employee, you’ll benefit from an environment of engaged colleagues, thought leadership, and opportunities for career advancement and recognition.
Be part of the leading high-precision engineering and manufacturing technologies!

","

Responsibilities:

  • Champion Agile Project Management in all team member.
  • Setup and run IT Governance and Architecture board
  • Support annual budget Planning and monthly Project review meeting 
  • IT Governance and Compliance
  • Setup and run project management office
  • Coordinate audit and follow up with open issues 
  • Review the adequacy and effectiveness of internal control systems pertaining to the IT and make appropriate recommendations 
  • Formalize Project Management and Architecture Board.
  • Provide training and ensure adoption for IT Project Management and IT Governance/Compliance
  • Lead and manage the IT team and inspire team towards high performance and common goals 
  • Any other duties as and when assigned.
  • Take reasonable care of workplace health and safety; abide by all EHS policies and procedures; cooperate with Management and colleagues in EHS initiatives

Requirement

  • Min Diploma / Degree in Information Technology or equivalent
  • Min 5 years of relevant experience
  • Good knowledge of Project Management, Dev/Op environment and IT Governance and compliance
  • Proficient in JIRA Software , Microsoft Project and Office Application
  • Independent, good initiative and able to multi-task in fast paced environment

The above statements reflect the general tasks, duties, activities and/or responsibilities necessary to describe this position and is not intended to set forth all of the specific requirements of the job. These job duties/responsibilities may change or vary in response to business needs.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Sunningdale Tech is an equal opportunity employer – we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce will cultivate a vibrant, productive and innovative workplace where all employees are truly respected and valued.

All qualified applicants shall be considered for employment regardless of age, race, gender, gender identity, religion, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, political and/or third party affiliation or veteran status. All offers of employment shall be conditioned upon successful completion of background checks, valid work passes and medical screenings, as applicable and/or mandated by law, and subject to the applicable local laws and regulations.

86,tech project manager,/en/job/machine-assembly-technician-9388917,9388917,Machine Assembly Technician,False,False,2000,3500,SGD,Rim Polymers Industries Pte Ltd,26-Mar-22,False,,,198202149C,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div>

Rim Polymers entered the polyurethane solutions business more than 30 years ago when it first partnered Italian industrial group to develop the Asian markets. Since year 2000, Rim Polymers progressed towards developing its own technologies and customised solutions for its customers. We also developed our own line of polyurethane machinery – the GMA brand of exceptional high-pressure polyurethane-bolding machinery.

Creating value by developing winning polyurethane solutions for our customers – for over 30 years that’s always been our driving passion at Rim Polymers. We develop customised, winning solutions to some of the largest automotive and household appliance groups on the planet. Our network of offices and service centres provide industry-leading standards of customer attention and response.

We prize reliability. It is the critical feature that turns a good solution into a winning one, and turns simple business encounters into enduring partnerships. We are rapidly transforming our machines to be Industrial 4.0 enabled for greater operational efficiency.

","

Responsibilities

  • Reporting to Manufacturing Manager and involve actively in hands-on assembly of machines.
  • Ensure that production targets are met in terms of production cost, delivery lead-time, quality and reliability of machines with proper packaging before delivery.
  • Ensure the total manufacturing process that is integrated and done in a cost-effective manner.
  • Comply with all workshop procedures, safety regulations, directives and work instructions.
  • Liaison with other personnel on production status, engineering matters, material supply, testing and quality issues for machine rectification and improvement.
  • Initiate machine testing upon completion of assembly (complete machine test checklist for accepted machine), prepare packing check-list and conduct final review within one week after delivery of machine to customer.
  • Final packaging and shipment of machines upon completion.
  • Ensure all aspects of the operations that are in compliance with the ISO 9001:2015 requirements.
  • Maintain proper housekeeping and 5S and to provide improvement suggestions monthly for continuous improvement.
  • Other ad-hoc duty as required, including R&D projects.

Requirements

  • Higher NITEC or Diploma in Mechanical or Mechatronic Engineering.
  • 3 years of experience in machine assembly.
  • A team player with positive learning attitude and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to perform overtime as required.
  • Ability to understand P&ID Diagram.
  • Good knowledge in mechanical parts and fittings.
  • Ability to perform hands on assembly of machine, modifications as required.
  • Prior experience in the PU (Polyurethane) industry is an advantage.

87,tech project manager,/en/job/service-delivery-lead-standard-workplace-application-infrastructure-services-9424821,9424821,Service Delivery Lead (Standard Workplace Application & Infrastructure Services),False,False,,,SGD,Government Technology Agency of Singapore (GovTech),29-Mar-22,False,,,T16GB0002G,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

Singapore is building the world’s first Smart Nation, with fuller use of technology to live, work and play, resulting in improved quality of life for individuals; business opportunities for enterprises and an anticipatory government that uses technology to better serve and anticipate citizens’ needs.

GovTech will continue enhance our national capabilities, ensuring that the key enablers are in place to enable citizens, businesses and government agencies to leverage technology to make lives better in a Smart Nation.As a Service Delivery Lead, you will provide strategic and tactical leadership in harnessing technologies to deliver value-added services to government agencies. You will also be responsible to lead the team in driving and executing ICT initiatives, apps and services, in partnership with the Chief Information Officer of the assigned agencies.

You will strive to meet the business objectives and operational needs of the agencies and to ensure that they are recognized as innovative users of infocomm technologies. You will also provide advice and guidance on the strategic use of ICT and develop strong collaboration with partners and vendors for leverage in resolving critical or escalated issues.

What you will be working on:

  • Alignment of the agencies’ workplan to higher-level objectives. Review ICT initiatives and programmes, identify opportunities to harmonize IT applications, in order to achieve alignment with the over-arching ICT infrastructures and architecture.
  • Strategic partnership with agencies’ senior management to understand their issues and help promote / influence directions.
  • Monitor effectiveness of site performance and pre-empt problems.
  • Facilitate synergies with other entities within GovTech and beyond. You will also cascade down higher-level vision, goals and initiatives.
  • Manage the deployment of staff effectively and strategically to fulfil resource requirements.
  • Coach/mentor staff, identify high potential talent and hone their capabilities, drive staff development opportunities, coordinate and integrate people efforts with the objective of attracting and retaining a motivated and high-performing team.

What we are looking for:

  • Graduate degree in computer science or general discipline with relevant ICT experience
  • 20 years’ experience with at least 10 years in management capacity
  • Experience in the public sector or robust ICT experience in the private sector, preferably in the development, implementation and deployment of ICT plans and activities
  • Knowledge of ICT operations in public and private sectors
  • Strategic thinking skills with broad perspective of different issues
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and marketcompetitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Team Introduction: 

The Data Science & Artificial Intelligence Division (DSAID) works with public sector agencies in using data science and AI to improve policy outcomes, service delivery and operational efficiency. We extract data-driven insights and build intelligent platforms to add value to the work of our partner agencies. We also help public sector agencies transform by partnering them in building data science expertise, formulating data strategies and setting up the necessary data infrastructure. 

How do we work: 

Outcome Driven - Our projects are not academic exercises. We are driven by the “so what” and make sure that our findings and models can be translated into tangible impact. 

Start Small and Move Fast - We build things quickly. If it works, good — how can we scale this up further? If not, what went wrong and what can we do better next time? 

Ownership - You are not just here to write code, but also to figure out what we should be building and how we should build it. 

Continuous Learning - Working on new ideas often means not fully understanding what you are working on. Taking time to learn new architectures, frameworks, technologies, and even languages are not just encouraged but essential. 

We are in this Together - We draw from the deep domain knowledge of our partners and best practices from our community of experts. 

Read more about us from the team's blog https://medium.com/dsaid-govtech 

Job Overview:

We are seeking an Engagement Manager to join our Quantitative Strategy team, to drive our partnership efforts with other government agencies, which aim to grow data science capabilities at these agencies while remaining in close alignment to DSAID's approach and philosophy. 

As an Engagement Manager, you will play an instrumental role in creating value out of data for partner agencies to refine their policies and operations and, through the process, building capabilities in data science at whole-of-government level. 

This role requires an individual with strong stakeholder management and communication skills, who can engage agency partners at senior management / middle management / working level, understand their business problems, identify areas where data science can be of help, build rapport to drum up support for data science initiatives, and drive collaboration efforts. 

What you will be working on:

  • Co-lead analytics engagement with partner agencies, together with the lead data scientist identified for each partner agency. 
  • Facilitate discussions with stakeholders at partner agencies to understand their business challenges, sharpen use cases, translate them into computational problems answerable with data, and define metrics to quantify success. 
  • Cultivate a strong pipeline of impactful projects with partner agencies. 
  • Ensure the presentation of each completed project is targeted at influencing the partner agency's problem owners and stakeholders towards actionable impact, through appropriate framing and data storytelling. 
  • Understand technical blockers faced by the team, and advocate for organisational / resourcing solutions with senior management at partner agencies to help clear the blockers. 
  • Forge common ground and align expectations between the various stakeholders at each partner agency (e.g., business end users, data and IT teams, senior managements) to ensure that resources are focused on creating business value. 
  • Monitor developments in data science within and outside government, to identify opportunities for growth and position the team to capitalize on these opportunities  
  • Ensure that teams working with partner agencies continue operating in close alignment to DSAID’s approach and philosophy towards data science. 

What we are looking for:

  • A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • At least 2 years of relevant experience, in data science and/or public sector, with good understanding of government organisations and processes. 
  • Have strong analytical, conceptualisation, and problem-solving skills. Able to translate between broad strategic perspectives and practical business needs, as well as between business needs and technical problems. 
  • Understand key concepts, broad methodologies, and common use cases in data science. 
  • Have excellent oral and written communication skills, along with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders at all levels on the adoption of analytics. Able to present technical concepts and results from technical analyses to non-technical audience effectively. 
  • Adaptable to dynamic operating contexts and able to work with multiple stakeholders across different teams and agencies. 

Preferred requirements:

  • Experience in working with technical team consisting of data scientists and/or data engineers 
  • Experience in programme management 
  • Experience in agile project management 
  • Understand processes in digital transformation 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Assistant Head / Senior Officer (Health & Medical Technology Horizontal Technology Programme Office), IBB
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a project manager to drive projects in Health & Medical Technologies space. The successful candidate will have the primary responsibility to drive project success under our Biomedical Engineering
Programme (BEP) though the following responsibilities:
  • Manage multi-institutional research projects and working closely with the research team to develop commercially viable MedTech products
  • Direct the research team towards developing clinically driven products that have commercialization potential
  • Perform high-level market research and analysis of the target market of the projects to ensure each project has a reasonable business model
  • Monitor and track the progress of the projects to ensure a smooth and on-track execution to meet the intended clinical need
  • Ensure that the project milestones, timelines and budget are followed
  • Provide inputs and resources to resolve issues and challenges related to the projects to meet the deliverables
  • Support the project team in getting clinical feedback on product concepts
  • Provide regular updates to the Health & Medical Technologies Horizontal Tech Centre’s leadership
  • Coordinate and prepare project reports and submissions for internal and external stakeholders
  • Participate in the review, selection and grants administration process
  • Perform any other relevant, project-related duties as required
Other responsibilities include:
  • Supporting the MedTech Horizontal Tech Center in A*STAR-wide strategic planning in MedTech
  • Supporting in the organization of seminars and workshops to promote collaboration in the field of MedTech
  • Planning and executing the subsequent BEP grant calls
  • Surveying the MedTech landscape to be kept up-to-date on the latest major innovations, needs, regulatory changes etc.
Requirements
  • Minimum of 3 years' R&D experience in MedTech or related fields
  • Possess excellent communication and writing skills, and ability to effectively interact with staff and management across functional groups and levels
  • Highly motivated and driven individual who strives for excellence
  • Familiarity of the MedTech ecosystem is a plus
  • Knowledge of the quality management system (ISO 13485 and related standards) and regulatory landscape for medical devices is a plus
  • Knowledge and understanding of business development is a plus
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column3: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients.
Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd.

Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

Our deep market understanding and industry expertise, honed over four decades of operations in Singapore, gives us an edge in driving business change and empowering your organisation to overcome future HR challenges. We combine our expertise with genuine human insights to provide strategic solutions for your HR needs. Our team will partner with you to enhance your HR practices, so you can confidently achieve more.

  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, any field.

  • Be an effective communicator who is persuasive and has excellent interpersonal skills, as well as a highly analytical and detail-oriented team member capable of handling multiple projects at once.

  • Must have strong communication skills.
  • Strong technical skills, advanced proficiency in MS Office and fast learning agility with other online tools and platforms.
  • Good time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, often across different time zone
Program Manager – Training

PolicyPal Singapore Pte Ltd
About the Company
  • PolicyPal Tech Pte. Ltd. is one of the leading InsurTech companies in Singapore that believes in bringing tech and insurance together for families and communities to enhance their insurance experience. We also believe in helping the community attain relevant knowledge on financial planning through gamification, and offering in-app credits incentives that can be used to help them get covered. PolicyPal Tech Pte. Ltd. has also built a policy management platform that helps users easily keep track of all their insurance policies on one app. Since 2016, it has helped over 100,000 users manage their policies.
  • Under PolicyPal Group, Baoxianbaobao Pte. Ltd. (also branded as ‘PolicyPalFA’,)  is wholly owned by PolicyPal Pte. Ltd., is an insurance broker and exempt financial adviser licensed and regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
About the role
  • We are looking for a Business Development Intern for PolicyPal. Reporting directly to our Partnerships Manager, your core responsibilities will be to support the business development projects for PolicyPal Group. You will also support multi-channel marketing activities, in particular, to raise awareness and drive sign-ups.
  • Our ideal candidate is someone who is proactive, organized and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a timely manner. You are also independent but also able to collaborate in a team environment. If you always wanted to know what it’s like to work in a fast-paced start-up environment, this role is for you! Apply today.
Responsibilities:
  • Support in planning, executing, and pivoting growth experiments with new business models in a start-up environment.
  • Hands-on experience in experimentation of new business models
  • Promoting sign-ups through professional communications with individuals/corporations through various channels, including phone, email, chat and text
  • Collaborate cross-functionally (strategy, marketing, operations) to ensure smooth business operations

Requirements:
  • A committed team player, responsible and able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Good interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Sales experience in any industry is not a mandatory requirement, but a plus
  • Salary Range:$800-$1,000

column1: 94,tech project manager,/en/job/manager-ict-governance-and-compliance-9425855,9425855,"Manager, ICT Governance and Compliance",False,False,,,SGD,Government Technology Agency of Singapore (GovTech),29-Mar-22,False,,,T16GB0002G,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.Government Infrastructure Group (GIG)

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure, and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore.

How we work

Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure.

We examine factors such as people, culture, policies, and processes to provide a secure, predictive, and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime.

By leveraging on innovative Cloud and SaaS technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacenter hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services.

Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernization and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly.

We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy, and training.

You will be responsible for: 

This role is key contributor to GIG ICT delivery strategy, and includes contributing to the development of frameworks, systems and processes which are aligned to appropriate WOG and corporate standards, creating the required forums, and establishing appropriate monitoring mechanisms to ensure that compliance is effective.  

What you will be working on:

  • Assist in the contextualization of WOG ICT framework, policies, and standards for GIG, which requires appreciation of GIG domains and ICT processes and risks (eg. project & cybersecurity risks), as well as principles and rationale of WOG / GovTech corporate policies and standards.
  • Conduct stakeholder engagements within GIG, which involves assisting in the development and execution of communication and engagement plans (e.g. briefings, clinics etc) to create awareness and ensure effective promulgation of ICT policies and standards.
  • Provide consultancy to GIG product delivery teams (e.g. for new products) on the various ICT Governance, policies and standards to guide compliance and adoption.
  • Conduct health checks to assess understanding and adoption of policies and standards, remediation follow-up, and guiding project teams in the process.
  • Support audit exercises conducted by external auditors such as Auditor General’s Office, WOG ICT Governance Group, Internal Auditors, etc, by working alongside with product delivery teams to collate, review, seek approval for submission of RFI requests during audit fieldwork, drafting management responses, and follow-up actions to ensure on-time and on-target execution of audit plans by external auditors.
  • Assist in the sourcing for outsourced augmentation of internal capability to deliver committed deliverables.
  • Conduct polls in response to compliance checks requests review and obtain clearance before submission when necessary.

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s in computer science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related discipline. Those without a degree but have relevant experience may also apply.
  • Minimum 5 years ICT experience, preferably with at least 3 years in ICT audit and or compliance management.
  • Good understanding of IT management processes, technology risks and internal controls and ISO9001 standards
  • Able to deliver quality and thorough work, with eye for details.
  • Team player & good interpersonal skills.
  • Good written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
  • Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) is an advantage.
  • Prior experience in project management, application development and cloud application development on project lifecycle (both traditional SDLC and Agile project development) is an advantage.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

95,tech project manager,/en/job/manager-facilities-hotel-9421059,9421059,"Manager, Facilities - Hotel",False,False,,,,Marina Bay Sands Pte Ltd,28-Mar-22,False,,,200507292R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Marina Bay Sands® is Asia’s leading destination for business, leisure and entertainment delivering once-in-a-lifetime experiences. The landmark building is situated in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District and transforms Singapore’s skyline and the country’s tourism landscape.

The destination offers a luxury hotel, state-of-the art convention and exhibition facilities, theaters, world-class entertainment and the best shopping and dining in the region. The three hotel towers are crowned by the Sands SkyPark® on the 57th story.

column1: <div>
<div>

column3: Conveniently located in the heart of the Central Business District and 20 minutes from Changi Airport.

• Hotel: The Marina Bay Sands hotel has three 55-story towers with 2,561 luxury rooms and suites. The three towers are capped by the Sands SkyPark, which offers 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline. It is home to restaurants, lush gardens, an infinity edged swimming pool and the world’s largest public cantilever housing an observation deck.

• Expo and Conventions: The Sands Expo and Convention Center has 1.3 million square feet of flexible convention and exhibition space. It can host over 45,000 delegates, 2,000 exhibition booths and 250 meeting rooms. It features Southeast Asia’s biggest ballroom, which can accommodate 6,600 people for a banquet, and up to 11,000 for an auditorium-style lecture.

• Shopping: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands has 800,000 square feet of retail and dining space. Luxury retailers include Bally, Cartier, CHANEL, Ferragamo, Franck Muller, Gucci, Hermès, Hublot, Hugo Boss, Louis Vuitton, Miu Miu, Omega, Patek Philippe, Prada, Tiffany & Co. and Yves Saint Laurent. New brands include Anne Fontaine, Henry Cotton’s, Leviev, Marisfrolg, Moiselle, Rabeanco, Stefano Ricci, and Wolford.

• Restaurants: Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a gourmet experience with over 50 dining choices. These include celebrity-chef restaurants helmed by Mario Batali, (New York), Daniel Boulud (New York), Wolfgang Puck (Los Angeles), Guy Savoy (Paris), Tetsuya Wakuda (Sydney) and Justin Quek (Singapore). Marina Bay Sands features signature restaurants, modern bistros and a premium food court.

• Entertainment: Marina Bay Sands energizes the entertainment and nightlife scene in Singapore with nightclubs, world-class entertainment, a museum and a casino. The museum, which has a lotus-inspired design, will feature blockbuster exhibitions from around the world. Two state-of-the-art theaters will open with a total of about 4,000 seats. The Broadway hit The Lion King will debut in Sands Theater, with Le Theater presenting shorter-run shows such as concerts, award ceremonies and gala events. The outdoor event plaza along the promenade next to Marina Bay will host audiences for watching events on the bay or on the plaza.

column1:
","

JOB SCOPE

Job Responsibilities

Corrective Maintenance

  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest and internal department requests such as ad-hoc breakdown and ensuring Maximo job chit are closed promptly and accurately.
  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest services within assigned department(s), consistent with the company’s core service standards and brand attributes.
  • Conduct daily on-site physical inspection and monitor the work progress of all defects rectification; identify and follow through for any repair within the hotel footprint.

Preventive Maintenance & Projects

  • Manage and carry out hotel guest rooms and corridor maintenance program for all finishes, fit-outs and furniture.
  • Advocate improvement on work processes and areas to achieve excellent customer services to hotel guestrooms to improve the maintenance standard and efficiency of the Hotel Facilities operation team.
  • Conduct regular meetings and coordinate with the maintenance contractor to resolve and improve the service of relevant systems within the hotel footprint.
  • Coordinate and supervise external contract works as assigned by immediate supervisor to ensure their works are compliant with the required specifications and standards so as to meet objectives.
  • Work closely and liaise with all departments in property and contractors in project and maintenance coordination to minimize disruption to the hotel operations.
  • Coordinate and manage contractors and sub-contractors for any repair or Testing and Commissioning (T&C) of equipment along with contractors and other Team Members within the hotel footprint.
  • Review drawings and schematic diagrams to ensure designs and specifications to be compliant to the regulatory requirements and MBS standards.

Resource and People Management

  • Lead the Hotel team of Assistant Managers/Supervisors/Technicians/Engineers to deliver quality up-keeping of the hotel.
  • Assist the Associate Directors in planning of job duration and assessing manpower, materials, tools and equipment, special services required for the job.
  • Coaching and training for Team Members to be aligned to the company’s standard
  • Develop and sustain a high quality and motivated team.
  • Prepare RFP document for maintenance contract with measurable KPIs and SLAs.
  • Plan, manage, select and procure consumable materials.
  • Review and streamline all purchase requests with procurement department.
  • Develop annual CAPEX and OPEX budgets.
  • Perform regular forecast to the CAPEX and OPEX to maintain accuracy.

General

  • Enforce all safety programs and training with regards to WSH.
  • Perform all duties in accordance with MBS policies and within the realm of the MBS Company vision, mission and values.
  • Manage Human Resources responsibilities for assigned department(s) to include: creating a work environment that promotes teamwork, performance feedback, recognition, mutual respect and employee satisfaction; quality hiring, training and succession planning processes that encompass the company’s diversity commitment; adherence to the company’s status quo; administering progressive discipline in accordance with MBS guidelines.
  • Build and design initiatives, programs and reports for continuous quality monitoring and improvement to the overall maintenance of the Hotel and service.
  • Perform ad-hoc tasks as required.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education & Certification

  • Tertiary qualification(s) in the fields of Electrical, Mechanical, Building Services, Facilities Management or equivalent. Candidates without the required qualifications but with adequate experience in similar position may apply.
  • Professional Qualification and Certification relating to the above-mentioned fields will be an advantage.

Experience

  • At least three to five years of solid hands-on practical working in any Hotels providing Customers Service, Operations supports, and maintenance.
  • Understanding of local regulations, standards and ordinances on hotel operations and maintenance.
  • Possess good understanding of building services.
  • Be able to work outdoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to fatigue, noise, dust, and be able to access all areas of the property including those at height.

Competencies

  • Possess good communication, interpersonal and supervisory skills, with an eye for detail .
  • Get along with fellow Team Members and work as a team.
  • Be able to work with minimum supervision and at times independently, as well as under pressure.
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced, busy, and somewhat stressful environment. Maintain physical stamina and proper mental attitude while dealing effectively with guests, management, team members, and outside contacts while working under pressure and meeting deadlines.
  • Meet the attendance guidelines of the job and adhere to Departmental and Company policies.
  • Be willing to work any day of the week and any shift, long hours when necessary.
  • Withstand various activities such as frequent walking, sitting for long periods or prolonged standing, stretching, bending and kneeling without restriction.
  • Have a well-groomed, professional appearance.

You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.
