column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
SVP, Program Director (Rewards) - (WD27485)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
The role is responsible for managing and leading the strategy, roadmap and implementation of a leading edge Rewards and Loyalty system. Program director needs to work closely with the stakeholders across the Bank to plan, implement and drive technology programs and related projects within the AGILE framework. This role will play an integral role in ensuring the success of these programs, and be a change agent for the way programs and projects being run.
  • Design, build and roll out a detailed strategy and methodology for a new loyalty program including a reward system and membership system to deliver on key metrics to meet organizations strategic objective.
  • Work closely with the business stakeholders to drive technology teams to deliver highly performant system.
  • Define the delivery plan as per strategy/roadmap and obtain buy-in and approval from senior management and stakeholders for plan execution
  • Manage a team of resources comprising in-house staff, contractors and product vendors to deliver the program
  • Constantly evaluates program performance and investigates opportunities in order to recommend optimizations that drive key performance metrics (Zero production incidents, High availability, High scalability - 12 factor application)
  • Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams to design and deploy relevant and meaningful loyalty program communications and activities
  • Act as the primary point of contact for the program and undertake a continuous focus on data collection and relevancy for our customers
  • Based on customer segmentation, drive the loyalty marketing and communications plans to our most valuable loyalty customers at all times
  • Work with internal BI & financial controllers to manage the Loyalty P&L ensuring that all financial targets are achieved and all planned activities are completed within budget.
  • Explore venues using AI/ML to make the technology stack future ready.
Requirements
  • Demonstrated 15-20 years' of progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management.
  • Minimum 10 years IT experience with Open-Source development.
  • Experience in loyalty/reward system desirable, preferably in digital payment, credit-card or digital marketplace industry
  • Ability to drive technical development using Open Source full tech stack, including integration with multiple vendor products
  • Good understanding of different loyalty systems and existing market players
  • Proven effectiveness driving complex multi-stakeholder planning processes, driving cross-team programs to desired results, and managing risk.
  • Project/program management leadership including scope, schedule, budget, quality, risk, communications, procurement, human resources, and integration management
  • Proven competency in strategic leadership, executive communication and influence, organizational agility, cross-team collaboration, drive for results, and written and verbal communications
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities, effective in matrix management and team building
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak to technical-level staff and summarize communications for business stakeholders and executives
  • Strong organizational skills, the ability to perform under pressure and management of multiple priorities with competing demands for resources
  • Change driver - Significant experience in managing and driving change
  • Highly effective in managing the risk and cost implications of IT contracts or contract negotiations
  • Ability to act as in a consultative manner with both business and IT leaders to align strategy
  • Knowledge in technical program management methodologies.
  • Demonstrated experience building, mentoring, and growing technical program management or engineering teams of 100 or more.
  • Experience taking ownership and delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies, Project Management, Software Development Life Cycle, Software Quality Assurance methodologies, and familiarity with project management tools and bug/issue tracking system.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
The role is responsible for managing and leading the strategy, roadmap and implementation of a leading edge Rewards and Loyalty system. Program director needs to work closely with the stakeholders across the Bank to plan, implement and drive technology programs and related projects within the AGILE framework. This role will play an integral role in ensuring the success of these programs, and be a change agent for the way programs and projects being run.
  • Design, build and roll out a detailed strategy and methodology for a new loyalty program including a reward system and membership system to deliver on key metrics to meet organizations strategic objective.
  • Work closely with the business stakeholders to drive technology teams to deliver highly performant system.
  • Define the delivery plan as per strategy/roadmap and obtain buy-in and approval from senior management and stakeholders for plan execution
  • Manage a team of resources comprising in-house staff, contractors and product vendors to deliver the program
  • Constantly evaluates program performance and investigates opportunities in order to recommend optimizations that drive key performance metrics (Zero production incidents, High availability, High scalability - 12 factor application)
  • Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams to design and deploy relevant and meaningful loyalty program communications and activities
  • Act as the primary point of contact for the program and undertake a continuous focus on data collection and relevancy for our customers
  • Based on customer segmentation, drive the loyalty marketing and communications plans to our most valuable loyalty customers at all times
  • Work with internal BI & financial controllers to manage the Loyalty P&L ensuring that all financial targets are achieved and all planned activities are completed within budget.
  • Explore venues using AI/ML to make the technology stack future ready.
Requirements
  • Demonstrated 15-20 years' of progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management.
  • Minimum 10 years IT experience with Open-Source development.
  • Experience in loyalty/reward system desirable, preferably in digital payment, credit-card or digital marketplace industry
  • Ability to drive technical development using Open Source full tech stack, including integration with multiple vendor products
  • Good understanding of different loyalty systems and existing market players
  • Proven effectiveness driving complex multi-stakeholder planning processes, driving cross-team programs to desired results, and managing risk.
  • Project/program management leadership including scope, schedule, budget, quality, risk, communications, procurement, human resources, and integration management
  • Proven competency in strategic leadership, executive communication and influence, organizational agility, cross-team collaboration, drive for results, and written and verbal communications
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities, effective in matrix management and team building
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak to technical-level staff and summarize communications for business stakeholders and executives
  • Strong organizational skills, the ability to perform under pressure and management of multiple priorities with competing demands for resources
  • Change driver - Significant experience in managing and driving change
  • Highly effective in managing the risk and cost implications of IT contracts or contract negotiations
  • Ability to act as in a consultative manner with both business and IT leaders to align strategy
  • Knowledge in technical program management methodologies.
  • Demonstrated experience building, mentoring, and growing technical program management or engineering teams of 100 or more.
  • Experience taking ownership and delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies, Project Management, Software Development Life Cycle, Software Quality Assurance methodologies, and familiarity with project management tools and bug/issue tracking system.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

100,tech project manager,/en/job/monetization-strategy-operations-smb-9424119,9424119,Monetization Strategy & Operations - SMB,False,False,,,SGD,BYTEDANCE PTE. LTD.,29-Mar-22,False,,,201923456H,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

column1:
","

Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

We are looking for entrepreneurial spirits to join our monetization strategy team. You will have a ground floor opportunity to shape monetization efforts in the Asia Pacific region. In this role, you will partner with cross-functional leaders to assess performance and plan for the future.

The Monetization Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics and financial modeling, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Responsibilities

  • Act as the key strategy partner to the monetization team focusing on the Small & Medium Business (SMB) advertiser segment
  • Assist in the development monetization strategy through analysis and research, and evolve insights into growth initiatives
  • Build short-term and long-term strategic and financial plans
  • Set and manage performance goals
  • Measure and track business performance, own business reporting and performance analysis, and drive business review cadences
  • Partner closely with monetization team leadership to drive high impact projects
  • Manage key initiatives on a project basis, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams within APAC, Beijing (HQ), and other international markets

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of sales strategy, sales finance, sales operations, business operations, product strategy, investment banking, consulting, or related analytical experiences. High growth tech start-up experience and advertising experience preferred
  • Exceptional data analytics skills. Familiarity with SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau preferred
  • Skilled project manager. High EQ team-player with the ability to manage expectations across time-zones and cultures
  • Self-motivation, comfort with ambiguity and cross-cultural environment, adaptability to change, roll-up-the-sleeves attitude and other helpful qualities for a high-growth environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

101,tech project manager,/en/job/assistant-manager-9422051,9422051,Assistant Manager,False,False,,,SGD,MOH Office for Healthcare Transformation Pte Ltd,28-Mar-22,False,,21 days,201725110N,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div>

column2: MOH Office for Healthcare Transformation (MOHT) is an MOH unit with a mission “to shape the future of healthcare in Singapore by identifying, developing and experimenting with game-changing, systems-level concepts and innovations in the promotion of good health, prevention of illnesses and delivery of care.”

column3: MOHT will work with multiple stakeholders and partners on a number of areas where fundamental change is critical for the effective transformation of the healthcare system. It will adopt an agile, collaborative approach, using sandboxed test-beds and pilots with the intention to scale these across the public healthcare system if successful.

column2:
MOHT will play a catalytic and facilitative role to drive and scale the solutions in care redesign led by health professionals; patient engagement and trust; data and technology enablers; and financing redesign. MOHT will be data-driven and conduct robust evaluation of the benefits and cost-effectiveness of its initiatives, and make recommendations on the strategy for system-wide roll-out and early stage scaling if pilots prove successful.  We seek to be a discerning champion through agile collaborative implementation involving deep listening and close partnerships with patients and partners","
MOHT envisions a transformed health system that is patient-centric, data-driven and digitally-enabled to better empower health, prevent disease and provide excellent value-based care. To realise this vision, MOHT’s mission is to design and implement innovative solutions essential for the desired health system transformation.
The MOHT Data, Science, and Technology (DST) Team plays a significant role in MOHT’s projects and experiments, and in its operating environment. MOHT adopts an agile approach using rapid and continuous build-measure-learn cycles that identify, develop, deliver and adapt technology to improve health outcomes.
The candidate will be part of the DST team that looks at analytics, tracking and product UX/UI development. The candidate will help MOHT leadership and programme managers in leading growth marketing efforts to user growth and engagement with our healthcare transformation projects.

The candidate will promote the brand, products and services of mindline.sg - a Singapore-developed stress management and coping website that consolidates access to many local and carefully-selected resources with a wellbeing self-assessment tool. The core duties include managing mindline.sg’s growth marketing strategy and efforts, planning campaigns, analyzing success metrics, and identifying user trends.
The candidate will be also be involved in creating a detailed roadmap to drive the overall delivery of mindline.sg projects from a Customer Experience (CX) viewpoint, by focusing on key messaging, user experience and provide input towards marketing strategy and tactics.
Duties:
  • Drive marketing campaigns and channel monitoring, and work with cross-functional team members (in marcomms, product, partnerships and tech) to sustain positive UX and increase user adoption and satisfaction with mindline.sg’s products, services and initiatives
  • Drive work with creative & branding agencies to create brand assets for mindline.sg and manage media buy agencies (SEO, SEM, Social, Native Ads) to execute growth marketing campaigns targeted at population-wide usage and awareness
  • Analyse growth marketing campaigns via tracking tools (e.g. GTM) and in-house/commercial analytics dashboards to optimise campaigns for marketing goals and acquire target users in B2B/B2C
  • Co-lead in mindline.sg’s efforts in establishing community-based approaches and sector partnerships in designing and co-creating solutions in healthcare
  • Provide marketing and communications support (copywriting of collaterals, simple design and layout) and support the department’s stakeholder engagement efforts
Job Requirements:
  • Strong degree in Marketing, Business or Communications with extensive knowledge of cross-channel and account based marketing strategies/ tactics
  • Ideally 5 years’ of experience in performance marketing and B2B2C project management
  • Strong operational knowledge in growing audience engagement in leading social media channels such as Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, Reddit, Telegram etc, in addition to skills in advertising, copywriting and content creation
  • Good interpersonal skills, with strong verbal and written communication
  • Comfortable with presenting to stakeholders at all levels
  • Ability to work independently and thrive in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment
  • Experience in the healthcare industry and/or understanding of strict user privacy policies (PII) will be beneficial
  • Working knowledge of Design Thinking / UI/UX is highly favourable
Why Join Us?
At MOHT, you can look forward to contribute meaningfully to the transformation of Singapore's health system. You will be a part of an innovative team, shaping change through close collaborations, internally and with partners. We are committed to develop our people professionally and individually. Our conducive work environment and culture empowers our people to stay healthy and well.
If you have what it takes, join us and let's make a difference together!
","['Join a high performing team', 'Make a difference in the community', ""Improving others' lives through your work""]",Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Miscellaneous allowance', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9422051&advertisement_id=9420422&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70170,Central,sg

column3: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients.
Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd.

Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

Our deep market understanding and industry expertise, honed over four decades of operations in Singapore, gives us an edge in driving business change and empowering your organisation to overcome future HR challenges. We combine our expertise with genuine human insights to provide strategic solutions for your HR needs. Our team will partner with you to enhance your HR practices, so you can confidently achieve more.

","
Job Description

AVP/Senior Associate, Program Manager, Regional Operations Transformation & Communications, Technology & Operations - (WD31692)

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
  • Drive Operations Journey Program Strategy (Regulatory & Internal Reporting employee journey etc) and institute strong Journey Thinking culture and mindset through effective communication, collaboration and engagement with all internal & external stakeholders
  • Oversight of Operations Reporting Journey program management & governance to ensure Journey progresses through the 4D phases in accordance to agreed timeline and outcomes
  • Drive adoption and implementation of Employee Journey (EJ) design standards, reusable architecture and employee digital experience framework for employee workbenches and workflows
  • Cross-functional collaboration with Ops, Tech, EJ Council & SG COO to drive key programs (Reporting, Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP), SG Go-To-Model etc) outcomes across locations (when applicable)
  • Organize and lead Reporting Journey cadences & ensure regular sponsor updates on Reporting Journey progress
  • Close partnership and collaboration with Group Transformation, Data Steward community, Report Owners and the CDO Data Management Team in the formation of Regulatory Reporting Project Steering Committee to identify regulatory report inventory / landscape opportunities and drive alignment of platform backlogs to book of work for strong delivery of regulatory reporting project outcomes
  • Establish a golden source of truth to ensure required Ops data for reporting is integrated into Control Tower for actionable insights as part of Ops DDOM construct
  • Play the role of a Journey lead/coach to drive synergies and best practice sharing of Journey thinking across operation regional functions
  • Co-ordinate and gather the required support from the requisite resources and SMEs across Ops functions to contribute to regulatory report solutioning
  • Ensure regular communication of Journey progress & outcomes to T&O community regionally as part of T&O employee obsession agenda
Requirements
  • Degree holder with minimum 5-6 years of experience in managing Customer/Employee Journeys as Journey lead and/or Journey Coach
  • Experience in running AGILE sprints and knowledge in Ops reporting (Internal & Regulatory) is preferred
  • Familiarity with Institutional Banking Operations, Consumer Banking Operations, Treasury & Markets Operations will be an advantage
  • Self-starter, meticulous and analytical. Excellent program management skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skill and the ability to understand a broad range of operational issues
  • Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word
  • Good team player with strong inter-personal and communication skills
Apply Now
  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>
About ASUS:

ASUS is a multinational company known for the world’s best motherboards, PCs, monitors, graphics cards and routers and driven to become the most-admired innovative leading technology enterprise. With a global workforce that includes more than 5,000 R&D professionals, ASUS leads the industry through cutting-edge design and innovations made to create the most ubiquitous, intelligent, heartfelt and joyful smart life for everyone. Inspired by the In Search of Incredible brand spirit, ASUS won thousands of prestigious awards in 2018 and ranked as one of Forbes’ Global 2000 Top Regarded Companies, Thomson Reuters’ Top 100 Global Tech Leaders and Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies.
關於華碩

華碩為美國《財富》雜誌評比「世界最受推崇企業之一」，並榮登美國《富比士》雜誌「全球最受信賴企業排行榜」及英國《路透社》「全球科技100強」。產品類別橫跨主機板、顯示卡、筆記型電腦、智慧手機、螢幕、路由器及全方位的科技產品解決方案，並積極拓展電競產品及開創AIOT新領域的各種應用。華碩致力追尋無與倫比的科技創新，為全球使用者創造體貼人心的智慧生活與無所不在的幸福感，以成為「數位新世代備受推崇的科技創新領導企業」為品牌願景。華碩全球員工數約14,500人，擁有世界級研發菁英超過5,000人，產品行銷全球70多個國家，營業額超過100億美元。
Today, ASUS is looking to expand its presence in Singapore and is looking for enthusiastic, aggressive and career-minded individuals to join the team.
For more details, please visit https://www.asus.com/sg/.

105,tech project manager,/en/job/scientific-manager-cancer-science-institute-9429235,9429235,Scientific Manager (Cancer Science Institute),False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,22 hours ago,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

Funding has been obtained to establish a National research program on manufacturing of Autologous cells for cellular therapy. The main objective of this Industry Alignment Fund - Prepositioning is to establish a program constituting different research groups that are performing research on the different component of the entire chain of manufacturing process from cell expansion, transfection, CAR-construct, release criteria, GMP manufacturing, clinical trials and regulatory science. A key objective is to create new solutions in the different aspects of the manufacturing process and to engage industry and academia for potential collaborations

Program management
-    Work with individual Co-Is to align research goals and directions (consistently meet up to review their bandwidth in achieving committed milestones); understand their research pain points and what they need to plug them
-    Coordinate regular research meetings with all IMPACT members (general meetings) for everyone to update on research progress and also discuss on future directions.
-    Strategic planning and realignment of research scope as necessary
-    Identify areas of interest and spearhead the integration of research work within IMPACT and with other STAMP (ASTEM and CAMP) counterparts
-    Meetings records keeping 
-    Tracking of research progress, and mapping of tech/capability (developed and in development)
-    Organizing, hosting and/or disseminating cell therapy-related talks/webinars to IMPACTers 
-    Sharing latest cell therapy related news, published papers and industry talks for education purposes

Administration
-    Liaises with and oversees the collation and reporting of annual reports, budgets, KPIs and scientific progress to the funding agency in a timely manner
-    Addresses internal administrative matters involving budget, manpower hiring, variation requests, reporting, etc.
-    Ensuring NDAs/MTAs/RCAs are in place
-    Assisting with the administration of cross program RCAs + other non-industry collaboration contracts
-    Program updates to BMRC / SAB
-    Budget tracking and updating the leads on the latest development

Business Development
-    Working closely with BD Manager to identify competitive research capabilities and to drive industry engagements
-    Stay on top of each co-Is potential and existing industry partnerships while ensuring that the research scope and capabilities remain relevant to the current needs
-    Contributing to the scientific input in developing BD slides for sharing with industry counterparts

Miscellaneous
-    All other relevant matters (non-exhaustive)
 

Qualifications

Qualifications:

-    PhD/PharmD/ Masters in immunology, biomedical science, molecular biology
-    Ability to apply and leverage scientific and medical knowledge is essential

Experience: 

-    Minimum 2 years of prior program management experience
-    Experience in specialized therapy area is desirable

Skills: 

-    Strong project management skills; organized and systematic in managing projects 
-    Highly collaborative, confident, and strong presence
-    Strategic thinker, innovative, able to drive multiple-simultaneous initiatives, able to work under pressure
-    Excellent presentation, interpersonal and communication skills

Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.[1]

[1]  MOM Updated advisory on COVID-vaccination at the Workplace, subject to changes in accordance with the national COVID-19 measures

column1: 106,tech project manager,/en/job/business-intelligence-manager-9380008,9380008,Business Intelligence Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Carro Singapore,29-Mar-22,False,,1 day,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

Carro is on a mission to redefine what car ownership is and transform the way that people and businesses across Asia interact with one another to get the cars they need. Our digital platforms are game-changers in the automotive trading industry, seamlessly integrating the buying and selling user journeys for speed, efficiency, and transparency.

Since 2016, Carro has continually disrupted the existing business models and practices within the automotive trading industry, launching numerous market-first services, and grown to more than 800 people across 4 countries in Southeast Asia. Our platform serves nearly every need that car owners have, and does it in a more tech-enabled, efficient, and delightful way. Today, Carro transacts more than $1Bn in cars annually and has won numerous industry awards for innovation and marketing excellence.

We’re looking for a seasoned and strong Business Intelligence Manager to ramp up and grow our new team from the ground up. You will be leading the team in helping the organisation to uncover latent value in our data, providing visibility into our operations, and drives accuracy in business decisions, You will define the strategy for how we should analyse the health and success of our product and services, and extrapolate on past data to make data-driven predictions for the future. 

You will work closely with our multidisciplinary teams of Product Manager, Product Analyst, Software Engineers, Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

What you will be doing: 

  • Lead our analytics capability and efforts, including data construct, report development, workflow optimisation and insights.
  • Build and maintain the semantic level by synthesizing data from multiple sources
  • Collaborate with the multidisciplinary teams to collect requirements to design and implement scalable data models 
  • Subject matter experts in defining technical and business approach
  • Standardizing and structure metrics and reporting across the organization
  • Be involved in hiring and development of the team of BI Engineers, Analyst and Data Engineers.
Requirements

What you will need:

  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems, quantitative or related field 
  • 8+ years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence/Business Analytics with experience in leading Business Intelligence teams and experience in planning and implementing analytical and reporting projects in fast-paced environments.
  • Experience in a product-oriented analytics environment in a high-growth organisation.
  • Experience in data visualization tools like Google Data Studio, Tableau or similar tools
  • Excellent grasp of SQL and Python/R, Excel and other Business Intelligence tools/software
  • Excellent communication skills to summarize insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication

Bugis | 5 days | 9am-6pm
CCTV industry experience is a must
Lenel or CCure is a plus!!
Attractive Salary
Career Progression Opportunities
Interested applicants can send your resume to ✉ supreme.cyred@gmail.com and allow our Consultants to match you with our Clients. No Charges will be incurred by Candidates for any service rendered.

JOB MISSION
The mission of the Project Engineer is to ensure all system installations and projects are carried out on schedule and to both the clients and Company Standards. The Project Engineer is required to facilitate successful delivery through the testing, coordinating, inspection and commissioning process while maintaining and improving standards where possible.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Minimum of 3 year’s industry experience working within security installations,servicing, or design.
  • Relevant degree or Certifications in Electronic Engineering.
  • Lenel or CCure training or experience preferred.

DUTIES
Outline the essential duties of the position:
  • Work within the project delivery teams to engineer physical layout and system security designs or mark-ups.
  • Attend break fix call, perform troubleshooting and provide report as and when requested by the team.
  • Review of system design prior to installation works and highlighting of any apparent technical, functional or compatibility issues with the design package while highlighting any deviation to client’s standards.
  • Manage all on site trades both external and internal ensuring that all security dependencies are aligned and completed on time to enable the project to be delivered successfully as planned for the clients FDOB (First Day of Business).
  • Manage and execute onsite changes to the physical installation to meet Client and Company standards as indicated within the agreed design package.
  • Communicate effectively while on and off-site with clients, client project teams and the Company Project team when required, discussing problems, clarifying situations, identifying, and explaining solutions.
  • Communicate effectively with our Local Service Partner (LSP) on all projects to establish their assigned engineering proof of concept (POC).
  • Discuss with LSP project details, requirements, identified problems, clarify updates, identify, and explain clear solutions.
  • In-depth testing and troubleshooting of access control and IP network video systems.
  • Basic population of programming sheets at the discretion of the assigned applicationengineer.
  • Population of commissioning sheets, site plans, mark-up drawings, and co-ordinate with the assigned application engineers in the commissioning process of client systems.
  • Commission systems and be responsible for testing and handover of the finished installation to a satisfactory conclusion in line with the security design package.
  • Complete commissioning and hand over documentation with punch list items to the project manager to ensure all elements are driven to completion for a clean, error free operating security system.
  • Follow assigned projects to final adjustments, test, troubleshoot and rectify as part of the commissioning and signoff process.
  • Ensure on-site clients are trained in the use of the installed system.
  • Supervise and manage members of the installation team for both internal technicians and local service partners engineering teams while working on site.
  • Verify the installation quality meets as a minimum the standards as defined within the security design package and in line with Company best practice guidelines for security installation standards.
  • Communicate progress on jobs and provide regular status reports to the Project Manager to enable efficient resource planning.
  • Work on project pre-builds when required or inspect and verify the quality of builds completed by others are to client and Company standards prior to being dispatched to sites.
  • Partner with colleagues to improve and maintain standards across the company.
  • Attend site meetings as required, representing the company in an effective and professional manner.
  • Ensure prompt completion of personal timesheets, expenses, project tracker reports and any associated paperwork on a weekly basis.
  • Work and maintain compliance with the Company’s Health and Safety standards and requirements, with the safety of self and others in mind at all time.
  • Maintain confidentiality and be sensitive to client’s security requirements.
  • Other duties as assigned.
SKILLS
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Highly organized and detail oriented.
  • Practical aptitude.
  • Ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
  • Time-management
  • Works well under pressure.
  • IT literacy, MS Office.
  • High level of knowledge in MS Excel.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of IP technology.
  • Basic understanding of networking (e.g. Cisco, TCP/IP, routing, switching

This is a 6 months maternity cover contract.
This is a fantastic opportunity for an ambitious marketer to lead Fin Tech’ global event planning and execution.
The candidate will be a key member of the team, responsible for Fin Tech presence at the industry shows and conferences, and supporting events on the ground.
The ideal candidate has experience successfully executing events and exhibitions, managing multiple projects simultaneously, while delivering great quality of execution and results.
Responsibilities:
  • Organising participation in exhibitions, partner dinners and forums, and other marketing activities;
  • Creating detailed operational plans for all events, including timelines, venues, vendors, staffing, and budgets;
  • Briefing, collaborating and communicating with internal and external stakeholders;
  • Conducting pre- and post-event evaluations and report on outcomes;
  • Planning, monitoring and tracking budget and invoices;
  • Negotiating sponsorship deals;
  • Liaising and negotiating with vendors;
  • Content creation and production;
  • Project administration and management of workflow;
  • Offsite and onsite supervision and delivery of events.
Requirements
  • At least 5 years of experience in event management
  • Strong command of project/program development, project management and budget control skills
  • Able to travel
  • Prior experience handling B2B Tech corporate event
  • Good analytical, consultation, planning, presentation and facilitation skills will be an advantage
  • Strong business acumen and mindset
  • Self-motivated and positive attitude, excellent work ethic, a strong team player
  • Self-starter, hustler, able to work independently;
  • Good time management ability and ability to handle multiple tasks at any point of time
  • Detail-oriented, able to satisfy high executional standards
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written): able to brief internal and external stakeholders: sales teams, partners, sponsors, speakers, etc. to ensure the smooth implementation of projects; able to negotiate with vendors/service providers to ensure a successful, high-quality and cost-effective project execution;
Job Code: FAL
Email Address: felicia.lim@persolkelly.com

column3: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients.
Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd.

Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

Our deep market understanding and industry expertise, honed over four decades of operations in Singapore, gives us an edge in driving business change and empowering your organisation to overcome future HR challenges. We combine our expertise with genuine human insights to provide strategic solutions for your HR needs. Our team will partner with you to enhance your HR practices, so you can confidently achieve more.

112,tech project manager,/en/job/solution-architect-data-engineering-9429309,9429309,Solution Architect - Data Engineering,False,False,,,SGD,Government Technology Agency of Singapore (GovTech),22 hours ago,False,,,T16GB0002G,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

As a Solution Architect, you will be part of a team, collaborating with the Product Managers, Project Managers, Application Infrastructure Engineers, Software Engineers, Data Engineers, Operations Managers and Engineers, Digital Business Analysts and government agency users to deliver ICT capabilities to realise Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation.
You will be responsible for designing the end-to-end architecture for data analytics systems that is aligned with GovTech/agency’s strategic objectives and needs and GovTech’s tech directions. You will also be responsible for ensuring that the detailed design and development remains consistent with the overall architecture.
Success in your role as a solution architect will be demonstrated by your strong technical aptitude and ability to communicate in an effective and efficient manner.
What you will be working on:
  • Provide technical leadership and is responsible for establishing the direction for the IT architecture, standards, design and implementation approaches for the data analytics systems.
  • Demonstrate leadership in IT management by producing strategic and innovative concept proposals and papers.
  • Translate data analytics business requirements, including application resiliency requirements, into application architectural specifications. Propose products and solutions based on GovTech/agency’s Enterprise Architecture and standards.
  • Create, evaluate, and implement plans and design proposals for high impact IT solutions, involving leading edge technologies and methods considering key factors such as long-term effectiveness, practicality, technical limitations and criticality.
  • Design the architecture blueprint of GovTech/agency’s business, information and ICT assets, by using multiple architectural models.  Use, govern and enhance the architecture blueprint to ensure that the business and ICT are in alignment.
  • Manage technical project delivery; perform code reviews and make recommendations of code changes; collaborate with vendor development staff to resolve technical challenges; help to analyse and determine performance tuning and scalability improvements of code and queries.
  • Provide architecture and technical support during production incidents.
  • Possess broad and deep skills across disciplines, ability and interest in mentoring technical staff and raising collective technical competencies within the team.
What we are looking for:
The Solution Architect needs to have:
  • Degree or Diploma in any discipline.
  • Minimum 7 years of design/implementation/consulting experience – must have a minimum of 3 years hands-on experience as a technical lead and system architect for a data analytics system (i.e. system design, performance tuning, and system prototyping & maintenance).
  • A solid system development background.
  • Extensive experience in designing, developing, and deploying large, scalable production systems, both on-prem and on cloud such as AWS, Azure and Google Cloud platform, for cloud native applications.
  • Solid understanding of server-side, Service Oriented Architectures, containers, microservices, APIs and web services and public web sites / digital services development.
  • Solid technical skills and the ability to leverage them to determine the best solution to a technical problem.
  • Ability to analyse and identify comprehensive solutions considering all functional implications while developing a workable solution.
  • Working knowledge of DevSecOps software development tools and methodologies.
  • Results and customer oriented.
  • Team player with strong organisation and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders.
  • Preferably possess data modelling and SQL skills.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a comprehensive and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep developing your skill in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.
*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours.

113,tech project manager,/en/job/mechanical-construction-manager-9408501,9408501,Mechanical Construction Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Bintai Kindenko Pte Ltd,23-Mar-22,False,,21 days,197301874H,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"
Bintai Kindenko Pte Ltd was established as a joint venture between Kinden Corporation and Bintai of Singapore in 1973.

With 41 years of working experience in the Mechanical and Electrical engineering field, Bintai has established a reputation for quality work and reliability. It has since then undertaken and completed many major and prestigious projects in Singapore and within the region.

Headquartered in Singapore, the company has expanded its operations regionally throughout in Southeast Asia and China. Our regional offices are located in Vietnam (Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh), China (Beijing and Shanghai), Indonesia and Myanmar.

Bintai maintains a skilled and responsible workforce with a flexible approach and is able to mobilize at short notice to support projects in any location. Within the organization, there are a unique blend of skills ranging from project, management, design, planning, logistics, supervision, commissioning and maintenance.
","
The Construction Manager shall be responsible for the planning and execution of the construction works, managing field construction supervisors and plant and equipment supervisors, planning and managing temporary works, and ensuring the construction works are executed in accordance with the contract specifications.
  • Lead and manage a team of project engineers & supervisors for the construction scope of works
  • Lead and manage a team of sub-contractors for the construction activities
  • Manage the interfacing and coordination scope of works with other System Wide Contracts and Civil Contractors
  • Manage and take the lead to initiate meetings with LTA, main contractors, sub-contractors and other parties
  • Confer with engineers and other personnel to implement operating procedures, resolve system malfunctions, and provide technical information.
  • Analyze client design, specifications, manuals, and other data to evaluate the feasibility, cost, and maintenance requirements of designs or applications.
  • Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications.
  • Assist drafters in developing the structural design of products, using drafting tools or computer-assisted design/drafting equipment and software.
  • Provide feedback to design engineers on customer problems and needs.
  • Oversee installation, operation, maintenance, and repair to ensure that machines and equipment are installed and functioning according to specifications.
  • Develop and test models of alternate designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modification.
  • Develop, coordinate, and monitor all aspects of production, including selection of manufacturing methods, fabrication, and operation of product designs.
  • Estimate costs and submit bids for engineering, construction, or extraction projects, and prepare contract documents.
  • Perform personnel functions, such as supervision of production workers, technicians, technologists and other engineers, and design of evaluation programs.
  • Establish and coordinate the maintenance and safety procedures, service schedule, and supply of materials required to maintain machines and equipment in the prescribed condition.
  • Organizing, Planning, and Prioritizing Work -- plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
  • Monitor Processes, Materials, or Surroundings -- reviewing information from materials, events, or the environment, to detect or assess problems
  • Judging the Qualities of Things, Services, or People -- Assessing the value, importance, or quality of things or people.
  • Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others -- Handling complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others.
  • Complex Problem Solving -- Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
  • Critical Thinking -- Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
  • Time Management -- Managing one's own time and the time of others.
Experience & Education:
  • The candidate shall have a minimum of ten (10) years of construction experience, of which about five (5) years shall be in managing the construction of projects of similar size and complexity to the project
  • Construction manager in Infrastructure (LTA) project (depot, underground metro, road tunnel and etc.)
  • Mechanical Engineering degree holder
  • More than 10 year experience in construction industry
  • Management experience as Construction Manager/ Project Manager more than 5 year experience in either Depot or Underground MRT station
  • Working experience with LTA or similar Government Authority
Other requrements:
  • Knowledge of each system, ACMV, Tunnel ventilation, Fire fighting, BMS/SCADA, plumbing and sanitary and etc.
  • Knowledge of installation details of every system
  • Knowledge of Work breakdown structure & BOQ
  • Capability to build the detailed execution plan, method statement
  • Capability to execute engineering calculation, such as fan pressure drop, hydraulic calculation and etc.
  • Capability to manage the change/ variation and its costs

114,tech project manager,/en/job/digital-marketing-manager-b2b-saas-9425435,9425435,Digital Marketing Manager - B2B SAAS,False,False,80000,100000,SGD,Ambition Group Singapore Pte. Ltd. (SG),29-Mar-22,False,,30 days,10C5117,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

column2:
Ambition is a leading global boutique recruitment business listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. With coverage across Hong Kong, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and London, we specialise within the areas of Banking & Financial Services, Finance & Accounting, Sales & Marketing, Supply Chain & Procurement, Technology and Digital.","

Our client is an award-winning regional HR service provider with its headquarters in Singapore. A tech-enabled company, they provide a suite of HR solutions and services to customers across a wide range of industries (retail, healthcare, financial services, government, energy, manufacturing etc).

About the role :

As a Digital Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing the digital marketing strategy for the organisation and leading its execution to create client engagement opportunities that show clear ROI. You will be responsible for the budget for all related marketing activities across all digital channels including search, social media, content, email and display. Other responsibilities include:

  • Leading the digital marketing plan road-maps and digital campaigns across various social media and ad platforms
  • Developing and implementing a robust paid media strategy across creatives, audiences, strategies, channels and geographies
  • Meet and exceed ambitious growth KPIs for the company's digital marketing goals
  • Being accountable for metrics such as traffic quality, conversation rates etc. across channels
  • Developing and executing media strategy to promote the brand and products across multiple channels to expand audiences and customer base
  • Incorporating market and industry trends, available research data, and web funnel analytics to determine the optimal media mix
  • Hiring and coaching of the digital marketing team

The ideal candidate will have

  • At least 5 years of experience in media strategy and planning, digital marketing, and media and campaign analytics.
  • Prior experience in B2B tech marketing in a SaaS tech company with prior experience in lead generation as well as inbound and outbound digital campaigns
  • Knowledge and experience with digital marketing and automation tools across digital channels (Google Adwords, Linkedin Ads, Analytics etc)
  • Strong digital media planning experience across SEO/SEM and with working knowledge of managing CPC, PPC, paid search and paid social
  • Ability to work independently while also managing subordinates well
  • Strong organisational skills & effective at project management

To apply online please use the 'apply' function, alternatively you may Contact Tushita Kumar at tushita.kumar@ambition.com.sg . For more information, please visit www.ambition.com.sg. Due to application volume, only successful applicants will be notified

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you know someone who would be great at this role, why not take advantage of our referral scheme? We offer SGD1,000 or SGD350 in shopping vouchers for every referred candidate who we place in a role. Terms & Conditions Apply. https://www.ambition.com.sg/refer-a-friend

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. Do you want to apply your skills, knowledge and energy to implement cutting-edge infocomm technology and digital solutions that will change the lives of Singaporeans and the public? In GovTech, you can! As a Digital Business Analyst, you will work in a Government Agency as a key member of the GovTech project team. You will support the Chief Information Officer at the Agency and collaborate with fellow project managers, solution architects and technical services consultants to deliver leading-edge digital solutions. You are a pro-active, self-motivated and resourceful team member with good tech/digital knowledge and possess strong influencing and people handling skills. You are also adept at balancing multiple projects concurrently while constantly looking for new ways to apply digital technologies to meet identified Agency and citizen/business needs. What to Expect:
  • You will be involved in a range of tasks including the following:
  • partner with the Agency’s business teams to elicit citizen/business needs through human-centric, visual methods such as service journeys and develop the appropriate business case
  • apply Design Thinking / Service Design methodology and tools to develop and execute the approach to derive current state gaps and challenges, and future state design and solutions
  • work with fellow Govtechies and the Agency's project teams to develop user stories, functional/technical specifications and acceptance criteria
  • adopt best practices in data governance, perform data cleansing, pre-processing and feature engineering that facilitate meaningful analysis
  • design interactive visualisation dashboards for data exploration and provide insights to Agency’s business teams
  • evaluate and recommend suitable technology while aligning with GovTech’s technology directions (such as cloud-based, enterprise architecture and modernization of legacy systems, adoption of SG Tech Stack)
  • identify and adopt the appropriate development methodology (e.g. Agile or Waterfall) in an Outsourced, Co-Sourced or In-house development environment
  • ensure system or product readiness for smooth deployment, adoption and operations
  • analyse impact of requested changes and propose improvements to continuously address changing business needs, and work with support team to understand and address technical problems (Operations & Maintenance phase)
  • assist the CIO to identify new opportunities for the Agency’s digital transformation
How to Succeed:
  • Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related subject area with minimum 3 years of relevant experience. Candidates with more years of experience will be considered for more senior roles
  • Prior working experience in IT business analysis, application solutioning design and testing
  • Participated in at least one full software or product development cycle, preferably using Agile Methodology
  • Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills
  • Good communication skills with the ability to pitch ideas and influence
  • A driven and motivated personality with an inquisitive mind
  • Ability to learn and apply
Preferred Skills:
  • Business Analysis certification, e.g. Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
  • Past development or consulting experience
  • Relevant experience in one or more of the following areas:
  • Data manipulation using scripting languages like Python or using ETL tools Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Power BI End-to-end analytics architecture, preferably with some working knowledge of big data stack
Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

116,tech project manager,/en/job/application-solution-architect-%7C-2100027m-%7C-9377959,9377959,Application / Solution Architect | (2100027M) |,False,False,,,SGD,OCBC Bank (Singapore),14-Mar-22,False,,30 days,193200032W,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: The OCBC Bank group of businesses comprises a family of companies owned by Singapore’s longest-established local bank.

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. Since the time of our founders, we have always understood the financial needs of our customers and developed financial solutions that meet their needs.

To address increasingly diverse needs across different communities and geographies, OCBC Bank has expanded and acquired businesses beyond the realm of commercial banking. OCBC Bank has been ranked by Bloomberg Markets magazine as the World's Strongest Bank for two years, 2011 and 2012.

column1:
","
The Application / Solution Architect plays a core technical role in the development of a system and is actively involved in the entire project lifecycle especially through requirements gathering, design. Working hand in hand with the Project Manager and other stakeholders such as business analysts, technical lead and vendors, the Application / Solution Architect shapes and steers the software architecture and design for the solution, and is a key contributor to the overall smooth delivery of any solution within the targeted timeline.
He/she is also expected to work independently, a strong technical background that enables him/her to propose sound, practical solutions to business problems. Influencing skills are a must, not only to resolve conflicts, but also to manage stakeholders across the business and IT community. The candidate should already have the ability to think laterally and quickly grasp key concepts, have a positive attitude and be resilient when dealing with challenges.
Description
  • Propose best-fit architecture solutions for projects
  • Advise on complex coding, issues & resolution
  • Provide detailed design (domain-driven, bounded context, granularity of microservices)
  • Work hands-on with the development team
  • Escalate design and implementation challenges to Technical Architect and Development Manager level for resolution
  • Contribute to identifying best-fit architectural solutions for one or more projects
  • Develop design of application and provide regular support/guidance on complex coding, issue resolution and execution
  • Be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.
  • Manage the Application Architects.
  • Overall architect to deliver the business capability ensuring architecture principles are adhered to, design review and define tech stack.
Qualifications
  • Preferably 7 years of experience in technology consulting, enterprise and solutions architecture and architectural frameworks in Java/J2ee technologies.
  • Preferably 3 years of experience in Micro-services architecture, Messaging (MQ, Kafka).
  • Nice to have experience in Cloud, and infrastructure setup.
  • Exceptional communication skills and the demonstrable ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations.
  • Must be a team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus. Must be highly reliable, trustworthy, honest, and commitment oriented.
  • Strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities.
  • Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from an architectural standpoint.
  • Good experience in thought leadership, white papers and mentoring of staff and internal consulting teams.
  • Experience and knowledge of Financial Industry Risks & Compliance or Management & Controls type of application systems will be advantageous.
",[],Junior Executive,,7 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Subject to designation', 'Subject to designation']",https://ocbc.taleo.net/careersection/ocbc_external/jobdetail.ftl?job=2100027M&lang=en,70170,Central,sg

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

The Government Technology of Singapore (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us in working together to support Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

GoBusiness, one of the key strategic national projects, aims to transform digital services for businesses in Singapore by making it Simpler, Faster and Better. GoBusiness portal offers comprehensive information for businesses, supporting and assisting them with their needs in their Start, Run and Grow phase. We are on a journey to expand the list of service offerings and features in GoBusiness, and we are looking for an experienced Engagement Manager to join the team to realise this mission. If you are inspired by this vision, we invite you to join our Engagement Manager team.

What You Will Be Working On:

  • Work with design researchers and Product Team to identify market and service gaps for businesses in Singapore, and perform deep analysis using data to identify and conceptualise potential features and services for GoBusiness.
  • Innovate in order to manage changing situations (such as Covid) and react quickly to the market needs by breaking down requirements to release quickly and iterate.
  • Engage and provide agencies or private companies with a compelling vision to deliver their products and services through the GoBusiness platform to create a seamless experience for businesses.
  • Responsible for successful integration of GoBusiness with external systems for the provision of products and services through the GoBusiness platform.
  • Experienced in working with Agile Product Teams to ensure features are built well, delivered on time and successfully rolled out.
  • Be responsible for delivering on KPIs, define appropriate metrics and track consumer behaviour post launch. Perform extensive data analysis to gain consumer insights, and pro-actively share updates on feature performance.
  • Develop effective stakeholder relationships across GovTech and other government entities. Communicate and present to senior decision makers and stakeholders on project progress and resolve issues efficiently.
  • Able to identify potential project risks and its implication to the different stakeholders, and recommend mitigating measures so as to manage the risks and provide reasonable assurance.
  • Able to understand tech management policy, quality management policy and security guidelines to ensure development processes and systems are designed to comply with these policy and guidelines

What We Are Looking For:

  • We are looking for someone who is proactive, with a strong drive to get things done. Keeping up with the changing needs of businesses is hard work, where tenacity, perseverance and willingness to debate and learn is important.
  • Solid experience in Business Analysis, Service Design or Product Management in a demanding, agile working environment.
  • Agile approach to project management that is utilized in product management and software development.
  • Proven record of successfully delivering high-impact, complex projects while managing risks
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem-solving skills.
  • Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems, Electronics Engineering or related disciplines.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a comprehensive and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep developing your skill in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours.

Omni Mold company, is a ultra precision plastic injection mould making company in Singapore. Specializing in ultra-precision, high complex and high cavitation moulds. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced computer software and machine tool hardware. Together with proven track records, system and highly trained staffs, we are positioned to meet the requirements of the most stringent customers in the global arena, in sectors such as Medical, Pharmaceutical, Healthcare, Nutrition / Food Packaging, Information Technology, Office Automation, Automotive and Consumer Electronics.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Lead and direct cross-functional team in program execution
  • Ensure proper qualification of new projects and successful implementation of programs in the production/manufacturing unit
  • Track and monitor project progress to ensure project schedules and cost objectives are met
  • Actively follow on sales leads and take lead in business development
  • Serve as primary technical contact with customers on strategic or politically sensitive issues
  • Provide support to BD manager in generating quotation for molding projects involving new toolings
  • Provide customer support and perform in BD activities to direct customers; Serve as primary technical contact with customers on strategic or politically sensitive issues

  • Identify and specify engineering requirements for new projects
  • Initiate equipment procurement activities for new projects when needed (with Purchasing)
  • Plan and execute tooling qualification activities with supporting groups to achieve successful project execution

Job Requirements:

  • Diploma/ Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related
  • Minimum 3 years of working experience in project management & production process
  • Plastic injection moulding and mould assembly background preferred

The above statements reflect the general tasks, duties, activities and/or responsibilities necessary to describe this position and is not intended to set forth all of the specific requirements of the job. These job duties/responsibilities may change or vary in response to business needs.
