column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Job Descriptions
  • Implementation of business plans and support for key strategic initiatives for High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Responsible for OPEX cost recovery through securing new stakeholder contributions
  • Develop and plan for strategic infrastructure including software and hardward for HPC
  • Drive, organized and support outreach activities to Institutes of Higher Learning and Government agencies
  • Meet KPIs in terms of number of industry related projects supported by NSCC
  • Management of operational Marketing and customer relationship activities
  • Build and maintain key customer relationship with various governmental agencies, Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs), Research Institutes and commercial organizations to ensure that NSCC meets its target
  • Present to C-Level Executives on NSCC’s solutions and services that meet customers’ need
  • Identify new opportunities, negotiates and closes engagements
  • Assist in pricing solution/services
  • Forecast, track and ensure targets and KPIs are met by team
  • Maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions and knowledge of customers
  • Work closely with internal teams to meet customer needs and to increase user base and projects
  • Develop clear processes and systems for new business
  • Attend industry functions and provide feedback and information on market and trends
  • Oversee and liaise with legal team with the various governmental agencies, Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs), Research Institutes and commercial organizations
  • Oversee and liaise with both internal and external teams on the various project agreements
  • Project management and management of strategic projects
Job Requirements
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT or Business Administration from a reputable university. Master Degree Preferred
  • About 5-7 years of Administrative, Business Development, Sales, Marketing or relevant working experience
  • At least 3 years of experience in delivering integrated solutioning and consultancy for end to end projects
  • Good knowledge software development and solution architecture skillsets are highly advantageous
  • Excellent negotiation skills, proven track record of successfully pitching for new business and engagements.
  • Highly organized and motivated
  • Excellent networking, strong interpersonal, presentation and writing skills
  • Experience in working with senior management to align business development strategies and solutions
  • Good team player who must be able to adapt quickly and work independently when needed
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Has strong interest in technology knowledge in Supercomputing, AI, Quantum Computing and etc.
  • Experience in the government, IT and High Tech sector will be an advantage

141,tech project manager,/en/job/compliance-program-manager-9431223,9431223,Compliance Program Manager,False,False,,,SGD,TikTok,5 hours ago,False,,,201719908M,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

","

Responsibilities

About Us:

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

About the Team:

We are looking for a Compliance Program Manager to be based in Singapore to join our Global Legal Compliance team. The candidate we are seeking is a seasoned compliance professional with good experience as a frontline compliance specialist in sanctions/KYC screening, third party due diligence, data analysis, and compliance system or tool optimization. The ideal candidate should be willing to work in a fast-paced environment with cross-functional teams and embrace challenges to navigate in various jurisdictions and new issues.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Review international trade screening/KYC risk alerts and be a first line specialist on how to proceed accordingly.
  • Conduct due diligence related to third-party on-boarding and monitoring process.
  • Conduct risk assessments related to compliance programs including anti-corruption and sanctions/KYC.
  • Perform data analysis to identify potential compliance risks and gaps.
  • Work closely with cross-functional legal teams, internal system operations teams, and other corporate function teams to design and optimize international trade screening mechanisms, third-party due diligence programs and other monitoring/reporting processes.
  • Advise and escalate to Global Legal Compliance team and business stakeholders on compliance-related issues arising from risk assessment and data analysis.
  • Support regional and global compliance initiatives.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree from a recognized university.
  • Over three years of experience as a compliance program manager in international trade and anti-corruption areas from a multinational company, ideally in the tech industry.
  • Hold highest standards of ethics and integrity, while possess capability to navigate risks with cross functional teams.
  • Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English to work with international stakeholders.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to work under time pressure and manage various deadlines in a fast-paced and demanding work environment.
  • Experience with working with international teams in various time zones in a cross-functional environment.
  • Willingness to travel and to visit sites within the region on a regular basis after the pandemic.
  • A strong team player.
  • Mandarin speaking is a plus but not a must as the role would liaise heavily with Chinese speaking stakeholders .

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

column3: Since our humble beginnings in 2002, People Profilers has steadily grown from strength to strength. Our expertise in providing Human Capital consultancy to our clients – universally sought after skills and expertise in just about any sector– has allowed People Profilers to leave an imprint across various industries and build a reputation for competency and expertise.

What differentiates People Profilers from every other recruiter is our unwavering commitment to building relationships with our clients- understanding exactly what our clients are after, and allowing us to match their precise needs. We deliver human capital solutions that allow organisations and their employees to succeed.

Here at People Profilers, we pride ourselves on being a one-stop human capital solutions provider for your organisation. Our innovative and relationship-focused workforce solutions have been provided across a wide range of industries.

Job ID: QX99R76R
  • Attractive Benefits
  • Completion bonus
  • MNC
Responsibilities
  • To provide package unit and equipment project design expertise to the Project to ensure project requirements are fulfilled. Liaising with different parties (Contractors, Operations, Authorities) ensuring alignment in all relevant aspects for equipment, package units, with piping, E&I and structural/civil and with local authority requirements
  • Review equipment and package unit (PU) engineering making sure project requirements are fulfilled.
  • Assist in managing package/equipment engineering needs of the Project with close coordination with appointed Contractor(s) and Vendors.
  • Check and Review the Project technical documentation and requirements covered in Project specifications, RFQs, Bidder Quotes, Clarifications, PO Requisitions, Vendor Docs, Inspection and Testing Plans, Tech Queries from 3rd parties, etc to ensure Company’s expectations and requirements are satisfactorily met
  • With in-depth engineering expertise coordinate interfaces between various disciplines (such as Equipment, PU, piping, Civil/Structural, and E&I) internally and externally with contractor(s) and vendor(s).
  • Preparation of RFQ Package(s) for Project Tender.
  • Assist in EPC contractor coordination for effective management of Engineering & Construction interfaces from an equipment/package standpoint
  • Support the engineering contractor with required as-built information and coordination with plant operations.
  • Interface management with other sub-projects, suppliers, and operations/ maintenance ensuring smooth execution as part of a brownfield project
  • Alignment of engineering design vs actual site conditions
  • Coordinate preparation of technical specifications for procurement.
  • Ensure an adequate standard of technical documentation in accordance with Company’s guidelines and standards
  • Responsible for validating that all specified requirements have been fulfilled.
  • Coordinate and assist in the resolution of technical issues arising during the project and for interfacing/supporting the various engineering disciplines and departments.
  • Verify and act upon the remarks of the Client/Certifying Body.
  • Responsible for providing technical support during pre-commissioning/commissioning and start-up.
  • Representing Company in Model reviews

Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant engineering subject with min 10 years professional experience in related field.
  • Experience working in project and construction environment within gas & gas industries.
  • Extensive engineering expertise in Package Unit, static equipment, and / or piping design (Mandatory) in Oil & Gas Industry or petrochemical, or similar
  • Construction experience in Oil& Gas Industry.
  • Familiar with Pre-assembled equipment units and associated interface challenges
  • Conversant with Singapore Authority requirements with respect to Steam Boilers, Steam Piping and associated equipment Design, Fabrication, and Installation to effectively interface with Project Permitting team
  • Brownfield experience (preferred)
  • Experience in piping design
  • Detailed knowledge of relevant national and international codes and standards.
  • Detailed knowledge of local safety and construction practices
  • Familiar with P&IDs, Isometrics, equipment dwg’s, E&I
All Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.
Interested applicants may wish to email your resume in a detailed Word format to cindy.char@peopleprofilers.com
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

",

144,tech project manager,/en/job/o-t-transition-services-program-management-senior-lead-22424540-9417648,9417648,O&T Transition Services Program Management Senior Lead -22424540,False,False,,,SGD,Citibank N.A.,27-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200309485K,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.

Mission: Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. We are Citi, the global bank – an institution connecting millions of people across hundreds of countries and cities.

column1:
","
As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do. We keep the bank safe and provide the technical tools our workers need to be successful. We design our digital architecture and ensure our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. Our operations teams manage risk, resources, and program management. We focus on enterprise resiliency and business continuity. We develop, coordinate, and execute strategic operational plans. Essentially, Enterprise Operations & Technology re-engineers’ client and partner processes to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and controlled services.
This Senior Program Manager position is responsible for overseeing the fulfilment of the Transitional Service Agreement (TSA) activities for Operations and Technology associated with the Consumer Divestiture, working in conjunction with the wider regional program team.
The Senior TSA Program Manager will be the first point of contact for the buyer throughout the TSA period. They will participate in and lead relevant governance committees to ensure appropriate governance, coordinate billing for the services provided, manage entitlements and access and partner with groups across EO&T including Citi Shared Services, Citi Technology Infrastructure, Global Functions Technology, the Chief Information Security Office, Citi Reality Services, Records Management, Continuity of Business Services, the Resource Management Office and the Citi Solutions Centers.
The successful candidate requires a comprehensive understanding of the Asia business and Operations and Technology - including how they interact in order to achieve the objectives of the function.
The successful candidate will:
  • be accountable for the delivery of the separation plan for O&T for the multi-market buyer;
  • apply their in-depth understanding of the business impact of technical contributions.
  • require strong commercial awareness
  • have excellent communication skills in order to negotiate internally, and with the buyer often at a senior level;
  • manage and maintain strong records and governance;
Responsibilities:
  • Supports planning, directing and coordination of day-to-day activities of running Damselfly for O&T.
  • Identifies stakeholders and key organizations and build and manage relationships.
  • Directs the creation of multiple programs of work and manage their alignment to business goals.
  • Leads the facilitation, coordination, and arbitration of cross-functional macro level topics within/across programs and with Senior Management.
  • Leads the identification and drive resolution of issues, including those outside established programs of work.
  • Works with stakeholders to ensure program scope definition meets business objectives.
  • Drives adherence to program processes, procedures, methods, and standards for program delivery and leverage across the program.
  • Directs the communication of status, issue, and risk disposition to all stakeholders, including senior management, on a timely basis.
  • Directs the identification of risks which impact program delivery and ensure mitigation strategies are developed and executed when necessary.
  • Manages multiple teams or a functional area (depending on size of business).
  • Applies comprehensive understanding of concepts and procedures within own area and basic knowledge of other areas to resolve issues that have impact beyond own area.
  • Ensures creation and signoff of program plan and charter, benefits management plan, stakeholder management plan, acceptance plan, and central program issue log.
  • Ensures program plans meet business needs as described in the program initiation documents.
  • Ensures all stakeholders are identified and included in scope definition activities, understand the program schedule and key milestones and receive schedule status regularly.
  • Ensures funding has been approved for the program.
  • Ensures all areas of the program are appropriately staffed.
  • Ensures program commitment from those assigning resources.
  • Escalates program risks to the Program Director, or Program Sponsor, when appropriate.
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
  • 12+ years of experience
  • Technical expert and known internally and externally as reliable, knowledgeable resource.
  • Clear understanding of Citi's' different businesses and the related economics.
Education:
  • Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred
",[],Senior Executive,,12 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://jobs.citi.com/job/singapore/o-and-t-transition-services-program-management-senior-lead/287/22421651264,70000,Singapore,sg

145,tech project manager,/en/job/information-technology-manager-facilities-it-operations-9428412,9428412,Information Technology Manager (Facilities & IT Operations),False,False,,,SGD,Procter & Gamble (Singapore) Pte Ltd,30-Mar-22,False,,,196900413D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"
P&G is its people and the values by which we live. We attract and recruit the finest people in the world. We build our organization from within, promoting and rewarding people without regard to any difference unrelated to performance. We act on the conviction that the men and women of Procter & Gamble will always be our most important asset.

Come Grow With Us!","

Do you like a hands-on and fast-paced role that merges IT strategy and P&G's facilities and workplace? Information Technology (IT) at Procter & Gamble brings business, innovation and technology together to create competitive advantage. Our growing family works closely with all functions across the company to understand both current and future business needs. We design and deliver quality solutions that meet business objectives through state of the art and industry leading mobile, social, cloud, big data analytics, IoT capabilities or modern technologies and capabilities. A career with us builds change leadership and influence skills, breadth of experience across multiple businesses, and depth of expertise in areas like Application & Integration, Infrastructure, Data & Analytics and IT Security & Risk.

Your Team

You will report to the regional Workplace Services Cluster Leader and be working with multi-functional partners across Singapore Sites. You will also be accountable for a large team of P&G's external workplace vendors and suppliers.

What Success Looks Like

As a Information Technology Manager (Facilities & IT Operations), you are expected to lead a team that will run our workplace and ensure that our employees perform at their peak in our offices. You will be responsible for crafting a strategy to run, digitize, and transform our workplace, and you are also expected to eventually lead local and regional workplace IT projects with some low-level coding.

Role Responsibilities

  • Be the first point of contact for workplace business needs and partner with regional and global service teams to drive transformation and execution
  • Work with management (both IT and HR) to strategize and develop internal processes and business strategies
  • Work with the local facilities management team to ensure that the physical workplace is operating as expected
  • Work with the local IT operations team to ensure that the site IT equipment and processes are operating as expected
  • Adjust and execute global and regional IT and facilities priority projects to meet the local workplace needs
  • Develop and maintain a well-coordinated internal relationship with partners within your customer's organization (Site HR and General Management) and with the wider IT organization.

Qualifications

  • BS/ B.Tech./ M Tech in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • 2-8 years of working experience
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Ownership with executional excellence
  • Excellent communication skills and proven experience in leading data driven projects from definition through interpretation and execution
  • Strong leadership skills, with the ability to initiate and drive projects, and communicate plans to internal clients and senior leaders
  • Facilities management skills is an added advantage
  • Experience managing medium to large teams even with 3rd party vendors and suppliers

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Job Description:
SIMTech & ARTC (S&A) aspire to help our customers and partners achieve translational research to technology deployment in MedTech Manufacturing by leveraging the power of research and development to co-innovate and co- develop.
Responsibilities
As a Key Account Development Manager for MedTech & Healthcare, reporting to Director MedTech & Healthcare (S&A), you will play a pivotal role responsible for customer success through the management of program deliveries and strong customer relationships. You will have the opportunity to implement the MedTech Manufacturing business strategy, driving collaborations between industry partners and ARTC, securing projects and building a collaborative ecosystem.
This role focuses on onboarding customers into SIMTech and ARTC's MedTech Manufacturing Alliance Consortium. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles leading development processes and technical discussions with senior customer executives.
Our prevailing business priority is the customers’ successful adoption and productive use of our MedTech Manufacturing technologies and solutions.  You are front and centre with our customers supporting their digital journey..
Key Accountabilities include
  • Drive value-based engagements with potential partners and to onboard them onto MedTech Manufacturing Alliance Consortium
  • Build a robust and sustainable MedTech Manufacturing ecosystem composed of product owners, solution & technology providers, manufacturers, system integrators, institute of higher learning, research institutes, and public agencies.
  • Strategize, develop, and execute business plans for multi-stakeholders and senior executives’ engagements in MedTech Manufacturing
  • Develop deep relationships with key customer, identify business opportunities for growth, negotiate and close business deals.
  • Lead conversations with customers to capture business and technical requirements, identify problem statements to scope work package proposals for collaboration
  • Work closely with our technical divisions to enable the translation of research outcomes to business viable products
  • Coordinate with other A*STAR Research Institutes and public agencies to deliver business viable solutions
Job Requirements:
  • Bachelor in any business/engineering-related discipline.
  • With 2 to 5 year (s) of working experience in business-related functions, technology, enterprise sales/account management and marketing.
  • Proven track record in sales and sales achievement, with experience in value-based selling, selling as a team, a selling service.
  • Strong business acumen, and is self-driven to deliver customer requirements and project deadlines
  • Professional presentation and communication skills for management-level audience, both written and verbal
  • Positive attitude, resilient, agile, and able to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

147,tech project manager,/en/job/hardware-design-manager-9384251,9384251,HARDWARE DESIGN MANAGER,False,False,,,SGD,Doodle Labs (SG) Pte Ltd,11 hours ago,False,,,201200731C,,,1 - 50 Employees,,Tai Seng,"

As an engineering-driven organization, Doodle Labs’ core competency is developing state-of-the-art wireless broadband solutions to enable innovative Industrial IoT applications. Our goal is to allow our customers go to market quickly with better performing products at a lower overall cost.

For almost 20 years OEM manufacturers have been relying on Doodle Labs for expertise in designing their wireless systems. Our design philosophy has always focused on achieving best-in-class performance while requiring minimal integration effort.

We have a broad portfolio of products that are available off-the-shelf. In addition, we work closely with OEMs to conceptualize and develop solutions for large-scale projects. Please contact us with your project requirements and we would be happy to discuss them with you.

Our products have been adopted by many Fortune 500 companies in a variety of industries. We use only tier-1 components and well-established RF manufacturing processes to achieve the highest quality products possible. Each product is individually tested and calibrated to ensure performance and reliability. As a testament to their quality, our radios have been field proven in the most demanding industrial and military applications possible.

Doodle Labs was founded in 1999 and has offices in the United States and Singapore.

","

Hardware Design Manager

About Doodle Labs

Doodle Labs is the global leader in high-performance private wireless systems. We build cutting-edge mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. Doodle Labs has experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our radio systems have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies (e.g. Airbus, General Electric) and industry-leading innovators (e.g. Boston Dynamics, FLIR).

Your Opportunity

Doodle Labs develops market-leading broadband mesh radios. Products include handheld mesh hotspots (Wearable Smart Radio) and tiny embedded multi-band radios for robots (Helix). Your opportunity is to lead cross-functional teams of RF, networking, and mechanical experts to build the next generation of Doodle Labs’ radio portfolio.

The successful candidate will have significant experience designing hardware products and leading cross-functional engineering teams. Project management and leadership skills are just as important as technical abilities for this role.  

Job Description

General Requirements

  • 10+ years’ experience developing hardware products and leading teams.
  • Confidence and leadership qualities, keen to guide a team of engineers and technicians
  • Experienced in broad aspects of analog and digital HW design. Ideally with knowledge of signal processing and basic demodulation and networking concepts.

·      Candidate must possess at least a bachelor’s degree, Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in EE Engineering or equivalent. A master’s degree or PhD is an additional plus.

Product Development

·      Direct, review, and approve product design and changes. 

·      Develop and implement policies, standards and procedures for the engineering and technical work performed. 

·      Create detailed engineering plans, processes, and procedures for engineering staff to use and abide by. 

·      Lead the handover of new models to Production together with the test procedures.  

Project Management 

·      Lead development projects from technical, team management, and schedule perspectives. 

·      Work cross-functionally with management, production, and marketing staff to discuss project requirements and coordinate development timelines. 

·      Utilize detailed project plans to communicate timelines and expectations within the development team and across the company. 

·      Analyse technology and resource needs to plan and assess the feasibility of projects. 

Team Leadership 

·      Lead a team of engineers to develop advanced wireless in a collaborative and sustainable way.

·      Develop the team's engineering talent via one-on-one mentorship and regular constructive feedback. 

·      Evaluate individual performance of team members on a semi-annual basis

·      Aid in the recruitment of high-quality engineering talent.

FUGRO is a multi-discipline group of companies in Asia with its main centers operation located in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Brunei and Indonesia. Being part of the world wide Fugro Group, independent provider of geo-intelligence and asset integrity solutions, which provides a board range services in the fields of offshore marine, geophysical, positioning, construction surveying, subsea technologies and services.

","

Job Description

Supports lab operations by

1) carrying out standard laboratory tests,

2) assisting more senior Lab Technicians in carrying out non-standard laboratory tests,

3) preparing and cleaning up test settings within time, budget and quality requirements and,

4) working within clearly defined standard operating procedures. Works with close supervision.

Requires preparatory vocational education (VMBO) and limited prior relevant training or work experience.

Reports To: Laboratory Manager

Job Responsibilities:

  • Carry out laboratory tests and provide results of the soil samples taken from onshore or offshore
  • Assist Project Manager and Engineer with onboard routine test result and data processing
  • Ensure traceability and proper handling of soil samples
  • Mobilise and demobilise equipment for projects
  • Perform inventory and maintenance check
  • Ensure the process conforms to customer, statutory and management system requirements
  • Perform other Laboratory related operations as and when required.
  • Perform routine laboratory tests on vessel during offshore soil investigation.
  • Willing to work on vessel for offshore site investigation work.
  • Willing to travel to other countries for work purposes as and when requested by the company.

Job Requirement:

·       Diploma in Civil Engineering / G.C.E. “O” or “N” Level or equivalent

·       Relevant experience in soil testing industry

·       Good analytical ability, organizational and time management skills

·       Self-driven, possess excellent team spirit and good interpersonal skills

·       Preferably proficient in MS office applications

Interested applicants, please apply via:

Workday (myworkdayjobs.com)

About Fugro

Fugro is the world’s leading Geo-data specialist, collecting and analysing comprehensive information about the Earth and the structures built upon it. Adopting an integrated approach that incorporates acquisition and analysis of Geo-data and related advice, Fugro provides solutions. With expertise in site characterisation and asset integrity, clients are supported in the safe, sustainable and efficient design, construction and operation of their assets throughout the full life cycle.

Employing approximately 9000 talented people in 61 countries, Fugro serves clients around the globe, predominantly in the energy and infrastructure industries, both offshore and onshore. In 2020, revenue amounted to EUR 1.4 billion. Fugro is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.

Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:

Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated.

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","
the Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. The Cyber Security Group (CSG) is the cybersecurity arm of GovTech. CSG is committed to create a digital government that is safe and secure. CSG delivers technical and operational capabilities to counteract cyber threats, provides thought leadership on transformative cybersecurity governance and policies and to strengthen the cybersecurity posture of government agencies in a manner that is sustainable, pragmatic, and effective. We are seeking for a Cybersecurity Strategic Analysis and Planning Consultant (Products/ Programmes/ Services) to manage and support various cybersecurity workplans. In this role, you will also have the opportunities to be exposed to new developments and cutting-edge technologies that are used in our smart nation initiatives.
What you will be working on:
  • Interface with the technical teams to understand the team’s function and deliverables, and represent the teams to support in the formulation of the Division’s workplan and strategies.
  • Maintain regular engagement and proactive partnership with technical teams to ensure assigned strategies align with overall workplan.
  • Manage and support in the formulation and tracking of the KPIs for the delivery and performance measurement framework for the Division’s workplan.
  • Embed as project management support in technical teams to oversee the delivery of products/programmes/services.
  • Ensure the success of the deliverables through planning, tracking of the project timeline, financial, manpower and reporting the status to both internal and external management stakeholders.
What we are looking for:
  • Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science/Engineering, IT, or equivalent
  • Experience in IT Project management, Workplan or Strategic Planning.
  • Possess strategic and critical thinking mindset
  • Good communication and presentation skills
  • Collaborative and team player, self-motivated, creative and versatile
Other preferred considerations:
  • Certifications such as CISA, CISSP, ISO27000, ITIL, COBIT is an advantage
  • Well-versed in security principles, policies and industry best practices (e.g. ISO27000 security policies, IM8, COBIT, ITIL)
  • Experience in IT cybersecurity consultancy for IT sector or with major consulting firms
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column3: GroupM, the world’s leading full service media investment management operation, was created by WPP to oversee its assets in this sector.  These assets include Mindshare, MediaCom, MEC and MAXUS.  The focus of GroupM is the intelligent application of volume and scale in trading, innovation and quality of services, in order to bring benefit to clients and the companies it operates.

WPPis the world leader in communications services.  It comprises of leading companies in all of these disciplines: advertising; media investment management; consumer insight; public relations & public affairs; branding & identity; direct, digital, promotion & relationship marketing; healthcare communications; and specialist communications.  There are more than 150 companies within the Group.  Between them, our companies work with 336 of the Fortune Global 500; 29 of the Dow Jones 30; 61 of the NASDAQ 100; and 35 of the Fortune e-50.  Collectively, over 146,000 people work for WPP companies out of almost 2,400 offices in 107 countries.

column1:
","

Overview of the Job

We are currently looking for an Reporting & Analytics Manager, to join the GroupM Services Data & Technology team.

GroupM Services - Data & Technology is an Analytics, Technology, and consulting group supporting the buying & campaign delivery teams. We combine adtech and martech platform strategy with data science & data engineering expertise, helping our clients make advertising work better for people.

The Reporting & Analytics Manager will be responsible for providing data-driven analytics solutions across GroupM Services campaigns, driving performance in delivering campaign objectives.

This person will be focused on developing and delivering advanced reporting and Insights solutions such as audience segmentation & analysis, Data driven attribution, cross-channel measurement. The manager will also play a supportive role to the director on Advanced analytics projects, whilst providing training & development for executive level team members.

They should have excellent oral and written communication skills, strong project management skills, Stakeholder management experience, an eye for process iteration with a focus on delivering high levels of service for client success.

In addition, as a member of the regional team based in Singapore, you will be guiding the market GMS Data & Technology teams, through the delivery of training & enablement plans, coordinating regional technology project rollouts, and being an escalation point for market support.

Reporting of the role

This role reports to the Reporting & Analytics Director Manager – GroupM Services

3 best things about the job:

  1. Be a member of a high performing team focused on technology, data, partners and platforms, a key strategic growth area for GroupM and WPP.
  2. Work in an environment that promotes freedom, flexibility, empowerment and diverse working styles to solve real business problems.
  3. The opportunity to learn and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders across all GroupM agencies and business units in APAC.

Responsibilities of the role:

  • Provide advanced analytics reports utilising respective tools (ad servers, web analytics platforms, Clean Rooms), to be used for optimisation.
  • Deliver audience- based strategies (e.g. rules based segmentation), for media activation.
  • Create custom data driven attribution models for client digital campaigns
  • Develop client advanced omni-channel measurement solutions such as cross-device, offline to online, cross channel etc.
  • Design & Setup A/B tests for implementation with the respective buying teams.
  • Utilise log data to build algorithms for media targeting & delivery (e.g. Custom bidding)
  • Contribute actional insights to post campaign analysis reports for clients.
  • Manage project timelines and deliverable schedules, communicate with stakeholders & raise issues with the Analytics Director as required.
  • Provide training & support executives in both their responsibilities and developing new capabilities to become a future manager.
  • Support the Analytics Director with Partner/Vendor management, including internal global teams.
  • Any other ad-hoc projects or tasks relevant to the position.
  • Build a great working relationship with your team, market teams and client team, operating seamlessly together to deliver success for our clients, across the briefing, booking, set up, optimisation and reporting processes.

Measures of Success –

In 3 months:

  • Thorough understanding of the GroupM Services Data & Tech processes and commenced utilizing in their day- to- day tasks & projects
  • Developed strong working relationships with all team members and relevant stakeholders (e.g. agencies, partners, GMS buying teams).

In 6 months:

  • Has gained any outstanding accreditation/certifications of relevant technologies utilised within the GroupM Services Data & Tech team.
  • Commenced supporting the GMS buying & Campaign Delivery teams, and has identified opportunities to add value with our Reporting & Analytics services.

In 12 months:

  • Delivered advanced analytics projects (eg C4M - Cloud for Marketing) across a number of key client campaigns.
  • Built comprehensive models that have resulted in improved ROAS across GMS buying activity.

What you will need:

  • Bachelor’s or Graduate Degree in in a relevant quantitative field (Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics preferred), or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years related work experience in the field of data management, marketing analytics, and/or technology
  • 1-2 years of experience in a people management or supervisory role.
  • Thorough understanding of online marketing (specifically search, social & programmatic) & digital media metrics
  • Proven ability to extract insights from data and present findings.
  • Advanced dashboard/visualisation capabilities (Tableau, Datorama, PowerBI)
  • Strong SQL experience & has worked with at least one of the major DBMS (SQLServer, MySQL or Postgres
  • Exposure to Front-end web development (HTML, CSS)
  • Exposure to Web API development (PHP, Java, C#, Python, cURL)
  • Demonstrated capabilities working with media data within ad servers (CM360, Sizmek) DSP's (DV360, TTD) and clean rooms (ADH preferred)
  • Accreditations/Experience utilising web (eg GA360, AA) & App analytics (eg Firebase, Appsflyer, Kochava) platforms.
  • Highly organised, detail orientated, QA-focused with demonstrated project management capabilities
  • Flexibility to work in a cross-functional team but also have the initiative to problem solve independently
  • The following will be highly regarded:
  • Advanced analytical skills across multiple statistical tools & methods.
  • Working knowledge cloud computing services for Analytics, preferably GCP (ege.g. BigQuery, AutoML Tables)
  • Intermediate to advanced Python including Python packages for Data Analysis
  • Comfortable with direct client & partner engagement

About GroupM

GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology.

Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients lets us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent the space, support and tools to innovate and grow.

Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com

Follow (at)GroupMAPAC on Twitter

Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm

About GroupM Singapore

GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment.

GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for end-to-end project delivery, coordinate business, product, as well as tech teams to define project governance, project scope and plan, identify potential issues and risks to ensure smooth resolution and mitigation
  • Drive change management including but not limited to identifying key stakeholder, setting up checkpoints and defining communication procedure during project implementation
  • Explore potential optimization opportunities to drive tech excellence
  • Constantly work in data driven approach to identify improvement area
  • Always in agnostic working mode to build trust with all stakeholders in daily working environment and resolving conflicts between teams

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor or master degree in Computer Science, EE, or related field.
  • Proven experience in program management across multiple departments
  • Proven stakeholder management skills
  • Experience as Developer or Product manager is highly preferred
  • Experience in eCommerce, Order Management, Supply Chain, Logistics, Online Marketing would be addon
  • Bilingual in both English and Chinese preferred

153,tech project manager,/en/job/talent-acquisition-manager-9382811,9382811,Talent Acquisition Manager,False,False,5000,7000,SGD,Quista Technology Pte. Ltd.,10 hours ago,False,,,201933043D,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

About us

Reebelo is one of APAC’s fastest growing startups. Seven-digit monthly sales, strong MoM growth & well-funded by top VCs and serial entrepreneurs. Join our online marketplace for pre-loved electronics and help us to build the circular economy for tech devices! Our vision is to reduce e-waste by saving electronics from a premature death - while doing so, we enable customers to save up 70% on their favorite brands and flexibly rent devices instead of buying them. Join us if you want to be part of a high-growth, disruptive startup with a positive social impact!

","

Create The Circular Economy With Us

At Reebelo.com, you empower customers to buy their favorite tech devices in a more sustainable way. Our mission is to refresh the way we all consume tech, delivered through a platform built on sustainable values and quality-assured devices.

We are looking for motivated team members like yourself with an innovative mindset. In 2 years we launched 7 countries, raised $21M from top investors and scaled to 8-digit gross sales. Get the guidance & inspiration you need to make the most out of your career!

Your Role

We are looking for a hands-on Talent Acquisition & HR Manager based in Singapore. Join our fast growing team as one of the company’s core team-members. Together with our HR team, you are contributing to our success across APAC by hiring top talents and strengthening our employer brand.

Your Responsibilities

  • Manage recruitment processes, perform initial interviews with candidates & help us sourcing great talent
  • Choose the right tools & optimize our hiring and selection process across all our current and future markets in APAC
  • Support our HR team with various tasks including onboarding of new team members, creating a great team culture & organizing team events
  • Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics and procedures across the organization
  • Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics
  • Ensure legal compliance throughout human resources management

Your Background

  • Motivated person with multi-tasking capabilities: structured + team player
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in HR
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education
  • Based in Singapore, business fluent in English

What we offer

  • Purposeful work
  • Competitive salary
  • Private medical care perks
  • Hybrid work environment
  • Generous budget for skills training
  • Ownership of your own projects
  • Career development
  • Spend time abroad in one of our 7 offices
  • Team events, employee discounts & a great culture!

Join our dream team and make a positive impact with your career - we can’t wait to hear from you!

154,tech project manager,/en/job/learning-development-program-manager-trust-and-safety-9430609,9430609,"Learning & Development Program Manager,Trust and Safety",False,False,,,SGD,TikTok,6 hours ago,False,,,201719908M,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

","

Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.

The Enablement team aims to be the strategic partner of the T&S team., driving collaboration, optimization, and synergy for Trust & Safety (T&S) global functioning, whereas other T&S functions fight at the frontline for content integrity and community safety. We facilitate the application of smooth cross-functional/cross-region/cross-culture corporations, support, and training, and drive change initiatives for leadership within the organization so that they fight with maximum efficiency and sustainability.

As our international organization expands rapidly and becomes more complex, the Enablement team identifies strategic priorities, opportunities, pain points, provides insights and revolutionary solutions; so that we build better efficiency and consistency into the organization and promote global synergy under localized decision making.

Our Global Training team helps the business develop through skill-set building from a talent development perspective. They help and accompany employees' individual development during different stages of their careers and ensure the balance between improving how our team executes its business function and investing in the team's needs and growth.

What will I be doing?

  • You'll collaborate closely with function leaders in the region to facilitate the successful integration of new hires including developing and implementing onboarding programs according to teams' needs
  • You'll operate training projects and monitor training effectiveness according to regional/business needs; including but not limited to material preparation, training organization, and curriculum development
  • You'll collate local feedback and share it with global team to continuously iterate training projects
  • You'll cooperate with different teams and functions across the globe, deeply understand the business, leverage internal/external resources for better implementation of our training system and projects

Qualifications

What should I bring with me?

  • You have practical experience in training or talent development ideally within the media, tech, or entertainment industry
  • You are passionate about designing and facilitating high-quality training utilizing classroom and online methods
  • You have an understanding of how business teams operate within the tech industry ideally with a focus on internet safety, security, or risk

Trust and Safety is committed to the wellbeing of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Personal Financial Services

We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations.

Job Responsibilities

Project Management and Governance
·    Manage a portfolio of complex initiatives that impact one or multiple lines of business 
·    Manage all aspects of project and program engagement from planning, external vendor engagement, resources planning and budget, change management, risks and issues 
·    Prepare overall implementation plan taking inputs from all stakeholders including technology, business, operations, regulators, etc., and co-ordinate execution by respective owners
·    Ensure that projects are proceeding according to scope, schedule, budget and quality standards
·    Manage the day-to-day project activities, including chairing project management working committee meetings and facilitating steering committee meetings
·    Monitor, track and control outcomes to resolve issues, conflicts, dependencies and critical path deliverables

Stakeholder Management
·    Manage project stakeholders, e.g., escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes
·    Manage relationships with stakeholders and ensure teams work in a collaborative environment
·    Manage stakeholders expectations through governance processes 
·    Deliver appropriate and effective executive level communication
·    Understand interdependencies between technology, operations and business needs
 

Job Requirements

Basic Qualifications
·    8+ years of experience in IT Project Management
·    Experience in Agile/Scrum environment and framework, e.g. sprint planning, sprint review, backlog grooming, etc 
·    Minimum 8-10 years of retail/digital banking experience, and exposure to banking systems, products, operations, processes

Preferred Qualifications
·    Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline
·    Experienced of having direct responsibility for project with budget size of $10 to $20 million 
·    Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II Certification is preferred
·    Exposure to Lean/Six Sigma or process re-engineering
·    Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals

Other Experience/skills:
·    Executive level communication skills with excellent written and verbal communication 
·    Experience in full end-to-end project management in a lead role 
·    Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions in the bank
·    Technical domain expertise is an advantage, but at minimum is tech-savvy

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

157,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-infrastructure-engineer-infrastructure-architecture-management-9429218,9429218,"Senior Infrastructure Engineer, Infrastructure Architecture & Management",False,False,,,SGD,Government Technology Agency of Singapore (GovTech),22 hours ago,False,,,T16GB0002G,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.
Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore. How we work
Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure. We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime. By maximizing on innovative Cloud and SaaS technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacentre hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services. Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernisation and automation is also our key focus. Using the newest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly. We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy, and training. What to Expect: 
  • Responsible for the overall technical design of a system/project pertaining to the infrastructure elements, integration, connectivity and hosting.
  • Ensure the design gels and aligns to Application architecture, Enterprise architecture and Security architecture.
  • Apply in-depth knowledge and skillset in the technical domains like Cloud, SaaS, Middleware, Network and Platforms, as well as methodologies, policies and processes relating to the end-to-end implementation of an ICT System.
  • Knowledge of up-to-date of solutions, services and offerings from commercial providers so as to recommend modernised solutions, designs and processes to projects.
  • Some experience in determining and recommending automation in term of infrastructure operation or development processes.
  • DevOps and infrastructure-as-code knowledge is desired so as to support and be able to apply to project management and implementation.
  • Work with all other Architects/Developers to balance and rationalise the technical design to ensure the building of a robust, scalable and efficient ICT system.
  • Work closely with the Solutions Architect to produce a technical specification for infrastructure, systems integration and hosting requirements.
  • Provide technical architectural support to the Project and ensure project architecture is aligned with whole-of-Government architecture, policies, and framework.
 How to Succeed: 
  • Technical discipline with 5 or more years of progressive experience in solutioning, architecture and design.
  • Some implementation and management experience in some of the technology: AWS/ Azure/ Google Cloud/ VMware, Kubernetes, Docker DC
  • Good to have experience in the use of the following DevOps , CD/CI tools: Ansible, Jenkin, GitHub, Puppet, Yarn, Rancher, CasperJS
  • Proficiency in multi-tiered architecture, design and implementation.
  • Strong working knowledge and ability to apply architecture concepts, frameworks and methodologies to projects.
  • Good consultation skills with the ability to convey technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and contribute within a team environment.
  • Experience with Web and server technologies including Virtualisation.
  • Good knowledge of servers and storage technologies includes different OSes, software and hardware solutions (like EMC, Cisco, HDS)
  • Experienced in business and technical analysis, architecture design, project management.
  • Must be able to communicate IT architecture methods, concepts, standards and policies.
  • Experience developing and implementing technical and integration architectures
  • Excellent customer service mind-set. Must be able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and sponsors on projects.
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is essential to innovation. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round *Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

158,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-electrical-engineer-9416304,9416304,Senior Electrical Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,Cummins Asia Pacific Pte Ltd,26-Mar-22,False,,26 days,201131653C,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Cummins Inc., a global technology leader, is a corporation of complementary business segments that designs, manufactures, distributes and services a broad portfolio of power solutions. The company’s products range from diesel and natural gas engines to hybrid and electric platforms, as well as related technologies, including transmissions, battery systems, fuel systems, controls, air handling, filtration, emission solutions, and power generation systems.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Headquartered in Columbus, Indiana (U.S.), since its founding in 1919, Cummins employs approximately 62,600 people in approximately 190 countries and territories.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: See how Cummins is powering a world that’s Always On by accessing news releases and more information at https://www.cummins.com/always-on.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Follow Cummins on Twitter at www.twitter.com/cummins and on YouTube at www.youtube.com/cumminsinc.  ","
Our culture believes in POWERING YOUR POTENTIAL.  We provide global opportunities to develop your career, make your community a better place and work with today’s most innovative thinkers to solve the world’s toughest problems.

We believe in flexibility for you to explore your passions while making an impact through meaningful work within our inclusive workforce.  That’s what #LifeAtCummins is all about.

We are looking for a Senior Electrical Engineer for Distribution Business to join our team in our SE Asia Office in Singapore.  This product focused position performs established technical tasks at the sub-system and/or component level for current and future products within a given business unit or corporate area.  This involves work across many steps in the product life cycle.  Because of the product centred nature of this position, they are very often a central point of coordination and decision making between product line engineers, customer teams, systems engineers, purchasing, suppliers and manufacturing.

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
• Review tender specifications, providing deviation lists and input into the technical scope of supply for the Sales team.
• Design and develop control systems to meet customer specifications and regulatory requirements.
• Develop and release the package bill of materials and package designs to meet customer specifications, Cummins requirements and regulatory requirements.
• Conduct package validation tests at our factory and customer sites.
• Publish reports providing technical direction to testing and commissioning technicians for the package.
• Work with industry partners or manufacturers to develop package and control systems to meet customer specifications and regulatory requirements.
• Managing small and medium size projects from sales order to commission and handover to customer.
• Develop and deliver customer specific engineering documents.
• Obtains input from stakeholders such as technical managers, project leaders, other product and manufacturing engineers and supplier partners to deliver information and recommendations that lead to quality product decisions.
• Delivers an independent execution of established and emerging work processes and systems, while still developing technology or product knowledge.
• Leads the development and improvement of work processes and systems across a functional discipline area within a business unit site.
• Provides support and guidance to influence technical direction within a project team and continues to develop proficiency in the competency areas critical to success in the role.
• Operates as a recognized specialist in a discipline or product area within the immediate team.
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
• Degree in Electrical Engineering
• Minimum of 5 years of electrical design manufacturing and commissioning experience
• Demonstrated track record of technical problem solving and quality decision making
• Knowledge of Marine and Offshore O&G classification societies and regulations will be an advantage
• Experience of using  Creo or Auto CAD will be an advantage
• Be capable of product delivery throughout the entire life cycle from concept design to final design
• Experience in team leading and project management for technical deliverables
Compensation and Benefits
Salary rate commensurate with experience. AWS/13-month bonus. Flexi Benefit. Variable Compensation (bonus). Annual Salary Review. Life Insurance. Medical / Hospitalization Insurance.

At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, colour, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

The TikTok Creator Marketplace is the official platform for brand and creator collaborations on TikTok under TikTok Creator Marketing Solutions. This role is part of the regional Growth Strategy function which drives overall health of the business as it scales product/services with GTM operations in the region; involving growth marketing, performance management, budgeting, strategic initiatives, and overall program management.

Responsibilities

  • Cultivate business and performance reporting framework for APAC markets with emphasis on regional impact, and opportunities for client facing teams.

  • Institute program management frameworks for our newly formed APAC team to drive efficient stakeholder collaboration and decision-making on large-scale projects.
  • Support GTM initiatives from a regional operations stand-point to launch and scale creator first product/services.
  • Support growth marketing campaigns, budgeting, and strategic finance deal desks.

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of experience in Business Analytics, Project Management, Strategic Finance or similar disciplines. Experience working in Tech or Consulting will be preferred.
  • Comfortable with large data sets, dashboarding and BI tools.
  • A builder mindset with an ability to be attention to detail, analytical and output driven.
  • Demonstrated ability to be adaptable in early stage set-ups while being effective in collaborating with multiple cross-functional teams.
  • Passion for creator economy, marketplace platforms, and project management to scale processes.
