column2: Launched in 2012, Lazada is the number one online shopping and selling destination in Southeast Asia – present in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. As the pioneer of the eCommerce ecosystem in Southeast Asia, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: With over 80 million SKUs available, Lazada offers the widest range of products in categories ranging from consumer electronics to household goods, toys, fashion, sports equipment and groceries. Focused on delivering an excellent customer experience, it offers multiple payment methods including cash-on-delivery, comprehensive customer care and hassle-free returns through its own first- and last-mile delivery arm supported by 80+ logistics partners.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Lazada Group is majority owned by Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA).","

Job Description

Seller Acquisition and Onboarding

  • Leads business development efforts and end-to-end incubation of key target brands, sellers & retailers to support and drive the growth of Lazada platform in Singapore based on the company and new retail strategy
  • Identifies new sellers/ brands and valuable strategic accounts prospects through data-driven analysis of the market and category behavior
  • Manages the business development operations – which include and not limited to vetting sellers’ documents, managing the offline marketing collaterals, etc
  • Analyzes big sets of data on performance of existing merchants
  • Ensures that appropriate metrics are in place to measure performance and progress towards strategic goals
  • Work cross functionally with Tech, Operations, Customers, Seller Care & other internal teams to deliver strategic projects that will allow Lazada to offer the best customer experience
  • Recommend processes and performance measures to improve business performance in line with the company objectives
  • Support the successful execution and roll-out of business performance improvement plans, such as system adoption, campaign coordination and execution activities, etc.

Seller Growth and Adoption Improvement

  • Constantly engage in our solution development and develop communication and training plans aimed at clearly conveying benefits and workings to internal and external addressees
  • Produce corresponding messaging across a variety of communication channels (ranging from live events to EDMs and notifications) and execute on their delivery
  • Build up and maintain an effective support system for our existing customer base by equipping our existing support systems appropriately (customer and partner care, key account managers, ...)
  • Constantly measure reach, conversion, and impact of your activities, report on effectiveness, and course-correct where needed
  • Act as an undisputed internal ""knowledge hub"" on our solutions and help your peers from other department succeed in applying our solutions
  • Act as ""voice of the market"" to your peers in product management and user experience design in particular on behalf of the internal stakeholders you interact with

Seller Operation Excellence

  • Improve the seller operation metrics (seller RTS leadtime, cancellation process etc) via operational support, seller trainings and product/tech enhancement
  • Support retail merchant offline operations (artworks, signages, and offline assets governance), manage external vendors and support brand to develop offline brand awareness
  • Perform weekly & monthly analysis on operation data to identify performance trends and to update performance to management, advise whitespace growth potential for quality seller acquisition based on data

Job Requirements

In order to succeed in the role, you should ideally have:

  • A proven track record in program and project management within a complex organization, ideally within e-commerce
  • Demonstrable strong structured communication skills, both verbally and in writing
  • Past experience in coaching or training roles or past experience in product or solution marketing is a plus
  • Past experience in traditional retail is a plus
  • Past experience or exposure to product management or product development is a plus
  • Past experience in managing a team is a plus
  • Fluency in English
  • Tenacity, resilience
",[],Senior Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://www.lazada.com/en/careers/job-description/GP834817/,70000,Singapore,sg

column1: 161,tech project manager,/en/job/technology-governance-compliance-and-risk-specialist-9430766,9430766,"Technology Governance, Compliance and Risk Specialist",False,False,,,SGD,NTUC Enterprise Co-operative Limited,6 hours ago,False,,7 days,T12CS0002D,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
NTUC Enterprise Co-operative Limited is the holding entity of the group of NTUC Social Enterprises including NTUC FairPrice, NTUC Income and NTUC First Campus, which were set up by the Labour Movement to help working families. NTUC Enterprise’s role is to support the NTUC Social Enterprises to scale up rapidly to meet growing needs of working families. Towards this end, we are looking for highly motivated & driven professionals to join us.","
The IT Governance, Compliance and Risk Specialist drives end-to-end alignment of digital/technology risk management with business units and corporate functions of the NTUC Social Enterprises to ensure adequate management of technology-related risks. This role also supports building of capabilities across the organization related to IT governance, compliance and risk management.
  • Implement and maintain a robust IT management framework and control processes
  • Manage the IT Risk Management Framework and ensure alignment with the broader Enterprise Risk Management Framework
  • Work with process owners to establish and operate an effective governance and management of relevant policies, guidelines, standards and procedures
  • Work with management on continuous assessment of IT governance and risk management, identify gaps and develop action plans to address them
  • Develop effective and collaborative relationships and ongoing communication forums regarding IT governance and risk management across the organization
  • Work with stakeholders to integrate IT governance and risk management with other frameworks (e.g., Enterprise risk management, cyber security governance and compliance, etc.) and three lines of defense
Qualifications
  • Minimum 4 years’ experience in IT Governance, compliance and Risk Management, preferably in a fast-growing and tech-heavy environment and product-centric organizations
  • (IT) Audit and risk management background with Big-4 would be preferred
  • Strong cross-domain IT expertise (architectures, systems, services, software engineering, cybersecurity, project management, etc.)
  • Knowledge of relevant frameworks (e.g., ITIL, COBIT) is mandatory, certifications are strongly preferred
  • Pragmatism and ability to develop and champion affordable, efficient and timely solutions
  • Pro-activeness and acting with a sense of urgency
  • Analytical skills and strong attention to relevant details
  • Strong stakeholder management, problem-solving and decision making
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Other Information

Location : Tanjong Pagar 
",[],Junior Executive,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://nexus.recruiterpal.com/career/jobs/4dn5r,70170,Central,sg

162,tech project manager,/en/job/production-engineer-civil-construction-9415017,9415017,Production Engineer (Civil/Construction),False,False,2500,4500,SGD,Greyform Pte. Ltd.,28-Mar-22,False,,,201543308N,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"
GREYFORM is a wholly owned subsidiary of Straits Construction Group Pte Ltd, one of the most established building construction company in Singapore. Our vision is to be the leading manufacturer of innovative precast concrete products in Singapore and the region.

Under the Building & Construction Authority’s initiative, GREYFORM has built one of the most modern and most technological advanced Integrated Construction & Prefabrication HUB (ICPH) in Singapore. The HUB is highly automated and most manufacturing operations are carried out by intelligent computer systems. Unlike traditional precast constructions, our staffs can expect to work under a clean and safe factory environment.
","
As an Production Engineer (Senior / Assistant), you will assist the Production Manager in managing the Overall Operation of Precast Construction Plant. You are to adhere to Quality, Environmental, Safety Management System in accordance with Company’s standards and customers’ requirements.
Responsibilities
1) Identify operational problems by observing and studying system functioning and performance results; investigating complaints and suggestions; interviewing process supervisors and operators; completing troubleshooting procedures.
2) Identifies operational priorities by assessing operational objectives; determining project objectives, such as, efficiency, cost savings, energy conservation, operator convenience, safety, environmental quality; estimating relevance, time, and costs.
3) Develops operational solutions by defining, studying, estimating, and screening alternative solutions; calculating economics; determining impact on total system.
4) Anticipates operational problems by studying operating targets, modes of operation, limitations & performance.
5) Improves operational quality results by studying, evaluating, and recommending process re-design; implementing changes; contributing information and opinion to improve productivity performance.
6) Provides operational management information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing operating and engineering data and trends.
7) Maintains safe and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.
8) Participate in reviewing Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Risk Assessment to ensure its effectiveness.
9) Participate in investigation of EHS incident and recommend preventive measure.
10) Authorize to stop production relating to Safety, Environmental or Efficiency issue not complying to Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Management System or Procedure.
11) Verify that solutions agreed for problems relating to non-conformities relating to product process and Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Healthsystem are implemented.
12) Review and recommend the disposition of the rejected in-coming raw material, work-in-process and finished goods.
13) Review and endorse Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health System Procedure.
14) Manage, coach and train the team members which include carrying out performance review and disciplinary action, if required.
15) Perform any other duties as assigned by the Management and the designated manager.
Requirements: 1) Minimum ITEa) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineeringb) 5 years’ experience working as Engineer or 8 years’ as Technician in a manufacturing environment.
2) Diploma in Engineeringa) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineeringb) 2 years’ experience working as Engineer in a manufacturing environment
3) Preferably with knowledge of manufacturing and assembling of Precasting.
4) Knowledge of ISO 9000, HSE and AutoCAD will be advantages.
5) Knowledge in Safety Management is a must.
6) IT savvy with proficient in Microsoft Office application.
7) Possess leadership and supervisory skills with manpower planning experiences.
8) Possess problem-solving, analyzing and reporting skills.
9) Possess good interpersonal skills and excellent team spirit.
10) Independent with high level of initiative and fast learner.
11) Meticulous and positive attitude in learning.

166,tech project manager,/en/job/infrastructure-engineer-%7C-platforms-9429271,9429271,Infrastructure Engineer | Platforms,False,False,,,SGD,Government Technology Agency of Singapore (GovTech),22 hours ago,False,,,T16GB0002G,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.
Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore. How we work Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure. We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime. By leveraging on innovative Cloud and Saas technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacentre hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services. Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernisation and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly. We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training. Job Overview 
  • As an Infrastructure Engineer, you will work with a team of like-minded Engineers and Architects to deliver various automation solutions. You will also be assisting the Lead Engineer to manage the following:
  • A Big Data infrastructure that provides the compute, storage, and data visualization platform.
  • A Service Management Platform (SMP) that digitalises the delivery and support of the Services to the Government and public officers.
  • An Infrastructure Automation Platform (IAP) that provides various tools that supports Agile Project Management, Orchestration and Configuration Management, Development Security. The IAP provides agile project management, development, and automation capabilities to Whole of Government (WOG) infrastructure. Common industry tools that are integrated as part of this platform includes but not limited to the following:
  • Atlassian Jira / Bitbucket / Bamboo / Confluence
  • Sonatype Nexus
  • Chef Software
  • Ansible
  • Terraform
 What to Expect: 
  • Assist the Lead Engineer in Big Data Infrastructure: data analytics compute solutions, storage, and data visualization technologies.
  • Help with IAP and SMP for Agile and DevOps practices and solutions.
  • Function within a team of like-minded engineers to ensure that the platforms are operating optimally in terms of availability, capacity, security, and business continuity
  • Develop appropriate materials or processes to onboard developers and data engineers/analysts to use the platforms.
  • Design, evaluate and implement framework and platform that can handle the needs of a product development and the needs of rapidly growing data.
  • Manage and operate critical production services which enables automation and analytics related capabilities to the WOG infrastructure.
  • Manage the continuous testing and deployment of automation products, data pipelines, new data platform services
  • Architect and scale the platforms infrastructure, finding opportunities to improve and optimize workloads, processes to ensure that performance levels can support continuous accurate, reliable and timely delivery of products.
  • Managing budgeting and procurement matters relating to the platforms.
  • Review and recommend suitable relevant industry best practices for Government IT infrastructure for adoption
  • Ensure that project implementation and operations are aligned to Government technology standards and policies
 How to Succeed: 
  • Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in Big Data (Cloudera and Qlik)
  • Candidates with hands-on experience with Agile and DevOps infrastructure will have an advantage.
  • Proficient in common big data tools like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Nifi in a large scale,
  • The following will have an advantage
  • Either network, system or application administration and troubleshooting
  • Coding for Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) use cases
  • Setting up continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines for IaC
  • Setting up continuous integration and deployment for big data or other projects
  • ServiceNow
  • Keep abreast of latest ICT technologies, skillsets and industry practices
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and ability to influence and communicate effectively with non-technical audience and senior management
 Preferred Certifications/Skills: 
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines
  • ITIL V3 Foundation certified
  • Cloudera Certified Associate (CCA) certified
  • Qlik Sense System Administrator certified
  • Candidates with the following will have an advantage
  • Red Hat Certified Engineer or Red Hat Certified System Administrator with Red Hat Certified Specialist – Ansible Automation
  • Hashicorp Certified: Terraform Associate
  • Jira Administration for Cloud / Data Center and Server
  • DevOps Foundation by DevOps Institute
  • SRE Foundation or SRE Practitioner
  • DevSecOps Foundation
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is essential to innovation. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hour

column2: STMicroelectronics is a world leader in providing the semiconductor solutions that make a positive contribution to people’s lives, today and into the future.  Among the world’s largest semiconductor companies and a leading technology innovator: ~7,400 people working in R&D and product design, ~18,000 patents, ~ 9,600 patent families and ~ 550 new patent filings, employing ~46,000 employees worldwide in 11 main manufacturing sites, 80 sales & marketing offices in 35 countries and committing close to 20% in R&D.

column3: People are the foundation of ST and they drive our success. We believe there is a strong correlation between employee's commitment and business results. Our engaged employees will make ST even more successful. For this reason, ST has a solid infrastructure to manage the core processes related to people and, one of our top corporate priorities is ""People"". This corporate priority focuses on employee engagement and recognition, talent management, leadership development.
Our HR Strategy

Our Human Resources strategy aims to ensure the right level of hiring and retention, to match the company’s evolving requirements in terms of profiles, competencies and the dynamic integration of new people. At ST, we believe that the development of our people is the key factor for ensuring our long term success.
Our Vision : Everywhere microelectronics make a positive contribution to people's lives, ST is there.
Our Values :
INTEGRITY: we conduct our business with the highest ethical standards, honor our commitments, deliver on our promises, are loyal and fair.

column2: PEOPLE: we behave with openness, trust and simplicity; ready to share our knowledge, encourage everyone’s contribution, develop people through empowerment, teamwork and training.

EXCELLENCE: we strive for quality and customer satisfaction and create value for all our partners; we are flexible, encourage innovation, develop our competencies, seek responsibility and are accountable for our actions.",Job description
  • Hook Up Technician
  • Assist the Engineers in their duties by being deployed to the shop floor to ensure that our safety protocols and operating methodologies are respected.
  • Supervising the safe work of contractors on site:
  • During logistic activities (movement of production equipment)
  • During Hook Up activity
  • During production equipment decommissioning (Line Breaking) 
  • Basic administrative tasks

Profile
  • Safety focus always
  • Able to supervise and be in control of contractor teams so as to stop any non conformance or dangerous practice
  • Team focus
  • Alert and vigilant

column1: 168,tech project manager,/en/job/equipment-engineer-diffusion-ref%3A-2022-19151-9337092,9337092,"Equipment Engineer, Diffusion, (Ref:  2022-19151)",False,False,,,SGD,STMicroelectronics Pte Ltd,10 hours ago,False,,18 days,196900236M,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: About STMicroelectronics:
<div>

column4: We are creators and makers.
<div>

column5: We are 46,000 creators and makers of semiconductor technologies, devices, and solutions that start with our employees, with our 100,000 customers, and with our thousands of partners. Together, we design and build products, solutions and ecosystems that address the sustainability and resource management challenges our customers are facing, while helping them seize opportunities they are pursuing.

column4: <div>

column5: This is why we have 8,100 R&D employees, invest about 16% of our revenues in R&D every year, and engage in extensive collaboration with leading research labs and corporate partners throughout the world. Moreover, we are continuously investing in our footprint as an independent device manufacturer. Our 11 manufacturing sites master all aspects of the semiconductor supply chain and offer our customers the quality, flexibility, and supply security they need.

column4: <div>

column5: Technology that augments life:

ST’s products are found everywhere today, and together with our customers, we are enabling smarter driving and smarter homes, factories, and cities, along with the next generation of mobile and Internet of Things devices.

column4: <div>

column5: Our technology starts with you

We believe the future should not be in the labs of a few, but in the hands of the many and we believe in open ecosystems and a partnership approach. We provide easy-to-use software development tools, design kits, and support educational initiatives to make our technologies accessible to more engineers and enthusiasts today.

column4: At ST, we are creators of technology. And our technology starts with you.
<div>

column5: Sustainability is an integral part of ST

column4: All these trends call for a more sustainable world. This is also what our technology is made for, and this is the reason why, for over 25 years, sustainability at ST has been an integral part of everything we do. It guides the way we conduct our business and our relationships with customers, partners, and employees. It guides the way we innovate, and the way we behave - driven by our values: integrity, people and excellence.
ST is committed to become carbon neutral by 2027 and to source 100% renewable energy by 2027.

column3: <div>

column4: STMicroelectronics in Singapore:

column3: <div>

column4: STMicroelectronics established its operations in Singapore in 1969. Since then, the Company’s Singapore operations have grown dramatically, cementing ST’s place as a major industry player in Asia Pacific - the fastest-growing semiconductor market in the world.

column3: <div>

column4: Today, ST’s presence in Singapore comprises the regional front-end manufacturing and global back-end manufacturing headquarters; logistics hub; R&D; advanced IC design; application support; sales and marketing; and supply-chain management. ST employs approximately 4,600 people at its Singapore operations.

169,tech project manager,/en/job/regional-strategy-partnerships-manager-9382550,9382550,Regional Strategy & Partnerships Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Applied Materials South East Asia Pte Ltd,10 hours ago,False,,30 days,1995070151,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,Upper Changi Road North,"
At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels on an industrial scale is used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world.

First establishing its presence in Singapore in 1991, Applied Materials (Applied) has since grown to a strategic hub for the company in Southeast Asia supporting diverse functions including manufacturing, R&D and customers’ support services in the region.

Today, Singapore’s Asia Production Center (APC) is responsible for half of Applied’s annual production of semiconductor equipment globally, the largest outside the United States. Applied is the largest contributor of output and employment for Singapore’s semiconductor equipment industry.","

Applied Materials is an innovation-driven company. Our ability to identify emerging technologies that can complement and leverage Applied’s materials engineering expertise is critical to the company’s continued growth. To accelerate our growth programs, Applied Materials fosters a vibrant innovation network of academics, researchers, government organizations, commercial partners and entrepreneurs in the ecosystems we operate in. https://www.appliedmaterials.com/company/collaboration

Singapore is a key ecosystem for Applied Materials. At the South East Asia Regional Office and CTO Office in Singapore, we identify new growth opportunities and build win-win partnerships within the ecosystem to realize this growth.

Key Responsibilities

This is a high visibility and high growth role, reporting into the CTO’s Office and Regional President’s Office. In this challenging and rewarding career opportunity, you will

-         Working with global project teams to translate global strategies to regional opportunities, as well as sense-make regional trends to shape global strategies

-         Originate, negotiate and execute ecosystem partnerships in Singapore to accelerate new business opportunities from inception to execution

-         Partner the businesses to identify differentiating technology and R&D capabilities in the region (in universities, public research entities and tech startup ecosystem), and analyze how these technologies enable or benefit from industry inflections and global trends

-         Build and maintain relationships with key ecosystem stakeholders (government agencies, public research entities, universities, tech startup ecosystem) to ensure Applied Materials is strategically positioned

Skills & Competencies

-          Someone who is excited by the possibilities of how technology can play a role in improving our lives, and is interested to accelerate and translate technology innovations to business through partnerships

-          High learning agility to quickly understand the value drivers in numerous science and technology fields

-          Entrepreneurial – strong sense of ownership and ability to work across different functions and BUs

-          Strong analytical skills and effective problem solvers, with ability to navigate ambiguity

-          Excellent communicator, with the ability to manage and influence stakeholders at all levels

-          Strategic marketing capabilities, including: customer needs and value proposition discovery, landscape analysis, techno-economic analysis

Education and Experience

-          Bachelor in any Engineering or Science related discipline with min 4 years of relevant experience

-          Experiences in public-private partnership, strategic operations and project management

-          Experienced in structuring and negotiating partnership deals; Familiarity with legal contracts e.g. NDAs, research collaboration agreements, MOUs

-          Good knowledge of the high technology or semiconductor industry

-          Experiences working across time zones in multi-functional global teams

column2: STMicroelectronics is a world leader in providing the semiconductor solutions that make a positive contribution to people’s lives, today and into the future.  Among the world’s largest semiconductor companies and a leading technology innovator: ~7,400 people working in R&D and product design, ~18,000 patents, ~ 9,600 patent families and ~ 550 new patent filings, employing ~46,000 employees worldwide in 11 main manufacturing sites, 80 sales & marketing offices in 35 countries and committing close to 20% in R&D.

column3: People are the foundation of ST and they drive our success. We believe there is a strong correlation between employee's commitment and business results. Our engaged employees will make ST even more successful. For this reason, ST has a solid infrastructure to manage the core processes related to people and, one of our top corporate priorities is ""People"". This corporate priority focuses on employee engagement and recognition, talent management, leadership development.
Our HR Strategy

Our Human Resources strategy aims to ensure the right level of hiring and retention, to match the company’s evolving requirements in terms of profiles, competencies and the dynamic integration of new people. At ST, we believe that the development of our people is the key factor for ensuring our long term success.
Our Vision : Everywhere microelectronics make a positive contribution to people's lives, ST is there.
Our Values :
INTEGRITY: we conduct our business with the highest ethical standards, honor our commitments, deliver on our promises, are loyal and fair.

column2: PEOPLE: we behave with openness, trust and simplicity; ready to share our knowledge, encourage everyone’s contribution, develop people through empowerment, teamwork and training.

EXCELLENCE: we strive for quality and customer satisfaction and create value for all our partners; we are flexible, encourage innovation, develop our competencies, seek responsibility and are accountable for our actions.","Job description

Job Description

We are looking for a passionate and customer focused program manager to join us in building the largest and most innovative tech-driven logistic company and ecosystem in South East Asia. This role sits within the Regional Fulfilment Operations team where you will work closely with fulfilment business and product/tech teams to launch and enhance solutions for driving best in class fulfilment services. You will work alongside business teams to understand organizational goals, define product requirements, coordinate resources from other groups, and guide the team through key milestones.

This role will require a high level of cross-functional collaboration and a successful candidate will be highly analytical, strategic, able to work extremely effectively in a semi-structured environment.

Your Roles and Responsibilities

  • Act as business product owner for effective functioning of all fulfillment systems (Dabao, WFM, ASCP)
  • Work closely with local, regional fulfillment and cross functional teams to manage product roadmap for improving cost efficiency and service quality
  • Manage BRD, PRD, UAT of new projects & work with business process owners to implement and drive adoption across countries
  • Initiate and explore fulfillment operating model changes and drive adoption by effectively demonstrating scalability
  • Improve structure of fulfillment P&L through enhancing rate card structure & define standard policies for customers

Job Requirements

  • Minimum of 4+ years of working experience in program/product management/consulting or related fields
  • Fluent in English and Mandarin as the role requires working directly with business, tech and product teams based across multiple geographies
  • Proficient in MS Office and basic SQL is preferred
  • Knowledge and familiarity in Technology/E-commerce industries with warehouse experience is a plus
  • Logical thinking, strong planning, execution, communication and coordination skills
  • Team player with good communication and analytical skills
  • Track record of successful project management, demonstrated ability to work with multiple stakeholders in a complex organization

Knowledgehut Singapore (www.Knowledgehut.com.sg)

We help individuals create awesome careers by empowering them with cutting-edge knowledge and skills of ICT and Digital Technology and we help companies create competitive advantage by equipping their employees with such skills.

The training we offer leads to globally-recognised professional certifications that are top-notch and enable individuals to be job-ready for some of the most highly-demanded occupations in the world. Our courses straddle areas such as Agile, SCRUM, Project Management, Big Data Analytics, Data Science, AI, Machine Learning, Digital Marketing and Cloud Computing.

We are a high growth company and currently train in 70 over countries, including USA, Europe, Asia Pacific and India. To date, we have trained more than 120,000 people worldwide. A number of our clients are government agencies, banks, insurance companies, airlines and major manufacturing companies in Singapore and the Asia Pacific.","

About the Company

Knowledgehut Singapore welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, contributing back to society. So, feel free to express who you are and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!

The Knowledgehut Holding Company, located out of Bangalore, was established in 2011 to empower technologists and other professionals with high-quality, hands-on learning opportunities at scale, nurture talent for the future of work, and help close the skills gap. Leveraging a state-of-the-art immersive learning experience platform, KnowledgeHut fundamentally disrupts how tech is learnt and empowers enterprises with a scalable tech-driven solution to align role-based skill requirements with desired business outcomes. Whether you're looking to develop capabilities in Software Development, IT Service Management, Cyber Security, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning / AI or Data Science, KnowledgeHut is your learning partner of choice.

The uPGrad Education Company, a global online higher education provider with Temasek Holding (Singapore) investing US$120 million in them, acquired KnowledgeHut Group in August 2021. The company intends to use the capital proceeds to strengthen its team further, scale its global market operations, bolster its technology and product capabilities, and pursue merger and acquisition opportunities.

We will reach out to shortlisted candidates for further career conversations.

Job Description

Objectives of this Role

The Program Manager is essential to manage operations, support internal and external stakeholders (sales, marketing, legal), and drive various funded training programmes' success. Be a single point of contact for all stakeholders from different business (marketing, content, product, operations) units to manage, inform and articulate various requirements.

1) Operations:

  • Program Manage the end-to-end operations for prospective funded training programs under different schemes in Singapore. Be a single point of contact for various internal teams (content, product) and channelize & evaluate all work to formulate end package for course approvals under respective funding schemes.
  • Manage existing courses that are already approved for updates and audits

2) Sales & Marketing:

  • Weekly Review the Ad copies, website course pages and other marketing artifacts relevant to the funded program and propose necessary changes and approve as per guidelines.
  • Train and bring sales team up to speed on product, funding, and other relevant information to ensure program success and continuity as per guidelines.
  • Liase with sales operations to measure sales effectiveness and revenue analysis.

3) Management Representative Liaison

  • Meeting deadlines and various contacts with Funding bodies and Internal teams
  • Updating and bring other teams to speed with latest information and update from the funding bodies

4) Audits & Reports

  • Auditing student records, invoices, receipts, customer emails from time to time (preferably monthly) and suggest various improvements to fix gaps immediately.
  • Managing data and presentation for external audits to funding officers that may be needed from time to time.

5) Partnerships and Tenders

  • Supporting local office with partnerships for various programs (funded, non-funded and e-learning) across apac region. (Travel may be necessary from time to time).
  • Simplify prospective government tender specs for operations team to submit relevant information for tender bids.

Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field (Master’s will be an added advantage)
  • 5+ years in an advanced management role (preference given to those with program managementexperience in edtech) & with overall 10 years’ experience in business roles.
  • Exceptional leadership, time management, facilitation, and organizational skills Workingknowledge edtech business (previous experience from edtech will be added advantage)
  • Outstanding working knowledge of change management principles and skills framework

Preferred Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in business administration or related field
  • Previous stakeholder management skills
  • Strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite, Adobe
  • Proven people management experience

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
UOB GWB Transformation Office is the central GWB function that plans, manages, executes and implements GWB strategic and transformative initiatives. We collaborate and work with all GWB Business Functions and enterprise wide functions to deliver the initiatives.   GWB Transformation office is managed under GWB Chief Operating Officer, covering all GWB businesses, products and markets globally. The team works with senior stakeholders across the Bank offering project management support, operational excellence as well as overall GWB business strategy implementation.
Job Responsibilities
The individual would be leading and ensuring successful delivery strategic projects under GWB Transformation office to. The projects vary from strategic initiatives in the regions, productivity initiatives to digital transformation.   The primary responsibility will be leading project executions, stakeholder alignment as well as to be a thought partner to the management team. These activities aim to drive strong organizational collaboration, executable strategy/ solutions between various functions in GWB and the Bank globally.   The individual will be responsible for the full Project Lifecycle core activities such as  
  • Management for planning and execution of key project phases: discovery, design and implementation
  • Project issues identification, discussion and resolution at the project working groups and escalation to management, where appropriate
  • Owning & formulating business analysis, operating model and problem solving for the respective projects & representing the team in certain discussions
  • Ongoing project management and execution for key strategic initiatives by working closely with other GWB functions such as Coverage, Products along with Group HR, Compliance, Tech & Ops, Finance, Risk across all UOB markets
  • Supporting GWB Heads and COO in building GWB strategy
Job Requirements
Given the function position at the forefront of change within GWB, you will have the opportunity to work on the most important initiatives across GWB. The work is project-based and broad ranging, spanning across divisions and geographies.    You will work closely with the seniors within UOB, owning and executing your projects. We are focused on growing talent, providing learning opportunities and exposure to grow your technical expertise, domain knowledge and visibility within UOB.  
Job Qualifications
We are looking for an individual with project management or banking process experience or consulting experience. The candidate is also expected to have sufficient financial services knowledge with at least 8 years of experience with a reputable firm and/or transformation division of leading financial institutions.  
 
-    8 years of experience in consulting, banking or other financial institutions with experiences in project management or banking process or consulting
-    Strong and proven project management capabilities, with the ability to manage both our internal teams and coordinate with our client partners
-    A presence with excellent and persuasive oral and written communication skills 
-    Strong relationship skills: the ability to influence management and the ability to work across all levels of an organization
-    Self-driven achiever with ability to work effectively 
-    Flexibility and proven ability to diagnose and resolve complex issues
-    Excellent analytical skills both in terms of logic of reasoning and analysis of numerical and financial data
-    Demonstrated value for diversity, excellence and integrity in all that is done
-    Working knowledge of Excel (business analysis), MS PowerPoint (slide writing)
-    Proficiency in Chinese Mandarin/ Bahasa Indonesia/ Thai will be an advantage
 
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

column2:
Singapore Pools is Singapore’s legal gaming operator set up by the Ministry of Finance in 1968.  Surplus from gaming revenues are channelled through our parent, the Tote Board, to fund charitable donations and worthy causes that benefit the community in Singapore.","

We are looking for an experienced Senior Technician to join our Facility Management team to organise and executive the repair, maintenance and improvement programs at all Branches, Livewires, OCBs, Ubi Stores and BCP sites.

This incumbent will ensure the business operations continuity of the branches within corporate guidelines and budget

We also recognize that each individual has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in Electrical Engineering or Building Services, we want to talk to you.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • You will collaborate with various stake holders to plan and execute all A&A, repairs and maintenance works for all branches, livewires, OCBs, UBI stores and all BCP sites in order to ensure the business operations continuity.
  • You will manage contracts through timely call for quotations, stringent review and evaluation of proposals in order to ensure getting the best value for all building services, maintenance and renovation works.
  • You will submit reports, monitor budgets and expenditure, prepare RFP/RFQ/Tender documents/EAFS, check invoices and update records in order to ensure that operating expenditures are within budgets.
  • You will assess and manage risks at all workplace during A&A and comply with prevailing safety and statutory regulations in order to ensure the safety of the employees, customers and SPPL assets.
  • You will maintain currency on the various technical regulations stipulated by relevant authorities/governing bodies (eg, BCA,SCDF) in order to ensure that SPPL properties do not breach safety regulations.

Requirements:

  • You will at least a Diploma in Electrical Engineering or Building Services & Technology
  • You will at least a Higher Nitec in Electrical Engineering with Minimum 3 years of related working experience
  • You will have Knowledge in Electrical Systems
  • You will have Project Management and Risk Management experience
  • You will have knowledge of relevant code of practices, standards and legislations
  • You are qualified as a Licensed Electrical Worker (LEW)

Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!

Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools' surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

If you are interested, please email by clicking ""Apply now"", and ONLY shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview discussions.

176,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-technical-consultant-9412338,9412338,Senior Technical Consultant,False,False,,,SGD,UC Tech Pte Ltd,24-Mar-22,False,,,201508072D,,,,,,"
UC Tech is an IT company specialized in providing professional services to our enterprise customers in the areas of systems and infrastructure implementation, upgrades, managed services. 
","

Roles & Responsibilities

Job Description:

  • Provide technical leadership to the project team.
  • Assist the Project Manager with regards to resource management, incident reporting and articulation of issues with customer and vendors.
  • Manage a team of engineers and assist with trouble-shooting.
  • Project execution will includes weekends.
  • Perform mass OS patching for large number of servers (>1,000) within specific time frame (mass patching sessions include weekends).
  • Guide junior technical staff in preparation checks, post patching technical validation and troubleshooting.
  • Assist Project Manager in technical communications as needed.
  • Plan for sufficient technical resources (people) to complete mass patching sessions.
  • Liaise with relevant vendor principal support to resolve complex issues.
  • Work closely with infrastructure team engineers (especially System Administrators) and management to continuously drive improvement in efficiency and effectiveness through increased automation or process improvement or other means.
  • Track issues encountered to minimize or eliminate recurring issues
  • Prepare materials for management reporting on issues encountered, action plans to mitigate or address future recurrence and improvement plans.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 3-5 years in similar capacity.
  • Technically sound with good hands-on experience.
  • Strong leadership, planning and organizational abilities.
  • Proactive in addressing technical and non-technical risks, formulating mitigation and contingency.
  • Effective task delegation while retaining accountability for results.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, comfortable in communicating with many different stakeholders at different levels (e.g. engineers, managers, head of department).
  • Must have strong system administration background in Linux (preferably Red Hat Enterprise Linux) and shell scripting skills in a large enterprise environment (>1,000 servers).
  • Must have experience in supporting and deploying at least one of the following platforms (in addition to Linux):
  • Windows Server (including Powershell scripting)
  • Solaris
  • AIX
  • VMware vSphere
  • Experience in all or more than one of the above will be an added advantage.
  • Familiarity with at least one of the following clustering software will be an added advantage:
  • Veritas Cluster Server (on RHEL)
  • Microsoft Failover Cluster
  • Oracle Solaris Cluster
  • IBM PowerHA/HACMP

column3: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

column1:
","

Responsibilities

About ByteDance

Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

R&D HRBP Team is driving the growth of ByteDance R&D in Singapore, and aspires to contribute to Singapore's Tech-Hub transformation! We wish to empower the future generation with the opportunity to embrace Tech, work in Tech and live in Tech! If you are someone who's passionate about Tech & want to make an impact in transforming the tech landscape in Singapore, join us now!

Responsibility

  • Build relationships with R&D leaders to offer thought leadership on organizational and people-related strategy and execution.
  • Develop plans & execute for successful leadership assimilation as well as transforming R&D employee onboarding experiences.
  • Solve problems and get to the root cause of any issue. Design and quickly implement solutions that cut across multiple disciplines, even those beyond people and organizational solutions.
  • Provide expertise in the following areas: career planning, performance management, coaching, data analysis, compensation and rewards, employee relations, learning and development, recognition programs, and strategic development.
  • Use and request data strategically. Identify and surface trends in both qualitative and quantitative data to help improve organizational health.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5+ years of HR business partner or generalist experience supporting leaders at MNC.
  • HR experience in at least three or more areas below: organizational design, succession planning, performance management, business consulting, culture transformation, compensation and rewards, employee engagement, coaching/development, talent management, talent acquisition, data analysis, employee relations.

Preferred qualifications

  • Ability to work within constraints as well as to challenge the status quo.
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and being able to iron out clarity from uncertainty.
  • Effective change management skills to help leaders and the organization to navigate through constant change.
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to analyze data, understand trends, scope out problems and develop recommendations for action based on the analysis.
  • Strong project management skills to effectively initiate, plan, and execute important HR projects that creates long lasting impact on business.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

column2: We’re a diverse collection of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what’s possible to help us all do what we love in new ways. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with the Mac, iPhone, iPad and Apple Watch, as well as with services, including iTunes, the App Store, Apple Music and Apple Pay. And the same innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Every new product we invent, service we create or store we open is the result of people working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","

Summary

This role is part of the Pacific Ops System & Process Function to lead complex, global & regional initiatives supporting various areas within Pacific Operations. Pacific Operations include the areas of Reseller operations/channel management, Online store fulfillment operations, Retail fulfillment logistics, Supply/demand management & execution, Logistics and Product Launch Readiness. You will be responsible for leading cross-functional and cross-organizational teams to define, build and roll-out innovative technology and business process solutions that increase efficiencies, improve customer satisfaction, and drive revenue. You should have subject matter expertise in fulfillment supply chain from manufacturing and distribution centre sites, exceptional project management skills, a good grasp of process management, a maniacal attention to detail, and a proven ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.

Key Qualifications
  • SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:
  • Good understanding of supply chain and planning concepts
  • SAP System and process savvy
  • Good process re-engineering skills
  • Experience in Change Management is a plus
  • Strong Project Management experience with attention to detail
  • Excellent operation issue resolution skill
  • Excellent people and communication (written and spoken) skills
  • Excellent presentation skills, including developing high quality slides to articulate complex concepts
  • Ability to facilitate brainstorming sessions and workshops to gather requirements
  • Excellent listening skills
  • Good teamwork attitude
  • Ability to work with ambiguity
  • Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working in a global, fast-paced environment
  • Proficiency in developing detailed optimization models is a plus
  • Ability to “sense the moment” for when details vs executive communication is required
  • EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
  • Proven track record of leading strategic projects combined with the ability to execute at tactical project-level activities and tasks
  • In-depth knowledge and experience in project and process management
  • Minimum of 8-10 years of global supply chain management experience, preferably in high-tech / consumer electronics / retail industries
  • Proven experience as a change agent having effectively implemented change in large cross -functional organization
  • Large Cross Functional project implementation experience
  • Proven experience working effectively in a matrixed, global organization
  • Experience working on projects with teams based outside of Singapore, e.g. virtual teams
  • Past experience of working on industry standard Demand forecasting and Supply Planning systems and processes as well as retail partner management is a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail and high comfort in working with numbers
  • Ability to remain focused and efficiently work under pressure while handling multiple simultaneous projects
  • Ability to assimilate and learn complex processes in a changing and dynamic work environment on a steep learning curve
  • People management experience is essential to lead a team with in depth technical knowledge and experience
Description

AS A TEAM MANAGER:

  • Lead a team of experienced BPR managers to deliver Pac Ops priorities
  • Lead by example in sustaining the Apple Culture within the team
  • Provide guidance, mentoring and coaching to the team especially in terms of growth and development
  • Lead resourcing and balance between members and ensure exposure to opportunities

AS AN INDIVIDUAL:

  • Develop partnership with key partners across the organisation and upkeep an understanding of Operations’ core business processes
  • Understand each function’s interaction with their key partners and the corresponding processes
  • Leverage industry trends, best practices, and groundbreaking technology and process improvement ideas, working collaboratively with IS&T and business teams.
  • Lead and implement process and tool change initiatives within Operations across all Apple’s product lines, influencing decisions through collaboration, leadership and a customer-focused approach.
  • Understand and assimilate detailed and complex business processes across multiple functions, especially between Reseller Operations & Supply Demand Management. Proactively identify key changes in processes required to enable accuracy, scalability and efficiency.
  • Responsible in driving and implementing Change Management to accompany the business during project implementation
  • Garner support from senior management for the proposed changes through clear and concise communication of time bound benefits.
  • Develop a detailed project plan for all approved initiatives within the constraints of resourcing and time.
  • Project-manage cross-functional process re-engineering implementations.
  • Ensure process integration across organization, both regionally and globally.
  • Ability to use relevant project/program management approaches for different types of initiatives (e.g. waterfall vs agile).
  • -Ability to lead a team of BPRs + Business Support in terms of resourcing and personal growth & development.
  • Monitors market / industry trends and emerging technologies to identify areas for competitive advantage
  • Lead change; Implement new ideas effectively within the Apple culture
  • Measure and track results; Help deliver business benefits.
Education & Experience
  • Bachelors degree required, Masters degree or MBA preferred.
  • Minimum of 8-10 years experience in project management
  • 8-10 years of Supply Chain Management or Industrial Engineering experience

column2: Established in 1985, Robert Walters is a leading global recruitment consultancy, with 19 offices spanning five continents. Robert Walters specialises in placing high calibre professionals into permanent, contract and temporary positions at all management levels.

The group specialises in the accounting, finance, banking, IT, general management, legal, HR, sales and marketing, call centre and support fields. Robert Walters' blue-chip client base ranges across leading investment banks and multi-national corporations covering all market sectors.

If you require further information please visit our website - www.robertwalters.com.sg ","

An exciting Solution Specialist, Pre-Sales x3 (12-month, renewable) job opportunity has become available at a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions.

About the Solution Specialist, Pre-Sales x3 (12-month, renewable) Role:
You will be responsible for driving and co-owning future data centre solution sales, business development, and marketing activities within his/her assigned region.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist with account leadership, business development, and managed services teams on our future workplace portfolio and how to position and architect our solutions to build customer value and drive revenue growth
  • Leadership and delivery teams during architectural design sessions, key customer workshops, implementation project reviews, and end-to-end solution shaping
  • Partner and co-own sales activities at a customer level with the field-based account manager (Business Development Manager [BDM])
  • Performance and success measured by GP performance of region and individual accounts. Performance based quarterly incentives will be structured in commission format
  • Analyse and gather business requirement from large and complexity client environment and perform required research and investigation to identify and create thorough, accurate technical solution proposals based on client requirements
  • Partner with BDMs and local sales leadership to drive net new business opportunities within the existing regional account base as well as supporting customer acquisition activities as assigned
  • Prepare cost estimates for licensing and product sales as well as professional services (deployment, migration, implementation, workshops, etc.) by studying blueprints, plans, and related customer documents, and consulting with other engineers, architects, practice leads and other professional and technical personnel (both internal and external)
  • Develop overall solutions including high-level design (e.g. Whiteboarding), statements of work (SOW), service design and bills of materials (BOM)
  • Contribute to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations, recommending options and courses of action, and implementing directives

To succeed in this Solution Specialist, Pre-Sales x3 (12-month, renewable) role, you will need at least 10 years' experience of architecting and supporting sales on private, hybrid and cloud native solutions spanning infrastructure, platforms, applications, devices, security, data, experience, and business improvement.

Key Requirements:

  • On-premise to cloud migration approach - IaaS, PaaS and how to migrate on-premises infrastructure to the cloud
    • Cloud Compute, Storage, Database
    • Cloud Governance
    • Cloud Optimisation
    • Cloud Native Applications
    • Landing Zone and Control Tower
    • Common Cloud Integration Points
    • Serverless Architecture
    • Re-Architecture of Database on Cloud for Scale
    • Cloud Security, Risk and Compliance and Shared Security Model
  • Experience in container technology (Docker, Kubernetes) is an added advantage
  • Experience with Big Data and Analytics is an added advantage
  • experience with Datawarehouse and BI is an added advantage
  • University degree preferred (in the field of Information Technology and/or or equivalent combination of experience and education; bachelor's degree preferred)
  • Cloud related Solutions Architecture certification
  • Knowledge of ITSM; ITIL v4; Agile; DevOps
  • At least 10 years' experience of architecting and supporting sales on private, hybrid and cloud native solutions spanning infrastructure, platforms, applications, devices, security, data, experience, and business improvement
  • Sales and/or end-to-end solutioning accountability and track record for a pipeline of $10M+ TCV managed services deals with demonstrable innovation and value creation plus evidence of successful cross and upsell motions
  • Service design, integration, implementation/transition and life cycle management including development of performance metrics spanning operations, experience and business value
  • Ability to independently conduct meetings with engineering-level, management-level or executive level customer personnel in regard to positioning sales and solutions
  • Workplace services strategy, organisation and operations consultancy knowledge
  • Experience of working within a matrixed business spanning consulting and technology services and onshore/nearshore/offshore delivery centres
  • Experience leading, implementing, and deploying innovative go-to-market strategies (all sales and marketing initiatives) across large scale services-based opportunities
  • At least three years' of experience in team leadership

This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a company with strong footprint within tech sales.

If you are currently within a technical function but would like to take a step into a more functional and pre-sales position, this is the role for you. Excellent career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Solution Specialist, Pre-Sales x3 (12-month, renewable) role.

Apply today or contact me to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd

ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451

EA Registration No.: R1768414 Stephanie Tan

column2:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
How Will You Make an Impact?
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com
What will you do?
When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team, and help us make significant contributions to the world.
Responsibilities
  • To work on build plan schedule to fulfil the program schedule.
  • Coordinates with supplier and vendor on quotation for all parts, delivery schedule, monitor and evaluate cost expenses and price negotiation
  • Plan and control material expedition, build and product transfer to manufacturing with assistance of senior technicians.
  • Work closely with project team and ensuring final BOM being transfer to manufacturing.
  • Coordinate product cost with NPI procurement / sourcing and technical lead to meet COGS.
  • Coordinate NPI procurement / sourcing on final vendor selection for mass production.
  • To work with NPI procurement and PMO to gather the quotes and document for NPI CAPEX.
  • To liaise with drafter to deliver the drawings for the project.
  • Generate and renew CDA with new/existing vendors/suppliers.
Qualification
  • Diploma / Degree in Engineering or equivalent
Experiences
  • Min 1-2 years experience in product development cycle
  • Understand on basic engineering fabrication process is an advantage
Competencies Preferred
  • Good team player and ability to work in dynamic environment
  • Good communication skillsets
  • 3D CAD knowledge / experience (eg. Solidworks / ProE) will be added advantage

M-TECH is a leading M&E company based in Singapore. Since inception in 1993, M-Tech has reliably delivered successful in HVAC projects in residential , commercial & industrial sectors. With our multifaceted project management team capabilities and supported by a strong diverse competence workforce, M-TECH provides a full range of services in design, engineering, procurement, construction and maintenance in HVAC services across the local region.","

Responsibilities

  1. Evaluate, review of tender drawings/documents for discrepancies, additional BOQ items/scope and incorporating within the tender offer, liaise with consultant regarding ambiguities contract work scope and seek clarifications.
  2. Prepare plans and documents for quotations to suppliers that will be used as basis for pricing.
  3. Obtains, compiles and evaluates quotations from the respective suppliers/vendors according to tender requirements. (sourcing 3 quotation for start rated items)
  4. Prepare bill of quantities which involves quantity take-off, material sourcing, measuring and estimating materials and labour costing.
  5. Carry out the detailed breakdown pricing.
  6. Understanding of Tenders with respect to scope of work, pricing schedule and non-material requirements.
  7. Check and review the site requisitions and compare them with the approved Bill of Quantity (BOQ).
  8. Assist in analyze and recommend subcontract payments based on actual progress and valuing completed work and issuing payments requests to finance.
  9. Assist in the submission and negotiate contract variations, additional works and maintenance orders.
  10. Drafting & preparing letter of award and contract documents.
  11. Built-up rates for costing purpose.
  12. Leading the QS Team in tendering process and sort out the tender process and assigning them to various tender enquires & meet submission deadline date set by the clients.
  13. Assist in the guidance and development of the junior QS.
  14. Attend tender site show round on with respective HOD/Senior Project manager / Project Manager.
  15. Any other duties which the company required the roles to be duly performed.

Requirements:

• Hold a relevant degree/ diploma (e.g. Quantity Surveying or Construction Management)

• Equip with ACMV / M&E knowledge is added advantage.

• Be able to work well both in a team and as individually.

• Possess good communication skills.

• Be self-motivated, detail orientated and very organized, with an aptitude for working with numbers and

absorbing and analyzing tender requirement & contract law.

• Have good IT skills (including proficiency in using Microsoft Powerpoint, Excel and Word)
