column2: Launched in 2012, Lazada is the number one online shopping and selling destination in Southeast Asia – present in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. As the pioneer of the eCommerce ecosystem in Southeast Asia, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: With over 80 million SKUs available, Lazada offers the widest range of products in categories ranging from consumer electronics to household goods, toys, fashion, sports equipment and groceries. Focused on delivering an excellent customer experience, it offers multiple payment methods including cash-on-delivery, comprehensive customer care and hassle-free returns through its own first- and last-mile delivery arm supported by 80+ logistics partners.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Lazada Group is majority owned by Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA).","

Job Description

Reporting to the Head of Intellectual Property Protection, you will be responsible for the following core duties

  • Handling operations relating to product listings notice and takedowns.
  • Minimize the product listings risks – through data-driven and end-to-end operation workflow strategies based upon deep understanding and knowledge of product listings lifecycle.
  • Identifying product listings related risks loopholes and driving improvement of current risk monitoring tools/process.
  • Maintain strong cross-functional partnerships with partners in cross-functional teams e.g., policy, legal, engineering, data, business, product, tech and other teams to implement optimal solutions to product-related problems.
  • Define operational metrics, indicators and device dashboards to monitor various aspects of operation effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Create scalable solutions for managing product listing risks through the use of segmentation analysis and other statistics and machine learning techniques.
  • Provide analysis and insights for product listings risks across SEA countries.
  • Develop, update, and implement product listing risk prevention policies with internal/external stakeholders and promote a risk-free environment in Lazada through different form of projects.

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science / Economic / Business / Risk Management/ Statistics & Math/ Computer Science or related fields.
  • Minimum 6 years’ experience in one or more of the following areas: Data analytics, Strategy Consulting, Risk Management, Trust and Safety, Policy Development, prefer in the eCommerce or Tech industry in general.
  • Familiar with notice and takedown procedures.
  • Experience in the Risk, Fraud, or Trust Safety domain, and/or some knowledge in Intellectual Property Protection will be a plus.
  • Proficient skills in data analysis and visualization using SQL & Excel. Experience with analytical tools is a plus (SAS, R, Python).
  • Demonstrated capacity for critical thinking and analysis with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to manage ambiguity and thrive in a fast-paced working environment.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships and effectively liaise with people at all levels.
  • Strong project management skills, with experience in collaborating with different business and technical stakeholders. Able to develop and execute project plans, independently monitor, and ensure timely delivery of project deliverables.
  • Fluent in written and spoken English.

column2:
The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.","

J.P. Morgan Private Bank advises the world’s wealthiest families and helps them achieve their desired goals. Our teams of Advisors deliver advice, solutions and services across investments, wealth planning, credit and banking to help clients build, preserve and manage their wealth over time.

 Our team of specialists works seamlessly to help our clients achieve their financial goals and aspirations. We’re proud to be named ‘2019 Best Private Bank for Ultra-High-Net-Worth Clients’ by Euromoney: Egypt, France, Greece, Italy, Lebanon, Qatar, Spain, United Arab Emirates and UK.

.  

The Role and Responsibilities

The Technical Support Manager will be responsible for on-going BAU support of all applications within Client Service. A key responsibility will be to own and manage the end to end resolution of any technical issues impacting CSS (Client Service Specialist) BAU, including understanding the initial issue, raising of support tickets and ensuring speedy resolution by technology, transformation and product teams.  The successful incumbent will join and help run any global resolution calls being the voice of Client Service, also ensuring where issues are global in nature they partner with their colleagues across IPB CSS to ensure issues are resolved and solutioned for all IPB regions. Additionally, the incumbent will ensure root cause analysis is completed by the responsible party (possibly technology, operations, transformation) and any recommendations are planned and implemented. He/She will partner closely with both Technology, Transformation and Product teams on the role out of new functionality and be the primary point of contact within CSS for any BAU technical issues.  The candidate needs to have the mindset to work independently, facing off to multiple internal teams and be confident to engage with people at all levels.

  • Point person within CSS for all CSS BAU technical issues, escalation and ownership until resolution and communication to CSS
  • A desire to be the technical expert in all applications which CSS need to manage their day to day activities
  • Manage project related coordination within the region on behalf of CSS and be the point person to assign testing resources, other project requirements from time to time
  • Strong communicator, who is able to contribute in meaningful and appropriate ways to meetings, project deliverables or calls. Clear, concise and confident written and oral communications.
  • Able to work with multiple teams and people at all levels to ensure issues are understood and resolution agreed
  • Confident in proposing solutions to issues, using their detailed understanding of the business
  • Can work independently to drive resolution, but also partner at a global level
  • Bring and develop a strong network across the business which they can utilize in support of speedy issue resolution
  • Able to work and thrive in a high pressure environment where timeliness of resolution is critical to limit business and client impact
  • Partner with Product teams on the implementation of new systems to become the BAU technical expert and help to ensure the successful delivery of new applications
  • Provide CSS management reporting of Tech incident trends to facilitate end to end issue resolution and preventative solutioning
  • Own feedback management process on Tech enhancements which includes new tool designs, enhancement and /or fixes on existing toolset.
  • Key CSS champion on new tool set, partnering with CSS, Transformation and Technology to ensure new roll-out implemented are robust and meet user/platform requirements.

Qualifications

  • Detailed understanding of CSS processes, procedures and applications
  • At least 1 year proven CSS experience 
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to work independently showing initiative and problem solving, while working within a team environment
  • Excellent communication skills, can effectively communicate challenges and issues, and simplify complex business situations across all levels of seniority and functions
  • Be a team player who is flexible and can maintain both a positive attitude and high level of performance on high demand/time-sensitive initiatives
  • Bachelors or Master’s Degree (or equivalent)

231,tech project manager,/en/job/field-service-representative-9336860,9336860,Field Service Representative,False,False,4000,5600,SGD,Rheinmetall Communication and Technology Pte. Ltd.,17-Mar-22,False,,,201427420M,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

Rheinmetall Communication and Simulation Technology Pte Ltd (RCST)

RCST is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rheinmetall Electronics GmbH in Germany and part of the Integrated Electronics System (IES) business. IES provides satellite monitoring systems; military simulation and training solutions; mission systems, vision systems and fire control solutions for military vehicle and naval applications and C4I solutions for the battlefield. In the future, soldiers, vehicles and autonomous systems such as drones or ground robots will operate in an interconnected, fully digitized and highly automated combat network. Rheinmetall offers solutions in this area to ensure information superiority and higher response speeds – the system parameters that are crucial for mission success. This also includes simulation and training systems for modern and holistic training and decision support. The battlefield of the future will also include cyberspace.

","

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

This role is working for Rheinmetall Communication and Simulation Technology Pte Ltd (RCST) in Singapore. RCST is a 100% owned affiliate business of Rheinmetall Integrate Electronics Systems (IES), based in Bremen Germany. IES is a designer, system integrator and manufacturer of complex simulation and training solutions for military customers worldwide. This role focusses on delivering simulation and training solutions in the SE Asia Region.

The Field Service Representative is responsible for the installation, integration, service and customer support for complex simulation and training systems and assemblies Installed on customer sites.

The job includes all measures for the preparation and liaison with the designer and manufacturer - this includes the preparation of parts lists as well as the planning of requirements and the scheduling and provision of material, machines/tools/jigs, subcontractors and qualified personnel. In addition, the role supports the creation of the installation, integration, and/or service specifications and plans.

Tasks

* Planning and control of installation, integration, commissioning and service project activities for simulation and training solutions being delivered to SE Asia region

* Support to the In Service Support (ISS) manager in the preparation of ISS offers and contracts in coordination with the project manager

* Responsibility for cost, quality and schedule compliance where delegated

* Planning and control of subcontractors and partner companies supporting on site installation, integration and service

* Creation and maintenance of drawings and system documents to support installation, integration and service activities

* Support to the system development team in Bremen during the design phase and on site system acceptance testing activity

* Planning and delivery of customer operational and maintenance training activity

* Support to the ISS Manager for the concept development for integration, installation and commissioning and logistics support of future and existing projects

* Support to the ISS manager for the creation of innovative maintenance and operational concepts worldwide for military and civilian customers

* To be the main onsite representative for the company and able to deal effectively with customer concerns and issues

* To take responsibility for own on site safety in accordance with regulations, procedures and any risk assessments

* To liaise with customer project staff and dedicated on site company staff on all aspects of installation, integration and support for the project

Requirements

Professional Requirements

* State-certified technician or technical training with additional qualifications in the relevant field and several years of professional experience

* Training as an electrician who is authorized to work under voltage in accordance with the laws in force in Singapore

* Good experience in the field of service/integration, in a comparable industry

* Experience in project work processes including planning, specifications, procedure and cost control

* Good knowledge of computer hardware and basic software skills (e.g. Windows, Linux, Network Administration)

* Good mechanical and electrical technical knowledge

* Experience of software and hardware integration in complex electro-mechanical systems

* Experience of supporting the delivery of customer maintenance and operator training

* Business fluent in English (written and spoken)

* Demonstrable project and contract commercial and financial awareness

Personal requirements

* High intercultural awareness and competence and ability to work in an international business environment

* Goal-oriented and independent way of working as well as assertiveness

* Team oriented worker

* Confident personality and appearance

* Willingness to travel worldwide

* Good understanding and awareness of safety at work regulations and risk analysis procedures

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.GovTech is seeking for a Communication Specialist to support the communication for the Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) programme which is driven by the CODEX (Core Operations Development Environment and xChange) division. CODEX is a strategic national project and the CODEX platform presents a huge opportunity to rationalise and consolidate a federated agency hosting and infrastructure through modern cloud architecture implementation and the modernising of Government applications through adoption of agile development practices. 

The role is expected to leverage and work closely with both product management team and client stakeholders to understand the stakeholders’ communication needs and communicate on the development of the GCC coherently and consistently to all stakeholders. This role also requires basic understanding of the change management practices so as to be able to guide stakeholders’ through their journey on both the adoption and the use of the cloud.

We expect the incumbent to be able to communicate using different best practices across the product management team within CODEX.

What you will be working on:

  • Develop messaging that clearly articulate value and benefit of GCC
  • Communicate GCC value proposition to the senior and middle management group within Govtech
  • Partner with the Govtech service team to develop GCC communication and change management plan
  • Build engaging, easy-to-read collaterals like playbooks, step-by-step guides, FAQs to help agencies onboard smoothly
  • Execute communications through different channels for both internal GovTech divisions and the agencies team
  • Collate and centralize feedback and queries arising from the rollout of various cloud programmes
  • Support the development and scaling up of product marketing effort for GCC
  • Continuously refine and improve messaging on GCC

Being part of the GCC roll out, you will be instrumental in helping the public sector agencies to unlock the power of cloud and enable them to offer top-notch services to Singapore citizens and businesses

What we are looking for:

A Communication Sead with experience of communicating complex product across a very diverse and large community. Excellent programme communications skills and strong acumen, with the ability to deliver crisp message, that demonstrates empathy for users and follows the brand tone. Critical competencies required but are not limited to:

  • Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering, Information Technology, Electronics Engineering, Marketing or equivalent
  • Basic project management experience, with experience in communications planning and execution
  • Understanding of the use of different channels, e.g., email, meetings, newsletter, as an execution vehicle for communications
  • Experience in dealing with complex work group across multiple business functions or units
  • Excellent spoken and written capabilities to communicate effectively to a wide audience
  • Strong collaborative skills to work with multiple stakeholders and leverage their capabilities to deliver consistent messaging at scale
  • Experience in building relationships at various levels, and communicating at a one-on-one level
  • Business acumen to understand different communication needs for each stakeholder
  • Experience in the change management of new project launches, migration and rollout and the communications appropriate for each scenario
  • Plus if there is past experience in agile software development, including experience in some of the relevant areas such as CI/CD, Devops, Microservice, TDD/BDD, cloud computing

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column3: GATEWAY SEARCH. GATEWAY TO TALENT.

Gateway Search is about identifying the best talent in the market.  A preferred strategic search partner for many global and local clients looking at first-rate qualified professionals, Gateway Search is chosen for its track record of placing talents with precision, speed and success in high retention ratings.

We believe through our extensive network, deep relationships across the specializations we recruit, coupled with a flexible yet robust search methodology - We are the gateway to talent. To find the right talent for your team, please contact us at admin@gateway-search.com

column1:
","
About the Team:
You will join our SG local HR team and collaborate with our global HR team worldwide on daily basis. The team aspires to realize innovative ideas and practical solutions in a long term vision to pursue employee happiness within the Group. We strive to ensure you feel heard and well supported to be effective and efficient during your career in the team.
 
Job Description
  • The role acts as a primary point of contact of recruitment function, managing talent acquisition methodology, process as a program manager etc.
  • Work together with Business leaders & HRBPs to plan the workforce, draft out recruitment strategy and execute recruitment plan and selection in Singapore and other regions.
  • Actively manage various recruitment channels and vendors, including but not limited to: direct application, active sourcing, internal & external referral programs, networking events, campus recruitment, etc.
  • Build strong company brand, promote the company culture and design a competitive compensation package to attract and retain talents in the market.
  • Conduct market mapping for a sustainable talent pipeline;
  • Interview and access the candidates’ suitability technically and culturally fit to the company.
  • Help to the managers to upskills their interview skills by providing training to the panel of interviewers if needed;
  • Guarantee good candidate experience during the end-to-end recruitment process from the first call until onboarding.
  • Work with HRBP to enhance employee and workplace experience through localizing policies and processes through process improvement, implementation of best practices and data analysis.
  • Help to scale various HR initiatives to create efficient and simple people processes, systems, policies, and programs within the whole Group.
  • Implement employee engagement initiatives to ensure that best talent are attracted, retained and rewarded.
  • Applies knowledge of local, regional and global manpower laws and regulations to provide support in the areas of employee relations, recruitment and development, etc.
  • Help to process administrative transactions including offers, work pass applications (if needed), job and compensation changes, terminations and other HR transactions.
Job Requirement
  • Bachelor’s degree from top universities in Human Resources, Psychology, or any other fields.
  • A self – starter, proactive, independent and results-oriented.
  • A recruitment expert for established MNC in tech/crypto/fintech/semiconductor background is at advantage;
  • Possess a mind of continuous improvement.
  • Excellent creative and problem-solving skills
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Demonstrate positive working attitude and with a fast learning curve.
What you will expect
  • Fast-growing digital assets service provider company with a supreme network of investors, pioneers and enthusiast with ample knowledge and experience in the new industry;
  • Ability to contribute directly and make an impact to the future of digital asset industry;
  • The chance to build up new things/processes/systems from scratch;
  • Personal accountability, fast growth and learning opportunities;
  • An inspiring working environment with dynamic workspaces, flexible work time, flat structures, great team and a start-up spirit;
  • Attractive salary package and welfare benefits;
  • The change to grow your knowledge and career with internal and external training and mentoring resources.
To submit your application, please apply to this advertisement online or email your CV to melody.guo@gateway-search.com. We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2:
Defence research and development (R&D) is at the heart of what we do at DSO. As Singapore’s largest national defence R&D organisation, DSO is entrusted with the critical mission of developing technological surprises to enhance Singapore’s defence capabilities. From research to systems development, our defence engineers and scientists push the boundaries to develop game changing technologies and solutions that are not available in the market, or not available to Singapore. DSO also invest and explore emerging technologies to ensure the nation’s defence and national security capabilities are future ready. With more than 50 research areas across the domains of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace, DSO shapes the future of defence with our imagination and dare-to-do spirit in the relentless pursuit of the next big idea.","
DSO National Laboratories (DSO) is Singapore’s largest defence research and development (R&D) organisation, with the critical mission to develop technological solutions to sharpen the cutting edge of Singapore's national security. At DSO, you will develop more than just a career. This is where you will make a real impact and shape the future of defence across the spectrum of air, land, sea, space and cyberspace.
People are DSO’s greatest asset. You will get to realise your career aspirations and develop your own niche either as a deep technical expert or a leader in the team. With frequent career dialogues and a robust training and development framework, we will provide you with the necessary development tools for you to reach your potential. You will also be recognised and rewarded through competitive remuneration packages and scholarship opportunities.
In DSO Digital Office, the System Architect designs the technical architecture of new digital initiatives, ensuring that they can securely integrate and complement existing DSO digital technology and systems.
Principal System Architect / Tech Stack Lead
In this role, you will:
  • Be part of a dynamic team driving the digital transformation of DSO
  • Lead the design of technical architecture of new digital initiatives so that they can integrate and complement with existing DSO digital capabilities
  • Architect and deliver comprehensive, secure and performant technical solutions for DSO digital initiatives
  • Lead Tech Stack operation team in day-to-day operations
    - Design and implement operations processes and SLAs
    - Ensure compliance with processes and SLAs
    - Ensure secure functioning of Tech Stack systems
  • Scan for industry best practices and technologies for digital transformation
  • Propose and assess suitable solutions for DSO
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer & Information Science / Data Science & Engineering / Information Systems Technology & Design / Computer Engineering or any other related field
  • At least 5 years of experience in ICT / software engineering field
  • Experience as a Technical / Solution Architect or Project Manager
  • Experience in software development and system administration
  • Extensive knowledge of computer hardware and networking systems
  • Good understanding of private cloud, hyper-converged infrastructure, data lake and AI infrastructure technologies
  • Familiar with DevSecOps process and tools

Job Description

As an experienced professional in Project Execution, you thrive at managing complex technology programs that have far-reaching implications for clients, employees, and stakeholders throughout the firm. This role requires a strong grasp of the big-picture – namely, how can technology help achieve business goals – as well as a keen ability to establish priorities, manage resources and budgets, and build and incentivize high-performing teams. You'll work closely with colleagues across the firm to identify opportunities to develop projects and programs that are broadly applicable. Once you and your team establish a roadmap, you'll play an integral role in ensuring that the project is running on time, within budget, and in accordance with firm-wide guidelines, including risk and architecture. Just as importantly, you'll work with your team to set goals, foster collaboration, and promote the values, culture, and brand of JPMorgan Chase & Co.

This role is part of the Channels Risk Management Global team. The ideal candidate will be focusing on work related to technology risk & control in the Channels Technology International APAC Team. The ideal candidate will be team oriented and will work closely with Treasury Services Information Security Management, Corporate Information Technology Risk, as well as various program and technology managers in the Channels Technology group. The qualified individual will be responsible for the strategic and day-to-day risk management functions including risk assessment for new product launch, periodic e-banking assessment, and pre-audit controls reviews. The candidate will ensure all the risk and regulatory requirements are addressed so that all new platforms and products are implemented to the region in a smooth and timely manner. The position will also provide leadership in promoting awareness and driving an evergreen process in the Channels Technology space to ensure continuous compliance to the complex APAC regulatory environment both in project delivery as well as in BAU.

This role requires a wide range of strengths and capabilities, including:

  • Expert knowledge in all business processes across an entire line of business, as well expertise in other lines of business and technology disciplines
  • Understanding of global and line of business project and program management standards and methods
  • Experience working with high-performing teams in complex program execution
  • Understand regulatory requirements and relevant government regulations, particularly on e-banking related areas
  • Control and monitor the Business' compliance with the Information/Technology Control Policies and support reviews with Internal and External auditors
  • Review IT Development initiatives and regulatory changes to ensure compliance with the Banks' IT Control policy and with the various APAC Tech Operating Committees governance process
  • Stay current on regulatory issues affecting the technology with Treasury Services and provide guidance to the global technology teams on all technology issues related to policy compliance
  • Engage with multiple business and technology partners for review and completion for Supervisory CSAs and Regulatory Questionnaires
  • Initiate and implement a proactive risk self-assessment process that is used to assess the business' compliance and reveal any potential risk exposures
  • Summaries results of the risk assessment and create actions plans to remediate risk or document compensating controls to mitigate risk
  • Ability to create and maintain relationships with a wide range of stakeholders throughout the firm
  • Partner with both Internal Auditors during reviews and External Auditors performing annual review
  • Perform the role as IT representative at meetings with Regulators, and Auditors

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree 
  • 6 or more years of related business experience, including at least 3 years in Risk Management and/or Technology Audit functions
  • Business proficiency in Mandarin(speaking and basic reading) is required to be able to communicate with clients. The individual in the role will be liaising with stakeholders in Singapore, Hong Kong and Taiwan.
  • Project management skills to execute risk related projects effectively and the ability to resolve conflicts
  • Subject matter expert on technology risk management, with thorough knowledge of industry best practices
  • Understand and be familiar with the workings of APAC banking regulatory bodies (e.g. MAS, HKMA, FSS, etc.), as well hands-on experiences in dealing with Compliance and regulators
  • Control related experience (e.g. Risk Management, Vendor Reviews, Access Administration, Change Control, Contingency Planning); and strong understanding of the Information Technology Control Policies
  • Strong in stakeholder management, a strong people manager who can work in a highly complex environment
  • Good business analysis skills with good corporate IT Audit and IT Risk Management experiences
  • Keep abreast on IT regulatory developers in banking industry
  • Eager to learn new and varied systems
  • Service focused and detail-oriented
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • CISSP/CISM/CISA certified will be an advantage

Job Description

As an experienced professional in Project Execution, you thrive at managing complex technology programs that have far-reaching implications for clients, employees, and stakeholders throughout the firm. This role requires a strong grasp of the big-picture – namely, how can technology help achieve business goals – as well as a keen ability to establish priorities, manage resources and budgets, and build and incentivize high-performing teams. You'll work closely with colleagues across the firm to identify opportunities to develop projects and programs that are broadly applicable. Once you and your team establish a roadmap, you'll play an integral role in ensuring that the project is running on time, within budget, and in accordance with firm-wide guidelines, including risk and architecture. Just as importantly, you'll work with your team to set goals, foster collaboration, and promote the values, culture, and brand of JPMorgan Chase & Co.

This role is part of the Channels Risk Management Global team. The ideal candidate will be focusing on work related to technology risk & control in the Channels Technology International APAC Team. The ideal candidate will be team oriented and will work closely with Treasury Services Information Security Management, Corporate Information Technology Risk, as well as various program and technology managers in the Channels Technology group. The qualified individual will be responsible for the strategic and day-to-day risk management functions including risk assessment for new product launch, periodic e-banking assessment, and pre-audit controls reviews. The candidate will ensure all the risk and regulatory requirements are addressed so that all new platforms and products are implemented to the region in a smooth and timely manner. The position will also provide leadership in promoting awareness and driving an evergreen process in the Channels Technology space to ensure continuous compliance to the complex APAC regulatory environment both in project delivery as well as in BAU.

This role requires a wide range of strengths and capabilities, including:

  • Expert knowledge in all business processes across an entire line of business, as well expertise in other lines of business and technology disciplines
  • Understanding of global and line of business project and program management standards and methods
  • Experience working with high-performing teams in complex program execution
  • Understand regulatory requirements and relevant government regulations, particularly on e-banking related areas
  • Control and monitor the Business' compliance with the Information/Technology Control Policies and support reviews with Internal and External auditors
  • Review IT Development initiatives and regulatory changes to ensure compliance with the Banks' IT Control policy and with the various APAC Tech Operating Committees governance process
  • Stay current on regulatory issues affecting the technology with Treasury Services and provide guidance to the global technology teams on all technology issues related to policy compliance
  • Engage with multiple business and technology partners for review and completion for Supervisory CSAs and Regulatory Questionnaires
  • Initiate and implement a proactive risk self-assessment process that is used to assess the business' compliance and reveal any potential risk exposures
  • Summaries results of the risk assessment and create actions plans to remediate risk or document compensating controls to mitigate risk
  • Ability to create and maintain relationships with a wide range of stakeholders throughout the firm
  • Partner with both Internal Auditors during reviews and External Auditors performing annual review
  • Perform the role as IT representative at meetings with Regulators, and Auditors

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree 
  • 6 or more years of related business experience, including at least 3 years in Risk Management and/or Technology Audit functions
  • Business proficiency in Mandarin(speaking and basic reading) is required to be able to communicate with clients. The individual in the role will be liaising with stakeholders in Singapore, Hong Kong and Taiwan.
  • Project management skills to execute risk related projects effectively and the ability to resolve conflicts
  • Subject matter expert on technology risk management, with thorough knowledge of industry best practices
  • Understand and be familiar with the workings of APAC banking regulatory bodies (e.g. MAS, HKMA, FSS, etc.), as well hands-on experiences in dealing with Compliance and regulators
  • Control related experience (e.g. Risk Management, Vendor Reviews, Access Administration, Change Control, Contingency Planning); and strong understanding of the Information Technology Control Policies
  • Strong in stakeholder management, a strong people manager who can work in a highly complex environment
  • Good business analysis skills with good corporate IT Audit and IT Risk Management experiences
  • Keep abreast on IT regulatory developers in banking industry
  • Eager to learn new and varied systems
  • Service focused and detail-oriented
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • CISSP/CISM/CISA certified will be an advantage

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Senior Associate, Digital Service Delivery - Quality Assurance, Consumer Banking Group - (WD28640)

Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Job Purpose
DBS is a leading Asia bank servicing our clients for over 50 years in the 18 markets we operate in. Besides providing a comprehensive suite of financial solutions, our award-winning digital solutions are tailored for our clients as people are the heart of everything, we do in DBS. We are committed to deliver banking that is simple and hassle free and embed our digital solutions in client’s everyday life.
In our team at regional product delivery, we collaborate with a cross functional team of experts from product managers, analytics, design, engineering, quality assurance to user enablement. We provide insights with our strong domain knowledge, expertise in end to end project execution cycles and strength in quality assurance to turn requirements into output.
Our digital product delivery execution cut across the different digital channels which include internet banking for both desktop browser and mobile app, secured web, Chatbot, Paylah! app, intelligent banking, SMS banking to Wealth services.
We understand requirements from product managers, translate them to user story and acceptance criteria and slice them into executable scenarios using our behavioural driven design framework for execution post development by our technology team. Post that we will execute the end to end user acceptance test to validate the quality via our manual or automation tools before release to market.
The delivery of these highly complex and sophisticated banking solutions requires a capable and highly motivated individual who excel in stakeholder engagements and familiar with project management to deliver successful outcomes for the organisation.
As the bank continue to grow and invest in digital platform and increasing our digital suite of services, testing scope have expanded, platform have become more complex thus there need to have more creative and sustainable way of ensuring that our services delivered , both old and new remain robust and make banking invisible and joyful to our customers.
As a specialist in quality assurance delivery, you are part of a core team that focus on the end to end cycle of quality assurance in the user acceptance cycle, besides execution with our manual and automation tools, you will also work with team to identify opportunities to improve and drive efficiency in productivity and quality management in the projects that we execute.
Key Accountabilities:
  • Responsible for end to end execution of the overall test strategy developed collectively with the product owner from user story acceptance criteria, JBehave writing, execution of testing and defects management to live verification support.
  • Expected to be an expert in banking domain and able to write test plan and testing summary documents. To write and execute end to end test scenarios with detailed steps as per requirements either via manual or automation testing.
  • Actively participate and collaborate in project meetings and discussions, keen attention to details and time management to ensure quality and timely output of project assigned.
  • Execute the assigned manual or automation testing, log defects and follow up on defects to ensure timely closure. Generate reports of testing, prepare training slides for touchpoints, and required update to delivery
Job Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Design, develop, execute, and maintain test scenarios and detailed end to end test cases for the assigned projects relating to the digital platform’s user acceptance testing.
  • Able to write test cases in JBehave for agile projects.
  • Expert in using testing tools such as JIRA, Confluence etc to execute and maintain project status.
  • Knowledge of web and mobile application testing in banking domain, with good time management and keen eye for details to ensure quality and timely output
  • Detect, report and track defects in the application tools and with various stakeholders to ensure proper closure of issues.
  • Collaborate with all stakeholders proactive to complete job assigned from clarification to issue closure.
  • Good with documentation as constant update to project changes will need to be updated timely
Required Experience:
  • Minimum 1 years’ experience in web and mobile application testing in the banking industry is preferred.
  • Strong analytic skills to process complex requirement to come up with end to end scenarios and test cases
  • Familiar with Agile and waterfall methodology, and understand the life cycle of testing in both automated and manual testing
  • Have experience in running or being part of an agile project team in banking industry and have had hands on experience on JBehave
  • Understanding Java and VB Scripting will be an advantage
  • Experience with Quality assurance processes and tools including HP ALM, JIRA is a must
  • Good stakeholder engagement skills with strong verbal and written communication is required as will need to collaborate closely across multiple teams during project execution
  • Good team player with strong organizational skills and can work independently with minimum guidance
Tech Skills Preferred:
  • Strong knowledge in automation testing and testing life cycle and methodologies.
  • Experience with Quality assurance processes and tools including HP ALM, JIRA and JBehave
Skills (Non-Technical):
  • Must have resilience and the ability to work well under pressure with minimum guidance
  • Quick learner, adaptable to changes on project needs and good team player who take initiative to help team to complete assigned task
  • Strong working knowledge of SDLC practices and procedures.
  • Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and projects
Core Competencies:
  • Dependability — Staff can be trusted to work independently to fulfilled required task assigned.       
  • Adaptability/Flexibility — Need to display resiliency and work well under pressure due to possible evolving changes in requirements.       
  • Cooperation — Good people person is required as job require a lot of stakeholder’s engagement cross team to collaborate closely to achieve the required results.        
  • Stress Tolerance — Selected staff need to work under stress due to timeline pressure so staff must be able to manage stress well       
  • Leadership & Initiative — Staff displayed willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and willingness to assist when required.       
  • Persistence — Role requires staff to be persistence as changes may not happen overnight and candidate may be required to follow up closely with stakeholders to ensure closure.       
  • Analytical Thinking — Role requires analysing information and using logic to address work-related issues and problems.       
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

238,tech project manager,/en/job/assistant-manager-innovation-business-process-9348186,9348186,Assistant Manager (Innovation & Business Process),False,False,,,SGD,National Gallery Singapore,19-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200900977G,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>
ABOUT NATIONAL GALLERY SINGAPORE
UNVEILING MODERN SINGAPORE AND SOUTHEAST ASIAN ART
<div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div>
<div>

National Gallery Singapore is a leading visual arts institution overseeing the largest public collection of modern art in Singapore and Southeast Asia. Situated at the birthplace of modern Singapore, in the heart of the Civic District, the Gallery is housed in two national monuments – City Hall and former Supreme Court – that have been beautifully restored and transformed into this exciting 64,000 square metres venue. Reflecting Singapore’s unique heritage and geographical location, the Gallery aims to be a progressive museum that creates dialogues between the art of Singapore, Southeast Asia and the world to foster and inspire a creative and inclusive society. This is reflected in our collaborative research, education initiatives, long-term and special exhibitions, and innovative programming. The Gallery also works with international museums such as National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo (MOMAT), National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Korea (MMCA), Centre Pompidou, Musée d'Orsay and Tate Britain to jointly present Southeast Asian art in the global context, positioning Singapore as a key node in the global visual arts scene.

In 2018, the Gallery was the only museum in Southeast Asia that received a ranking in The Art Newspaper’s annual global survey of attendance at museums and took the 38th place. It is also the first museum in Asia to receive the Children in Museums Award by the European Museum Academy and Hands On! International Association of Children in Museums. It also won the awards for “Best Theme Attraction” at TTG Travel Awards 2017, “Best Attraction Experience”, “Breakthrough Contribution to Tourism” and “Best Customer Service (Attractions)” at the prestigious Singapore Tourism Awards in 2016 for its role in adding to the vibrancy of Singapore’s tourism landscape. For more information, visit https://www.nationalgallery.sg.

","

Job Requirements

Business Process Design (40%) 

  • Investigation: To conduct root cause analysis in problematic processes, investigate pain points with users (staff/visitors) through user interviews / research, and determine problem statement to be solved 
  • Process Mapping: To map out and evaluate existing business processes while working with the relevant process owners; to map out improved business processes and refine solution with the relevant digital teams  
  • Process Optimisation: To quantify impact of recommended improvements and present them in a clear and succinct manner for formalisation; to perform ongoing analyses on business processes related to productivity, quality, costs, and time management  
  • Change Management: To coordinate business process improvement and change management strategies with internal stakeholders; to oversee all aspects related to the implementation stages of business process improvement initiatives, especially during implementation of new systems; to analyse and monitor implemented changes to business processes and adjusting as needed 
  • Process Automation: To identify mature processes and to work closely with RPA and workflow management vendor / staff in the implementation 
  • Knowledge Management: To create user-friendly and accessible documentation for knowledge transfer and repository; to revise and update procedures and policies where applicable. Objective is to equip staff with business process management skills

Innovation Product Management (40%) 

  • Product Management: To design and develop innovation product according to business goals, leveraging waterfall, agile/scrum methodology depending on scenario. Experience with product and project management software. Co-develop and reporting of product ROI and KPIs (e.g. via Google Analytics, Firebase, App Store Reviews). Familiarity with product marketing and sustainability to ensure high level of service experience / uptime for Gallery stakeholders
  • Innovation Planning: To shape the future of internal and external user engagement by co-developing a strategic roadmap for increasing participation across the Gallery’s existing and future channels, while being cognisant of the Gallery’s needs and resources, and of tech and museum trends
  • User Experience Research: To design user experiences using participatory and iterative design techniques, including observational studies, visitor interviews, focus group discussions, usability testing, and other forms of requirements discovery
  • Innovation Process: To contribute in developing best practices and standards around user research and innovation development. Under the Digital Innovation and Transformation (DIT) group, we practice the Innovation Process of a) Proof of Problem, b) Proof of Market, and c) Proof of Scale. 

For Procurement Role (20%) 

  • To see through projected owned through and ensure projects owned through the various procurement process steps from seeking project approval through final acceptance and payment with the various corporate support structures. 
  • Knowledge of procurement techniques, abiding by Gallery’s procurement practice  
  • Experience in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to C-Suite 
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is essential, with agility to adapt and learn new applications quickly especially being in an innovation team 
  • Experience in marketing, programming, audience development, and/or service quality in arts and cultural, lifestyle, or attractions markets would be ideal, but not necessary   

Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor's degree in business process management, product / project management, user experience, behavioural science, or in a related field 
  • At least two years' experience in business process management in a related industry. 
  • Proficiency in process management software, such as Nintex Promapp 
  • Familiar with process automation tools and being able to identify which processes are suitable for RPA vs workflow management 
  • Exceptional leadership, collaboration, and communication skills. 
  • Superb recordkeeping, time management, and organizational skills. 
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Highly adaptable to changing environment and needs; to learn new apps quickly 
  • Being able to ask the right questions amid uncertainty so that the ideal course of action can be determined  
  • Strong project and people management skills. Self-motivated to function as a project leader, as well as an individual contributor 
  • Effectively communicate research findings, conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design rationale both verbally and visually 
  • Passion for researching and co-creating experiences that resonate emotionally with people, with qualitative and quantitative data to support decision-making 
  • Curious and keen on the various digital platforms and trends 
  • Bonus #1: As the innovator role requires ability to connect with diverse audiences, ability to pitch and communicate well would be beneficial orally and visually. Graphic design skills (e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator, Invision) would be a plus. 
  • Bonus #2: Working experience of prototyping tools and user interface design, as applied to Web/Mobile applications, consumer electronics, and exhibition design (e.g. Figma, Invision, SketchUp) 
  • Bonus #3: Experience in business consulting, marketing, programming, audience development, and/or service quality in arts and cultural, lifestyle, or attractions markets would be ideal, but not necessary.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in business process management, product / project management, user experience, behavioural science, or in a related field

Other Information

-

240,tech project manager,/en/job/project-manager-%7C-ai-singapore-9361741,9361741,Project Manager | AI Singapore,False,False,,,SGD,National University of Singapore,9-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description
AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI).   The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore's AI efforts.

We are looking for an individual to join our team as a Project Manager.  The Project Manager will manage and oversee a series of experimental projects on Artificial Intelligence (AI) from initiation to implementation, working with project teams of Mentors, Engineers and Apprentices, and working groups of Project Sponsors, Professors and PhDs, to jointly design, develop and implement the AI solutions. The Project Manager is required to plan, manage, execute and track the progress of the projects, to bring the projects to their successful completion.  
Duties & Responsibilities
  • Own and be responsible for the successful delivery of projects, ensuring they are completed on time, meeting requirements and within allocated budget
  • Manage project lifecycle, from requirement, design, technical construction, testing, acceptance, training, documentation and implementation, in accordance with the Company's Project Management Process and Methodology
  • Work closely with the group of Project Sponsors, Professors and PhDs on the agreed project timeline and objectives
  • Plan, coordinate and communicate project plan, timeline and activities to the project team of Mentors, Engineers and Apprentices
  • Monitor and track progress of projects and stay on top of projects to ensure smooth execution
  • Manage and coordinate project deliverables, ensuring their quality and configuration management
  • Analyse and highlight project risks and develop necessary risk mitigation plans
  • Analyse and highlight project dependencies to pre-empt project issues
  • Manage performance of project teams, guide project teams in resolving issues, and resolve conflicts within project teams
  • Manage customers' expectations by understanding customers' needs and providing realistic expectations and scope of projects
  • Manage and work closely with 3rd-parties, if any, involved in projects
  • Provide periodic update on project progress to Head of Project Management, and escalate project issues not resolvable at project team level
Qualifications
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Certified Project Manager, either CITPM or PMP certified, with at least 8 years of experience in IT, including 3 years of experience in managing IT projects and software/application development lifecycles
  • At least 1 year of experience in Agile project management methodology
  • Strong delivery management experience, with proven track records in managing and steering projects towards smooth execution and on time delivery
  • Strong project management skills, with ability to manage multiple projects concurrently
  • Experience in managing AI projects is preferred
  • Experience in change management, issue management and configuration management
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, effective in fostering teamwork and managing high performance project teams
  • Occasional travel within Singapore is expected, when the work requires it
Salary Range:  $7,000 - $8,000 More Information
Location: Kent Ridge Campus Organization: Office of the Deputy President(Res&Tech) Department : AI Singapore Employee Referral Eligible: No

column2: United Overseas Bank (""UOB"") was incorporated on 6 August 1935 as the United Chinese Bank. Founded by Datuk Wee Kheng Chiang, the Bank catered mainly to the Fujian community in its early years. The change of name was effected in 1965. Over the past 76 years, UOB has grown from strength to strength. Through a series of acquisitions, it is now a leading bank in Asia. Besides Far Eastern Bank in Singapore, UOB’s major banking subsidiaries in the region are United Overseas Bank (Malaysia), United Overseas Bank (Thai), PT Bank UOB Buana and United Overseas Bank (China). Today, the UOB Group has a network of over 500 offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Western Europe and North America.

UOB Innovation Hub 2 Sdn Bhd is a UOB-wholly owned subsidiary, providing end-to-end technology solution for UOB and seamlessly integrates with our Technology Centre in Singapore. UOB Innovation Hub 2 started the operations with providing technology solution across 5 key countries with the end goal to venture out into a full fledge trusted back-end delivery center support back to UOB Group.

","

About UOB

United Overseas Bank (""UOB"") was incorporated on 6 August 1935. Over the past 76 years, we have grown from strength to strength. Through a series of acquisitions, we are now a leading bank in Asia that is at the fore front of the Digital Age with cutting edge capabilities. Today, we have network of over 500 offices in 19 countries.

UOB (Malaysia) offers an extensive range of commercial and personal financial services through its branches, subsidiaries and associate companies: commercial lending, investment banking, treasury services, trade services, cash management, home loans, credit cards, wealth management, general insurance and life assurance.

We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve.

About UOB InnoHub2

Pure Technology, Pure Ideas, Same Values

Over our vast history, we have witnessed the evolution of technology and the power it holds to change the lives of everyone that it touches. Our solutions have changed the way the customers do banking and continues to evolve to ensure the best experience. With that spirit, we felt it was essential to have a dedicated hub that focuses only on creating the new and push the boundaries of our understanding beyond what we know today.

Hence, say hello to our Innovation Hub! Armed with a vision to create and a deep engineering expertise, we are now looking for you, the creators, the architects, the mis-fits who strive to challenge the norms and are eager to build products and services of our shared future.

If you decide to join us, you can expect:

  1. Complex and cutting-edge work and solving new problems
  2. Chance to grow rapidly through the ranks on the back of outstanding performance
  3. Flexible work environment that can mold to suit your work-life needs
  4. Company wide Innovation Challenge ‘Innova-thon’ , to generate the ideas of the future and pitch for investments
  5. Inclusive and Diverse colleagues with a passion for collaboration

If you do join, you will join not only a historical bank, but also a centre for Technology in its purest form.

Job Responsibilities

• Responsible for managing the end-to-end software development and support for a Digital Banking squad. This could be for projects, quarterly change requests, and L3 production fixes and includes analysis and design to development, implementation, testing and support

• Responsible for quality assurance of the team delivery in conformance to the Bank-defined software delivery methodology and tools

• Partner closely with the Digital Banking leads to plan and manage transitioned deliverables.

• Supporting development team on pipeline jobs and tools configuration

• Troubleshooting server or tool issues

• Identifying ways to improve development pipeline with automation

• Work closely with developers and tech leads to set up required CI/CD tools as per specifications

• Ensuring proper access control and governance of CI/CD pipeline jobs

• Contribute to improvement initiatives relating to methods, tools, people, architecture, project management and governance

• Provide insight, measurement, accountability and a positive working environment

Required Skills

Must have:

• MacOS, Xcode, Android Studio and mobile technologies

• Java development as well as iOS, Android and/or JavaScript frameworks

• Maven

• Unix Shell scripting

• Control M job scheduling

• Rocket Aldon, Clearcase tools

Good to have:

• Python and Javascript

• GitOps

Minimum Experience

• At least 5 years’ experience in software development, preferably in digital banking

• Experience working on delivery pipelines and in DevOps and CI/CD context

• Experience in system administration and configuration of BitBucket, SonarQube, Jenkins and Artifactory

• Understanding of release management process

• Familiar with Agile practices

• Familiar with DevSecOps

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

Visit our website here: www.uob.com.my

column3: TechnoDigm aims to provide total solutions in Fluid Dispensing and UV Curing.  We are committed to engineering excellence and dedicated to a continuous process of research and development.  Our high-performance equipment are the optimal solution to complex dispensing and UV curing processes, thus enabling customers to concentrate on product enhancement.

TechnoDigm works closely with industrial material suppliers to better understand material characteristics and application requirements.  This provides us with the knowledge and experience to create user-friendly dispensing platforms that can handle a wide range of materials with different properties and characteristics.

Our dispensing equipment ranges from simple table-top dispensing controllers to fully integrated in-line platforms.  Each system is specifically designed to meet customers’ requirement on volumetric consistency, high throughput, low maintenance, and cost-efficiency.  We provide standard machines that can be adapted to your needs.

TechnoDigm’s ability to combine both technical knowledge and experience has gained us a reputation for high-precision systems with excellent repeatability.  With our extensive range of products, we aspire to provide customers with total solutions in fluid handling and UV curing processes.

TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. ","

Ecommerce's Governance and Experience is a global team responsible for ensuring our marketplace is safe and trustworthy for not only users but also sellers and creators. We value user satisfaction and work on policies, rules, and systems to ensure quality. As the Anti-fraud Investigation & Operation Regional Lead, you will be part of the leadership group for Ecommerce's Governance team and lead a team that is responsible for building, scaling, and monitoring business processes that detect and prevent fraudulent activities in various scenarios.

Roles & Responsibilities:

- Own and drive the antifraud operations team strategy and OKR;

- Lead, build, and retain a team of high performing specialists in a fast-paced environment;

- Direct day-to-day operations of the fraud detection and mitigation areas;

- Identify vulnerabilities in current systems, policies, and products and take actions to mitigate emerging frauds;

- Drive continuous improvement in our antifraud processes to improve efficiency and achieve early detection of fraud

- Develop up-to-date subject matter expertise in fraud detection and prevention within your team;

- Engage with various business, product, technology, and security/risk stakeholders to solve risk problems at scale;

- Regularly produce high-quality fraud reports to summarize new trends and business impacts and present them to senior management teams.

Qualifications

- At least 5+ years of related experience in one of the following areas: Antifraud, Risk Management, Trust & Safety, eCommerce or Tech industry in general;

- At least 3 years of experience in a people management role;

- Detail-oriented, highly analytical, and strong project management skills;

- Ability to understand opposing points of view on highly complex issues;

- Strong ability to gather information from various online sources and community groups;

- Capability to draw actionable insights from datasets; knowledge of SQL, Python, or equivalent is a plus;

- Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships and effectively liaise with people at all levels;

- Prior law enforcement and/or prosecution experience a plus;

- Proficiency in English is required; any second language proficiency is highly preferred but not required.

- About 10~20% of travel if needed and when travel is allowed.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","

Business Function  

As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you.  

Background

DBS Remit is DBS' remittance platform that offers same day transfers to 50 countries around the world. Started in 2011, it has grown tremendously and is now a significant revenue generator for the Consumer Banking digital business across the region. More recently, DBS Remit API Services (DBS Remit API) was launched where we avail the same key value propositions - same day payments, low cost, and trusted brand - to our institutional clients.

As we position for the next phase of growth and scale DBS Remit API to new heights, we are looking for dynamic individuals to join our Technical Sales Specialist (TSS) team within the Consumer Banking Digital Payments Group (DPG). This is an ideal role for someone who wants to work in a dynamic, market-oriented group and directly drive key cross border payments initiatives for DBS.

Job Purpose

The Technical Sales Specialist team member will work closely with our business development personnel to pitch our Remit API product to clients, support the sales team to conduct required market/client research and demonstrate the product to the clients. The successful candidate would need to be an experienced product person or technical sales with a strong track record in understanding complex business and client requirements and be able to deliver a compelling product while interfacing with key internal stakeholders such as FI Relationship Management, Treasury & Markets, Tech and Delivery teams, Operations and Legal & Compliance.

Key Performance Indicators

  • Understand complex business requirements, workflows and booking models across internal channels and business lines, and deliver requirements to technology for design and implementation

  • Work with the team to develop the product strategy and roadmap to drive the business; provide support in the commercialization of the Remit API product

  • Provide API solutioning support for complex deals or RFPs working with business development and regional partners

  • Help grow client revenues by deepening client wallet share through recurring product sales efforts

  • Help the business development team by coordinating and managing the onboarding related activities by closely working with the client coverage and other internal teams to onboard client into various systems

  • As a product specialist and subject matter expert, educate the broader bank and functional stakeholders ensuring the platform and processes are compliant with broader bank policies.

  • Analyse industry trends within cross border payments and cash management, understanding risk and regulatory developments and competitive landscape

Responsibilities

  • Collaboratively interact with business partners and stakeholders including FI Relationship Management, Treasury & Markets, Remit Product Management, Tech and Delivery teams to design and implement Remit API solutions to increase wallet share for assigned clients and new to bank prospects.

  • Apply a Consultative Sales approach to all client engagements - Continuously engage clients to keep abreast of their evolving business priorities, treasury management practices to proactively position existing and emerging Remit API capabilities to address clients' changing situations.

  • Help develop and drive the sales pipeline

  • Work with in-house technology team in Agile methodology to deliver new or enhanced product features

  • Understanding local regulatory and compliance payments landscape and end-to-end capabilities that can be supported

  • Ensure that all products and solutions risks are understood and documented, and robust controls are in place, taking into consideration local regulatory requirements

Requirements

  • At least 4 years of relevant experience (Banking/Global Transaction Services, FX product development, Fintech, Payment Processor)

  • Education / Preferred Qualifications - University level Bachelors Degree, preferably having majored in either Business Management/Economics/Finance or Computer Science;

  • Strong product knowledge in cross-border payments and subject matter expert;

  • Understanding of foreign exchange markets and market conventions (Asia knowledge preferred)

  • Demonstrated ability to perform within a matrix organization and regional multi-country franchise

  • Understanding of technology project management/implementation, APIs, transaction process flows (preferred)

  • Strong knowledge of MS Excel, Powerpoint and ability to develop effective marketing materials for client meetings/RFPs/pitches/etc

  • Strong passion for cross border payments;

  • Ability to influence and impact outcomes;

  • Strong team player with excellent interpersonal skills;

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and interpersonal skills;

  • Ability to handle multi-tasking environment, meet deadlines, and work with a wide range of sensitive and confidential issues;

  • Ability to take initiative, work independently and accomplish a task with little supervision;

  • Strong strategic mindset with proven analytical skills.

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Avia Equipment was established in 1989. We are a trading and engineering company specialised sales and marketing of a wide range of aircraft ground support equipment and aircraft components repair services. Our customers are airlines, aircraft maintenance companies (MROs), airport authorities and air forces in this region and China. Our activities cover Southeast Asia Countries and China. We have branch offices in China. Beijing, Shanghai and Chengdu.

Product & Services

We represent over ten world leading ground support equipment manufacturers from USA and Europe. Our Products and Services are: - Aircraft Centralized 400 HZ Systems for hangar - Aircraft Ground Power Unit - Aircraft Ground Service Pits - Aircraft Hydraulic Service Cart - Electrical Load Bank - Rotary and Solid State Frequency Converter for Navy ship and aircraft - Aircraft wheels and brakes shop equipment - Aircraft maintenance platform for aircraft hangar - Aircraft components repairs etc. - Electrical products such as isolators and load banks

We also provide consultancy services on design and installation of centralized 400 HZ systems for airlines and aircraft maintenance company who build aircraft hangar. We work with M&E Consultant in this area as well. Avia has completed more than 30 hangar's fixed centralized 400 HZ systems in Southeast Asia and China. Products sold by us are promptly and effectively supported by our service engineer.

column3: Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.
