column1:
","
APAC Lean and Smart Automation SVP – Singapore
The APAC ICG CitiLean and Smart Automation role will partner the Business and O&T leaders in APAC to deliver priority one strategic programs focused on improving risk and control, client experience, process efficiency and revenue expansion utilizing the CitiLean Smart Automation methodology. Reporting to the Global Head of ICG CitiLean and Smart Automation, he/she will be leading a team of Lean, Smart Automation and Data analysts accountable for building and delivering on a pipeline of work across Citi franchises in APAC covering ICG and other franchise functions.
This role is responsible for four main areas: driving large scale programs with measurable outcomes, building leadership capability, managing, and developing a pipeline of programs and leading a team of CitiLean & Smart automation members. This role partners with Business, O&T and Re-engineering leaders in the region to target large-scale programs to meet their strategic objectives.
Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for scoping, directing & managing a portfolio of CitiLean and Smart Automation projects within or across businesses.
  • Develop and executes influencing strategies to build & increase buy-in and business leadership support.
  • Accountable for achieving measurable and sustainable operational efficiency results, and consequently, financial benefits. Accountable for staff's bench strength; provides technical expertise, and overall expert advice (technical, functional, change management, linkage to systems redesign efforts, etc).
  • Interface with business, key stakeholders, champions & reengineering leadership. Proactively communicates with senior leadership.
  • Identify potential targets based on priorities for the management and global strategy.
  • Engage senior process owners for each project, as required.
  • Shape large re-engineering programs of projects define business cases and gain stakeholder buy in for CitiLean and Smart Automation projects
  • Form project teams and create documentation to deliver CitiLean and Smart Automation projects.
  • Run project workshops, pilots, and other delivery activities.
  • Manage a core team of expertise on a day to day basis to drive overall functional objectives
  • Educate teams in CitiLean and Smart Automation tools, techniques, and principles.
  • Execute communication campaign to senior stakeholders across all impacted areas.
  • Maintain accurate documentation including plans, financials, and control points for each project.
  • Create and maintain analysis supporting re-engineering projects.
  • Direct analysis resources to deliver project related supporting material.
  • Assist business managers to identify where saves have been achieved and ensure that saves are realized
  • Work with cross-business teams to ensure communication is effective and achievements are communicated in a streamlined fashion.
  • Provides governance oversight for CitiLean and Smart Automation business-led programs
  • Engage partner organizations where appropriate to continue to raise awareness of re-engineering principles.
  • Conduct training for senior staff in CitiLean and Smart Automation tools, techniques and principles via workshops and formal training sessions.
  • Influence re-engineering strategy and execution, including continually improving CitiLean and Smart Automation toolsets, etc.
  • Develop and execute influencing strategies to build & increase buy-in and business leadership support.
  • Accountable for achieving measurable and sustainable operational efficiency results, and consequently, financial benefits.
  • Management responsibility for a team or multiple teams, including management of people, budget and planning, performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary actions and terminations and budget approval.
  • Perform other duties and functions as assigned.
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Key Cultural Fit:
  • You are entrepreneurial, and thrive in environments with a blank canvas that will allow you to flex your intellectual muscle to contribute to building a strategy from the ground up
  • You have a passion for new tech, and are always on the lookout for “what’s new”
  • You are naturally gifted at thinking of ways to “do things better, faster, smarter”
  • You work well in high-pressure situations, and consistently deliver under tight time constraints while delighting your stakeholders 
  • You can work across boundaries to fill the gaps, and drive accountability for yourself and others
  • You are highly motivated, organized and methodical and can work with minimal structure
  • You are Logical, analytical and rational thinker
  • You have demonstrated team player and ability to manage large teams who are not reporting to you
Job Skills/Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 15+ years total work experience (ideally with deep experience in financial services)
  • Minimum 15+ years of Lean or Six-Sigma experience including use of all relevant tools and delivery of training
  • 10+ years of strategic consulting experience covering operating model resign and business expansion strategy
  • Experience working with robotics and other emerging technologies would be ideal
  • Previous experience in supporting the build-out and running of a pipeline of transformation work at an organizational level
  • Previous experience leading or developing automation solutions for Operations and Services (and particularly with Robotics) will be highly valued
  • Strong data analytics capabilities especially cost analysis and internal/external benchmarking
  • Ability to work effectively with senior managers and with large teams across countries, functions and businesses
  • Understanding of the drivers of value including the ability to size and prioritize large scale initiatives across businesses and functions
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to structure logical analysis in presentations
  • Excel and PowerPoint skills are key
  • An understanding of Citi's businesses, the major strategic issues and the senior management landscape would be beneficial
Educational Level:
  • An undergraduate degree and an MBA (desirable but is not required)
  • Internationally recognized inhouse or external Lean Certification
  • Internationally recognized Project management certification

248,tech project manager,/en/job/content-manager-freelance-on-site-9426122,9426122,Content Manager (Freelance On-site),False,False,,,SGD,HOGARTH WORLDWIDE PTE LIMITED,30-Mar-22,False,,,201110033R,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

Hogarth Worldwide is a leading international advertising implementation agency. We use proprietary technology to deliver savings for global brands. By putting together a series of new systems and technologies, Hogarth produces and delivers national and international campaigns at a fraction of the historic cost, while enhancing quality.

Decoupling of production is a well-established trend with over half the world’s leading advertisers already having gone down this route. Hogarth works across all media, with production expertise in TV, print and digital, supported, where relevant, by its unique transcreation capabilities.
We are a culturally diverse organisation with around 3,000 employees globally, and are made up of over 50 nationalities who speak over 100 languages.

","

About the job

Hogarth Worldwide is the world’s leading creative content production company. Born to make the best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative workHogarth Worldwide is the world’s leading creative content production company. Born to make the best work brilliantly, we combine craft, insight and technology to bring creative work to life for many of the world’s most famous brands.

A Hybrid working model

Once offices are fully open we will be moving to a hybrid working model, which will allow our employees to split their time between the office and other locations, something we hope will provide everyone much more flexibility to their working week. The expectation is that working life at Hogarth will involve working from the office for about 50% of the time for most people. Please speak to the Talent Acquisition team to find out more information.

What does a Content Manager (Freelance On-site) do at Hogarth?

This vacancy is for upcoming short-term projects that will happen 3-4 times the year. Each project is likely to last for a week and would require the team to work full days on-site at the office.

The Content Manager manages end-to end content updates across the SEA markets, uploading new content and making changes to existing content on the CMS. You will require strong communication as well as organisation and time management skills as multi-tasking will be a core part of your role.

  • Ensuring the briefs received from the Client are clear and all assets are complete and appropriate for use
  • Managing the localisation production process within the markets in your portfolio, which includes:
  • Uploading packaged files
  • Checking and validating the staging site
  • Troubleshooting if any issues on CMS

Requirements

  • Experience working in a content management/account servicing/project management role within advertising/marketing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, demanding creative and production environment
  • Flexibility is essential to this role and working beyond the 9:00-18:00 framework and occasionally on weekends.
  • An eye for detail
  • Tech-savvy
  • Self-starter
  • Can-do attitude and ability to work under pressure

#LI_EL1

Diversity and Inclusion

Hogarth is committed to diversity and inclusion, through our ideas, our people, how we behave and conduct ourselves. Creating a truly inclusive culture at all levels of the organisation that encourages different points of view, making Hogarth not only a better company and place to work but an environment where everyone experiences connection, opportunity and a sense of belonging.

Data

We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.

When you click the ""Submit Application"" button at the bottom of this page, this will send all the information you have added to Hogarth WW. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Privacy statement. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

249,tech project manager,/en/job/solution-architect-hybrid-cloud-modern-data-center-apj-9425542,9425542,"Solution Architect, Hybrid Cloud & Modern Data Center, APJ",False,False,,,SGD,Avnet Technology Solutions (SG) Pte Ltd,29-Mar-22,False,,,199700062G,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"
As a global IT solutions distributor, Avnet has nearly 18,000 employees and will be increasing due to expansion and growth in businesses. The group serves customers and suppliers in the Americas, Asia Pacific, and Europe, Middle East and Africa however we are expecting the highest growth from APAC region. We are going to play as a major success driver in the group so we need great talents to bring more businesses in.
","

To support the organization to build end to end solution architecture for sales opportunities on the solution domain of Hybrid Cloud and Modern Data Center (Servers, Storage, Network, Automation) through the provision and application of technical expertise and knowledge across multiple vendors, technologies or industries.

Responsibilities:
  • Ability to accurately design complex vendor solutions to meet customer requirements.
  • Build Solution Blueprint and architecture for supported solution domain.
  • Responsible to lead the Hybrid & Modern Data Center Solutions Center of Excellence by building the solution use cases to support Demos, Proof of Concepts and Partner Enablement.
  • Provide solution architecture design & lead solution workshop.
  • Connect with the respective vendor business leaders, build solution initiatives that support the business growth and promote active engagement of the Center of Excellence.
  • Conduct Technical workshop and lead Tech Data event presentation.
  • Provision of an outstanding quality of service and meet predefined customer service level agreements (SLAs).
  • Develop Solution knowledge to a very high technical level
  • Lead the complex and high value tender project and responsible for the overall submitted solution for specified solution domain.
  • Point of escalation for the technical issue & Subject Matter Expert on the assigned solution domain (Data Centre, Desktop and Cloud, Security, Data Analytic, Document and data management)
  • Perform business planning activities including Quarterly Business planning and Review with vendors and BDM teams.
  • Involved in Services Cadence Meeting and responsible to drive services’ revenue
  • Communicate product, Solutions, software and technology information to educate internal and external audiences.
  • Deal with solution enquiries from internal/external sales and resellers and end users.
  • Accompany Account/Channel Manager where required in customer meetings to provide technical input.
  • Mentoring and coaching the presales consultant & system engineer on solution knowledge and day to day activities.
  • Hold the required level of industry and technical knowledge in technology group and the achievement of any vendor related accreditations.
  • Involved and participate in Specialist Business Unit’s business planning
  • Solution evaluation for the specified solution domain
  • Responsible for cross solution initiative.
  • Accountable to understand the business challenge and map the solution/technology accordingly to customers to mitigate the business pain points during pre-sales.
  • Ability to ensure adoption of the solution and technology as post sales engagement and capture the business metrics for renewal and upsell.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
  • Certified and credible on across multiple industry solutions and supported vendors
  • Strong Technical knowledge on the assigned solution domain. (Data Centre and Hybrid Cloud)
  • Possess strong leadership skill and decision-making capability.
  • Knowledgeable on principles, practices and techniques of project management.
  • Professional and polished delivery of presentations to C-Level Executive
  • Strong commercial awareness
  • Effective oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail, priority management and planning skills.
  • Good business skills and able to run professional meetings and business engagements.
  • IT industry knowledge – Channel, Vendors, Competition and End User is desirable
  • Ability to work independently with little or no supervision and result oriented
  • Must possess relevant solution domain certification/credibility.
  • Minimum 8 years of relevant experience on the solution domain.

Cultural Competency Requirements:

  • Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

250,tech project manager,/en/job/executive-senior-executive-shared-services-9402230,9402230,"Executive/Senior Executive, Shared Services",False,False,,,SGD,EMPACT PTE. LTD.,22-Mar-22,False,,,201127696E,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

Founded in 2011, Empact is a leading social enterprise with a mission to build the capacity of social organisations (referred to as non-profit organisations and social enterprises) in Singapore and the region. Our aim for our capacity building efforts is to empower these social organisations to be empowered for greater impact.

Through our cross-sector collaboration with sector developers, grantmakers, corporates and volunteers, we bridge the capacity gap of the social sector by channelling talents, skills and resources to co-create innovative solutions to address the various needs of social organisations.

To date, Empact has impacted and empowered more than 2,000 social organisations in the region, with a contribution of savings amounting up to $9 million worth of professional services that have been rendered pro bono for the social sector.

In 2019, Empact was selected as a finalist for the President’s Challenge Social Enterprise of the Year Award. This is the highest accolade for social enterprises in Singapore by the President of Singapore.

","

An Overview In our Shared Services department, we empower non-profits and social enterprises by providing affordable and professional services that are critical for their daily operations, such as bookkeeping, donation tracking, accounting to payroll and human resources support. By bridging this gap, we believe our social organisations are enabled to fulfil their social missions and scale their social impact. We are currently looking for an Executive / Senior Executive, who will be responsible for assigned client portfolio and Internal Finance/Admin portfolio. You will be working together with our Client Services Managers / Assistant Managers / Executives, and guiding our interns and volunteers to provide accounting, HR, and financial process improvement services to our non-profit and social enterprise clients.

Roles and Responsibilities This job is for you if you are: Passionate about active engagement in supporting the non-profit sector and social enterprises Able to strive well in an action-oriented and agile environment Comfortable working both independently and in coordination with cross-functional teams Able to work on multiple projects and prioritise effectively Enthusiastic and committed in providing excellent services to our clients Committed to knowledge sharing and can work with volunteers and interns

Your job role will cover: External client-facing scope: Maintaining a good client relationship with our Shared Services clients and ensuring on time delivery of services Performing accounting, financial reporting, payroll, GST, tax and other shared services functions for our clients Supporting supervisors in liaising with the clients and tasks assigned Attending to clients’ accounting / audit queries and requests in a timely and professional manner Guiding volunteers and interns for delivery of services and problem-solving Reviewing deliverables by the volunteers and interns Assisting in ad-hoc Shared Services projects (financial process improvement projects) Assisting in ad-hoc business development for new and existing clients Internal finance/admin scope: Supporting internal finance team in finance-related tasks (AR, AP, vendor & staff claims payment processing, bookkeeping, management reporting, GST reporting, tax computation) Supporting in sales invoicing to clients Supporting in payroll processing and IR8A tax filing Ensuring proper documentation of accounting files Assisting in other ad-hoc finance/admin tasks (grant claims preparation, budgeting, vendor liaison, office space management)

Requirements At least a Diploma in Accountancy or related discipline With a minimum of 1-2 years working experience in the areas of accounting and financial reporting Audit experience will be advantageous Experienced in client-facing tasks Experienced in preparing full set of accounts Experienced in project management; adaptable to change and able to communicate and build rapport with diverse stakeholders (clients, interns, volunteers) Proficient and patient in communicating financial principles to stakeholders with no accounting background Familiarity with charity accounting standards is a plus; familiar with cloud-based accounting and HR software; interested in constantly learning new skills Good interpersonal skills with a positive disposition. Ability to work effectively with people from different cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives Have a “can-do” spirit and would take initiative to make things happen Take responsibilities and ownership for tasks assigned Ability to multitask, adaptable to change and handle stress Exhibit good ability to work as team Generally tech savvy and proficient in Microsoft applications

251,tech project manager,/en/job/tech-lead-cloud-native-infrastructure-9423576,9423576,"Tech Lead, Cloud Native Infrastructure",False,False,,,SGD,BYTEDANCE PTE. LTD.,29-Mar-22,False,,,201923456H,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

column1:
","

Responsibilities

Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin and Toutiao. ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

Our Cloud Native Infrastructure team manages a Kubernetes-like cluster management system to host microservices, serverless applications, big data processing, machine learning, distributed storage services, and edge computing platforms for the company.

The team builds and leverages the container-based cluster management system to manage elastic computing resources, and provides PaaS hosting capabilities to our developers and infrastructure services. This cluster management system is designed to be capable of managing ByteDance's fleet of machines across multiple data centers, managing hundreds of millions of containers and applications for our business, with high agility, large scalability, high availability, and extreme performance assurance.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the team to build application orchestration framework to host various types of production workloads, covering services management, big data jobs, distributed machine learning systems, and distributed storage services;
  • Build performant container-based cluster management system to manage our hyper-scale resources and workloads, with horizontal scalability and ultra-low E2E container startup latency;
  • Design and build cluster federation, horizontal scaling, vertical scaling, and co-location solutions to optimize resource utilization;
  • Apply ML methodologies to the scheduler system to help reduce resource fragmentation, balance hot spots and optimize data center power usage;
  • Recruit and mentor engineers with various levels of experience into a performant team, build team culture and cohesion, help team members grow technical capabilities.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields;
  • 6+ years of professional software development experience;
  • Strong with Golang/Java/Python program development (at least one), pursue high-quality code and focused on code engineering quality;
  • Solid knowledge of Linux system, proficient in multi-threading, network programming, and distributed development in any programming language;
  • Good communication skills, able to lead and drive projects effectively. Familiar with team and project management methodologies and approaches.

Preferred Qualifications

  • In-depth research and industry experience in application scaling, workload co-location, and isolation enhancement;
  • Experience in cloud-native application or framework development, including OAM, dapr, vitess;
  • Experience in large scale cluster management systems, including Kubernetes, Yarn, Mesos;
  • Experience in container runtime and relevant projects, including Containerd, Kata-Container, gVisor, and x-containers;
  • Contributor/Committer or PMC of the open-source community is a plus.
",[],Senior Executive,,6 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Miscellaneous allowance', 'Medical', 'Vision', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual & Business']",https://jobs.bytedance.com/en/position/7035824822140668196/detail,70000,Singapore,sg

252,tech project manager,/en/job/asia-product-development-lead-specialist-tts-senior-vice-president-22436731-9425213,9425213,Asia Product Development Lead Specialist – TTS - Senior Vice President -22436731,False,False,,,SGD,Citibank N.A.,29-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200309485K,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.

Mission: Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. We are Citi, the global bank – an institution connecting millions of people across hundreds of countries and cities.

column1:
","
The Asia Trade Product Development team is a horizontal organization cutting across all Trade products and solutions with a primary objective of digitizing our capabilities front to back and to enhance client experience, considering the evolution of the industry and clients’ needs. Working closely with our partners across TTS Products, Operations and Technology and the Product Management team, this team will lead the client experience and trade digital agenda, the modernization and build-out of our infrastructure, development of a holistic data strategy and commercialization of our new digital solutions in Asia
The Asia Trade Product Development Lead Specialist role would encompass leading product design ideas, product and application developments as well as partnerships and alliances to accelerate the innovation. It would be instrumental in driving the short to medium terms digital product strategy within Trade to future proof the business from the rapid change and disruptions in the marketplace.
The Asia Trade Product Development Lead Specialist will have continued engagement with client facing trade teams (Sales, Client Management team) for identification of new opportunities including those where we will co-create with clients. Direct client engagement will be needed for origination, validation and execution of ideas
The role will have significant interaction with senior management and stakeholders across Trade in region and outside and will work with various partner groups including Country Product, Innovation Labs, Operations, Technology, Channels, and Implementations etc.
This position reports to the Asia Head of Trade Product Development.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead product development within the Product Innovation and Tech space via a combination of Project & Product management skill set; This would entail product design, co-development both internally as well with external service providers (Fintech/Digital solution developers), as well alliances and partnerships with other bank/tech, entities etc.
  • Provide leadership on development of emerging Trade Digital infrastructure including emerging tech like DLT (distributed ledgers), AI, IoT (Internet of things), Workflow solutions and new pathways for rapid API development and deployment that will fit into the open banking world. This will include building a client friendly narrative that will help scale these initiatives across broader set of clients, geographies, Industries or Products.
  • Lead and drive the Trade specific Data Strategy including development of Data Platform and analytics capabilities. This will entail use of AI and machine learning for prediction/forecasting, recommendation and commercialisation with a view to develop and deploy high value use cases that have potential for becoming powerful client solutions and/or create value for internal processes.
  • Drive adoption of existing proprietary & other new multi-banking Trade Client Communication Channels like: Citi Direct, SWIFT MT798, APIs, DocuSign etc) including development and governance of an optimum operating framework for associated Client and Supplier (For Supplier Finance) on boarding onto these Channels & engagement post on boarding
  • Oversee supplier on-boarding for large multi-country regional supplier finance programs using tools like TAOS/DocuSign
  • To lead the management of the technology book of work for Asia trade by working closely with country product, operations and technology and focusing on proper budgeting, prioritization, project planning and delivery and tracking the tangible outcomes
  • Regular and continued engagementswith all the client facing teams for identification of emerging needs and client pain points. Direct client interactions for project deep dives and co-creation opportunities.
  • Focus on producing cutting edge client material and collateral for positioning Citi as thought leader to clients and represent Citi on relevant industry forums where such discussions are taking place and to introduce new initiatives that will ensure constant flow of ideas to and fro between clients and Citi.
  • Work with fintech, vendors, regulators and other industry partners to bring the outside in and forge partnerships with these stakeholders for opportunity areas with significant and rapid impact;
  • Push through digital skill set development of Trade & Client facing teams through product training modules, short engagements in various work streams with a view to empowering teams to benefit from
  • Collaborate with other TTS businesses (including P&R, Channels, Account Services) with a view to leverage solutions already developed as well as develop internal partnerships for further scaling trade
  • A close look at the market developments and trade technology innovations within the client segments as well as competition – to continue stay ahead of the curve in an ever changing global trade landscape;
  • Setup appropriate & ambitious improvement targets and KPIs for the organization and track progress in delivery
  • Focuses on controls and governance, including performing Need-to-Know based security and access reviews, Access Approvals, controls testing and documentation
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
  • 10+ years of experience
  • Proven track record of successfully managing in a large and complex business
  • Intellectual curiosity, analytical and conceptual thinker
  • Proactively seeks and develops new opportunities
  • Thorough financial acumen and P&L management experience
  • Excellent analytical, interpretive and problem solving skills
  • Proven track record of bringing diverse groups and perspectives to work against a common goal
  • Ability to maintain momentum and minimize client and employee attrition
  • Ability to establish and maintain senior client relationships and to work across multiple facets of Citi businesses
  • Process Management knowledge with a propensity for detail and comprehensiveness of content
  • Ability to collaborate and clearly communicate with senior members of an organization
  • Project Management skills with experience leading large cross functional initiatives
  • Proven track record as change agent, with ability to encourage and embrace innovative ideas and solutions
  • High emphasis on “getting to yes” and building intercompany relationships
  • Self-aware with ability to adapt to various situations, rapidly assimilate and report on complex information while creating a future vision
Education:
  • Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred
Competencies:
  • Ability to work within and drive broad group of stakeholders, countries, global and regional teams
  • Practical knowledge and experience in mapping out client journey and translating into a set customer experience
  • Comfortable in presenting strategic objectives to senior management, gaining support for key initiatives and then providing regular updates on the progress
  • Ability to coordinate effectively in a multicultural and multiregional environment
  • Can work independently (self-starter) and lead a group of resources from various teams
  • Ability to achieve results through collaboration and networking
Development Value:
  • Develop extensive knowledge about Trade business
  • Ability to help shape and execute Global Trade strategy and initiatives
  • Broaden network at Citi and TTS through close interaction with the Trade Senior Management and partners across ICG
  • Be part of an exciting journey as we look to transform the trade business and participate in the exponential growtAch expected in the payables business.

253,tech project manager,/en/job/rov-workshop-engineer-9423477,9423477,ROV Workshop Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,IKM Subsea Singapore Pte. Ltd,29-Mar-22,False,,,201101195G,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"

IKM Subsea is an independent ROV and subsea operator with our own Merlin technology. We carry out ROV operations across the globe on a daily basis.

With around 200 employees and more than 28 ROV systems, we are one of the leading ROV operators in the world.

IKM Subsea Singapore was established to support the growing ROV market in Asia. The office oversees Operations & Sales of the ROV fleet and in the Asian region. 

The company provides innovative simple solutions in a cost effective manner to match the need of our client. We provide ROV services specializing in ROV Drill Support, Inspection Repair & Maintenance, Construction Support and Diving Support. We are able to provide different range of ROV’s from Observation up to Work Class. 

","

The Workshop Engineer is primarily engaged in the maintenance and preparation of equipment at the company’s premises, as well as the mobilization of such equipment for projects and its installation onto vessels regionally. The workshop engineer may also be required to work offshore as an Electronics Technician/Engineer, or as directed by the Workshop Supervisor or the Operations Manager.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To assist and manage day to day Workshop operations.
  • Technical & logistical support for ROV projects.
  • System integration for specialist projects.
  • To upkeep PMS and maintenance data of ROV system.
  • To know the designated equipment for which he is responsible.
  • To carry out workshop procedures, by ensuring that each item of equipment returned to the company’s premises after a project or hire, is thoroughly tested, before being labelled as checked and stored ready for the next project.
  • To utilize and discuss with the Supervisor / Sub Engineer returning from each project, equipment fault reports.
  • To have a sufficient understanding of the equipment under his responsibility, to be able to satisfactorily test the equipment’s operation. Specific requirements for training or test equipment are to be advised to the Workshop Supervisor.
  • To know which projects are forthcoming and their timing, and to prepare all required equipment within his responsibility, to include: back-up equipment, spares, consumables, power supplies, the fabrication of brackets, tools, manuals, etc.
  • To assist in purchasing of spares and consumables for workshop and offshore operations.
  • To liaise with the Project Managers and Offshore team on interfacing between equipment prepared for the same project but under a different responsibility.
  • As directed by the Project Managers / Operations Manager the workshop engineer will mobilize equipment on the vessel, install it and test it. Once installed and tested, it will be signed for by the ROV Supervisor, Client or Captain, whichever takes over responsibility for the equipment.
  • Actively participates in Operations, Quality Assurance and HSE group meetings.

column3: Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.

Mission: Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. We are Citi, the global bank – an institution connecting millions of people across hundreds of countries and cities.

Responsibilities
The IT Business Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.
Responsibilities:
  • Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
  • Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
  • Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
  • Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards
  • Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
  • Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
  • 6-10 years of experience
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
  • Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
  • Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
Education:
  • Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
  • Master's degree preferred
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Business analysis effort to deliver critical projects
  • Requirements gathering to Citi standards
  • Management of project deliveries – business, tech mandatory and regulatory, as assigned
  • Resolve day-day project issues and conflicting workload priorities
  • Reporting on project statuses, next steps and issues / risks to stakeholders and sponsors
  • Assisting and supporting user community with change management
Overseeing production of test cases
Ensuring release contents understood by the business, including producing release notes
Tracking release cycles
Knowledge, Skills and Experience Required:
Experience:
  • Significant Business Analysis / Project management experience across the full project lifecycle (requirements, design, development, testing and deployment).
  • Proven delivery record of managing multiple projects involving process change and technology enhancements.
  • Electronic execution exposure, particularly in the Cash Equities  area around Algorithms trading, SMART Order Router , market data , connectivity & reference data
  • Strong knowledge on managing the low latency infrastructure project for electronic execution platform
  • Understanding of regulatory constraints and experience in delivering regulatory projects is extremely desirable
  • Detailed and specific experience with  the full Cash lifecycle required
Skill set requires evidence of :
  • Ability to handle complex projects independently
  • Problem-solving and facilitation skills
  • Knowledge of the key functions and processes of Cash business
  • Self-motivation and prioritization of tasks and actions to hit deadlines according to business priorities
  • Strong inter-personal skills
  • Enthusiastic and proactive approach
  • Good attention to detail and relevant product knowledge

column3: The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.
Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

column1:
","

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an ""outside-in"" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

The Data Science and AI Division (DSAID)’s mission is to uplift the government’s data science and AI (DSAI) capabilities for public good. DSAID delivers high-impact DSAI projects and agency partnerships, as well as central data analytics and AI platforms for whole-of-government. We provide thought leadership on data science and AI matters as the DSAI capability centre, also helping to grow government capabilities through development efforts to uplift agencies’ data maturity and to upskill public service officers in data literacy. We believe passionately in data science and AI for public good. If you are passionate about data and looking for opportunities to work with a team of DSAI practitioners and leading industry experts, we welcome you to join DSAID!

As the Head of Video Analytics, you will provide engineering leadership to drive the strategy formulation and business development for the Video Analytics team as part of the DSAI Capability Centre. You will lead the execution and deployment of central AI-driven Computer Vision-based and Video Analytics solutions to support Whole-of-Government (WOG) demands. You will lead, manage, coach, mentor and grow a strong and highly motivated product development and specialized technical team that comprises product, design, engineering and partnership talent.

You will be a key change agent to drive the adoption of Computer Vision and Video Analytics solutions for agencies to enhance their policies, service delivery and operations. In doing so, you will lead and partner agencies to influence organisational developments towards an AI-driven Digital Government.

What you will be working on:

  • As the head of the Video Analytics team, you are responsible for the overall direction of the team, which includes overseeing the product development, program management and engagement plan for Video Analytics capabilities with an effective and sustainable vision to uplift WOG capabilities in Computer Vision and Video Analytics. This means charting out the go-to-market strategy, product priorities and the implementation plans.
  • Provide direction to direct reports in the performance of their duties and establishing work priorities to deliver quality Video Analytics outcomes aligned with our Smart Nation mission.
  • Mentor team managers and technical staff to grow as technical leaders and domain specialists.
  • As the functional lead of Computer Vision and Video Analytics, you are responsible to study and keep abreast of Video Analytics and related technological developments in the industry, leveraging on relevant research resources.
  • Be a strong advocate of an AI-driven Digital Government with Video Analytics capabilities as a key business enabler. You will help to assess and advise senior stakeholders on the latest strategic and technological developments in Video Analytics, emerging information technology landscape, and innovative Video Analytics products and technologies that may drive changes in Video Analytics strategies and policies.
  • Benchmark our own WOG Video Analytics programmes, capabilities and performance against industry, international and leading institutions’ standards, best practices and norms.
  • Strategize and drive key partnerships with the Video Analytics ecosystem, as well as engage the industry and professional communities to augment GovTech’s Video Analytics capabilities.

What we are looking for:

  • Passion and love for Computer Vision and Video Analytics is paramount.
  • At least 8 years of working experience in the field of AI and Computer Vision/Video Analytics and more than 12 years in related product development work.
  • Good technical understanding of AI for Computer Vision and engineering discipline, tools and framework that go into product development for Video Analytics products.
  • Possess good communication skills with the ability to build effective and strong working relationships with all levels.
  • Strong leadership and management skills with proven stakeholder management experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

*Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Senior Associate / Associate, POSB Marketing Manager - Consumer Banking Group - (WD31243)

Business Function
Established in 1877, POSB is the oldest bank in Singapore. We pride ourselves as “Neighbours first, bankers second” to our customers.  Being a bank that is close to the hearts of many Singaporeans, we strive to make banking simple and inclusive for our customers by bringing to them products, services and capabilities to support their lives, dreams and aspirations, with focus on delivering a joyful banking experience for our customers.
Join the POSB marketing team to fortify POSB’s brand leadership and propel POSB as a progressive financial partner that stays relevant for our customers and community.
Responsibilities:
  • Be part of the POSB marketing team to strategize and strengthen POSB’s brand leadership.  Develop both defensive and offensive marketing strategies to maintain POSB’s stronghold on BHM key preference drivers and chart new frontiers for the bank.
  • Push the boundary for innovative marketing ideas and campaigns to deliver delightful customer journeys and create meaningful engagement with target audience to elevate our POSB brand.
  • Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external partners, media, creative agencies to ensure marketing initiatives align to POSB brand strategy and support business objectives.
  • Marketing responsibilities include but not limited to:
  • Champion POSB Social media strategy to ladder up to brand ambition. Up the ante on creativity for social media engagement.
  • Endeavor to dominate brand mindshare for parents and kids segments. Be creative in engagement to build brand affinity and drive business outcomes.
  • Lead gamification for POSB from end-to-end project management, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders - from ideation, tech development, internal approvals, UAT up to ensuring a successful launch with innovative marketing communications and press publicity. 
  • Manage POSB events and sponsorships - support marketing communications from planning, creative production, event management to on-ground implementation and activation.
  • Ensure a strong discipline of campaign performance tracking to continuously optimize effectiveness of campaigns to deliver on set goals.
  • Manage branch distribution communications and marketing for POSB, DBS and Treasures.
  • Manage marketing budget to ensure prudent spending and maximize ROMI.    
Requirements:
  • Degree/Diploma in related disciplines like Marketing, Mass Communications or Advertising.
  • Minimum 7 years’ working experience in related fields like Marketing, Advertising and Media.
  • Experience in brand, product, segment or event marketing, development of games and digital platforms for customer engagement, familiarity with creative process and working with creative/media agencies is preferred.
  • Good understanding and knowledge of digital marketing, gamification for customer engagement and social media engagement will be a plus.
  • Ability to strategize, plan and execute with finesse.
  • Experience with managing a team.
  • Strong collaborator, resourceful and ability to navigate independently. 
  • Good team player with excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment.
  • Extremely meticulous, with an eye for details.  Comfortable with copywriting and able to provide constructive critique for creatives and steer development.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Data-driven and is able to draw insights from data.
  • Open-minded and nimble to change with a growth mindset.
  • Excellent powerpoint and excel competency.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

257,tech project manager,/en/job/medium-business-apj-online-transactional-marketing-manager-9419437,9419437,Medium Business APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Dell Asia Pte Ltd,28-Mar-22,False,,,198905101W,,,,,,
,"

Medium Business APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager

Assessing market trends, quantifying opportunities and developing marketing programs, Field Marketing at Dell Technologies is at the forefront of customer engagement. Responsible for a specific location, department or product, our teams drive marcom strategy – from making budget recommendations to defining roadmaps and informing content themes. Interacting directly with customers and utilizing third-party customer data, they provide Dell’s product marketing and messaging team with game-changing feedback. At the highest level, they develop and drive marketing policies and activities, from market

research through brand management and product development to pricing.

Join us as a MB APJ Online Transactional Marketing Manager on our Marketing team in SINGAPORE to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve

As a part of the MB APJ Central Marketing team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the APJ online marketing campaigns for the mid-market segment. Your role would be to drive online demand and engagement through marketing tactics for MB audience.

You will:

  • Development and execution of the cutting-edge Online marketing plan for APJ Medium Business driving incremental revenue, customer registrations and new buyers
  • Definition and drive of right marketing mix for online including Digital, E-shots, and other tactics pushing promotional offers and eCommerce value proposition with a consistent online Customer Journey
  • Deliver digital performance to meet the core financial goals of the team with available budget and Vendor Funding allocation. Apply a deep understanding of emerging online demand generation strategies to increase revenues and enhance online conversion.
  • Build a strong partnership with International and APJ eCommerce, Merchandising and Digital Teams
  • Collaboration with Mediacom (digital agency) team to ensure the successful and innovative implementation of MB APJ Online Digital Strategy.

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements:

  • Fluency in English with strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in Media / Digital / Marketing project management role in high-tech industry preferred.
  • Deep understanding of the media and advertising landscape, digital tactics and technologies and project management skills and drive for results
  • Experience in transactional online marketing, driving traffic acquisition, conversion, A/B testing and ability to interpret data and experience in running customer acquisition, revenue conversion and retention campaigns
  • Good overview of Dell’s solution portfolio and experience working with agencies
  • Creative, constantly look for new approaches and ability to work in fast-paced environment and deal with ambiguity

Desirable Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business
  • Deep understanding of IT market dynamics
  • Experience working in an international matrixed, complex organization

Key Relationships

  • MB APJ & International Marketing teams
  • APJ Digital Marketing team
  • Global Marketing & production teams
  • APJ eCommerce team
  • APJ CS & IS Merchandising team
  • Vendor funding, calming and compliancy team
  • External agencies: media partners and creative agencies

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

258,tech project manager,/en/job/growth-manager-meta-9422275,9422275,Growth Manager (Meta),False,False,,,SGD,Mighty Jaxx,29-Mar-22,False,,27 days,201511542C,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

Based in Singapore, Mighty Jaxx is an award winning design studio specializing in developing art collectibles. Since our inception in 2012, we have produced James Jean, PHUNK studio, Jason Freeny, DC Comics, Nickelodeon, MTV, New Balance and Cartoon Network. 

To date, we have created over 300 products for collectors in over 50 countries – all from our art-filled office in Tai Seng.

","

Our Team

Mighty Jaxx is a unique future culture company that creates quality products across multiple categories such as art collectibles and lifestyle items, bridging the physical & digital world by powering it with technology. Since our inception in 2012, we have produced over 1,000 designs in collaboration with world-renowned artists and global entertainment brands like Hasbro, Sesame Workshop, Toei Animation and Warner Bros, delivering 5 million units of tech enabled collectibles to collectors in over 60 countries in 2020 alone.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a diverse, inclusive work environment and encourage our employees to bring their true fun-loving and high-energy selves to the workplace. With big, vibrant dreams and a culture of high performance in our workplace, you will always be engaged, empowered and feel positively challenged.

At Mighty Jaxx, we always extend our full support to the team to help them reach their full potential personally and professionally. If you love keeping up with the latest trends across different sub-cultures, love technology and are ready to embrace your creativity, we love to have you join us in creating the most unique experiences, products and content for our collectors!

The Job

Mighty Jaxx is seeking a Meta Growth Manager with a can-do attitude, hands-on approach and a focus on exceeding expectations. The Meta Team at Mighty Jaxx is responsible for developing the best-in-class Web3 Platform for All Businesses. We are building a product that impacts brands and their customers at scale, crafting a strategy that places Mighty Jaxx Meta at the forefront of the Web3 Revolution. 

As Mighty Jaxx continues to evolve its strategy roadmap to encompass a broader Web3 mandate, you will have the opportunity to help grow the community around our foundational platform product that enables brands to provide elevated experiences for their fans.

The Meta Growth Manager will be reporting to the Meta Operations Team Lead within Meta Team.  

Responsibilities

The Meta Growth Manager serves a key function within the Mighty Meta Team and impacts the business on scaling our meta community.

Performance Marketing 

  • Lead the ideation, research, design, development and launch of Marketing Campaigns 
  • Create and maintain the marketing plan, ensuring continual improvement using hard data
  • Drive the marketing department’s commercial performance through systematic campaign-specific results and overall measurement. 
  • Works closely with the marketing and creative team in target-setting, as well as conducting advertisement experiments, computing and tracking user acquisition costs, optimizing per-channel conversion rates, and evaluating post-campaign results
  • Conduct market research, whitespace analysis and validation to identify marketing channels 

Collaboration

  • Work with creative team to align on communication of positioning and messaging to ensure differentiation from competitors
  • Maintaining good relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Project Management
  • Owning the delivery of various timelines, ensuring that key milestones are met and deliveries are of the highest quality
  • Proactively monitor and manage the progress of the deliverables, identify risks and eliminate the roadblocks

Requirements

  • Eagerness to learn, open-mindedness towards customers of all industries and sizes
  • 4+ years of product marketing experience in B2B, SaaS or platform products in a tech company
  • Undergraduate degree in business, marketing or other related fields
  • A desire to grow and engage communities
  • Strong analytical skills. Structure thoughts, identify and frame problems, and propose solutions with reasoned rationales.
  • An owner’s mindset - you embrace challenging problems. Can make decisions amidst ambiguity, achieving consensus amongst stakeholders.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills in English
  • Above all, love for the decentralized web

column2:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.","
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of more than $20 billion and approximately 75,000 employees globally. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, deliver medicines to market and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services – we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive services.
Position Summary:
  • The Installation Project Manager (IPM) is responsible for planning and execution of system installations of Electron
  • Microscopes in a region and supports the regional organization with his project management skills.
  • The IPM oversees all systems under install in a region and makes sure each has followed the steps of the installation process.
  • He/She takes ownership of the end-to-end order fulfillment from PO, until the customer sign-off and start of warranty.
  • On occasion also customer interaction is part of the (bigger) projects.
  • For the execution he/she is supported by the Regional Service team who provide the resources for the projects. Also 3rd party items are under control of the overall planning and execution.
  • The IPM is responsible for the financial DIR targets as well as the Installation related KPI’s. Also acts as main contact person (spider in the web) for the region and go to person for all installation related items.
  • The IPM reports to the Global Manager Installations and has a dotted line to the regional Field Service director in his region, actively working with the Field Service Managers/Supervisors
Key Responsibilities:
Together with the regional executers he/she makes sure every project follows the steps of the Installation Process and ensures all steps are done. This consist of:
  • Setting and maintaining the installation plan per project including status updates
  • Interaction with all involved parties in installation
  • Site readiness
  • Creates clear understanding in expectations with customers. (Start with the end in sight)
  • Config Check’s (incl NSR’s) and align these with needed resources.
  • TDA’s Management
  • Triggers Region on training skills for FSE’s on upcoming projects
Installation Margin P&L
  • Secures the service installation margin by controlling costs per project
  • Escalates projects on Margin loss
DIR management per Quarter
  • Setting Forecast and manages to achieve this
  • Supports escalation on technical issues
  • Escalates commercial mismatches to Sales and BU’s timely
Controls the I&W KPI’s with a region
  • Escalated and drives RCCM’s
  • Feedback to CIP teams on needed improvements
  • Customer Allegiance Score responsible for installations
Requirements/Experience:
  • The ideal candidate has a technical bachelor’s degree with +/- 5 years’ experience in the high-tech industry and preferably the service business.
  • Proven experience and background in Project management preferably with courses/degree in project management. (IPMA, etc)
  • Excellent written en verbal skills in English, other languages are a plus. (for APJ Mandarin is preferred)
  • Ability to effectively communicate with and managing the deliverables cross functional and cross-cultural teams, with customers and/or other involved parties in a project.
  • Builds trust and encourages respect to internal teams as well as customers.
  • Possess problem solving skills. Can influence others and negotiates to solutions.
  • Quick learner in understanding business processes and in the customers business. Flexible attitude, always ready to jump into operational issues which pop -up and needs solutions.
  • Highly motivated and driven to achieve goals, does not take “no” as an answer.
  • Looks critical to processes and can improve these.
  • Computer skills CRM, MS Projects MS Office
  • Travel on occasion to customers and internal TFS offices. (10-15%)

PolicyPal Singapore Pte Ltd
About the Company
  • PolicyPal Tech Pte. Ltd. is one of the leading InsurTech companies in Singapore that believes in bringing tech and insurance together for families and communities to enhance their insurance experience. We also believe in helping the community attain relevant knowledge on financial planning through gamification, and offering in-app credits incentives that can be used to help them get covered. PolicyPal Tech Pte. Ltd. has also built a policy management platform that helps users easily keep track of all their insurance policies on one app. Since 2016, it has helped over 100,000 users manage their policies.
  • Under PolicyPal Group, Baoxianbaobao Pte. Ltd. (also branded as ‘PolicyPalFA’,)  is wholly owned by PolicyPal Pte. Ltd., is an insurance broker and exempt financial adviser licensed and regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
About the role
  • We are looking for a Business Development Intern for PolicyPal. Reporting directly to our Partnerships Manager, your core responsibilities will be to support the business development projects for PolicyPal Group. You will also support multi-channel marketing activities, in particular, to raise awareness and drive sign-ups.
  • Our ideal candidate is someone who is proactive, organized and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a timely manner. You are also independent but also able to collaborate in a team environment. If you always wanted to know what it’s like to work in a fast-paced start-up environment, this role is for you! Apply today.
Responsibilities:
  • Support in planning, executing, and pivoting growth experiments with new business models in a start-up environment.
  • Hands-on experience in experimentation of new business models
  • Promoting sign-ups through professional communications with individuals/corporations through various channels, including phone, email, chat and text
  • Collaborate cross-functionally (strategy, marketing, operations) to ensure smooth business operations

Requirements:
  • A committed team player, responsible and able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Good interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Sales experience in any industry is not a mandatory requirement, but a plus

Salary Range:$800-$1,000

column1:
","
SVP / VP, Access Management and Automation, Tech Services, Technology and Operations - (WD29027)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.The suitable candidate will lead and manage a team of engineers and operations specialists in the support of DBS' enterprise identity and access provisioning infrastructure and operations. He/She will be responsible for the end-to-end strategizing, planning, deployment, operations and development of the bank's access provisioning framework, infrastructure, processes, and integration with other systems. This individual will manage a team in support of the administration and support of the systems.
Key Responsibilities
  • Provides vision for identity and access provisioning services, enables innovation, and aligns with industry trends and continuous improvements that enhances the security posture of the bank with regards to identity and access management. 
  • Responsible for budgeting, project management, deployment and operations support of new initiatives. 
  • Drive the automation and integration of access provisioning infrastructure to other systems to achieve straight through processing and reduce manual work.
  • Responsible for the day-to-day support, monitoring, upgrades, patching, configuration and management of the infrastructure. 
  • Provide on-going operations support including management reporting and operations dashboards relating to the governance oversight of privileged accounts and passwords.
  • Identify automation opportunities, drive operational efficiencies and convert such opportunities to initiatives to their implementation.
  • Responsible for overseeing and managing robotic process automation (RPA) initiative for access provisioning.
Requirements
The ideal candidate must be 'hands-on', well organised, risk and compliance focused, and self-driven as this is a fast-paced and highly technical environment. Someone wanting to learn and grow with an organisation will thrive in this role. The role requires excellent prioritisation, responsiveness, along with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Requires 10 or more years of related technical experience in OneIdentity Identity Manager or other similar identity and access provisioning systems, including deployment, configuration, management and support infrastructure components.  
  • Experience in .NET language and customization of scripts and code.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise identity and access management, risk management, compliance, governance and control. 
  • Strong understanding of key platform OS/databases e.g. Windows, Unix, MSSQL, MariaDB. Prior experience in administering such key platforms is preferred. 
  • Prior experience in managing and demonstrated ability to handle all audit matters relating to access management, including internal/external audit and regulators across the region.
  • Knowledge of program and project management methodologies and tools; track record of success in managing IT projects; effective problem-solving abilities; motivated to develop creative solutions to common processes or problems.
  • Able to present complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
  • Prior experience in developing project plans, resource requirements and project cost estimates; ability to deliver projects within budget. 
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and supervising staff including hiring, performance management, development and counselling. 
  • Experience in working in banking environment is preferred.
  • Possess the verbal and written communication skills to work effectively with technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organisation.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Engineering (or similar) OR combination of relevant professional experience and education.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
