column1:
","

Pfizer Singapore recruit permanent employees for manufacturing site expansion of PFIZER ASIA MANUFACTURING PTE LTD (PAMPL) in Singapore.

POSITION SUMMARY

  • Will be responsible for leading product manufacturing campaigns from the start of production, and providing technical supervisor with respect to quality and EHS until completion and release of the material.
  • Contribute to achieve our vision of being the best in class manufacturing site, production highest quality products in the safest way.
  • Deploy and use the IMEx “way of working” for day to day operations, problem solving, escalations and continuous improvements.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop Manufacturing/Operating Instructions and Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Develop, maintain and troubleshoot the process control system recipes/models.
  • Investigate, report and troubleshoot findings on both quality and EHS related issues observed during manufacturing or during batch record review.
  • Develop, implement and monitor robust preventive measures for processing issues.
  • Play a pro-active role in ensuring the site safety and quality standards are adhered to.
  • Proactively monitor, identify, develop and implement improvements in processes and equipment.
  • Communicate on a regular basis to the plant personnel on process updates.
  • Train the process technicians on the process and procedures as required.
  • Ensure adherence to approved procedures and update the procedures as required, including the principles and practices of good data management (ALCOA).
  • Focus on safety and GMP compliance as operational priorities and as performance measures.
  • Accountable for the Good Data Management and Date Integrity understanding and performance.
  • Report and investigate actions or behaviors that may negatively impact the desired outcome of the GMP process or activity.
  • Own one or more multiple equipment/GMP systems in production and present the system overview with evidence compliance to internal and external auditors
  • Develop courses of action and drive implementation of solutions.
  • Play an active and impactful role to deliver flawless execution for respective PCTs (e.g API, MS, QO, Leadership, Engineering) by updating performance against metrics, highlighting & resolving issues with appropriate escalations.
  • Work with the PCT to identify and drive improvement as per continuous improvement (CI) goals of the PCT.
  • Upload Pfizer’s code of conduct and values.
  • Perform coaching role to junior engineers and manage more complex manufacturing and operation issues. He/She is also expected to lead working teams managing projects to support manufacturing processes.

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive flawless execution. Internal Stakeholder includes:

  • Operation – for supporting operation team to meet production targets in cycle time and output.
  • Supply Chain – for ensuring availability of raw materials for production and supply of finished products to the market
  • Quality – for production batch release, production investigation/improvement
  • Engineering – for equipment readiness and production investigation/improvement
  • EHS – for performing safety review of changes in the manufacturing processes and in safety related investigation
  • Technical Services – for product chemistry, process design understanding, production investigation / improvement and product transfer

External Stakeholders:

  • Equipment Vendors and raw material suppliers – for new materials/equipment/consumables sourcing and during process investigation/improvement

Supervision

The position does not have any direct reports. However, is required to provide coaching and mentorship to junior engineers whenever required.

EDUCATION

Degree in Engineering, preferably in Chemical Engineering or Degree in Science with major in Chemistry.

EXPERIENCE 

  • 5-6 years experience in a relevant manufacturing environment.

Core Competencies: Technical Knowledge, Communication, Teamwork, Leadership, Project Management, Curiosity & Innovation, Self-motivated and independent.

Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","

  • Assist PIs with compliance matters such as insurance, sponsorship, regulatory matters, clinical trial certificate applications, ethical issues and legal liabilities
  • Negotiate terms as well as execute agreements for strategic partneships, including research collaboration and clinical trials, in consultation with legal office

BluOcean Security is a premium security service provider in Asia Pacific for organizations that are serious about security. 

When it comes to choosing the right security partner in Asia, companies count on BluOcean Security for quality services and better results. We offer a wide selection of security services to businesses, located in Singapore, China, and India.

Here at BluOcean Security, it’s all about the people. We have an amazing and dedicated team. You will be working with the best people in the industry. You will have a chance to participate in the growth of the best security service provider in Asia. We are serious and proud of what we do and hope to attract like minded professionals.

","

Security System Engineer                           

Work location: Singapore

General Description: 

As a System Engineer you will lead or provide services to our customers in the region. This may include security equipment installation, testing, commissioning, system programming, coordinating with other parties, and working with other team members to achieve objectives. You will ensure customers have the best possible experience and have the highest quality of services.

344,tech project manager,/en/job/sales-operations-manager-apac-9430822,9430822,"Sales Operations Manager, APAC",False,False,,,SGD,Sabre Asia Pacific Pte Ltd,6 hours ago,False,,,Sabre,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>

column2: Sabre is a technology solutions provider to the global travel and tourism industry. It offers a broad range of technology solutions including data-driven business intelligence, mobile, distribution and Software-as-a-Service solutions which are used by travel suppliers (airlines, hotels, car rental outlets, railways, cruise lines and tour operators) and travel buyers (travel agencies, travel management companies and corporate travel departments) to plan, market, sell, serve and operate their business.

column1: <div>

column2: In 2013, Sabre’s technology processed over $100 billion of estimated travel spending and more than 1.1 trillion system messages. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre employs approximately 10,000 people in approximately 60 countries around the world. We serve our customers through cutting-edge technology developed in six facilities located across four continents.

column1: <div>

column2:
The company operates three brands/businesses: Sabre Airline Solutions, Sabre Hospitality Solutions, and Sabre Travel Network.","

Sabre Corporation is a leading technology provider to the global travel and tourism industry. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre operates offices in approximately 60 countries around the world. At Sabre, we make travel happen. Positioned at the center of the business of travel, our platform connects people with experiences that matter in their lives. Today, Sabre is creating a new marketplace for personalized travel. It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs or our airline, hotel and travel agency customers. Join our journey! 

Sales Operations Manager, APAC

About Our Team

Sabre's Travel Network is seeking an experienced Sales Support Manager to lead the Sales Support & Operations function, playing an instrumental supporting role success of our sales teams and wider APAC region.

About the Role

As a Sales Support Manager you will:

  • Track and report on APAC sales performance against targets, summarising insights on sales pipelines, sales performance, etc. to make operational recommendations.
  • Prepare and/or consolidate sales management presentations, status reports, etc. to communicate financial, sales, and operational performance to Travel Network executive leadership, APAC sales leadership, the APAC sales organisation and other internal stakeholders.
  • Lead regional and some global projects and initiatives, including representing Sales Support & Operations in APAC leadership meetings to report on any goals, achievements and/or initiatives in progress.
  • Closely partner with the APAC Sales VP and other members of the sales leadership team to perform daily, weekly, monthly and annual processes required to direct, manage, and monitor the APAC sales organization of Sabre Travel Network.
  • Collaborate regionally and globally to develop or enhance standardised process, reports and sales programmes that facilitate efficient sales operations, effective sales execution and improved management insight. 
  • Lead standardised sales management processes, including sales planning, budgeting, territory design, quota allocation, pipeline management, sales forecasting, and deal review. Ensure wider sales org is informed of these standardised sales processes, requiring sales team coaching as needed.
  • Coordinate, manage and/or execute short and long-term initiatives in support of APAC sales goals, sales effectiveness, operational efficiency and global consistency.
  • Lead the direction for Sales Incentive Plan (SIP) quota setting within the APAC region.
  • Act as a subject matter expert and evangelist in the use of sales tools and systems, explore and define business requirements for any new or enhancements to currrent sales tools or systems.
  • Perform standard analysis using sales reports and basic ad hoc analysis.
  • Recruit, train and mentor a high-performing Sales Support & Operations team.

Role Requirements

  • 5-7 years of sales operations or sales support experience within a global B2B organisation, at least 3 of which have been team leadership capacity.
  • Exposure to the travel tech industry, or software/SaaS industries, is highly preferred.
  • Advanced technical skills in Salesforce, Excel and Powerpoint with proficient knowledge of Qlikview, Tableau, Einstein Analytics or a similar BI tool.
  • Deep knowledge and experience with best practices for sales operations process and sales effectiveness metrics. 
  • Strong relationship-building and influencing skills across all levels of the business - from sales team members to VPs, Directors and Country Leaders. 
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability interpret and explain data-driven insights to a wide audience.
  • Excellent written/verbal communication and presentation skills - must be able ability to ""tell a story"" and obtain buy-in.
  • Proven ability to quickly and consistently execute standardised processes and enable others to do so as well. Successful track record of ensuring process compliance and driving improvements to standardised processes.
  • Excellent organisational and project management skills with the ability to coordinate and execute multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strategic thinker with a strong commercial acumen displaying the highest ethical standards and impeccable character 
  • Self-directed with a start-up mentality. Resourceful, innovative, and adaptable. Comfortable in a rapidly evolving environment, and skilled in change management. 
  • Flexibility to work outside of standard APAC office hours as needed.

345,tech project manager,/en/job/product-manager-livestream-trust-safety-9427768,9427768,"Product Manager, Livestream, Trust & Safety",False,False,,,SGD,TikTok,30-Mar-22,False,,,201719908M,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

","

Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy; building a world where people can safely discover, create and connect. The Trust & Safety team at TikTok helps ensure that our global community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications.

As a product manager on our Trust & Safety team, you will work with teams of engineers, data scientists, operations, product policies and various relevant internal teams to build safety product features and strategies. You will be working on in-app safety features, technical strategies to improve our trust and safety processes, as well as methods to detect and address the risky behaviors and actors in the community. You will also work on project management to deliver major Trust and Safety product changes. Post-pandemic, travel between our global offices is expected.

Responsibilities

  • Identify risks and leverage in-app product solution or back-end processes to effectively address the risks, work with the engineering team to implement the product solutions
  • Define safety product roadmap, set metrics that inform the success of safety efforts, and drive cross-functional efforts to achieve success
  • Develop expertise in one of the product domains, e.g. safety of content, interaction integrity, integrity of account etc.
  • Develop a robust workflow for cross-team collaboration, manage large-scale product improvement projects to improve community safety

Qualifications

What should I bring with me?

  • 3+ years in product management, 1+ years in Trust and Safety
  • Ability to design product solutions based on evidence; proven track record of pushing ambitious product, and/or organizational or process changes
  • Good cross-functional project management skills, good communication skills; a passion to unite people behind a common goal
  • Experience in working with international partners across different time zones and cultures

Even better if:

  • Experienced in product manager team management.
  • Understanding of the landscape and new policy developments in new media, tech, and the entertainment industry
  • Technical skills in data-analysis (SQL, Python)
  • Experience working on live-streaming safety issues is a plus

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our recruitment process.

column3: The Adecco Group is the world’s leading HR solutions partner. We provide more than 700,000 people with permanent and flexible employment every day. With more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries, we transform the world of work one job at a time.

Adecco is Singapore’s leading HR solutions partner. For more than 34 years, Adecco provides a comprehensive array of HR solutions and consulting services which includes mid to staff level talent acquisition, contract recruitment, outsourcing, field sales and marketing as well as payroll services. Our teams are specialized in accounting & finance, administration, banking, engineering, healthcare & life sciences, human resources, IT&T, retail & events, sales & marketing, supply chain & logistics and other corporate functions.
Speak with an Adecco consultant to find out how we may be able to help you in your career and life goals.

column1:
","

The Opportunity:

  • This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the leading banks in Asia. It is an opportunity for an experienced Project Manager to join their team in this job opportunity
  • Full-time Permanent role
  • Office Location: Central
  • Great benefits

The company is a leading multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and mobile payments platform. It is a fast-growing company that is a market-leader across its region and exponentially gained international recognition in the Tech industry.

Talent:

  • Bachelor's degree in Banking & Finance, Computer Science or related field
  • Post graduate qualifications are desirable
  • Minimally 6-9 years' experience within financial services as a business analyst, project manager or product owner. Relevant experience in Private Banking / Wealth Management Operations desired but not necessary
  • A self-starter with a 'can do' attitude and delivery focused with attention to details
  • Possesses strong communication, influencing and presentation skills
  • Thrives in a fast paced & demanding environment, adaptive & resilient, one who enjoys working with diverse cultures
  • A team player who works well with technical and business stakeholders (Front Office, Legal, Compliance, Risk, Finance)
  • Exposure/experience with lean/continuous improvement, data analytics/visualisation, new/emerging technologies will be useful
  • Knowledge of Temenos T24, TAP and other common private banking systems including relevant rules and regulations relating to private banking is an advantage

Responsibilities:

  • Leading or providing support to product owner / project manager - manage, plan, organise, track, report, complete artefacts, test management, preparation of training plans / materials, user manual, rollout execution
  • Performing/supporting process reviews, process change and transformation agenda
  • Liaising and coordinating between subject matter experts, product owner / project manager and technology teams to ensure that business requirements are clearly articulated, documented, clarified and delivered. Syndicating signoffs and obtaining approvals s required
  • Translating business requirements to user stories, facilitate and participate in workshops, agile sessions, requirement refinement and backlog prioritisation
  • Managing / participating in user acceptance testing & regression testing - test management, review/approve test artefacts (test strategy, approach, plan, scenarios, cases and data) and test execution
  • Working with the testing teams to build, review and approve test cases / test automation. Ensuring alignment to the user stories / requirements as well as all necessary release regression tests
  • Coordinating prioritization of business requirements throughout the solution development lifecycle
  • Providing business analysis and business-related issue resolution to all cross-functional teams throughout the product development lifecycle
  • Promoting and developing sound change management practices
  • Maintain a working knowledge of business processes and solution design. Perform gap analysis where business requirements are not met

Next Steps

  • Prepare your updated resume (please include your current salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, annual wage supplement, etc.) and expected package to sarah.ng@adecco.com
  • Email Topic: Apply Project Manager -Ops Transformation (Banking |Permanent)
  • We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Sarah Ng Mei Wern

EA License No: 91C2918

Personnel Registration Number: R1983856

column1: 350,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-manager-manager-career-conversion-programmes-scale-executive-professional-development-9370145,9370145,"Senior Manager/Manager (Career Conversion Programmes), SCALE (Executive & Professional Development)",False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,11-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description


The School of Continuing and Lifelong Education (SCALE) was established to drive the expansion of NUS' lifelong learning offerings in a concerted and strategic way that furthers our mission to be a leading global university, as well as fulfil our role as a public university of Singapore, shaping the future.

Through SCALE, working adults (i.e. professionals, managers and executives) who aspire to stay relevant and ahead of competition, companies looking to up-skill/re-skill their workforce, and even youths exploring quality tertiary education options, have access to NUS' suite of innovative, world-class continuing and lifelong education offerings.

Drawing on unparalleled access to the multi-disciplinary expertise of 16 other NUS Faculties/Schools, SCALE offers youth, executive and professional development/education programmes, part-time and full-time degree programmes, as well as modular courses that may be taken singly or stacked towards certificates/diplomas/degrees that meet the lifelong learning needs of individuals.  All programmes are designed and developed in consultation with the industry to ensure relevance and currency.

About the Role

To augment our manpower resources in the School, we are looking for a suitably qualified candidate to join our Executive & Professional Development (EPD) Unit. 

The incumbent shall be an integral member of the Career Conversion Programmes team to foster the growth of NUS' Continuing Education & Training (CET) markets and consultancy capabilities. The primary focus of the role is to work with government agencies and industry partners to facilitate skills upgrading of disadvantaged or unemployed Professionals, Managers, Executives and Technicians (PMETs), to prepare them for re-employment in growing industry sectors.

This role is offered on a 3-year renewable contract basis; renewal is subject to satisfactory job performance.

Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to incumbent's performance and the University/School's prevailing remuneration policies.

The incumbent will be emplaced at an appropriate appointment grade based on his/her individual merits.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Define long-term organisational strategic goals, build key client and partnership relationships, identify employment opportunities for clients, negotiate and close partnership deals, and keep abreast of current market conditions.
  • Conceptualise, develop and manage Career Conversion Programmes (CCP) or similar type of initiatives, including project strategy design, stakeholders' management, programme structures/systems development and project operations.
  • Collaborate with the various NUS academic units in developing CCP courses, seek government funding support and engage in employer outreach activities, based on strategic priorities.
  • Strategize and drive implementation of plans for re-employment of clients into growing industries.  Pursue job placement targets and ensure rapid, sustainable growth in all identified industry segments.
  • Screen potential partnership deals by analysing market strategies, deal requirements and financials; evaluating options; resolving internal priorities.
  • Collaborate with relevant partners and government agencies to actively promote career opportunities and help PMETs in identifying personal goals, re-skilling and career planning.
  • Develop and manage financial budgets and recommend deal approval for training/consultancy opportunities for NUS CCP or related courses.
  • Manage strategic and operational client and partner relationship activities involving key employers, industry associations, government agencies, as well as NUS Faculties/Schools.
  • Form strategic alliances with other organisations to leverage on their existing networks.
  • Work with the Marketing team to create marketing materials and tools to support new CCP or related courses.
  • Work with internal stakeholders, trainers and curriculum developers in structuring and implementing training proposals for PCP or related courses.
  • Grow a strong network of key employers and industry partners both domestically and overseas.
Qualifications

Academic & Professional Certification

  • At least a good bachelor's degree from a reputable university in any discipline
  • IT savvy and proficient in MS Office applications

Experience & Attributes

  • At least 8 years of relevant experience in business development/sales in Institutes of Higher Learning and/or the Continuing Education & Training (CET) sector
  • Experience in coaching and assisting unemployed/disadvantaged PMETS or PMETs-at-risk (or clients) to look for jobs that commensurate with their qualifications, work experience and skills
  • Strong track record in business development
  • Strong project planning and organisational skills
  • Good working knowledge of financial reporting and accounting
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication (oral & written) and presentation skills; flexible in adapting public speaking/presentation styles to audience of diverse background and culture

column3: Ninja Van is an express logistics business created to take the hassle out of the parcel delivery process for online shoppers and catering to the logistics needs of Southeast Asia’s thriving e-commerce sector.
Driven by a desire to revolutionise the logistics industry, Ninja Van’s three co-founders - Lai Chang Wen, Shaun Chong, Tan Boxian - set up the company in 2014.

Encouraged by the success of the business in Singapore, Ninja Van subsequently expanded their operations in other parts of Southeast Asia and now has a presence in six of Southeast Asia’s key markets: Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines.

column1:
","

The Regional Technical Project Specialist sits within the Commercial team of Ninja Van’s Cross Border business. The Cross Border business creates and operates logistics products for all customers requiring cross-border services, focusing on Southeast Asia and China. 

The incumbent will be the subject matter expert within Cross Border for the technical onboarding (API integrations) and other 4PL tech products to enable customers to create robust orders and receive tracking updates. He/she needs to supplement this technical knowledge with cross-border operations know-how to advise customers or sales teams on the best end-to-end digital solution.

Responsibilites
  • Enabling Customer Success / Sales teams to advise customers on standardised API solutions by building resources and training them
  • Solutioning and troubleshooting Customer Success / Sales teams during the integration stage as well as after commencement if there are any integration issues
  • Coordinating requirements between customers’ tech teams and NV’s tech teams on customised solutions
  • Working with internal tech teams to improve the overall effectiveness and shipper experience of standardised solutions
  • Project managing the communication and adoption of new tech builds relevant to the portfolio (4PL)
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering backgrounds preferred) with 3-5 years of relevant work experience
  • Possess technical knowledge and understanding of APIs
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to face customers and internal stakeholders from multiple countries
  • Proven project management abilities
  • Willingness to take ownership of issues, including problem-solving and diving deep into the technical detail
  • Ability to manage a busy workload and balance multiple priorities
  • A positive, flexible solutions and ideas-focused approach
  • Attentive to detail 
  • Fluent in Mandarin and English

column3: APBA TG Human Resource Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of the TG Group)

TG Group (“TG”) is a global workforce solutions provider with an international reach in over 50 markets across the globe. Headquartered in Singapore with Shanghai Foreign Service (Group) Co Ltd (""FSG"") as a strategic shareholder, TG delivers a comprehensive suite of innovative human capital solutions to help our clients achieve greater business success.

TG adopts a future-centric approach where we aspire to be at the forefront of the evolution of the future of work. We believe that human capital is the greatest asset to any institution. With a wealth of experience in the Human Resources (HR) industry, we combine our international expertise and local know-how to deliver bespoke and innovative workforce solutions.

Our diverse portfolio of client-centric workforce solutions includes Contingent Workforce Management (CWM), Business Process Outsourcing (BPO), Permanent Placements, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO), Professional Employer Organisation (PEO), and Payroll Process Outsourcing (PPO).
We deliver workforce solutions in over 50 countries.

Vanguard International Semiconductor Corporation (VIS) is a leading specialty IC foundry service provider. Since its inception in 1994 in Hsinchu Science Park, Taiwan, VIS has been achieving continuous success in its technology development and production efficiency improvement. VIS has also been consistently offering its customers cost-effective solutions and high valued-added services. VIS has five 8-inch fabs in Taiwan and Singapore with a monthly capacity of approximately 241,000 wafers in 2021.

VIS has a total of 6,000 employees. We are committed to adhering to our customers-oriented business philosophy to provide customers continuously improved and enhanced specialty IC foundry services. To better serve our worldwide customers, VIS has established sales offices in Taiwan and sales representatives in main IC clusters around the world.

column3: The Adecco Group is the world’s leading HR solutions partner. We provide more than 700,000 people with permanent and flexible employment every day. With more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries, we transform the world of work one job at a time.

355,tech project manager,/en/job/talent-acquisition-data-tech-9353197,9353197,Talent Acquisition (Data & Tech),False,False,3500,5000,SGD,Carro Singapore,21-Mar-22,False,,1 day,201525411C,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:center"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

Carro is an automotive marketplace that offers a full-stack service for all aspects of car ownership. By offering a trustworthy and transparent experience, Carro challenges the traditional way of buying and selling cars through a proprietary pricing algorithm.

Besides selling cars, Carro provides services that offer a car owner everything they need throughout their car ownership journey. In 2019, Carro introduced the First Car Subscription Service in Singapore. The new service aims to provide Singaporeans with a commitment-free car ownership experience, unlike the traditional.

Carro’s technology-driven services leverage innovation and technology to provide consumers with a seamless experience. These include an in-house financing solution through its sister company Genie Financial Services and a suite of after-sales services such as an in-house car care workshop and Singapore’s first on-demand roadside recovery platform. In 2020, Carro redefined the car buying experience with Singapore’s first contactless service, providing consumers with added assurance through a 3-day return policy and 30-day wear and tear guarantee.
Best Funded Automotive Marketplace

Founded in 2015, Carro is Southeast Asia’s largest automotive marketplace, with the company having expanded to Thailand and Indonesia in 2017. Carro’s expansion coincides with exponential year-on-year growth, recording over US$100 million worth of transactions in 2016, with figures doubling to over US$250 million in 2017 and again doubling to US$500 million in 2018. In 2020, the total transactions stand at over US$1 billion.

In August 2019, Carro closed their Series B funding round at US$90 million. The round was supported by notable names such as SoftBank Ventures Asia, EDBI Pte Ltd, Insignia Ventures Partners, B Capital Group and many more. Overall, Carro has raised US$105 million since its inception. The funding has allowed the company to expand its presence across Southeast Asia and improve existing services in its automotive ecosystem.

","

People are the epicentre and the driving force behind all the milestones of Carro. We’re looking for a driven individual who will champion our campus outreach initiatives and work together with the stakeholders to build and develop our unique employer branding. You will support the efforts to identify, nurture and hire the next generation of highly-sought talents such as Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, Product Managers, Software Engineers and many more. If you have a strong passion for engaging people, managing events and working on building a culture, we’d like to hear from you.

Requirements

What you will be doing:

  • Scale and grow tech team Carro’s team in Singapore
  • Manage full recruitment life cycle from initial requirements gathering, sourcing, attraction, assessment to interview and offer management to onboarding.
  • Proactive sourcing and screening of quality candidates through various channels (job portals, networking events, referrals etc.
  • Build long-term relationships with great talents and provide excellent candidate experience through a seamless end-to-end process.
  • Work closely with the hiring teams to hire great talents that aligns with the business needs
  • Support ad-hoc cross team tasks

What you will need:

  • At least 2 years of work experience in Tech recruitment or Human Resources related employment preferred.
  • Self-driven with strong co-ordinations abilities and able to work cross functionally.
  • Project-management experience and skills
  • Affinity to creative problem solving, out-of-the-box thinking, and grit to find solutions.
  • Passionate about engaging with people, managing events and project management.

column7: M1, a subsidiary of Keppel Corporation, is Singapore’s first digital network operator, providing a suite of communications services, including mobile, fixed line and fibre offerings, to over two million customers. Since the launch of commercial services in 1997, we have achieved many firsts – becoming one of the first operators to be awarded one of Singapore’s two nationwide 5G standalone network license, first operator to offer nationwide 4G service, as well as ultra high-speed fixed broadband, fixed voice and other services on the Next Generation Nationwide Broadband Network (NGNBN).

We offer a wide range of mobile and fixed communication services to our consumers, and deliver an extensive suite of services and solutions to our corporate customers which includes symmetrical connectivity solutions of up to 10Gbps, managed services, cloud solutions, cybersecurity solutions, Internet of Things and data centre services.

We collaborate closely with our shareholders Keppel Corporation and Singapore Press Holdings Limited to achieve operational synergies that strengthen our position as an established communications provider in the market.
Our mission is to drive transformation and evolution in Singapore’s telecommunications landscape through cutting-edge technology and made-to-measure offerings.

column1:
","
Job Responsibilities/Requirements:

The Head of MarTech transformation plays a Product Owner role leading the development of marketing tools and market enablement technology for the consumer business in M1.
They explore, assess, and lead the development of these enablers required to enhance our marketing thrust and propose as well as take ownership of projects to develop suitable tools in partnership with chosen development teams.
They are therefore responsible for enabling better reach, conversion, offer management and lifecycle enablement for the growth, enhancement, retention and expansion of the consumer base.
To this end, they will also manage development through agile sprints and work in collaboration with the Retention, Acquisition, Revenue and Segments, Marcoms, other Marketing Product Owners, whose needs they will represent.
In addition, they will also collaborate outside the department with Digital Office, Software Engineering, UI/UX Product Owners, Customer Service and external development PO’s to bring the vision to fruition.
KPIs
  • Incremental revenue achievement through better access to customers;
  • Higher CLTV across segments and customer cohorts;
  • Higher reach and conversion;
  • Lower Cost to Serve and CPA; and
  • New revenue enabled - % contribution of new revenue to total revenue.
Job Responsibilities
  • To continuously evaluate the marketing processes for opportunity to enhance through better tech;
  • To manage the current initiatives and ongoing development for enhancing the marketing;
  • To compile requirements for the consumer marketing team to map a MarTech roadmap for the future;
  • To enable training of marketing teams on new tools, ensuring self-serve;
  • Work with our external development partners to deliver the development roadmap as per schedule; and
  • Create an aligned roadmap with the Marketing and Digital Office teams to deliver the marketing requirement.
Experience and Skills Required
  • At least 8 years’ experience in marketing, product management or ops management;
  • Must have some exposure to marketing technology systems especially in customer management;
  • Formal or informal experience in project management will be preferred;
  • Exposure to Salesforce/Marketing Cloud will be an asset;
  • Detail oriented and analytical, must have familiarity with revenue metrics and ability to report and interact with management;
  • Must be able to communicate well across support and matrix teams; and
  • Collaborative nature and willing to work across teams to achieve goals.

column2:
Dynamite Games is an indie game studio specialising in mobile game development on Unity and Html5. In less than 2 years, we have grown from 11 members to 100+ and shipped more than 2 dozen games growing our daily active player base by the thousands every month. We also build other creative products that compliment our business model and aspire to drive it to the next level. With such a trajectory, we have every intention to keep the momentum going for the good work done by the talented and enthusiastic game lovers in the studio.We have Dynamite Games makers in Singapore(HQ), Malaysia, Vietnam and Taiwan. We have battle-tested entrepreneurs and leaders leading each functional department from developing games to marketing and operationalising them. We look forward to bolstering our engineering capabilities with this listing.","

Responsibilities:

· Does extensive market research and dissection of game products and potential game mechanics.

· Working alongside other game designers to assist in the creative processes of game ideas and problem-solving.

· Design fair and balanced math models, systems/content based on the overall game creative direction to meet the KPI requirements;

· Create effective documentation for all systems designed in a clear manner & make it understandable for the entire development team;

· Maintain a data-driven design methodology for systems/content design through careful analysis of user feedback and key metrics to adjust gameplay and balance;

· Collaborate effectively with other departments of the development team (Tech, Art, QA, Product, etc) to create the best product possible;

Requirements:

· Degree in Game Design, Computer Science or any relevant field.

· 1-2 year(s) working experience or have shipped at least 1-2 game(s) as a designer or relevant fields.

· A proactive team player who can communicate clearly and constructively.

· Capable of working in a dynamic environment with shifting priorities.

· Knowledgeable in math concepts such as Probability and Statistics.

· High level of competency in Microsoft Office / Google Workspace software tools, especially Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets;

· Ability to create detailed and effective documentation as well as basic mock-ups based on UX design theories;

· Comprehensive knowledge and a deep passion for games across multiple genres of PC/mobile games and relevant game design theories;

Bonus Points:

· Experience working with game engines such as Cocos Creator and Unity;

· Experience working with agile production methodologies and relevant project management tools such as JIRA;

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

Responsibilities
  • Establish project goals/charter and delivery plans to implement IT infrastructure systems in engaging with business users and tech teams (e.g. IT operation team, IT security team, IT vendors).
  • Review business requirements and IT solutions & design to meet the scope of work and develop a detailed project plan.
  • Manage IT infrastructure implementation projects with regard to scope, schedule, budget, resources, quality, procurement, risk and change management with proper project management methodrogies.
  • As RHQ, play an active supporting role to other Asean region branches’ IT infrastructure system implementation projects.
  • Understand the bank’s IT infrastructure vision, strategies, existing system environments, operations and security rules.
  • Understand the stakeholders’ roles & responsibilities in the bank and close communicate with them.
  • Coordinate WBS with the stakeholders covering overall scope engaging with tech teams as well as business users to ensure all stakeholder's timely resource management.
  • Manage project activities to ensure timely delivery, including identification of critical path, monitoring and driving completion of interdependent activities and adjustment to project schedules to achieve overall completion deadline.
  • Ensure the regular project governance has been in place and following up closely with all project change requests via a proper change management process. Document and track closely on the project scope, changes, issues and risks as project management life cycle.
  • Coordinating project documentations (e.g. system design, test results) as required to ensure successful project completion.
  • Manage Stakeholder’s expectations by reporting all project status and progress regularly and consistently.
  • Conduct post-project assessment as part of the lesson learnt for continuous improvement for future projects.
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field or Diploma plus relevant 9-10 years’  project management experience;
  • 10+ years of Information Technology experience;
  • 7+ years of project management experience;
  • Experience in infra and middleware projects , 50% infra & 50% app
  • Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) project delivery experience with Agile and/or Waterfall methodologies that include requirements, analysis, design, development, testing, implementation
  • Windows / UNIX / Linux Knowledge in Messaging Technologies (MQ)( a kind of API) and Websphere knowledge is a plu

360,tech project manager,/en/job/maintenance-supervisor-elevators-escalators-9355589,9355589,Maintenance Supervisor (Elevators & Escalators),False,False,,,SGD,KONE Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,,197801381N,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

At KONE, our mission is to improve the flow of urban life. As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, KONE provides elevators, escalators and automatic building doors, as well as solutions for maintenance and modernization, which add value to the life cycle of any building.

Through more effective People Flow®, we make people’s journeys safe, convenient and reliable, in taller, smarter buildings. Together with our partners and customers around the world, we help cities to become better places to live in.
KONE has consistently been featured on Forbes list of World's Best Innovative Companies, World's Best Employers & World's Largest Public Companies.
It's time to make a move. Join our flow.

","

Did you know KONE moves over one billion people every day? We employ over 60,000 driven professionals in over 60 countries worldwide joined together by a shared vision. As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, it is our mission to improve the flow of urban life.

Why this role?

KONE Singapore is embarking upon an exciting growth phase and as such we are seeking a Maintenance Supervisor to join our team in Singapore.

You will be responsible for all the customer, operational and financial KPIs linked to the role and to ensure that targets are achieved or exceeded.

What will you be doing?

  • Lead the operational service delivery team
  • Ensure delivery to customers in a safe & timely manner at a high standard of quality
  • Establish & maintain good relationships with customers through regular interaction with them
  • Coach, lead & motivate Maintenance Technicians to continuously improve field performance.
  • Manage maintenance operations & variable costs according to targets
  • Ensure that repair & call-out sales targets are achieved

Are you the one?

  • Minimum Diploma in Electrical, Electronic or Mechanical Engineering
  • Strong communication, people leadership & coaching skills
  • Possesses a service mindset
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Proven experience in project management

What do we offer?

  • Career progression in opportunities within a global organization
  • Total reward elements that engage and motivate our employees and help us make KONE a great place to work
  • Comprehensive learning and development programs covering a wide range of professional skills

Being part of a global organization that actively supports your career and internal promotions, means that for the right person, this critical role could be the next step in a fantastic career at KONE.

361,tech project manager,/en/job/assistant-head-%5Bagile-application-developer-pm-sm%5D-9387091,9387091,Assistant Head - [Agile Application Developer/PM/SM],False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",16-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Roles & Responsibilities
  • Work with fellow IT colleagues to evaluate and recommend suitable technology and solutions while aligning to A*STAR’s technology directions.
  • Work with fellow IT colleagues to determine implementation approach, such as build or buy, bespoke or COTS and in-house or outsourced.
  • Work with business users/ system owners to justify and obtain the budget needed to implement the projects and run the systems.
  • As Application Developer / Project Manager, to perform user requirement analysis for and subsequently project-manage the development / implementation of new systems and/or enhancements to existing systems, including leading system integration and user acceptance testing.
  • Apply Design Thinking / Service Design methodology and tools to develop and execute the approach to derive current state gaps and challenges, and future state design and solutions.
  • As system manager, constantly review the technical and business performance and fitness of existing systems and processes as part of day-2 operations, and suggest improvements and ideas to increase efficiency and performance.
  • Plan for and coordinate end-user training for any system implementations or enhancements.
Desired Working Experience
  • Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred
  • Experience overseeing multi-function project teams with at least 3 - 5 team members including Developers, Business Analysts, and QA Personnel
  • Balanced business/technical background:
  • Sufficient level of technical background to provide highly-credible leadership to development teams and to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project risks and issues
  • Ability to provide leadership to business analysts and collaborate with customers and develop strategies and solutions of high business value
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment
  • A proven track record of successfully implementing software or web development projects using Agile methodologies including 5+ years of experience as a Project Manager and\or System Manager managing relatively large (>$100k), complex projects in a high-tech development environment with multi-function teams. PMP preferred.
  • Managing the complete end-to-end lifecycle of software or web development process from conception, design, development, testing, deployment, upgrading, maintenance, and decommissioning.
  • Overseeing and guiding the analyzing, writing, building, and deployment of software and web applications by Third-Party vendors.
  • Overseeing the automated testing and providing feedback to management during the development process
  • Collaborating with management, departments and customers to identify end-user requirements and specifications
  • Producing efficient and elegant code based on requirements
  • Testing and deploying programs and applications
  • Troubleshooting, debugging, maintaining and improving existing software
  • Compiling and assessing user feedback to improve software performance
  • Observing user feedback to recommend improvements to existing software products
  • Developing technical documentation to guide future software and web application development projects
Desired Skills & Trainings
  • Bachelor of Computer Science / Computer Engineering or equivalent experience is required;
  • Very effective interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building. Require to interact regularly with internal business stakeholders from all organizational levels and with varying technical backgrounds.
  • Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands
  • In-depth knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence
  • Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met
  • Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate tools:
  • Enterprise Low Code Application Platform such as Outsystems.
  • Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office Tools
  • NET, .Net Framework, C#, VB, ASP.NET, HTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery
  • Optional: PHP, Python
  • DevOps practices and tooling (E.g. CI/CD pipelines): SHIPS & HATS, Jenkins, Git etc.
  • Knowledge of Agile Framework – Scrum
  • Functional knowledge or hands-on design experience with MS SQL, APIs and web services (REST, SOAP, etc.) is a bonus.
  • Experience with multimedia content development (such as videos, graphics and EPUB files), and optimization for the web and for mobile devices is a plus.
  • In-depth experience with content management systems (CMS) such as Sitefinity,and MS Sharepoint is a plus.
  • Certification as AWS Solutions Architect or Certified Developer is a plus
  • Certification as Azure Solutions Architect or Certified Developer is a plus
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Junior Executive,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.a-star.edu.sg/JobDetails.aspx?ID=Bpn7qFtKIb3PoUY8ivLDkg%3d%3d,70000,Singapore,sg

362,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-engineer-product-and-process-engineering-9407433,9407433,"Senior Engineer, Product and Process Engineering",False,False,,,SGD,Edwards Lifesciences (Singapore) Pte Ltd,23-Mar-22,False,,,200502505R,,,2001 - 5000 Employees,,,"

Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world’s leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives.

We manufacture our products in several locations including the United States, Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic, Costa Rica and Singapore. In 2005, Edwards Lifesciences established operations in Singapore. Today, we provide a safe and healthy workplace to over 2,000 employees in our expanding world-class facilities in Singapore.

","

Job Functions:

  • Identify and ensure implementation of opportunities to optimize/improve manufacturing processes including using engineering methods (e.g., SIX Sigma and LEAN methods) employing technical design skills to re-design/design of and ensure equipment, tools, fixtures, etc are up to standards.
  • Develop complex experiments and tests (including writing and executing protocols) to qualify and validate manufacturing processes; analyze results, make recommendations, and develop reports.
  • Analyze and resolve complex Manufacturing and Compliance issues (e.g., CAPA, non-conformances, audit observations).
  • Develop training and documentation materials (e.g., work instructions) for production to enable the seamless knowledge transfer of project and manufacturing processes.
  • Lead and establish project plans to ensure deliverables are completed to customer’s expectations, using project management tools (e.g., Project Plan, Risk Analysis, etc.).
  • Oversee manufacturing support tasks; give instruction to technicians on conducting tests; train technicians and provide feedback; and coordinate technician work.
  • Other incidental duties assigned by Leadership.

Required Education/ Skills/ Experience:

  •  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Engineering or Scientific field with 4 years experience including either industry or industry/education.
  • Proven expertise in usage of MS Office Suite including MS Project; CAD experience preferred.
  • Strong documentation, communication (e.g., written and verbal) and interpersonal relationship skills including consultative and relationship management skills.
  • Basic understanding of statistical techniques.
  • Previous experience working with lab/industrial equipment required.
  • Substantial understanding and knowledge of principles, theories, and concepts relevant to Engineering.
  • Strong problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Substantial understanding of processes and equipment used in assigned work.
  • Good leadership skills and ability to influence change.
  • Knowledge of applicable FDA regulations for medical device industry.
  • Strict attention to detail.
  • Ability to interact professionally with all organizational levels.
  • Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast paced environment.
  • Must be able to work in a team environment, including inter-departmental teams and key contact representing the organization on contracts or projects
  • Adhere to all EHS rules and requirements and take adequate control measures in preventing injuries to themselves and others as well as to the protection of environment and prevention of pollution under their span of influence/control.

We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

363,tech project manager,/en/job/assistant-manager-engineering-9320789,9320789,"Assistant Manager, Engineering",False,False,4000,5000,SGD,Sunseap Group Pte Ltd,25-Mar-22,False,,30 days,201512402M,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Sunseap Group is a solar energy system developer, owner and operator in Singapore, with over 400 MegaWatt-peak (MWp) of solar energy projects contracted, of which more than 168 MWp have been completed on more than 1,500 buildings in Singapore, including public housing estates, as well as commercial and industrial buildings.
Sunseap Group also operates in China, Taiwan and Japan, as well as Southeast Asia countries including Vietnam, Cambodia, Thailand and Malaysia.
For our latest news, click here: https://www.sunseap.com/SG/newsroom/news.html#

column1:
","

Sunseap is the leading clean energy solutions provider in Singapore specialising in Solar PPA, offsite clean energy supply, EPC and O&M solar PV solutions, demand-side management, energy efficiency and other decarbonising solutions. The company also operates in various parts of Asia Pacific, including Vietnam, Cambodia, China, Taiwan, Japan, Thailand and Malaysia.

Euronext Lisbon-listed EDP Renováveis, S.A. (“EDPR”), the world’s fourth largest renewable energy producer, with expertise in wind, energy storage and green hydrogen, has recently announced plans to buy a substantial stake in Sunseap to expand its renewables platform in Asia.

Responsibilities

  • Managing/supporting solar project acquisitions, development and operations
  • Providing engineering input from initial assessment through to technical and economic feasibility, construction monitoring and acceptance and ongoing operations for both roof top and ground mounted systems (primarily in the megawatt scale)
  • Managing external technical advisers and due diligence processes
  • Support M&A projects after due diligence processes • Reviewing and preparing technical documents including specifications, reports, proposals, calculations and contracts
  • Site visits in Singapore and occasion travel to project sites around the region.
  • Provide technical support to Project Managers and Project Engineers on site
  • Technical assessment of PV products and equipment
  • Maintain design and proposal requirements, knowledge of local codes and International Standards
  • Other ad hoc activities as and when required
  • Define project goals and objectives for engineers and technicians.
  • Evaluate progress and make adjustments to achieve project success
  • Coach, guide, evaluate and mentor engineers and actively participate in their career development
  • Provide updates on execution and strategy for key projects to executive leadership

Requirements

  • Masters/Degree in Engineering
  • At least five (5) years of experience working as a team technical lead on PV plants
  • A good knowledge of PV technology and megawatt scale plants
  • A good understanding of the key commercial aspects of PV projects
  • Experience in the PV yield prediction software PVsyst
  • Competence in analysing solar irradiation measurements and PV plants production data
  • Ability to research and assess renewable technologies other than PV
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Good communication and organization skills, able to work independently and as a team.
  • Value alignment: stewardship, collaboration, innovation and with a spirit of excellence

column3: Shopee is the leading e-commerce platform in Southeast Asia and Taiwan. It is a platform tailored for the region, providing customers with an easy, secure and fast online shopping experience through strong payment and logistical support.

Shopee aims to continually enhance its platform and become the region’s e-commerce destination of choice via ongoing product optimisation and localised user-centered strategies. Shopee, a Sea company, was first launched in Singapore in 2015, and has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, Indonesia, Vietnam and the Philippines. Sea is a leader in digital entertainment, e-commerce and digital financial services across Greater Southeast Asia. Sea's mission is to better the lives of consumers and small businesses with technology, and is listed on the NYSE under the symbol SE. The Shopee team comprises over 8,000 employees from across the region, and with our rapid expansion, we are constantly on the lookout for potential talents who have the passion and drive to become part of a fast-moving and dynamic team.

column1:
","

The Marketing team at Shopee is responsible for conceptualising and implementing go-to-market activities to achieve increased usage and visibility. The team covers areas including Campaigns Management, Community, Public Relations, Partnerships, Offline Marketing and Design. The Regional Marketing team is responsible for strategising and implementing go-to-market activities and working with local teams to localise marketing for the specific markets. The Brand and Growth Marketing team covers all aspects of online and performance marketing for the region. This team is responsible for data-driven solutions, tracking and measuring data to reach the targeted customers. Browse our Marketing team openings to see how you can make an impact with us.

Job Description:

  • Cross-functional collaboration with regional and local stakeholders (including Product Managers, Marketing teams) to prepare for campaign launches and ensure system stability
  • Collaborate closely with local teams to consolidate and assess monthly campaign targets, understand local marketing strategies and key campaign objectives
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of campaign performance, as well as regular monitoring and optimisation of platform initiatives

Requirements:

  • Good degree from recognized university. 
  • Strong numerical abilities  - comfortable with handling large amounts of data, and is structured/ systematic in work approach
  • Strong project management and executional abilities
  • Reliable and good team player who enjoys working in a dynamic environment.

365,tech project manager,/en/job/associate-data-centre-engineer-tech-services-technology-operations-wd35358-9429764,9429764,"Associate, Data Centre Engineer, Tech Services, Technology & Operations - (WD35358)",False,False,,,USD,DBS Bank Limited,21 hours ago,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","

Business Function 

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. 

Job Objective

To manage Mission Critical IT facilities in Data Centre and remote buildings in Singapore. This role will govern the facility management operations of these major facilities and supervise the routine preventive maintenance to the key M&E infrastructures.

Responsibilities

  • To assist DC Facility Manager to govern the facility operation of Data Centres and remote buildings IT Rooms.

  • Manage outsourced facility vendors and Data Centre landlord.

  • Liaise with DC/Building landlord to ensure optimal operation of electricity, HVAC and monitoring environments within Mission Critical IT facilities in Data Centre and remote buildings.

  • Provide onsite supervision for all critical facility maintenance.

  • Respond to incidents following the standard incident response procedure & track till closure.

  • Rack space management.

  • Track, record, report and manage all equipment move-in and move-out of the data centres, power on and down of equipment.

Requirements

  • Minimum 3 years Data Centre facilities management and project experience.

  • Experience working in a high-pressured environment with 24x7 on-call responsibilities.

  • Working knowledge in the operation, maintenance & repair of Data Centre infrastructure systems including but not limited to power distribution, emergency generators, UPS systems, PDU's, chillers, pumps, CRAC units, Building Automation System, along with other components related to Power & HVAC support.

  • Experienced in rack and stack of IT equipment.

  • Familiarity with equipment requirements in Data Centre such as storage, servers and networking equipment such as routers, switches is a plus.

  • Familiar with Structured Cabling system and its related components.

  • Ability to multi-task and proficient in Microsoft Office applications; Excel & PowerPoint.

  • Good communication skills.

  • Organized and detail oriented.

  • Ability to work in a team.

Certification

  • Degree or Diploma in Engineering or a related field is preferred. 

  • Additional experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree or diploma.

  • Certified Data Centre Professional or Equivalent is preferred.

  • Qualifications in ITIL Foundation level at a minimum is preferred.

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2:
Quinnox Solutions Pte. Ltd. (License No: 06C3126) specializes in providing search and recruitment services. We pride ourselves in delivering effective human capital solutions in the diverse field of Technology based on our keen perception of both our clients' business needs and candidates' career aspirations.","
We are looking for Application / Solution Architect for our Clients in the FSI and Consulting sector.  He/She plays a core technical role in the development of a system and is actively involved in the entire project lifecycle especially through requirements gathering, design.  Working hand in hand with the Project Manager and other stakeholders such as business analysts, technical lead and vendors, the Application / Solution Architect shapes and steers the software architecture and design for the solution, and is a key contributor to the overall smooth delivery of any solution within the targeted timeline.

He/she is also expected to work independently, a strong technical background that enables him/her to propose sound, practical solutions to business problems. Influencing skills are a must, not only to resolve conflicts, but also to manage stakeholders across the business and IT community. The candidate should already have the ability to think laterally and quickly grasp key concepts, have a positive attitude and be resilient when dealing with challenges.
The Role:
• Propose best-fit architecture solutions for projects
• Advise on complex coding, issues & resolution
• Provide detailed design (domain-driven, bounded context, granularity of microservices)
• Work hands-on with the development team
• Escalate design and implementation challenges to Technical Architect and Development Manager level for resolution
• Contribute to identifying best-fit architectural solutions for one or more projects
• Develop design of application and provide regular support/guidance on complex coding, issue resolution and execution
• Be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.
• Overall architect to deliver the business capability ensuring architecture principles are adhered to, design review and define tech stack.
To Apply:
• Please send your latest CV to post@quinnox-solutions.com
• Kindly indicate your availability, current and expected remuneration package.
• We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
For more job opportunities, please visit our career page: http://quinnox-solutions.com/careers/

<div>

We are representing our client who develops batteries.

Equipment Engineer

Responsibilities

  • Lead the technical team to improve equipment uptime cost effectively to meet or exceed customers’ expectations and business goals.
  • This is a hands-on role; one should possess prior line/equipment maintenance function within manufacturing plant settings, tasked to manage, maintain, modify and/or continuously improve existing equipment operations that are designed for long term usages.
  • Develop and support a team comprising of Engineering Specialist and technicians, to deliver functional and Hoshin goals, with effective internal or external teamwork and collaboration.
  • Provide Engineering solutions to equipment reliability or quality problems with effective problem-solving skills.
  • Continuous improvement mindset into equipment design or system setup to deliver low-cost maintenance and high reliability.
  • Using Project Management methodology to implement projects to meet safety, time, scope, or cost performance.
  • Develop project budget and expenditure; implement productivity improvement projects (CAPEX) and support Singapore or overseas office initiated projects.
  • Compile and analyse maintenance and cost data, lead meetings and perform presentation.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree holder in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent qualification.
  • Minimum 5 years of working experience in equipment maintenance within manufacturing environment.
  • Knowledgeable or experience in maintenance system or program (AutoCAD, SAP, etc.) would be a plus.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills with all levels of parties (technicians, customers, and stakeholders).
  • Demonstrated supervisory experience in developing a diversify and cross-cultural team.
  • Problem solving resources practitioner; project management experience preferred.

EA License No: 12C6254

EA Personnel Registration No: R1988167

column1:
","

We are currently working with a Series C funded B2B e-commerce start-up company to seek for an Operations Excellence who will work with Tech and Platform teams on process design, process improvement and capability development projects to meet the needs of Operations, Product, Demand and Customer Experience teams.

The typical OpEx project cycle starts from ideation and ends with successfully achieving success criteria in pilot deployment in readiness for scaled deployment by the Operations team.

The team comprises pods that work on Upstream, Supply Operations, Fulfilment and Last Mile Logistics, and is supported by a shared team of data analysts, data science and other functions.

Responsibilities:

  • You will simultaneously work on four broad goals
  • Drive consistency and reliability in Upstream and Mid-Mile Ops through a mix of SOP development, compliance metrics design and deployment and training
  • Help the team meet their currently aligned KPIs incremental process improvement targeting on largest source of errors
  • Develop and prove in pilot deployment ops changes to deliver step change improvement in ops KPIs, targets for which will be set by company leadership
  • Develop and prove in pilot deployment new capabilities for your pillar – Examples may include coordinating supply chain with 3PL sellers, deploying backhaul volume to service other businesses, siting, and capacity planning for auxiliary storage etc
  • You will lead a team of OpEx Managers, Associates and domain Specialists focussing on the company’s last mile operations. As their manager your responsibilities will include team composition, recruitment, performance management and project allocation for members of your pod
  • In addition to the leadership team, you will work with Tech, Product, Platform, Demand and Customer Experience teams to set and achieve your goals

Requirements:

  • Have 7+ years of experience in logistics, with a significant portion in upstream/first mile/linehaul/mid-mile logistics. Experience in the Philippines or a similar market is preferred.
  • Have played a significant role in designing and scaling a supply chain network in the past
  • Combine industry and deep domain expertise with demonstrable first principles thinking
  • Have a strong orientation to using data for decision making, and familiarity with at least one data exploration tool beyond Excel
  • Have strong interpersonal skills
  • Are eager to learn new skills and continuously improve
",[],Senior Executive,,7 years,Not Specified,,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9383911&advertisement_id=9382282&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg
