column1: 440,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-manager-manager-incubation-9391812,9391812,"Senior Manager/ Manager, Incubation",False,False,,,,National University of Singapore,17-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description

NUS Enterprise is the Innovation & Entrepreneurial arm of National University of Singapore's (NUS), providing experiential entrepreneurial education, active industry partnerships, entrepreneurship support, and being Asia's thought leader in innovation and enterprise. We offer a comprehensive ecosystem, supporting tech startups through their entrepreneurial journey.

We are currently hiring a Senior Manager/ Manager to join our Incubation team. You will manage our startups under the incubator/accelerator programmes, supporting them in their entrepreneurship journey.

  • Lead startup incubation/acceleration programmes
  • Account management of startups under these programmes; supporting them in their growth
  • Scout, identify and recruit new startups
  • Drive community building initiatives
  • Manage alumni relationship development
  • Oversees the operations of the centre
Qualifications
  • Degree holder with at least 5 years of relevant experience
  • Good understanding of Tech businesses and products, related experience is a plus
  • Good knowledge of the Tech start-ups industry, prior experience e.g. with a Tech startup, VC, incubator, accelerator, etc.
  • Passionate about entrepreneurship
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Self-starter, able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent project management skills; able to manage multiple projects at a time
  • Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, critical-thinker and problem-solver
Covid-19 Message

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. 

In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

More Information

Job Type: Contract (2-year, renewable)

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: NUS Enterprise

Department : Office of Deputy President (Innovation & Enterprise)

Job requisition ID : 13248

column2: Duotech PTE.LTD is a global Fintech company based in Singapore with the headquarters in Australia.  The business branch offices based in 16 countries of Southeast Asia, Europe and America. The software technology branch offices based in 4 countries including Singapore.

column1: <div>

column2: Duotech aims to support and provide timely & excellent integrated solutions to our Group HQ, while building a strong team of in-house experts to internationalize the Group.
Singapore office is to be a 2nd HQ of the Group and the HQ of South East Asia. We are expanding all of teams in Singapore.

column1: <div>

column2:
We pride ourselves on being open, positive, and flexible in this energetic family. Most Welcome high talents join us.","

For more than 12 years, Vantage Markets has been an award-winning global financial services firm providing market opportunities to all clients globally. With millions of active traders ranging from retail traders to high-net-worth and institutional traders, you’ll have the opportunity to get your foot in the door working for a global powerhouse that has a local focus. 

JOIN A GLOBAL COMPANY THAT INVESTS IN YOU

With offices around the world, Vantage Markets has always spotlighted the importance of investing in YOU. We’re here to help build you into a well-rounded, knowledgeable, and ethical thought leader. 

The best part is – it doesn’t matter if you’re a recent university graduate, a seasoned Wall Street trader, or someone that’s never heard of derivatives before, you’ll receive world-class onboarding, continual professional development, and 360-feedback as a Vantage Markets employee.

Key Requirement - At least 6 years of digital marketing experience in the financial services space, preferably in the CFD/ brokerage environment

The Role

The role requires the candidate to lead, strategize and execute digital campaigns, to develop end-to-end marketing strategies with the objective of acquisition and growth for the company. With extensive experience managing digital channels (not limited to Display, Search and Social), this leader will need to also have worked with (including hands-on experience) both in house and external agencies to implement the plans. The candidate will be a key player in driving growth - planning and executing creative marketing campaigns, customer segmentation for tailor made outreach, developing rewarding strategies, tweaking the value proposition/ go-to market strategy, partnering with our internal products and external parties to value add our proposition. 

Key Skillsets

  • At least 6 years of digital marketing experience in the financial services space, preferably in the CFD/ brokerage environment, with proven success in growth/ end to end digital marketing and operations. eg, operation campaign design, content marketing, SEO and Performance Marketing, user journey mapping, email marketing, user segmentation, top of funnel growth and funnel optimization. 
  • Strong written communication capacity and interpersonal skills - Coordinate and project manage marketing campaigns with other teams, external partners, agencies, etc. Be an inspiration to your team and partners.
  • Data focused: ability to roll up your sleeves to pull and analyze data, gain insights and provide market and competitive intelligence for the company as well as monitoring the KPIs and trends 
  • Bilingual in English and Chinese (Native or business level fluency for both) 
  • Strong internal communications, project management and organizational skills
  • Action-driven, results oriented, attentive to details and enthusiastic, with a strong sense of responsibility and team work
  • comfortable working in a diverse, multi-cultural environment
  • User focused and product driven - strong understanding of product, tech and platform and audience
  • Fast learner - able to learn and understand the trading eco-system and product offerings and integrate the internal resources

column1: 443,tech project manager,/en/job/regional-vp-process-engineering-transport-services-9421080,9421080,"Regional VP, Process Engineering-Transport Services",False,False,,,SGD,LAZADA Singapore Pte Ltd,28-Mar-22,False,,,201403859E,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Launched in 2012, Lazada is the number one online shopping and selling destination in Southeast Asia – present in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. As the pioneer of the eCommerce ecosystem in Southeast Asia, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: With over 80 million SKUs available, Lazada offers the widest range of products in categories ranging from consumer electronics to household goods, toys, fashion, sports equipment and groceries. Focused on delivering an excellent customer experience, it offers multiple payment methods including cash-on-delivery, comprehensive customer care and hassle-free returns through its own first- and last-mile delivery arm supported by 80+ logistics partners.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Lazada Group is majority owned by Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA).","

Job Description

The role:

Lazada Logistics is seeking for a VP, Regional Process Engineering to work with local teams to build and develop an efficient transportation network for our parcels across Southeast Asia, from our warehouses and sortation centres to our last mile hubs.

Our goal is to have a seamless, ultra-reliable and highly efficient transportation network across land, sea and air cross-country to ensure parcels can be delivered right to buyers’ doorsteps.

This position will be based preferably in Singapore (but also open to be based in Malaysia), reporting to the EVP, Head of Transport.

Key Responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • Lead the team in analyzing performance of sorting, processing & delivery operations, across Southeast Asia to identify critical issues, with a focus on understanding local ground-operations issues
  • Strategise and develop best-in-class logistics processes, taking into account challenges unique to e-commerce, buyer-satisfaction, as well as the local environment.
  • Review capacities on continuous basis, work with technology on better planning, scheduling, and ensuring that it meets lead-time KPIs.
  • Lead the development and planning optimization, operating cadence, projects and work processes for all countries across Lazada South-East Asia:
  • Operating process and cadences of our delivery operations, including how we operate our facilities.
  • Ensuring high-quality operations, minimizing losses or exceptional handling, to ensure parcels arrive as per scheduled in good condition.
  • Working with local teams to optimize and improve processes, more accurate scheduling, increase productivity and decrease lead time

Manage cost efficiency and thought leadership:

  • Design and lead cross-functional initiatives – focused on enhancing delivery operations, working with planning teams, tech teams, etc to help deliver impactful projects
  • Planning capacity as well as alignment around campaigns (including excess capacity, specialized scheduling and operating hours)
  • Mentor and develop skills and capabilities of local and regional team members.

Job Requirements

  • Minimum Bachelor Degree required.
  • At least 10 years’ experience in logistics, preferably with exposure to e-commerce and South-East Asia (SEA) market experience.
  • Proven experience in leading teams regionally and remotely to achieve business outcomes.
  • Experienced in project management and change management.
  • Analytical, process and detail-oriented, good problem-solving experience, and able to work under pressure.
  • Strong communicator with all levels of stakeholders.
  • Collaborative, team player, and embrace a collaborative and open working culture.
  • Self-motivated, and has the desire to push for changes which create impact and value for the organization.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing business, and relatively unstructured environment.
  • Able to travel for business within our SEA business.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office. Experience with SQL is an advantage.
  • Fluent in English. Knowledge in an Asian-language within our markets will be an added bonus.

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column3: The OCBC Bank group of businesses comprises a family of companies owned by Singapore’s longest-established local bank.

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. Since the time of our founders, we have always understood the financial needs of our customers and developed financial solutions that meet their needs.

To address increasingly diverse needs across different communities and geographies, OCBC Bank has expanded and acquired businesses beyond the realm of commercial banking. OCBC Bank has been ranked by Bloomberg Markets magazine as the World's Strongest Bank for two years, 2011 and 2012.

column1:
","
Job Description
The digital revolution is upon us and it’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? We are a team of high-performing change leaders for OCBC consumer bank’s digital revolution and seek passionate self-starters with curious minds and unflinching tenacity to join us!

As fearless transformers, we dive into problem statements with our customers and internal partners to reimagine, design and implement meaningful digital solutions. From curating a digital strategy to revolutionizing customer journeys, we take ownership of inventing innovative ways to delight our customers while meeting their financial needs.

We view difficulties as opportunities. We are relentless in our quest to transform the business and uniting our stakeholders in the journey. We promote a culture of openness and experimentation, with a “can do” spirit. If you are an individual who thrives on challenges and inspires to drive change, join us and be an integral part of our digital change team.
We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as Digital Wealth Transformation Product Owner.
He/she will be responsible for conceptualising and leading high impact initiatives while exploiting technologies to drive digital wealth in the RM assisted space.
Responsibilities
Strategy
  • Assume end to end ownership of digital initiatives from ideation, design, development and adoption
  • Responsible for conceptualising and shaping the RM assisted digital wealth roadmap by focussing on customer feedback, industry trends, internal feedback and competitive landscape
  • Stay abreast of industry developments related to investment advisory and portfolio construction and incorporate best practices where possible
Execution
  • Execute digital initiatives in RM Assisted space, translating strategy into executable business plan, tracking of results and constantly take feedback, iterate and improve platform and adoption
  • Bridge vendor products and internal technology to build a best-in-class wealth advisory platform
  • Responsible for development of Agile execution documentation, including defining user stories to facilitate clear communication of requirements, priorities, objectives/goals and acceptance criteria to delivery team
  • Manage relationships and communicate clearly with key stakeholders on project status, key risks and issues as well as maintaining of prioritised Product Backlog
Collaboration
  • Engage cross functional stakeholders and ensure wealth capability build supports the front office needs and business objectives of strategic growth, revenue uplift, enhanced customer experience, improved risk management and operational efficiency
  • Co-create strategies/plans with multiple teams, drive consensus with multiple functional teams from front office, product, controls and technology to establish mutual wins
  • Develop best in class digital journeys in collaboration with CX team applying design thinking and a deep knowledge of our users and customers, and the data about how our customers engage with bank
  • Digital Adoption
  • Drive uplift in digital metrics including internal adoption of our digital capabilities among front office staff
Requirements
  • At least 8 -10 years of project management experience in a bank or fintech with proven track record in delivering digital initiatives as a Product Owner / Project Manager
  • Investment product knowledge, familiarity with digital wealth trends and prior experience in Fintech/tech start-up space will be a major plus
  • Thought leadership in conceptualising ideas and translate them into projects with tangible benefits.
  • Strong sense of ownership and entrepreneurship spirit to get things done, result oriented and driven to succeed
  • Structured thinking, strong data and user centric mindset in designing processes and solutions. Able to think out of the box with a constant lookout for leading industry practices
  • Proven ability to perform under a high pressure and dynamic environment
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, foster collaboration with multiple stakeholders including business partners, IT and CX
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Passionate self starter with a curious mind and unflinching tenacity

  • Leading a team of operators, technicians and supervisors.
  • Liaise with Supervisors, Engineers, Planners and other respective Departments for production processes

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble, and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage many of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
What we are looking for as a Business Analyst:
Business Analysts helps business do business better. You are an agent of change. As business analysts, you identify and define the solutions that will maximize the value delivered by an organization to its stakeholders. You will also work across all levels of an organization and may be involved in everything from defining strategy, to creating the enterprise architecture, to taking a leadership role by defining the goals and requirements for programs and projects or supporting continuous improvement in its technology
Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with business users and vendors/partners for solution planning and integration
  • Manage cross functional/matrix business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business processes, establishing project scope, goals and key value creation
  • Work closely with business stakeholders and system development team to gather requirements, Functional Specification Developments
  • Facilitate conflict resolution and able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective
  • Work with respective stakeholders on UAT planning, execution, identifying project risk and critical paths
  • Provide project dashboard reporting and metrics to business sponsor and key stakeholders
  • Coordinate with country business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases
  • Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues
  • Owns and manages process repository and is responsible for maintenance of all processes in the domain/sub-domain – (Payment utilities)
Requirements:
  • Analytical and with drive to solve problems
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and good presentation skills
  • The ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, including executives, subject matter experts, developers
  • Pro-active and able to organize, coordinate, and direct users and teams
  • Familiar with project management and SDLC process and writing Business Requirement Document & Functional Specification
  • Process positive attitudes and able to adopt to changes fast
  • Working experience in Banking environments will be an advantage
  • Having mobile applications and payments knowledge will be an advantage
  • Delivery focused and results oriented
  • Attention to details and highly organized and able to work under pressure in a time-critical environment
  • Ability to work independently, and keep calm when under stress
  • Microsoft Excel/Powerpoint/Projects/Word/Visio
  • Good Understanding of Payment/External Partnership Integration will be a plus
  • High level understanding of technologies associated with API
  • Understanding and hands-on experience in both Agile and Waterfall approaches in SDLC
  • Familiar with Jira and Confluence tools will be an advantage
  • Excellent organizational, vendor and partner management, negotiation, and prioritization skills

column3: At ST Engineering, our purpose is to apply our technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Our dedication to excellence and our strong track record have earned us a distinctive reputation for quality and trust as a global technology, defence and engineering group. Our diverse portfolio of businesses spans the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments.

We succeed because of our ability to deliver what our partners and customers need. Together, we transform and future-proof cities to make them more mobile, more secure and more liveable for communities. With our expertise and facilities around the world, we keep aircraft flying safely and seagoing vessels operating efficiently.

We help nations protect their citizens by meeting their air, land and sea defence needs and equipping their fighting forces to perform on the battlefield. Our cybersecurity and critical systems help our customers enforce public and homeland security in an increasingly digital world. And our satellite communications equipment contribute to much of the world’s network connectivity.

","
We are seeking System Admin/DevOps Engineers to join our analytics software product and delivery teams within the Group Engineering Centre in ST Engineering.
The candidate must be able to work in fast paced internal product development and also customer infrastructure environments. He/She will need to
• Contribute to the design, setup, and maintenance of on-premise and private cloud compute infrastructure
• Assist in provisioning and management of servers, deployment of databases, monitoring of security, patch systems, etc.
• Help manage internal and external network connectivity
• Contribute to the design and implementation of continuous integration-delivery pipelines with infrastructure as code, automation, and testing capabilities to facilitate automated deployment of applications
• Develop code to automate platform capabilities and operations
• Craft technical solutions to address and adapt to changing product/operational requirements
• Keep abreast of relevant new technologies, participate in tech communities, recommend tools and techniques for the team
The candidate will work with software engineers, business analysts, big data engineers, solution architects, and project managers in the course of work. The ideal candidate will thrive in a work environment that requires strong problem-solving skills, self-motivation, and an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication. The candidate will be supporting both defence and commercial projects.
Requirements
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, information systems or related quantitative field
- Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, Github, CI/CD, DevOps, Linux, System Administration, Active Directory
- Excellent coordination and time management skills to handle complex projects
- Willing and enthusiastic about continuous learning of new technologies
- Effective oral and written communication with strong analytical, problem solving, multitasking and project management skills
- Understanding of end-to-end analytics process – ideation/value elicitation, requirements definition, data profiling, analytical modelling, testing, validation, visualization, and deployment will be a big plus.
- Ability to quickly pick up microservices deployment, load balancing, HA design & implementation
- Ability to obtain required security clearance for defence related work is a cardinal requirement
- Open for applicants with no experience but with the right discipline

449,tech project manager,/en/job/wealth-management-client-services-technical-support-project-manager-associate-singapore-hong-kong-jpm-9370917,9370917,"Wealth Management, Client Services Technical Support Project Manager, Associate, Singapore / Hong Kong #JPM",False,False,,,SGD,"JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A.",11-Mar-22,False,,30 days,S74FC2367E,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">
<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.","

J.P. Morgan Private Bank advises the world’s wealthiest families and helps them achieve their desired goals. Our teams of Advisors deliver advice, solutions and services across investments, wealth planning, credit and banking to help clients build, preserve and manage their wealth over time.

 Our team of specialists works seamlessly to help our clients achieve their financial goals and aspirations. We’re proud to be named ‘2019 Best Private Bank for Ultra-High-Net-Worth Clients’ by Euromoney: Egypt, France, Greece, Italy, Lebanon, Qatar, Spain, United Arab Emirates and UK.

.  

The Role and Responsibilities

The Technical Support Manager will be responsible for on-going BAU support of all applications within Client Service. A key responsibility will be to own and manage the end to end resolution of any technical issues impacting CSS (Client Service Specialist) BAU, including understanding the initial issue, raising of support tickets and ensuring speedy resolution by technology, transformation and product teams.  The successful incumbent will join and help run any global resolution calls being the voice of Client Service, also ensuring where issues are global in nature they partner with their colleagues across IPB CSS to ensure issues are resolved and solutioned for all IPB regions. Additionally, the incumbent will ensure root cause analysis is completed by the responsible party (possibly technology, operations, transformation) and any recommendations are planned and implemented. He/She will partner closely with both Technology, Transformation and Product teams on the role out of new functionality and be the primary point of contact within CSS for any BAU technical issues. 

 The candidate needs to have the mindset to work independently, facing off to multiple internal teams and be confident to engage with people at all levels.

  • Point person within CSS for all CSS BAU technical issues, escalation and ownership until resolution and communication to CSS
  • A desire to be the technical expert in all applications which CSS need to manage their day to day activities
  • Manage project related coordination within the region on behalf of CSS and be the point person to assign testing resources, other project requirements from time to time
  • Strong communicator, who is able to contribute in meaningful and appropriate ways to meetings, project deliverables or calls. Clear, concise and confident written and oral communications.
  • Able to work with multiple teams and people at all levels to ensure issues are understood and resolution agreed
  • Confident in proposing solutions to issues, using their detailed understanding of the business
  • Can work independently to drive resolution, but also partner at a global level
  • Bring and develop a strong network across the business which they can utilize in support of speedy issue resolution
  • Able to work and thrive in a high pressure environment where timeliness of resolution is critical to limit business and client impact
  • Partner with Product teams on the implementation of new systems to become the BAU technical expert and help to ensure the successful delivery of new applications
  • Provide CSS management reporting of Tech incident trends to facilitate end to end issue resolution and preventative solutioning
  • Own feedback management process on Tech enhancements which includes new tool designs, enhancement and /or fixes on existing toolset.
  • Key CSS champion on new tool set, partnering with CSS, Transformation and Technology to ensure new roll-out implemented are robust and meet user/platform requirements.

Qualifications

  • Detailed understanding of CSS processes, procedures and applications
  • At least 1 year proven CSS experience 
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to work independently showing initiative and problem solving, while working within a team environment
  • Excellent communication skills, can effectively communicate challenges and issues, and simplify complex business situations across all levels of seniority and functions
  • Be a team player who is flexible and can maintain both a positive attitude and high level of performance on high demand/time-sensitive initiatives
  • Bachelors or Master’s Degree (or equivalent)
",[],Manager,,1 year,"Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9370917&advertisement_id=9369288&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

column1: 450,tech project manager,/en/job/avp-vp-specialist-marketing-consumer-banking-group-wd28043-9406452,9406452,"AVP / VP, Specialist, Marketing, Consumer Banking Group - (WD28043)",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Responsibilities:
  • Be part of the POSB marketing team to strategize and strengthen POSB’s brand leadership. Develop both defensive and offensive marketing strategies to maintain POSB’s stronghold on BHM key preference drivers and chart new frontiers for the bank.
  • Push the boundary for innovative marketing ideas and campaigns to deliver delightful customer journeys and create meaningful engagement with target audience to elevate our POSB brand.
  • Lead and collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external partners, media, creative agencies to ensure marketing initiatives align to POSB brand strategy and support business objectives.
  • Marketing lead for key areas of focus, but not limited to:
  • Parents and kids segments - Endeavor to grow mindshare. Be creative in anchoring POSB's positioning and relevance to build brand affinity and deepen engagement for these segments.
  • Gamification champion for POSB Hunt-Your-Zodiac game– Lead end-to-end project management, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders - from ideation, tech development, internal approvals, UAT up to ensuring a successful launch with innovative marketing communications and press publicity.
  • Events and sponsorships - Support marketing communications from planning, creative production, event management to on-ground implementation and activation.
  • Ensure a strong discipline of campaign performance tracking to continuously optimize effectiveness of campaigns to deliver on set goals.
  • Manage branch distribution communications and marketing for POSB, DBS and Treasures.
  • Manage marketing budget to ensure prudent spending and maximize ROMI.
Requirements:
  • Degree/Diploma in related disciplines like Marketing, Mass Communications or Advertising.
  • Minimum 12 years’ working experience in related fields like Marketing, Advertising and Media.
  • Experience in brand, product, segment or event marketing, development of games and digital platforms for customer engagement, familiarity with creative process and working with creative/media agencies is preferred.
  • Good understanding and knowledge of digital marketing, gamification for customer engagement and social media engagement will be a plus.
  • Ability to strategize, plan and execute with finesse.
  • Experience with managing a team.
  • Strong collaborator, resourceful and ability to navigate independently.
  • Good team player with excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment.
  • Extremely meticulous, with an eye for details. Comfortable with copywriting and able to provide constructive critique for creatives and steer development.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Data-driven and is able to draw insights from data.
  • Open-minded and nimble to change with a growth mindset.
  • Excellent powerpoint and excel competency.

451,tech project manager,/en/job/executive-senior-executive-primary-care-transformation-9404200,9404200,"Executive/Senior Executive, Primary Care Transformation",False,False,,,SGD,National Healthcare Group Polyclinics,22-Mar-22,False,,26 days,52929305J,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,One-North,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: National Healthcare Group Polyclinics (NHGP) forms the primary healthcare arm of the National Healthcare Group (NHG). Its six polyclinics serve a significant proportion of the population in the central and northern parts of Singapore.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
NHGP provides a comprehensive range of health services for the family, functioning as a one-stop health centre providing treatment for acute medical conditions, management of chronic diseases, women & child health services and dental care.  The focus of NHGP's care is on health promotion and disease prevention, early and accurate diagnosis, disease management through physician led team-based care as well as enhancing the capability of Family Medicine through research and teaching.","
Job Responsibilities

Primary Care Engagement
• Support Clinic Heads and GP engagement team with region-specific engagement of GPs, to follow up with GP partners once initial engagement has taken place, manage end-to-end of partnerships, including administrative logistics such as scheduling meetings with partners, preparing agenda of meetings, provide secretariat support to committees and write minutes of meetings.
• Engage with Point-of-Contacts within NHG for care integration projects and initiatives.
Project Management/Operations
• Perform data analysis, prepare trending reports and develop dashboards/data visualization to analyze and present various datasets
• Prepare monthly GP trending charts and provide insights to the trending pattern
• Work closely with the team of Care Facilitators, Polyclinic Heads/Deputy Heads, Doctor Champions to ensure operational efficiency of right-siting work in polyclinics
• Solicit feedback and insights from Care Facilitators on ground issues, address GP partners and manage patients’ feedback and to provide these inputs to the clinic management team for the purpose of resolving and refining the right-siting process
• Support management and Board reporting functions, including secretariat duties, preparation of presentation decks, trending graphs etc
• Support NHGP strategic planning process such as corporate planning matters (e.g. updates to budget, workplans etc).
• Any other duties assigned by RO/HOD
Job Requirements
• Bachelor Degree
• Preferably with minimum 3 years’ working experience in partnership engagement, data analysis, project management (preferably in the healthcare sector) in projects involving initiating new healthcare services, improving healthcare operations/processes
• Strong proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Good interpersonal & engagement skills, with an ability to engage, build and manage partnerships
• Tech-savvy
• Good data analytics skills
• Good written and oral communication skills
• Driven, with good organizational and problem-solving skills
• Ability to multi-task and adapt to a fast-paced environment to meet timelines
• Resourceful, proactive and analytical, with an eye for detail
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
",[],Junior Executive,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Miscellaneous allowance', 'Medical', 'Sports (e.g. Gym)', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9404200&advertisement_id=9402571&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

Business Function

Established in 1877, POSB is the oldest bank in Singapore. We pride ourselves as 'Neighbours first, bankers second' to our customers.  Being a bank that is close to the hearts of many Singaporeans, we strive to make banking simple and inclusive for our customers by bringing to them products, services and capabilities to support their lives, dreams and aspirations, with focus on delivering a joyful banking experience for our customers. 
Join the POSB marketing team to fortify POSB's brand leadership and propel POSB as a progressive financial partner that stays relevant for our customers and community.
Responsibilities
  • Be part of the POSB marketing team to strategize and strengthen POSB's brand leadership.  Develop both defensive and offensive marketing strategies to maintain POSB's stronghold on BHM key preference drivers and chart new frontiers for the bank.

    •     Lead gamification for POSB from end-to-end project management, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders - from ideation, tech development, internal approvals, UAT up to ensuring a successful launch with innovative marketing communications and press publicity.

453,tech project manager,/en/job/head-of-marketing-emerging-product-sea-9431350,9431350,"Head of Marketing, Emerging Product - SEA",False,False,,,SGD,TikTok,4 hours ago,False,,,201719908M,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok is a global short-form mobile video platform that allows you to express yourself by creating content. It gives rise to engaging, interactive challenges and trending topics in which anyone can participate. TikTok aims to capture and showcase the world's creativity, knowledge, and moments that matter, directly from your mobile phone. TikTok has global offices in many cities, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

","

Responsibilities

About TikTok:

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, Tokyo and Sydney.

The Role:

The Head of Marketing in SEA helps drive local marketing strategy, leads campaign development and execution, as well as drives cross-functional projects for the market. This role will work closely with product, operations, comms teams locally and globally to develop market level strategies across SEA and India, that will help Emerging Product to grow its brand and business.

This is a pivotal role in the team, and will require a deep understanding of consumer marketing techniques and principles, with a particular focus on audience insights, campaign strategy & planning, project operations, and execution & reporting. The Head of Marketing of SEA will manage and grow a high performing team of local marketing managers, work with global and regional marketing team to identify key priority campaigns and marketing initiatives to drive long term growth for the business.

This role will need to lead and coordinate with internal stakeholders as well as agencies and partners to develop campaigns and strategies to grow TikTok's new business. This is a senior marketing role with scope over all aspects of the consumer brand and funnel and a leadership role leading a regional marketing team.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop regional marketing strategies to grow Emerging Product's brand and product presence and relevancy in market with a deep understanding of the global business roadmaps.
  • Build and maintain relationships with external partners and agencies to support and drive local marketing strategy, and lead end to end campaign development and reporting
  • Identify, build and maintain partnership opportunities across a variety of channels including entertainment, social media, brands, celebrities and other businesses to drive our marketing strategy and objectives.
  • Collaborate closely with other functional teams, locally and globally, to define & deliver our marketing strategy. Lean in with localized approaches but keep a strong synergy with the global teams.
  • Utilize in-depth marketing research, customer insights and market segment developments to build effective marketing strategies.
  • Oversee activations and community building among specific communities within the total target audience.
  • Manage a regional team of marketing managers, facilitate the marketing org growth in SEA

Qualifications

  • 8+ years’ work experience in marketing at tech companies is highly preferred, especially experience from building high level strategies to campaign development and media management for new products in SEA is a plus.
  • Data and Insights driven, ability to synthesise data into strategy and execution.
  • You have excellent knowledge of the digital advertising industry in SEA
  • You are passionate and knowledgeable about the music industry and the user communities in SEA, familiar with the market in Indonesia is a plus.
  • Thorough knowledge of major music streaming platforms in SEA.
  • Experience leading and mentoring a diverse team across countries
  • A keen interest in brand and business development, including commercial and brand partnerships.
  • Excellent written and presentation skills & negotiation skills, and leadership ability.

About You:

  • A ‘roll up the sleeves’ self-starter with experience working in consumer marketing
  • You bring a great attitude, with a passion for the brand
  • Entrepreneur minded, must be proactive, and have an appetite for innovation.
  • Comfortable in an experimental and extremely fast-paced environment
  • You are creative, yet analytically minded with ability to work cross-functionally.
  • You exhibit curiosity, proactively solve problems, and get things done with a positive attitude
  • You have a growth mindset and want to work in a dynamic fast moving team, and have fun at work.
  • Last but not least, you love music!

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

",[],Manager,,8 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Education support', 'Medical', 'Vision', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Casual (e.g. T-shirts)']",https://careers.tiktok.com/position/7070705817587157261/detail,70000,Singapore,sg

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment.
  • Extremely meticulous, with an eye for details.  Comfortable with copywriting and able to provide constructive critique for creatives and steer development.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Data-driven and is able to draw insights from data.
  • Open-minded and nimble to change with a growth mindset.
  • Excellent powerpoint and excel competency.
Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

455,tech project manager,/en/job/oracle-essbase-consultant-9393244,9393244,Oracle ESSBASE Consultant,False,False,5800,8000,SGD,Avensys Consulting Pte Ltd,18-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200710657H,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Avensys is a leader in providing technology enabled business solutions and services. Since inception, Avensys has helped clients use IT more efficiently to improve their operations and profitability, focus on core competencies and achieve business results such as increased agility, innovation and profitable growth. Our in-depth technical knowledge coupled with industry experience and our unique methodologies enable us to successfully deliver and meet our customer’s expectations.","
Oracle ESSBASE Consultant
Eager to take the next step in your career at a Top-notch MNC, we want to hear from you!
Our client is an established brand in the Information Technology who is now looking for a passionate and driven Oracle ESSBASE Consultant to provide solutions or workarounds with regards to existing functionalities.
This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
  • Involved with designing and developing world-class technical solutions and demonstrating best Supply Chain Industry practices.
  • Work with Business Solution team and understand the business requirements and provide all possible technical/functional support.
  • Communicating with Client Manager and providing status on a daily basis.
  • Provide support to Project team during critical system availability issues, upgrades and enhancements and bug fixes impacting the business.
  • Requirement Management and Change Management process.
  • Understand the business process and provide high level design solution for the development team to provide better system solution for end users.
  • Well versed of working with onsite/offshore model.
  • Exposure to Project Management activities.
  • Adaptability to work with professionals having diversified backgrounds.
REQUIREMENTS
  • Minimum of 6 years of experience as Supply chain Techno Functional Consultant in Manufacturing and Hi-Tech industry.
  • Must Have Strong working experience in Oracle Essbase, PL/SQL, Shell Scripting
  • Strong Technical knowledge in Office 365 framework.
  • Advanced Technical knowledge in Operational Planning Framework (Oracle Hyperion Essbase).
  • Techno-functional analytical skill in supply chain module using Oracle Hyperion Essbase.
  • Strong Business knowledge in commodity procurement.
  • Domain knowledge and prior techno functional experience in Planning domain for Hi-Tech Manufacturing industry.
  • Domain knowledge in Supply and demand planning using custom built Framework
  • Complete Functional experience in clear to build inventory control.
  • Advanced level technical expertise must in Oracle (PL/SQL Programming), Oracle Essbase 512,
  • Excellent Trouble shooting and debugging skills. Should perform peer reviews and assist the team in troubleshooting.
  • Expertise in analyzing the client’s requirements, understanding the business process, and mapping it in Supply chain manufacturing.
  • Should follow coding standards by taking into consideration the Performance impact on system.
Preferred skills
  • Intermediate Technical skill in Angular JS, VB, O365, Python, Oracle Cloud.
Additional Skills:
  • Excellent customer interfacing skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.
WHAT’S ON OFFER
You will be remunerated with an excellent base salary and entitled to attractive company benefits. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to enjoy a fun and collaborative work environment, alongside a strong career progression.
To submit your application, please apply online or email your UPDATED CV in Microsoft Word format to Saridha@aven-sys.com and Prasad@aven-sys.com Your interest will be treated with strict confidentiality.
CONSULTANT DETAILS
Consultant Name : Saridha Sekar
Reg No.  : R1325954
Avensys Consulting Pte Ltd
EA Licence 12C5759
Privacy Statement: Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with the relevant data protection law and Avensys' privacy policy.

column1: 456,tech project manager,/en/job/svp-vp-digital-product-manager-consumer-banking-group-%7C-%5Bwd24564%5D-9361327,9361327,"SVP / VP, Digital Product Manager, Consumer Banking Group | [WD24564]",False,False,,,SGD,DBS Bank Limited,8-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
SVP / VP, Digital Product Manager, Consumer Banking Group - (WD24564)
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. Leveraging technology to build scalable products and solutions, we aim to democratise wealth management for our customers in the region by offering digital portfolios at low investment minimums. We are on a mission of making investments accessible, simple, cost-effective and convenient, to activate investing among our customer base by converting non-investing customers into investors and increase digital investments adoption.
Responsibilities
As a Digital Product Manager, this role will be part of the Regional Consumer Investments Product team, looking to launch digital portfolio solutions in our regional markets, as well as continue to develop and grow our robo-investing solutions in Singapore. Candidate will work closely with investment product teams across the region to understand and tailor the solution to the local regulatory environment / customer needs, as well as channels, delivery and technology teams to build and launch digital portfolios and other enhancements in the region.
  • Lead and shape product development roadmap for our robo-investing / digital portfolio solution
    • Develop deep knowledge of the competitor landscape (both direct and indirect competitors) to develop competitive advantage and continuously refine our product proposition for each of the markets
    • Work with key stakeholders, including in-house discretionary portfolio managers, country product teams to co-develop the product offering and support any in-country strategies
  • Customer experience and product management
    • Develop best-in-class customer journeys in collaboration with the UX design team
    • Work with in-country teams to develop business case, analyse investment-return paybacks, profitability and revenue / customer targets
    • Track, monitor and analyse key product metrics across the region, and come up with ideas to iterate the offering progressively
    • Apply data driven operating model, including identifying drivers and outcomes to increase customer engagement and deliver business outcomes
    • Provide input on regional operating model across multiple countries all leveraging the same platform and support
    • Develop keen understanding of the in-country regulatory framework, suitability and sales process, and compliance requirements
  • Project implementation
    • Manage and prioritise investment spend budget, making key recommendations on which features / enhancements to prioritise given limited resources
    • Work with key channels, delivery and technology partners to secure resources for project delivery
    • Act as business project manager, ensuring that key deliverables and milestones are met
    • Act as product owner under Agile methodology, providing high level product requirements and prioritisation with Tech teams
Requirements
  • Candidate should be passionate about the customer experience and our mission of making investments accessible, simple, cost-effective and convenient
  • Candidate should have excellent interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to lead and work with large cross-functional teams. Candidate should possess strong influencing and problem-solving skills, with a collaborative mind-set and will need to manage both external and internal stakeholders
  • Candidate should be able to drive innovation and be comfortable working in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment
  • Experience in the investments / product management is a plus, with a keen understanding of investment products and/ or portfolio management, customers’ investment needs, legal / regulatory requirements
  • Experience in a strategy role is a plus, to assist in the development of the long-term roadmap for the product
  • Prior experience in managing platform & systems / technology implementations is a plus
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
",[],Manager,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Medical', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)']",https://careers.dbs.com/careersection/dbs_professional_hires_career_section/jobdetail.ftl?job=WD24564&tz=GMT%2B08%3A00&tzname=Asia%2FManila,70000,Singapore,sg

458,tech project manager,/en/job/apac-securities-change-process-oversight-193483-9402444,9402444,"APAC Securities, Change & Process Oversight - #193483",False,False,,,SGD,Credit Suisse (Singapore) Limited,22-Mar-22,False,,30 days,197702363D,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2: The Credit Suisse Group purpose is at the core of everything we do. It underpins the value we create and has powered our progress for more than 160 years. It captures the essence of 'why' we exist as an organization. It motivates us when we come to work every day and serves as our North Star when we make decisions. Ultimately, it serves to define who we are and what we should be doing for our employees, clients and stakeholders.

Our strategy builds on Credit Suisse's core strengths: our position as a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities and our strong presence in our home market of Switzerland. We seek to follow a balanced approach to wealth management, aiming to capitalize on both the large pool of wealth within mature markets as well as the significant growth in wealth in Asia Pacific and other emerging markets.

We serve our clients through three regionally focused divisions: Swiss Universal Bank, International Wealth Management and Asia Pacific. These regional businesses are supported by an integrated global Investment Bank. Our Asset Management business is managed as a separate division, emphasizing the strategic importance of the asset management business for the bank and its clients. ","Your field of responsibility

The Change & Process Oversight team is responsible for Governance, Change & Innovation, Client Experience and Training in the region. The team oversee new business initiatives, market mandatory works and other securities related BoW working closely with custody banks, brokers, clients, Sales & Trading, Trade Support, Middle Office, Information Technology and other Operations teams across the Firm. Looking at highly skilled and experienced SME’s in project management who are able to support all locations across APAC including Hong Kong, India, Japan & Singapore.

The team is based in Singapore.

As a part of role, your responsibility includes:

  • Prioritize the APAC Book of Work(BoW), coordinate with tech team on the requirements
  • Provide SME support in New Business discussions
  • Provide operational support to Front Office, Trading Desk and Line Teams
  • Understanding and applying market rules, deadlines and characteristics when reviewing BoW, change request.
  • Working in a controlled environment
  • Identifying cost saving opportunities in operations processes and operational improvement opportunities in daily processes
  • Coordinating with the management team to comply to all market regulations and provide support for regulatory requests when required

Your future colleagues

Be part of a dynamic, highly motivating and challenging organization that values team work and dedication. An opportunity to learn, improve, implement and work with multiple groups across the bank.

We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values.

This position offers remote working opportunities for an agreed amount of days per week.

Your skills and experience

The right candidate will possess good numerical and analytical skills and a positive can do attitude, combined with strong attention to detail. Possess strong communication skills and can optimally collaborate and build positive relationships across all levels.

  • Proven experience in a project management with relevant operations knowledge
  • Proficient in financial markets and mechanics of equity and fixed income instruments
  • Ability to plan, organize and set priorities to enable the effective management and delivery of projects within set timeframes
  • Outstanding interpersonal ability and take a logical and pragmatic approach to problem resolution
  • Proficient in operational risk, control and ability to both implement and manage a control framework
  • Support, manage and deliver change initiatives, control enhancements and new business developments
  • Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives.
Your new employer

Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training.

We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. We will consider flexible working opportunities where possible. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.

column1: 459,tech project manager,/en/job/business-system-and-process-manager-%5B12-months-contract%5D%5E-9419161,9419161,Business System and Process Manager [12 months contract]^,False,False,,,SGD,Apple Inc.,28-Mar-22,False,,30 days,198903166R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We’re a diverse collection of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what’s possible to help us all do what we love in new ways. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with the Mac, iPhone, iPad and Apple Watch, as well as with services, including iTunes, the App Store, Apple Music and Apple Pay. And the same innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Every new product we invent, service we create or store we open is the result of people working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","
Summary
This role is part of the Pacific Ops System & Process Function to manage complex, global & regional initiatives supporting various areas within Pacific Operations. Pacific Operations include the areas of Reseller Operations, Online Store Fulfillment Operations, Retail Fulfillment Logistics, Supply/Demand Management & Execution, Logistics and Product Operations. You will be responsible for managing cross-functional and cross-organizational teams to define, build and roll-out innovative technology and business process solutions that increase efficiencies, improve customer satisfaction, and drive revenue. You should have subject matter expertise in fulfillment supply chain from manufacturing and distribution centre sites, exceptional project management skills, a good grasp of process management, a maniacal attention to detail, and a proven ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.

Key Qualifications
  • SAP System and process savvy
  • Good process re-engineering skills
  • Strong Project Management experience with attention to detail
  • Excellent operation issue resolution skill
  • Excellent people and communication (written and spoken) skills
  • Good teamwork attitude
  • Ability to work with ambiguity
  • Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working in a global, fast-paced environment
  • Strong knowledge of Excel (Advanced level) preferred
  • Proficiency in developing detailed optimization models is a plus

Description
  • Leverage industry trends, best practices, and leading-edge technology and process improvement ideas.
  • Lead and implement cross-functional change management initiatives across all Apple’s product lines, influencing decisions through collaboration, leadership and a customer-focused approach
  • Devise and implement in partnership with cross-functional business users (including outside pacific operations e.g. Finance, Sales, etc), Freight Forwarders, 3PL Warehouse, Apple OEM’s, IS&T business and system solutions that meet the changing business conditions.
  • Project manages cross-functional re-engineering implementations.
  • Drive for effective change management when necessary.
  • Ensure process integration across organization, both regionally and globally.
  • Develop good, up-to-date knowledge of IT capabilities and able to work closely with IS&T.
  • Work within the business (cross functionally and cross regions) to document and gain final approval for the Business Requirements
  • Work with the Business Process Owner to enhance the Business Processes to meet the Business Requirements
  • Articulate the Business Requirements to the IS&T Consultants and assist in the formulation of a prototype or proof of concept solution
  • Work with the IS&T Consultants to design the final solution to meet the requirements
  • Manage the User acceptance test and implementation of the business change and supporting systems change across Apple Pacific
  • Validate the return on investment was met post implementation

Education & Experience
  • Bachelor's degree required, Masters degree or MBA preferred.

Additional Requirements
  • Proven track record of leading strategic projects combined with the ability to execute at tactical project-level activities and tasks
  • In-depth knowledge and experience in project and process management. Minimum of 6-8 years relevant experience.
  • Prior consulting experience in a similar hi-tech industry is desirable but not required.
  • Proven experience as a change agent having effectively implemented change in large cross functional organization
  • Large Cross Functional project implementation experience
  • Proven experience working effectively in a matrixed, global organization.
  • Experience working on projects for teams based outside Singapore, e.g. virtual teams.
  • Past experience of working on industry standard CPFR, Demand forecasting systems and processes is a plus
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail and high comfort in working with numbers
  • Ability to remain focused and work efficiently under pressure while handling multiple tasks - Ability to assimilate and learn complex processes in a changing and dynamic work environment on a steep learning curve
  • Ability to both think strategically and execute tactically
",[],Manager,,6 years,"Primary/Secondary School/O Level, Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Casual (e.g. T-shirts)', 'Weekdays–Saturday–Sunday']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9419161&advertisement_id=9417532&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

","
SVP, Program Director (Loyalty Rewards), Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD27485)
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
The role is responsible for managing and leading the strategy, roadmap and implementation of a leading edge Rewards and Loyalty system. Program director needs to work closely with the stakeholders across the Bank to plan, implement and drive technology programs and related projects within the AGILE framework. This role will play an integral role in ensuring the success of these programs, and be a change agent for the way programs and projects being run.
  • Design, build and roll out a detailed strategy and methodology for a new loyalty program including a reward system and membership system to deliver on key metrics to meet organizations strategic objective.
  • Work closely with the business stakeholders to drive technology teams to deliver highly performant system.
  • Define the delivery plan as per strategy/roadmap and obtain buy-in and approval from senior management and stakeholders for plan execution
  • Manage a team of resources comprising in-house staff, contractors and product vendors to deliver the program
  • Constantly evaluates program performance and investigates opportunities in order to recommend optimizations that drive key performance metrics (Zero production incidents, High availability, High scalability - 12 factor application)
  • Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams to design and deploy relevant and meaningful loyalty program communications and activities
  • Act as the primary point of contact for the program and undertake a continuous focus on data collection and relevancy for our customers
  • Based on customer segmentation, drive the loyalty marketing and communications plans to our most valuable loyalty customers at all times
  • Work with internal BI & financial controllers to manage the Loyalty P&L ensuring that all financial targets are achieved and all planned activities are completed within budget.
  • Explore venues using AI/ML to make the technology stack future ready.
Requirements
  • Demonstrated 15-20 years' of progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management.
  • Minimum 10 years IT experience with Open-Source development.
  • Experience in loyalty/reward system desirable, preferably in digital payment, credit-card or digital marketplace industry
  • Ability to drive technical development using Open Source full tech stack, including integration with multiple vendor products
  • Good understanding of different loyalty systems and existing market players
  • Proven effectiveness driving complex multi-stakeholder planning processes, driving cross-team programs to desired results, and managing risk.
  • Project/program management leadership including scope, schedule, budget, quality, risk, communications, procurement, human resources, and integration management
  • Proven competency in strategic leadership, executive communication and influence, organizational agility, cross-team collaboration, drive for results, and written and verbal communications
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities, effective in matrix management and team building
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to speak to technical-level staff and summarize communications for business stakeholders and executives
  • Strong organizational skills, the ability to perform under pressure and management of multiple priorities with competing demands for resources
  • Change driver - Significant experience in managing and driving change
  • Highly effective in managing the risk and cost implications of IT contracts or contract negotiations
  • Ability to act as in a consultative manner with both business and IT leaders to align strategy
  • Knowledge in technical program management methodologies.
  • Demonstrated experience building, mentoring, and growing technical program management or engineering teams of 100 or more.
  • Experience taking ownership and delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Solid understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies, Project Management, Software Development Life Cycle, Software Quality Assurance methodologies, and familiarity with project management tools and bug/issue tracking system.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
