463,tech project manager,/en/job/software-developer-future-health-technologies-9397972,9397972,Software Developer - Future Health Technologies,False,False,4000,8000,SGD,ETH Singapore SEC Limited,23-Mar-22,False,,,201016935D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,CREATE Tower,"

 The Singapore-​ETH Centre (SEC) was established by one of the world’s leading universities - ETH Zurich (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich) and the National Research Foundation Singapore in 2010.

The centre provides a multicultural and interdisciplinary environment to researchers working on diverse themes focussed on sustainable and liveable cities, resilient urban systems, and patient-​centric healthcare. The centre is home to a community of over 100 doctoral, postdoctoral and professorial researchers working in three main programmes - Future Cities Lab Global, Future Resilient Systems, and Future Health Technologies – and a range of related research projects.

As part of the National Research Foundation's CREATE campus (Campus for Research Excellence and Technological Enterprise), members of the SEC also benefit from opportunities to engage with colleagues from top universities based in the campus.

","

Future Health Technologies – Brain -Computer Interface Driven Therapy

Introduction

ETH Zurich is one of the leading universities of the world with a strong focus on science and engineering. In 2010 it established the Singapore-ETH Centre (SEC) in collaboration with the National Research Foundation (NRF) to do interdisciplinary research on pressing problems.

In collaboration with the National University of Singapore (NUS), the Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Duke - NUS, the National Health Group (NHG), National University Health System (NUHS), and SingHealth, SEC is undertaking a research programme on ""Future Health Technologies (FHT)"". It addresses some immanent health challenges by developing a future-oriented Mobile Digital Health Concept that tackles the increase in patients suffering from chronic diseases such as stroke, as a consequence of a rapidly ageing population with mobile digital technologies, covering the value chain from acute care to patient's private homes.

Project background

Our project within FHT aims to develop and investigate human-machine interfaces that promote sensorimotor recovery in patients with stroke. We will be collecting health-related data at the hospital and participant’s home and delivering digital health solutions using mobile apps (e.g. gamified rehabilitation protocols) and therapy devices (e.g., for neurorehabilitation of upper limb sensorimotor impairments). To develop a technology platform for testing therapy protocols/programme and data collection pipelines with portability and simplicity, we are looking for an experienced Software Developer to work with an international team of researchers and technicians from SEC, ETH Zurich and local partners in Singapore, including the Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH).

Within this framework the SEC has the following job opening (workplace is Singapore):

Key responsibilities

As a Software Developer/Senior in the FHT, you will be responsible to

- Research, design, implement, test and manage software for the brain-computer interface driven therapy project.

- Deliver technical project management for FHT research activities at SEC including project planning activities, engineering requirements, effort estimates, on-site and remote exchange with several research partners.

- Develop secure mobile apps for data collection and mobile health interventions including interfaces to endpoints such as sensors as well as secure transfer to the FHT server infrastructure.

- Enable data exchange between multiple rehabilitation technologies and develop graphical user interfaces that can display these data in an intelligent manner to clinical personnel and patients

- Deploy and improve the existing mobile rehabilitation platform at the SEC and offer technical support to ongoing studies.

- Interact with FHT System Engineer(s), Scientific IT Services at ETH Zurich, FHT management, security/privacy specialists, and end users/researchers

Requirements

This position requires a university or applied science degree in Computer Science, informatics, software engineering or a related field/equivalent work experience. You have solid programming skills in C# and experience with Unity. Ideally, you also have experience with databases and working on a large codebase with multiple collaborators. You are interested in open source projects, user interface design, mobile app development incl. management of the app submission process, data management, continuous integration, privacy enhancing technologies and development. You can present technical complex aspects in a concise and easy to understand way. You are looking for a sustainable and meaningful job to support healthcare systems, healthcare workers and individuals in need, i.e. to use rehabilitation technologies to improve neurorehabilitation outcomes in persons with a stroke. You are proactive, communicative and you show personal responsibility, initiative and enjoy technology and interdisciplinary teamwork. You can work autonomously and with a self-starter attitude. Good communication skills orally and in writing are a plus for working in a multicultural environment. Previous experience with health-related data is a plus.

We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents:

A comprehensive CV, cover letter, educational certificates, work testimonial, and contact information of at least two references upon request.

Work location: 1 Create Way, CREATE Tower, Singapore 138602 (NUS University Town)

Further information about the project can be found on our website:

- About FHT, please visit https://fht.ethz.ch/

Remuneration will be offered based on educational qualification and work experience.

The Singapore-ETH-Centre is an equal opportunity and family-friendly employer. All candidates will be evaluated on their merits and qualifications, without regards to gender, race, age or religion.

The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.","Job Description

About JP Morgan

 JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.3 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the worlds’ most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. 

 At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. 

Global Technology (GT) is the technology organization for the Firm, delivering a wide range of information technology products and services, and collaborating with all lines of business to provide high quality service delivery, exceptional project execution and financially disciplined approaches and processes in the most cost effective manner.

Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically  partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.

Global Technology Resilience Management coordinate and manage the Technology Resiliency Program for the Bank, The organization is responsible for:

  • Defining the Policies and Standards for Technology Resiliency for the Bank
  • Defining the KPI’s and metrics that demonstrate adherence to the policy and standards
  • Centralized collation of the Resiliency KPI’s and metrics and visualization to the Banks Lines of Businesses
  • Coordination and execution of large disaster recovery exercises across the Bank’s data centers
  • POC and SME for Technology Resiliency for the Bank on all Regulatory engagements

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain strong business and technology relationships, becoming a trusted partner to these groups
  • Strengthen resiliency awareness amongst stakeholders and to increase resiliency profile in countries and line of business assigned
  • Collaborate with team members and stakeholders on firm mandated, cross line of business, regional audit and risk and control projects
  • Investigation, analysis, documentation, remediation, tracking and reporting of technology resilience risk and control identification and remediation
  • Engage in Solutions and Resilience Architecture to ensure existing and new solutions are designed to be continuously in synch with JPMC policies and standards
  • Proactively monitor Key Risk Parameters to identify non-compliance and assist in remediation to address security, risk and control gaps.
  • Partnering with Compliance and Cyber Technology control function to manage the regulatory response for Technology resiliency and ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
  • Manage and Execute Technology Resilience Test program for critical business locations in the region including results reporting and issue tracking
  • Act as SME for Technology Resiliency issues and lead all resiliency issues in the countries and line of business assigned
  • Drive the execution of the Global/APAC Technology resiliency strategy and drive global transformation projects in the region
  • Represent Technology Resiliency in Country Technology Operating Committee meetings
  • Expertise in Agile and can work with at least one of the common frameworks

Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree or equivalent educational qualification
  • 10 or more years of experience in Technology with emphasis in Technology resiliency
  • Strong Program/ Project Management Skills. Proven leader with successful track record driving Technology Resilience Testing Program from inception to implementation
  • Strong technology based experience with emphasis on development, testing and execution of Technology Resilience Plans
  • Stakeholder engagement skills, including ability to interact with senior levels of management.
  • Proven ability to build strong, cohesive partnerships with the business, operations, technology & other key stakeholders, including external vendor partners, and work effectively in a matrix organization.
  • Strong understanding of Technology Resilience Policies and Standards
  • Good grounding in business continuity disciplines and related practical work experience conducting Technology Resilience Planning, testing, identifying improvements and auditing test results
  • Experience with implementation of project management and Agile methodologies in a large organization
  • Experience with implementation and oversight of technology risk and controls, coordination of activities for audits and assessing an IT controls environment.
  • Proven experience in developing and presenting status reporting and metrics to senior level management 
  • Proven experience in developing and presenting status reporting and metrics to senior level management 
  • Experience in managing regulatory response and requirements required.
  • Familiar with technology regulatory requirements
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to work with diverse personnel and stakeholders in various departments
  • Strong analytical capability and multi-tasking skills
  • Dynamic and independent, resourceful and a self-starter. Strong leadership and communication skills
  • Knowledge of process-focused methodologies for IT related activities (Networks, Cloud, Change Management, Incident Management and Agile Methodologies).
  • Exposure to IT Risk and Process frameworks: COSO, COBIT, NIST, ITIL.
  • PMP, CBCP,CISSP, CISM, CISA preferred

Job Description

Lazada is looking for a highly-driven and experienced Payments Counsel to join our exciting family. You will be responsible for the structuring, development and implementation of payments initiatives and projects, as we continue to add more capabilities to serve our growing user base.

Responsibilities:

  • Working closely with the Regional and Country teams from various functions to structure, develop and implement payments initiatives and projects in various jurisdictions (namely Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and the Philippines);
  • Provide practical advice to internal stakeholders on regulatory requirements, policies, and provide creative solutions to problems;
  • Support and collaborate with the Financial Compliance and AML teams to develop and implement policies and processes to comply with the relevant financial regulations and audits;
  • Manage and negotiate partnership and cooperation agreements with suppliers and service providers;
  • Assist with all legal matters relating to Lazada’s growing payments business.

Job Requirements

  • English and Chinese language capabilities (spoken and written) are highly preferred (but not mandatory).

Lazada is seeking an Affiliate Senior Associate to play a key role within the Singapore - User Growth, Affiliate Team. The Senior Associate will serve as a primary point of contact for existing and new affiliates that are seeking to utilise Lazada Affiliate Program to grow their business, with emphasis on performance in various verticals. 467,tech project manager,/en/job/manager-compliance-systems-implementation-singapore-9349506,9349506,"Manager, Compliance Systems Implementation, Singapore",False,False,,,SGD,Crypto.com,4-Mar-22,False,,,201917495R,,,2001 - 5000 Employees,,,"

About Crypto.com

Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports.

Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks.

With over 3,000 people in offices across the Americas, Europe and Asia, Crypto.com is accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency. Find out more: https://crypto.com

","

About Crypto.com

Crypto.com was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money, data and identity. With over 10+ million users on its platform today, Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services, turning its vision of ""cryptocurrency in every wallet"" into reality, one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3000+ strong team.

For more information, please visit www.crypto.com.

Requirements

We’re looking for a Manager of Implementation to join our growing Compliance Systems & Partners organization. This position can be based in either Hong Kong or Singapore.

In this position you will be responsible for the successful implementation and maintenance of various compliance tools, partners and systems. You will achieve this by utilizing your strong project and program management skills and by establishing close working relationships with the global product and tech teams.

Your responsibilities:

  • Serve as the primary project manager and technical expert for implementations of the various compliance systems and partners initiatives
  • Learn and maintain expert level knowledge of the Crypto.com products and systems, their use by customers, and the process required to get from concept to implementation
  • Manage internal customer expectations, documentation, timelines, deliverables, and needs
  • Ensure all internal project trackers and information is kept up to date
  • Escalate any issues affecting implementations to the appropriate stakeholder for resolution
  • Work with the Head of Partnerships, the Head of Automation and senior management to prioritize and execute partner/vendor integrations, upgrades, automation, redundancy and similar projects
  • Coordinate and facilitate integration work between Crypto.com Engineering, third-party vendors/partners, and compliance personnel to fulfill requirements
  • Provide regular status reports to all stakeholders to accurately communicate the implementation’s progress, including risks, issues, and required adjustments to the plan
  • Design, configure, and test implementations to ensure that requirements have been met
  • Work to continuously improve the implementation process to reduce unnecessary steps, redundant activities, and improve internal/external customer satisfaction
  • Participate as a stakeholder in product improvement activities such as meetings, and testing of proposed changes to the Crypto.com products

This role will give you the opportunity to:

  • Be a big part in defining the vision for the department and also making it happen
  • Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitude
  • Develop in-depth knowledge of Crypto.com customers and products and how we are achieving the goal of Cryptocurrency in Every Wallet

A bit about you:

  • BA/BS degree in a business, technology, or related field
  • 5+ years experience and a proven record of technology project management success in an enterprise environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must have shown significant and consistent career growth as part of prior experience
  • Solid technical skills - expertise in business software as well as consumer tech, mobile apps, etc. - experience in FinTech is considered a strong plus
  • You possess effective organizational skills, self-directed time management, great communication skills, and attention to detail in addition to technical expertise and product knowledge
  • You are able to challenge and influence stakeholders to ensure decisions are well thought out and can be executed from an operations perspective
  • You are comfortable with change, ambiguity, conflict, and dealing with multiple senior stakeholders
  • You are eligible to work in Hong Kong or Singapore without the need for visa sponsorship

Other desirable skills for this role:

  • You have managed implementations of internal or vendor/partner solutions through all levels from concept to launch within a financial institution (FinTech, Bank, Crypto, etc.)
  • You drive results through leadership, people, communication and influence
  • You've worked with product and tech teams on tool implementations
  • You are highly organized, and process / people orientated
Benefits
  • We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.
  • Huge responsibilities from Day 1.
  • Be the owner of your own learning curve.
  • The possibilities are limitless and depend on you
  • You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team
  • You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

468,tech project manager,/en/job/technical-program-manager-gaming-peripherals-9373271,9373271,Technical Program Manager (Gaming Peripherals),False,False,,,SGD,Dell Asia Pte Ltd,11-Mar-22,False,,,198905101W,,,,,,
,"

Responsibilities

Technical Program Manager (Client Peripherals)

With a global remit, our Technical Program Management professionals lead cross-functional product design teams to develop and introduce game-changing new products and solutions. It’s about making sure we offer customers the right features, experience, quality, schedule, cost, continuity of supply, service capability and financials. And when products and solutions are in development, it’s about driving everything from definition through to planning, development and launch across global development centers and multiple lines of business. The team is also crucial to getting shipping right. All in all, it is a fascinating and incredibly varied area.

Join us as a Technical Program Manager on our Displays & Client Peripherals Program Management team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve

As a Technical Program Manager, you will drive the development and implementation of new and exciting product solutions within the extensive range of Displays and Client Peripherals products. Working closely with cross-functional team members, you will manage the entire lifecycle of the assigned product line that is critical to providing great user experience on our Client Peripherals products . From design to delivery.

You will: 

  • Manage end-to-end cross-functional, worldwide core team(s) for the Client Peripherals Line of Business (LOB) on Gaming Peripherals categories, kicks off programs, establishes schedules and drives meetings. Cross Functional Team members can include Services, Engineering, Quality, Product Operations, Marketing, Procurement, Global Operations, Finance, etc.
  • Lead the core team to meet or exceed program objectives (Cost, Quality, Schedule, Features, Fulfillment/Continuity of Supply, Solution delivery across products & service offerings, and Customer Specific Needs).
  • Establish clear objectives and deliverables on programs that support the business strategy for the LOB.
  • Proactively respond to risks and challenges through effective contingency planning and appropriate escalations.
  • Track progress, reports status and drives necessary changes to achieve program objectives.
  • Establish strong working relationships and influences/persuades at the Manager, Director, General Manager, Vice President, and Senior Vice President levels.
  • Communicate clearly, accurately and concisely with required depth, and facilitate effective decision making at core team to leadership business review forums
  • Prepare core product design team and extended teams for internal and external ISO Audits to maintain ISO Corporate Compliance.
  • Participate in non-product or solution cross-LOB initiatives, examples include Process Improvement projects, Digitalization Tools implementation and Resource sizing/planning.
  • Take the first step towards your dream career
  • Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements

  • 10–15 years of program/project management experience in product development processes, product/solution areas or business consulting
  • Strong track record in leading cross functional teams to clearly define the product/solution objectives, deliverables, opportunities, challenges and the required actions to achieve the defined objectives, at regional and global levels 
  • Capability to clearly communicate both technical and business matters, and influence decision makers

Desirable Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job Family: Engineering Tech-Support Program-Management

Job ID: R122834

469,tech project manager,/en/job/operations-lead-9404102,9404102,Operations Lead,False,False,,,SGD,Zenyum Pte. Ltd.,22-Mar-22,False,,,201816647D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

About Zenyum

Zenyum is one of Asia’s largest consumer brands in the making. We channel tech and innovation to transform the dental category from a boring chore to an exciting ritual.

We provide a range of Smile Cosmetics, such as teeth-straightening Invisible Braces (Zenyum Clear), all-natural ingredients toothpaste or the top-selling toothbrush (Zenyum Sonic) on SEAs e-commerce platforms and supermarkets.

Our team is backed by some of the world’s best VCs, including Sequoia and LCatterton. We are a bunch of ambitious folks and our intensity is not for everyone, but we want to show that it’s possible to create a place that you will want to show up for every single morning, and create products that make you smile more.

Join us in our mission to design products and experiences that spread smiles across Asia.

","

About Zenyum

Zenyum is one of Asia’s largest consumer brands in the making. We channel tech and innovation to transform the dental category from a boring chore to an exciting ritual.

We provide a range of Smile Cosmetics, such as teeth-straightening Invisible Braces (Zenyum Clear), all-natural ingredients toothpaste or the top-selling toothbrush (Zenyum Sonic) on SEAs e-commerce platforms and supermarkets.

Our team is backed by some of the world’s best VCs, including Sequoia and LCatterton. We are a bunch of ambitious folks and our intensity is not for everyone, but we want to show that it’s possible to create a place that you will want to show up for every single morning, and create products that make you smile more.

Join us in our mission to design products and experiences that spread smiles across Asia.

About The Role

Zenyum is looking for a knowledgeable and experienced Operations Lead to join the team.

Spearhead our Operations initiatives and play a key role as part of the core and backbone of the organization in the Supply Chain & Logistics function.

Join us and help make Asia Smile More!

Responsibilities

  • Take lead on warehouse operations and management. (inbound, outbound, QC)
  • Be responsible for inventory management over warehouse / consignment store. 
  • Manage vendor operational excellence through data driven metric. (3PL warehouse partner/ logistic partner)
  • Drive cross-functional strategic initiatives to improve supply chain process efficiency and overall cost structure
  • Monitor and analyse SCM KPI and provide relevant reports

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree with minimum 3 years of relevant supply chain management experience, preferably from FMCG/ e-commerce.
  • Warehousing, supply chain, inventory management, finance, vendor and/or project management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects - prioritization, planning and task delegation
  • Experience with OMS and WMS software / ERP system.
  • Experience with analysis tools including Microsoft Excel, SQL, and statistics software is a plus
  • Experience leading a team is a strong plus

470,tech project manager,/en/job/avp-performance-marketing-consumer-banking-group-wd34574-9402977,9402977,"AVP, Performance Marketing, Consumer Banking Group - (WD34574)",False,False,,,USD,DBS Bank Limited,22-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","

Business Function  

As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you.  

Responsibilities

  • The ideal candidate will be accountable for driving digital performance and audience acquisition strategy.

  • Lead the strategy, development, execution and optimization of paid digital efforts, especially Search, Dynamic Creative Optimisation and Programmatic Display.

  • Design digital media campaigns aligned with the Consumer Banking business goals.

  • Work cross-functionally with internal & external stakeholders to optimize campaigns across digital channels (Paid and Owned) and drive business objectives.

  • Own aspects of trafficking, optimization and troubleshooting with a sustained focus on efficiency and scalability.

  • Leverage datasets to identify opportunities to improve performance, reach, and return on investment of digital marketing activities.

  • Identify opportunities for applying new Ad/Mar Tech, Digital products and services to online campaigns.

Requirements

  • At least 6-7 years' experience in digital media and/or digital marketing role.

  • Experience in mobile app marketing preferred.

  • Passionate about online advertising, analytics and driving measurable results.

  • Strong grasp of Ad Tech (DSP, Google CM, Search 360, Ad serving and more) and Mobile Measurement Partners (such as Appsflyer).

  • Ability to share/present complex results of analysis in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action.

  • Fast Learner - Can achieve power-user status on multiple tools quickly.

  • Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Passion for the digital space from gaming, mobile, social networking, online videos, digital sparks, and everything in-between.

  • Strong team player with excellent analytical and project management skills.

Apply Now 

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

","
  • Salary : S$3000 – S$3,500 + Bonus
  • Working days: Monday - Friday
  • Working Duration: 2 years
  • Working Location: Ang Mo Kio
Job description
  • Assist tax manager in preparatory work relating to tax compliance, planning and advisory, audit defense, tax reporting and tax operational projects with key focus in South Asia countries – including the following:
  • Assist tax manager in the review of tax compliance work products mainly involving corporate income tax returns and where required, may also include the review of transfer pricing documentation and GST compliance deliverables
  • Assist in the preparation of deliverables and workplans pertaining to tax planning and advisory work
  • Assist in the preparation of tax query or audit letters in response to tax authorities
  • Assist in the preparation and review of tax reporting submissions (e.g. cash tax reporting, quarterly tax reporting, provision to return, etc.)
  • Other tax ad hoc projects as assigned from time to time
Job requirements
  • Minimum 2 to 3 years of professional work experience in Taxation
  • Good knowledge in Singapore tax regulations and some knowledge on Indonesia and Malaysia tax regimes
  • Possess Big 4 experience is an advantage
  • Ability to work independently and meet tight timelines
  • Self-starter and willingness to learn
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to liaise with various teams
What we can offer
  • Wholistic project and tax as a learning experience
  • Experience in high tech automotive company – rapidly growing
  • Inclusive company culture and people
  • Good progression and recognition
  • Opportunities in other areas of finance where possible
Interested candidate who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume.

473,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-manager-packaging-engineering-apac.-9412865,9412865,Senior Manager Packaging Engineering APAC.,False,False,,,SGD,Johnson & Johnson Pte Ltd,25-Mar-22,False,,,197402104W,,,1001 - 2000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column3: Caring for the world, one person at a time, inspires and unites the people of Johnson & Johnson. We embrace innovation—bringing ideas, products and services to life to advance the health and well-being of people around the world. We believe in collaboration, and that has led to breakthrough after breakthrough, from medical miracles that have changed lives, to the simple consumer products that make every day a little better. Our over 125,000 employees in 60 countries are united in a common mission: To help people everywhere live longer, healthier, happier lives.

column1:
","
  • be a Subject Matter Expert on Packaging Technology for the Consumer Health manufacturing network in APAC (internal & external manufacturing)
  • scout, test and scale new packaging technologies for maximum business and customer benefit, following robust stage gates
  • intake of customer & business needs to define innovation focus
  • scout, screen and validate potential fit-for-purpose technical solutions
  • lead “test to proof of concept”, business case development and initial deployment of new technical solutions in collaboration with regional technical teams
  • support scaling in the region once viability and value has been confirmed
  • adopt digital capabilities, intelligent and high-tech automation solutions, smart inspection, advanced process control modeling and machine learning
  • collaborate with R&D Global Packaging Experts to align equipment, process and packaging material innovation in new product development, applying Design for Manufacturability guidelines, as an example in the field of sustainability
  • engage in internal and external benchmarking and identify opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation
  • build networks and partnerships with OEMs, Universities, Institutes, Consultants, etc. in the relevant industry
  • leverage internal and external expertise and apply principles of Knowledge Management to drive innovative solutions in engineering support, project delivery and/or technical field
  • be responsible for the development, administration, updating, training and application of technical platforms, standards, guidelines and best practices for Packaging Engineering activities
  • assist the development of site-specific technology roadmaps incorporating state of the art and fit-for-purpose packaging technology solutions
  • be the Preferred “go-to” expert for complex issue resolution for the Packaging Technology Platform
  • lead & participate in Community of Practice in own area(s) of expertise(s)
  • build necessary technical capabilities for the future across our plant network

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of 8-10 years of experience is required
  • Experience of driving Manufacturing enabled Innovations through Engineering is required
  • Ability to drive multiple complex technical projects and to modify existing processes to increase efficiencies and yields is required.
  • Highly developed expertise in one or more core areas, such as digital applications (IIoT), Intelligent Automation, Packaging Engineering. Overall knowledge of all related Packaging Technology areas (Equipment and Packaging Materials) is required.
  • Track record of successful Project- / Program technical leadership including lean design, construction, commissioning, and qualification from concept through operations, cost control and scheduling
  • Experienced stakeholder management, both internal and external is required.
  • High capability to collaborate in teams, both cross-functional / cross-country is required.
  • Strong Customer mindset is required
  • Strong communication and influencing skills are required

Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements, and other customary conditions and approvals.

Should you accept this position, it is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you would be an employee of a new entity within New Consumer Health.

Primary Location

Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-

Organization

Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435)

Job Function

Engineering

Requisition ID

2206017825W

  • Salary : S$3000 – S$3,500 + Bonus
  • Working days: Monday - Friday
  • Working Duration: 2 years
  • Working Location: Ang Mo Kio
Job description
  • Assist tax manager in preparatory work relating to tax compliance, planning and advisory, audit defense, tax reporting and tax operational projects with key focus in South Asia countries – including the following:
  • Assist tax manager in the review of tax compliance work products mainly involving corporate income tax returns and where required, may also include the review of transfer pricing documentation and GST compliance deliverables
  • Assist in the preparation of deliverables and workplans pertaining to tax planning and advisory work
  • Assist in the preparation of tax query or audit letters in response to tax authorities
  • Assist in the preparation and review of tax reporting submissions (e.g. cash tax reporting, quarterly tax reporting, provision to return, etc.)
  • Other tax ad hoc projects as assigned from time to time
Job requirements
  • Minimum 2 to 3 years of professional work experience in Taxation
  • Good knowledge in Singapore tax regulations and some knowledge on Indonesia and Malaysia tax regimes
  • Possess Big 4 experience is an advantage
  • Ability to work independently and meet tight timelines
  • Self-starter and willingness to learn
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to liaise with various teams
  •  
What we can offer
  • Wholistic project and tax as a learning experience
  • Experience in high tech automotive company – rapidly growing
  • Inclusive company culture and people
  • Good progression and recognition
  • Opportunities in other areas of finance where possible
Interested candidate who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume.

Attention to Shao Ze & Job Title
Email Address: Shaoze_Ng@Persolkelly.com
Contact number: 9154 2691

Reg No: R21103145 (Ng Shao Ze)  
EA License No.: 01C4394

We have expanded our business operations into Asia with offices in Singapore, Thailand, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Taiwan, Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines and India. We are a team of highly motivated and professional members who challenge to build the company as Asia’s No. 1.","
Job Title: Innovation Researcher (Japanese Speaking) 
Ref ID: 32448
【Our Client】
Our client, an expanding Japanese insurance services company is currently hiring for the role of Innovation Researcher to join their dynamic team! They are currently expanding their business in ASEAN countries.
【What will you be working on】
  • Conducting research on Financial/Healthcare related innovations and Insurtech in Singapore/Asia, and reporting to management and Japan headquarters.
  • Building and maintaining connections with financial institutions, tech companies, incubators, VC, and other players in the innovation space.
  • Participating in meetings and seminars held in Singapore and overseas to obtain the latest information on Financial/Healthcare related innovations and Insurtech, as well as to expand the company's network.
  • Planning and participating in Proof of Concept (PoC) and promoting PoC through smooth communication with related parties (partners, Japan headquarters, group companies, etc.).
  • Ad hoc Admin duties.
【What they are offering】
  • Basic Salary Upto S$7,000!
  • AWS
  • Variable Bonus (Depending on Company and Individual performance)
  • Annual Leave (14 days)
  • Medical Leave (14 days)
  • Transportation Allowance
  • Medical Benefit
【What they're looking for】
  • Minimum Bachelor's Degree in any field.
  • Highly proficient in inputting and outputting Financial/Healthcare related innovations and Insurtech information.
  • Proficient in Japanese(JLPT N2 or above) to translate documents and communicate with native Japanese colleague.
  • Proficient in MS Office.
  • Experience in Financial/Healthcare related innovations or the Insurtech industry is an advantage.
  • Market research experience in ASEAN market is an advantage.
  • Preferably possess the excellent proficiency in project management. (Mainly progress management and promotion of PoC).
======================
For interested applicants, kindly email your latest resume (with stated job position and Ref No.) to: weilian@reeracoen.sg with following information in order for us to process your application faster:
1. Reason for leaving past and present employment(s)
2. Expected Salary
3. Availability date
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Registration No.: R21100464 (Chen Weilian)
Recruitment License : 12C5051

column1: 476,tech project manager,/en/job/vp-regional-trade-finance-project-test-lead-institutional-banking-group-operations-technology-and-operations-wd34408-9402974,9402974,"VP, Regional Trade Finance Project Test Lead, Institutional Banking Group Operations, Technology and Operations - (WD34408)",False,False,,,USD,DBS Bank Limited,22-Mar-22,False,,,196800306E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","

Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Job Role

The Regional Trade Project Test Lead is an individual who has strong trade finance knowledge, the ability to lead the testing team to complete the testing of end-to-end trade finance channels, ecosystem related projects in the region. The incumbent will be working closely with GTS and engage all stakeholders in Operations, Business and Technology to evaluate the end-to-end testing requirements and impact assessment to Trade Operations. He/She will be responsible to track the project's testing requirements, activities from inception to production deployment. Post project-go live, the monitoring of issues and resolution; and work closely with tech teams to resolve production issues.

Responsibilities

  • Leading the Regional Trade testing projects, collaborate with GTS, Ops and Tech and all other stakeholders to identify and prioritize critical project milestones and deliverables.

  • Strong in trade finance knowledge, experience is trade finance operations is a plus.

  • Develop project test and resource plans identifying schedules, specifications, risks and contingency plan.

  • Ability to handle multiple large scale and/or moderately complex projects deliverables concurrently.

  • Track and monitor production issues, engaging trade ops and technology for resolution.

  • Maintain a good mix of skillsets in the test team and keep the morale of the team high.

  • Constantly reviewing and improving the testing process and with ability to organise, escalate and unblock project issues.

Requirements

  • More than 12 years' and strong project management experience with a proven track record (waterfall or agile model).

  • Experienced in managing teams of more than ten staff, and strong in resource management.

  • Have knowledge on Trade systems and experience as system end user will be advantageous.

  • Have proven experience in requirements gathering, functional testing and conducting training to end-user.

  • Expertise in analysing customer requirements and translating the same into user stories, test strategy and test cases.

  • Strong presentation skill and stakeholder management skill.

  • Possess strong written and verbal communications skills.

  • Demonstrates good work ethics and is able to adapt to changes and is able to deliver within tight timelines.

  • Highly detail oriented, organized and organizationally agile individual preferred.

  • Ability to operate self-sufficiently under strategic direction.

  • Willingness to adapt to dynamic circumstances.

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

column2:
Certis is a leading advanced integrated security organisation that develops and delivers multi-disciplinary security and integrated services. Our design-for-purpose solutions are led by an extensive track record of running operations and design thinking to drive operational efficiencies and deliver business-critical outcomes for our customers. Headquartered in Singapore, our international presence that extends to Australia, Hong Kong, Macau, China and the Middle East.","
About Certis

We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thriving.

We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make the world safer, smarter and better.

Life at Certis

If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a 'job', we would love to hear from you.

At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you're looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solve, we want you to bring your ideas to the table.

We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow - the perfect place for you to grow your career!

Duties & Responsibilities

Candidate will lead a team of IT programme professionals in the field of mobile product development.

  • Develop product roadmap, architecture and development plans according to business objective
  • Work with both internal and external stakeholders, vendors and team members in delivering business outcome
  • Maintain high quality standards within the development team by adopting best practices in DevOps environment
  • Address any issues related to ICT security, performance, and system availability
  • Maintain awareness of industry trends, emerging threats, and technologies to understand the risks and opportunities presented to the organization
Skills & Experience
  • Degree in IT related discipline.
  • Experience and track record in end-to-end mobile development project management
  • Experience in OutSystems, Flutter, .Net or other mainstream tech stack is essential.
  • At least eight (8) years of experience in IT development.
  • Knowledge in cloud-based platforms (e.g. AWS)
Recognition & Reward

What you can expect from us:

  • Work on projects for world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency
  • Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education
  • Community volunteering opportunities
  • A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance.

Certis is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our Compass values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.

column1: 478,tech project manager,/en/job/regional-trucking-portfolio-strategy-procurement-vp-transport-9420505,9420505,"Regional Trucking Portfolio Strategy & Procurement, VP-Transport",False,False,,,SGD,LAZADA Singapore Pte Ltd,28-Mar-22,False,,,201403859E,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: Launched in 2012, Lazada is the number one online shopping and selling destination in Southeast Asia – present in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. As the pioneer of the eCommerce ecosystem in Southeast Asia, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: With over 80 million SKUs available, Lazada offers the widest range of products in categories ranging from consumer electronics to household goods, toys, fashion, sports equipment and groceries. Focused on delivering an excellent customer experience, it offers multiple payment methods including cash-on-delivery, comprehensive customer care and hassle-free returns through its own first- and last-mile delivery arm supported by 80+ logistics partners.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Lazada Group is majority owned by Alibaba Group Holding Limited (NYSE:BABA).","

Job Description

The role

  • Lazada Logistics is seeking a Vice President to lead our Trucking Strategy & Procurement Team, which will directly contribute to shaping the Logistics landscape in South East Asia.
  • This position will be based in Singapore, reporting to the regional Head of 3PL Management. You will be part of a team responsible for the Transport budget (and driving all cost saving initiatives), for defining LAZADA’s Logistic Portfolio strategy, and rolling out complex end-to-end logistics transformation initiatives with process & technology as backbone across Lazada’s ventures across South East Asia.

Key Responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • As lead of Trucking Portfolio Strategy & Procurement’ you are the gatekeeper for our Line Haul Shuttle (LHS) strategy. You will be responsible for ensuring that we work with the right partners across ventures and that we have a clear strategy with each of them in order to deliver on the overall LAZADA logistic strategy.
  • You will have to ongoingly make sure that we have the right governance & control, that we have a clear strategy on how to balance cost & performance, with the aim of always providing the best seller & customer experience.
  • You will be a key owner of the transport budget and responsible for monitoring all financial indicators for the transport team - including Cost initiatives, Invoice reconciliation, COD reconciliation and claims.

Your role will be focusing on 3 main pillars: LHS Portfolio Strategy, LHS Procurement, LHS Governance:

  • LHS portfolio Strategy: You will be responsible for designing a specific roadmap & cost reduction target in order to support the overall logistic strategy. You will ensure that each LHS has a clear growth strategy and that they operate at the right level of quality & cost. You will be responsible to drive market research & GAP assessments, in order to fully master the LHS landscape and understand areas of optimizations (ie. New line hauls, opening of new sorts for existing line haul, etc)
  • LHS Procurement: You will be the main driver of the yearly contract renegotiations. You will need to upgrade our existing contract to reflect evolution in our operations, as well as to better serve LAZADA’s strategic focus. You will need to define the overall governance strategy, as well as to support country teams to define a clear negotiation strategy per line haul, as well as clear cost negotiation target. You will also be directly owning the negotiation with our major regional strategic 3PLs
  • LHS Governance: Set up a strong 3PL governance, with clear milestones throughout the year (ie QBR, Contract Update, etc) to exchange on performance and making that strategies are aligned. You will also continuously work on developing new tech solutions (via 3PL Portal) to facilitate exchange, reconciliation and performance transparency between Laz and 3PLs.

Job Requirements

  • You have a Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Supply Chain Management or relevant disciplines
  • You have 10+ years of professional experience, ideally most of which is spent in procurement, sales or retail
  • You have strong project management skills, with experience in managing cross functional (Ops to Finance) and complex multi-stakeholder projects
  • You are a critical thinker and leader, with strong communication and negotiation skills. You have a track record of strong influencing skills, ability to drive change, meet deadlines, and inspire confidence among senior leadership
  • Strong analytical skills, familiarity with contracts and highly proficient in Excel
  • Proficiency in Bahasa and/or Mandarin are bonus.

column1: 479,tech project manager,/en/job/digital-channels-business-analyst-%7C-2100029b-9352142,9352142,Digital Channels Business Analyst | (2100029B),False,False,,,SGD,OCBC Bank (Singapore),6-Mar-22,False,,30 days,193200032W,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: The OCBC Bank group of businesses comprises a family of companies owned by Singapore’s longest-established local bank.

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. Since the time of our founders, we have always understood the financial needs of our customers and developed financial solutions that meet their needs.

To address increasingly diverse needs across different communities and geographies, OCBC Bank has expanded and acquired businesses beyond the realm of commercial banking. OCBC Bank has been ranked by Bloomberg Markets magazine as the World's Strongest Bank for two years, 2011 and 2012.

column1:
","
Responsibilities
  • The Digital Channels Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the Digital Product Owner, Front Office/Other department SMEs on the business side and IT Application development teams on the technology side.
  • The focus of this role will be to analyse business and functional requirements for multiple digital projects or change requests.
  • The incumbent is expected to collaborate with Product Owner, Project Manager/Scrum Master, Delivery Manager, Tech Lead, Developers, Architect teams and Quality Assurance teams to ensure the requirements provided by the business are delivered through the IT application implementations.
  • As an IT BA on the implementation of key business and technology change initiatives within the Private Banking process and Digital banking domains, this role will be responsible for participating in all scrum ceremonies and deliveries through regular releases.
  • Work closely with the Business Lead/PO and/or User representatives to ensure that solution is designed to meet the business needs.
  • Work with the various business stakeholders and supporting technology teams to aid in solutioning and submission of the business paper for sponsor approval.
  • Work with the technology development team and/or solution architects to deliver prototypes (when relevant) and evaluate together with business users to align expectations and to lock down requirements.
  • Coordinating the cross-functional team members and activities for business work streams or entire change and technology implementation initiatives while ensuring all business requirements are addressed within functional specifications and communicate the progress to the project manager/scrum master and/or functional stream leads accordinglySupport the test managers in the review of test artifacts like test plan, test scenarios, test cases and data.
  • Assist in coordinating prioritization of business requirements throughout the solution development lifecycle.
  • Provide business analysis and business-related issue resolution to all cross-functional teams throughout the product development lifecycle.
  • Maintain a working knowledge of business processes and solution design. Perform gap analysis where known business requirements are not met
  • Elicit, document and communicate non-functional requirements to ensure that the delivered IT systems provide business value.
Qualifications
  • Bachelor Degree in technology, mathematical or financial disciplines.
  • At least 13 years of experience working as Business Analyst or Solution Manager in a similar discipline.
  • Must have knowledge and experience in investment portfolio reporting or at least exposure to various financial instruments such as stocks, bonds, options, derivatives.
  • Candidate must have a strong acumen in business process analysis, requirements elicitation and Documentation.
  • Must understand Private Bank front, middle and back office transaction processing and related business processes.
  • Experience in writing user stories, use cases, use case modeling, workflows, business processes, business requirements document, functional specifications document and user requirements.
  • Understanding of data and information structures in an IT system environment including data modeling and design appreciation.
  • Experience in agile or iterative analysis, design and delivery methods.
  • Experience in the discipline of System development life cycle (SDLC) process, especially in solutioning, analysis, testing and implementation phases.
  • Good interpersonal skills and excellent communication skills, able to handle multiple projects and priorities concurrently and manage business expectations accordingly.

In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. column1:
","
About the Transformation Group
Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the 'World's Best Bank' (Euromoney 2018, 2019 and 2020). Our approach is a combination of both science and art. We immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our innovation pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)!
Job Purpose
As the Enterprise Agile Coach, you will have a proven track-record of transforming large enterprises (both Business and IT) to adopt Agile and enable a continuous flow of value by embedding Agile friendly operating models and supporting enablers (e.g. Agile demand management & funding).You will be comfortable with dealing with C-level stakeholders to articulate, influence and coach how we build, and the way we build to address organisational challenges and pain points.In an effort to help deliver business value faster through expert timely intervention and capability development, the role is to enable teams to high performance across the platforms and solve problems using DBS Agile Way of Working by removing systemic blockers.
Key Accountabilities
The position is accountable for driving enterprise agility through org design, the uplifting capability of the DBS group teams in Agile values, principles and practices for the planning and execution of business value in relation to coaching, mentoring & educating and has the following accountabilities:Being a trusted advisor to senior management:
  • Coach and develop all levels of staff on how to implement and sustain the Agile principles & practices
  • Lead by example and seen as a role model of Agile values, principles and practices
  • Establish a position as an expert in delivery that cultivates business value & risk mitigation
  • Engage senior management and promote business strategies and solutions which drive an Agile culture and make value visible
  • Leverage DBS Group resources to develop a robust-closed-loop policy / strategy deployment process that will strengthen the understanding of strategic direction and provide the goals required to cultivate a business value driven culture
Execute the Divisional execution of Platform (IT & Business) strategy for customer  & employee benefit
  • Plan an approach to incorporate Agile WoW the strategic oversight of the customers' technology investment and assets
  • Collaborate to ensure engagement and support for Agile strategy
  • Work closely with other divisions (e.g. Technology, Finance, Risk etc,) to deliver quality outcomes
  • Demonstrate a high level of strategic and tactical business acumen and industry knowledge in order to facilitate solution development taking into account expertise in Agile and other related disciplines.
  • Cultivate 'how' to be value-driven and flexible in the way we think and behave - not just 'do' such us stand ups  and iterations
Implement the Divisional strategy
  • Provide thought leadership to ensure successful design and implementation of delivery strategies that align with business unit, corporate goals and strategies
  • Provide coaching advice to leaders at all levels in analysing business value and delivering well considered solutions
  • Act as a trusted adviser to the business by driving innovative thinking with uncertainty & complex bodies of work
  • Collaborate with other Divisions to ensure long term alignment to enterprise strategy
Planning and Monitoring
  • Collaborate with internal business customers and IT departments to ensure engagement and support for strategies
  • Illustrate why Agile is in line with the nature of knowledge work by highlighting day to day inefficiencies that result from applying traditional mind-set to knowledge work
  • Support the business in identification of business benefit and value, tangible and intangible, for initiatives raised.
  • Work with leadership teams to gather business data, perform business analysis and identify key drivers for success
  • Drive efficiencies within DBS through proactive sponsorship of improvement initiatives
  • Balance between the needs of classical project management like answering the question 'What will I get, when and for how much 'without jeopardising the agility of the project and its ability to welcome change
Develop the capability of others through effective mentoring, coaching, professional development
  • Develop a culture that supports team engagement and high performance
  • Deliver Just In Time training on Agile to DBS employees at all levels
  • Develop and deliver Job Instruction Training (using the Tell - Show - Do method) to other Agile practitioners within DBS (including partners)
  • Provide coaching, mentoring and professional development opportunities for those being coached and mentored on Agile WoW
  • Teach organisation to understand the difference between the Agile mindset ('Being Agile) and Agile Practices ('Doing Agile') and the characteristics needed in individuals, teams and organisations to embrace, promote & manifest the mindset of agility
  • Create a team environment which is seen as an attractive career destination for internal and external candidates
  • Support internal Guilds/Community of Practices
Job Duties & Responsibilities
  • Develop and define enterprise business agility roadmap, set the business agility agenda and implementation plan with clear business outcomes, e.g., business value delivery and time to market
  • Define and implement metrics and performance indicators around business agility that will drive the success of the initiative
  • Engage senior management and stakeholders to secure buy-in and support for business agility agenda and participate in forums to propagate and promote business agility
  • Bridge business and technology by building a business agility culture that unifies, manages and resolves conflicts
  • Understand enterprise technology landscape and drive business agility agenda that leverages on tech partnership
  • Provide insight and guidance on enterprise/portfolio/project tech strategy that will support business agility agenda
  • Identify and manage issues and risks, escalate issues as needed, and provide regular progress updates to senior management
Required Experience
  • You will have a track-record of establishing the models for commercials, governance, funding, organisational change and underlying delivery organisation, necessary to achieve an effective Agile enterprise;
  • Proven hands on experience working with Agile & Lean Software development practices, and change management are essential i.e. able to do what you teach/coach others;
  • At least  years' experience in Agile Coaching roles, where you have transformed from traditional ways-of-working, and/ or recovered a troubled Agile transformation at the enterprise level;
  • At least 7 years' experience in Agile software development methodologies, values, principles and practices;
  • At least 7 years' experience in coaching, team building and group facilitation
  • At least 7 years' experience in Scrum, SAFE, DevOps, Kanban, Lean and of Systems Thinking;
  • Strong customer focus: skilled ability to interpret and analyse customer requirements; influence design solutions in-line with Corporate and IT strategy; utilise established internal and external networks to promote innovative solutions for customers;
  • Strong people leadership experience and a proven track record in leading high performing teams;
  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills;
  • Expert relationship management skills; ability to communicate well with diverse stakeholder groups through internal consultation & facilitation;
  • Ability to work independently;
  • Skilled ability to contribute to and understand strategic perspectives, and translate to tactical actions;
  • Flexibility and resilience in responding to multiple changing priorities, and comfortable handling complexity and uncertainty;
  • Systematic and disciplined approach to planning, organising, decision making and delegation;
  • Skilled ability to work in a dynamic leadership team, contributing to the overall goals of the group;
  • Skilled ability to perform synthesis and analysis working at the conceptual level for problem solving.
Essential Qualifications:
  • University degree in Business, Information Technology or related discipline (Mandatory) or equivalent industry related experience
  • Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
Desired Qualifications:
  • Industry Association or Discipline Association Membership well regarded.
  • ICAgile certification
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

","
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services.

Business Banking

We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure.

Job Responsibilities

Assessing benefits, define capabilities, ensure delivery in appropriate phases
Define the customer experience, end-to-end customer journeys/processes for the platforms
Develop business justifications, drive product vision, establish roll-out roadmap and implement accordingly, working closely with key stakeholders:


1.PD/ TB to make banking simpler for our customers
2.GTO on roadmap planning for tech build to ensure capabilities built within timeline & cost; Drive theimplementation of the digital capabilities
3.Sales to understand their pain points so as to create greater value for our internal users
Define pre-agreed performance matrix required to be reviewed on an ongoing basis

Driving local implementation efforts

  • Ensure local team structure is in place to drive platform delivery & post-implementation BAU operations(managing content, drive local usage, etc.)
  • Ensure countries to drive the execution of platform's development/delivery activities in accordance to agreed timeline

Performing ongoing reviews for content enhancement

  • Establish roadmap of local contents, features on an annual basis
  • Review of VoC to identify opportunities to enhance experience/ features for customers

Post-implementation monitoring against pre-agreed metrics

  • Ensure countries' post-implementation adoption/support monitoring based on defined performance matrix
  • Adoption monitoring of MIS and perform communication on performance matrix on an ongoing basis, e.g.no. of downloads, active/ dormant users), usability of features, penetration, etc.
Job Requirements
  • 3-10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience with Bachelor's degree.
  • Experience as a business lead/ product owner in driving digital self-serve, engagement and transact capabilities implementation
  • Strong business domain knowledge in business/ Small Medium Enterprise (SME) banking or related financial industry (E.g. Fintech, etc.)
  • Good understanding of the business/ SME banking landscape in terms of products, services and typical banking applications
  • Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals
  • Experienced in handling regional level programmes/ projects
  • Display strong analytical, problem solving, communication and creative skills
  • Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications, influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills
  • Resourceful team player, passionate, diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
