column1: 510,tech project manager,/en/job/content-writer-9417824,9417824,Content Writer,False,False,,,SGD,Parcel Perform Pte Ltd,27-Mar-22,False,,,201308254C,,,1 - 50 Employees,,,"<div>

Parcel Perform is the leading carrier-independent parcel tracking SaaS platform globally. With over 600 carriers integrated, we serve thousands of customers worldwide and track millions of parcels annually. Parcel Perform helps businesses improve their post-purchase customer experience, reduce customer service costs and optimize their logistics management.

We are a dynamic, fast-growing team that’s excited about e-commerce and logistics and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology. Join us and our journey to drive the growth in the e-commerce market.
","

What is an excellent product with no one knowing about it? Let the world know about us! Parcel Perform is looking for an amazing Content Writer to help us spread the word!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Ideate, research, and create creative content into omni-channel formats such as blog posts, case studies, e-books, social copies, bite-size videos.
  • Develop and promote content that drives leads and nurtures prospects through the funnel
  • Use SEO best practices to produce compelling content that attracts organic traffic, increases awareness, and establishes our product as a leading product in the brand
  • Support the development of the voice and tone for business, and champion its implementation company-wide
  • Be able to think visually and have a strong grasp of conceptualizing design elements, product mockups and infographics to support the content pipeline
  • Work cross-functionally with our design team to bring your content pieces to life
  • Research relevant topics to stay up to date with industry trends to support content creation
  • Stay informed on the content marketing, digital marketing, e-commerce trends
  • Ensure projects are completed on schedule with high quality

ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCES

  • 2-4 years relevant work experience in content writing, SEO, editorial or with a creative agency
  • Excellent writing abilities with a penchant for storytelling. If you have 1-2 writing samples you can show us; we’ll love to see them!
  • Prior experience executing key visuals for campaigns such as videos, online website design, social collaterals and so on
  • Have experience managing a company’s social media account to grow our strong Linkedin following as well as expand our growth on other platforms
  • Prior knowledge or interest in of logistics, supply chain, or ecommerce industries
  • Technical aptitude for understanding and marketing B2B SaaS solutions
  • Able to adjust tone of writing that aligns with brand messaging, narrative and tone of voice
  • Strong project management skills and experience working successfully with cross-functional teams

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN!

  • The opportunity to to work in a fast-growing and data-first company revolutionizing the e-commerce logistics industry
  • Kick-start your career with an expanding marketing team full of young vibrant teammates
  • You will be the needle of success on the growth of a global product that will become a key platform behind successful e-commerce logistics operations worldwide.
  • Work in an international team environment and be the critical driver of our content initiatives. You will work closely within the Marketing team and cross-functionally with other departments.
  • Dive into a nurturing environment and watch your talents and skills development as you develop work experience in a fast growing tech company.
  • This is your entry ticket into being part of the Parcel Perform journey, where you will work alongside people around the world that share the same passion and dedication for growth.

ABOUT US

Parcel Perform is the leading delivery experience platform. It enables modern e-commerce enterprises to create unique end-to-end customer journeys and optimize logistics operations with powerful data integrations, parcel tracking, delivery notifications and logistics performance reports in real-time.

Parcel Perform's scalable SaaS platform executes more than 100M parcel updates daily and integrates with 700+ carriers. The data-first company is pioneering innovative ML / AI use cases in e-commerce logistics including its 'Date of Arrival' prediction engine. Parcel Perform is the partner of choice for top brands, marketplaces and carriers across all major verticals globally.

In August 2021, we successfully secured US$20M in Series A investments led by blue-chip investors such as Cambridge Capital and SoftBank Ventures Asia. Parcel Perform believes in growing our dynamic and diverse team with the best talent to assist our global expansion. We have a myriad of talented individuals who have assisted in helping us achieve profitability. Join us while we grow in technology, talent and teamwork.

For more information, please visit www.parcelperform.com

HR Generalist & Administration      

  • Assist the HR Manager in the full spectrum of HR operations across the group of companies, i.e. Recruitment, Payroll, Learning & Development, Compensation & Benefits, Performance Management etc
  • Manage end to end recruitment process from sourcing to job offer and facilitate new hires onboarding

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Minimum of 3 year’s industry experience working within security installations, servicing, or design.
  • Relevant degree or Certifications in Electronic Engineering.
  • Lenel or CCure training or experience preferred.
DUTIES
  • Work within the project delivery teams to engineer physical layout and system security designs or mark-ups
  • Attend break fix call, perform troubleshooting and provide report as and when requested by the team.
  • Review of system design prior to installation works and highlighting of any apparent
  • technical, functional or compatibility issues with the design package while highlighting any deviation to client’s standards.
  • Manage all on site trades both external and internal ensuring that all security dependencies are aligned and completed on time to enable the project to be
  • delivered successfully as planned for the clients FDOB (First Day of Business).
  • Manage and execute onsite changes to the physical installation to meet Client and
  • company standards as indicated within the agreed design package.
  • Communicate effectively while on and off-site with clients, client project teams and
  • the company Project team when required, discussing problems, clarifying
  • situations, identifying, and explaining solutions.
  • Communicate effectively with our Local Service Partner (LSP) on all projects to
  • establish their assigned engineering proof of concept (POC).
  • Discuss with LSP project details, requirements, identified problems, clarify updates,
  • identify, and explain clear solutions.
  • In-depth testing and troubleshooting of access control and IP network video
  • systems.
  • Basic population of programming sheets at the discretion of the assigned applicationengineer.
  • Population of commissioning sheets, site plans, mark-up drawings, and co-ordinate
  • with the assigned application engineers in the commissioning process of client
  • systems.
  • Commission systems and be responsible for testing and handover of the finished
  • installation to a satisfactory conclusion in line with the security design package.
  • Complete commissioning and hand over documentation with punch list items to the
  • project manager to ensure all elements are driven to completion for a clean, error
  • free operating security system.
  • Follow assigned projects to final adjustments, test, troubleshoot and rectify as part
  • of the commissioning and signoff process.
  • Ensure on-site clients are trained in the use of the installed system.
  • Supervise and manage members of the installation team for both internal
  • technicians and local service partners engineering teams while working on site.
  • Verify the installation quality meets as a minimum the standards as defined within
  • the security design package and in line with company best practice guidelines for

  • Communicate progress on jobs and provide regular status reports to the Project

column1: 513,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-industry-development-officer-%7C-assistant-industry-development-manager-9338507,9338507,Senior Industry Development Officer | Assistant Industry Development Manager,False,False,,,SGD,"Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)",2-Mar-22,False,,30 days,T08GB0002C,,,501 - 1000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: The Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) is Singapore's lead public sector agency that spearheads economic oriented research to advance scientific discovery and develop innovative technology. Through open innovation, we collaborate with our partners in both the public and private sectors to benefit society.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: As a Science and Technology Organisation, A*STAR bridges the gap between academia and industry. Our research creates economic growth and jobs for Singapore, and enhances lives by contributing to societal benefits such as improving outcomes in healthcare, urban living, and sustainability.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
We play a key role in nurturing and developing a diversity of talent and leaders in our Agency and 19 biomedical sciences and physical sciences research institutes, the wider research community and industry.","
Senior Industry Development Officer / Assistant Industry Development Manager (PE COI), SIMTech
Job Description:
SIMTech is looking for a candidate with Engineering and business development background to join the Industry Development Office (IDO) to take up the role of Senior Industry Development Officer / Assistant Industry Development Manager.  The successful candidate will cover the following tasks:
  • Engage companies to understand industry needs and technology requirements, and to collate the industry intelligence for IDO.
  •  Formulate industry engagement plans and initiatives to establish collaborations and tech transfers to the companies.
  • Formulate and initiate training courses for the industry.
  • Organize industry sharing events such as seminars, roundtable discussions, workshops to outreach to the industry.
  • Develop marketing collaterals, newsletters, brochures for the various industry initiatives.
  • Take charge of the business and legal documentations for project, including liaising with companies and alignment with internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain good relationships with the industry partners and take charge of all business aspect in the on-going industry projects.
Job Requirement:
  • Degree in Engineering or Science.
  • With 2 years’ experience in Engineering or Business Development role.
  • Good customer relationship and management skills.
  • Willing to take on required tasks beyond the job description
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

514,tech project manager,/en/job/project-engineer-9344676,9344676,Project Engineer,False,False,3000,4000,SGD,Smardt Chillers,19-Mar-22,False,,,201221598W,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"

SMARDT is the world's largest manufacturer of oil-free centrifugal chillers. With operations in Singapore, Australia, Canada, USA, Germany and China, SMARDT's revolutionary high efficiency machines are driving rapid growth across key world markets. At the cutting edge of innovation, SMARDT Singapore is accelerating product development efforts that deliver substantial energy savings for our customers.

","

Project Engineer

We are looking for a Project Engineer to coordinate projects from the delivery of the equipment through site, start-up, commissioning and subsequently during warranty period support.

Responsibilities

The Project Engineer will be responsible for coordinating with different stakeholders such as Sales, Service and Engineering teams, contractors and commissioning agents in order to produce and/or review the different deliverables listed below:

·       Coordinate equipment delivery to customer sites

·       Schedule start-up activities

·       Participate in pre-commissioning meetings

·       Oversee all start-up, commissioning and final integrated test activities.

·       Keep track of any site issues and open items

·       Act as first point of contact for site issues which arise during the warranty period

·       Coordinate with Service team any warranty visits and parts during the warranty period

·       Review start-up and commissioning reports from Service Technicians

·       Prepare final project documentation

Qualifications

·       Diploma’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent

·       2 to 3 years of experience in project management in HVAC or construction industry

·       Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to establish and maintain relationships

·       Excellent communication skills as demonstrated by the ability to make presentations and to write reports, and business correspondence.

column2: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE LTD is a subsidiary of Micron Technology, Inc.  (‘Micron’).

column3: Micron is a global leader in the semiconductor industry. For more than 35 years, Micron has dedicated itself to collaborating with customers and partners to engineer technology that drives innovation and transforms what’s possible.  Micron offers the industry’s broadest portfolio of silicon-to-semiconductor memory solutions—starting with foundational DRAM, NAND, and NOR Flash memory, and extending to SSDs, modules, MCPs, HMC, and other semiconductor systems. This best-in-class technology powers leading-edge computing, consumer, enterprise server and storage, networking, embedded, automotive, industrial, and mobile products.

Micron is strategically located in Singapore to efficiently and effectively accommodate its global customers, while also serving as the base of the company’s worldwide operations. Singapore is home to Micron’s largest manufacturing footprint with three fabrication facilities, an upcoming fabrication facility expansion, and a test and assembly facility. Its presence in Singapore also includes a technology center supporting innovation across the company and a sales and marketing office that offers all Micron memory products to our regional customers.

Micron provides opportunities for team members’ personal and career development through challenging work assignments, training and educational programs. We hire, train, develop, and educate a workforce that is competent in performing job expectations by providing orientation, job specific training, professional certifications, external training and various continuous learning opportunities.
As Micron enters into a new era of growth, its presence in Singapore plays an important role in its worldwide operations and overall success.

  • Develop scope of work for the provision of provide outsourced services

  • Provide project management to meet the budget and schedule on multiple projects

Our Client, in the Manufacturing Industry located in the East has opening for Plant Engineer.
Responsibilities
General Equipment Maintenance
  • Administer and resolve all technical maintenance issues.
  • Monitors plant equipment operation and performance, adjusting to performance specifications, as necessary, and performing routine preventative maintenance
  • Maintain an efficient and safe working environment for all employees
  • Maintain logs, reports, work requests, or other records of work performed in plant
  • Propose improvements to prevent re-occurrence of trouble, target set not more than 3 times similar incident
  • Co-ordinate with all contractors/suppliers for in-house periodic maintenance including plant facilities and repairs
  • Provides remote support when necessary
Spare Parts Inventory Control
  • Maintain and update a spare parts inventory listing
  • Monitor the spare parts usage and determine a safety stock level
  • Inform/purchase the commonly used spare parts / equipment / accessories in a timely manner so as to minimize machine downtime
Other Operational Duties
  • Technical writing skills and maintain proper documentations
  • Review and recommend improvements of all SOP procedures and perform troubleshoot on all plant activities and resolve all issues
  • Initiate and participate in continuous improvement projects
  • As assigned by Managers.
Requirements
  • Diploma/ Degree in engineering discipline with mminimum 3-5 year of experiences in manufacturing industries with technical background.
  • This position required hands-on experience.
  • Strong organizational, analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Lead a group of technicians
  • PLC/MHI/Motion control Skills / robotics knowledge will be advantages.
Qualified or interested candidates, kindly apply to us in
the FOLLOWING FORMAT to facilitate the short listing process;
To: Kyan.hou@capitalhrm.com.sg
Attachment of CV’s in MSWORD FORMAT
Resumes please INCLUDE:
  • Personal Particulars with Recent Photograph
  • Education background
  • Work experiences in point forms
  • All Reasons for leaving
  • Current and Expected salary
  • Date of availability / Notice Period
**We regret that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.
Your Profile will be kept in our database for more career opportunities.
We wish you all the best in your job search.

Kyan Hou Shenglong
Reg No: R1435754
EA No: 15C7695

Job Descriptions
  • Implementation of business plans and support for key strategic initiatives for High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Responsible for OPEX cost recovery through securing new stakeholder contributions
  • Develop and plan for strategic infrastructure including software and hardward for HPC
  • Drive, organized and support outreach activities to Institutes of Higher Learning and Government agencies
  • Meet KPIs in terms of number of industry related projects supported by NSCC
  • Management of operational Marketing and customer relationship activities
  • Build and maintain key customer relationship with various governmental agencies, Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs), Research Institutes and commercial organizations to ensure that NSCC meets its target
  • Present to C-Level Executives on NSCC’s solutions and services that meet customers’ need
  • Identify new opportunities, negotiates and closes engagements
  • Assist in pricing solution/services
  • Forecast, track and ensure targets and KPIs are met by team
  • Maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions and knowledge of customers
  • Work closely with internal teams to meet customer needs and to increase user base and projects
  • Develop clear processes and systems for new business
  • Attend industry functions and provide feedback and information on market and trends
  • Oversee and liaise with legal team with the various governmental agencies, Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs), Research Institutes and commercial organizations
  • Oversee and liaise with both internal and external teams on the various project agreements
  • Project management and management of strategic projects
Job Requirements
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT or Business Administration from a reputable university. Master Degree Preferred
  • About 5-7 years of Administrative, Business Development, Sales, Marketing or relevant working experience
  • At least 3 years of experience in delivering integrated solutioning and consultancy for end to end projects
  • Good knowledge software development and solution architecture skillsets are highly advantageous
  • Excellent negotiation skills, proven track record of successfully pitching for new business and engagements.
  • Highly organized and motivated
  • Excellent networking, strong interpersonal, presentation and writing skills
  • Experience in working with senior management to align business development strategies and solutions
  • Good team player who must be able to adapt quickly and work independently when needed
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Has strong interest in technology knowledge in Supercomputing, AI, Quantum Computing and etc.
  • Experience in the government, IT and High Tech sector will be an advantage

524,tech project manager,/en/job/retail-manager-singapore-9404396,9404396,"Retail Manager, Singapore",False,False,,,SGD,PANDORA Jewelry Singapore Pte Ltd,22-Mar-22,False,,,201533579E,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"

About Pandora

Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 7,400 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 26,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated sales of DKK 19.0 billion (EUR 2.5 billion) in 2020.

We are immensely proud of our values: We Dream, We Dare, We Care, We Deliver.

","

Main purpose of the role:

The Retail Manager, Singapore primary responsibility is to grow the business by developing the network within Singapore and effectively managing and developing the Regional Sales Managers in their defined region.

The Retail Manager implements sales programs by developing field sales action plans; maintaining sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors.

The Retail Manager supports all Owned & Operated stores within Singapore.

Key accountabilities:

  • Create and execute business plans and sales strategy for the short and long term development for Singapore.
  • Responsible for the performance and development of the Singapore Regional Sales Managers through successful recruitment, selection, onboarding, training, counselling, coaching, management, appraisal and discipline of the team.
  • Strong financial acumen to support the organisation in setting sales and KPI goals, budgets and key objectives.
  • Develop strategy to support Singapore Regional Sales Managers in growing and strengthening the store network within Singapore. including new network opportunities.
  • Monitor results at Division, region and group level and develop/implement action plans as required.
  • Ensure Singapore meets company visual merchandising standards.
  • Influence, coach and build relationships with dealers and store management.
  • Maintain accurate and organised information and reporting at the store, territory and region level through weekly, monthly and quarterly business recaps and reviews.
  • Development and delivery of high impact content at Regional and National meetings.
  • Ability to build relationships and support cross functional capabilities in knowledge and action.
  • Control expenses to meet budget guidelines.

General:

  • Use the PANDORA Life values We Care, We Dare, We Dream, & We Deliver to guide how you work and behave towards people internally and externally.
  • Take reasonable care of your own safety and the safety of others and participate in health and safety training.
  • Perform ad hoc duties as required including covering for colleagues during absence.

Qualifications & Experience:  

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration and/or Commerce with minimum 5 years’ experience in hands-on retail sales or store operation and 3 years in managerial level.

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Experience and successful track record in a similar role at a similar level (i.e. state or national)
  • Experience and skill around forecasting, budgeting and reporting
  • Experience around rostering, stock optimisation, payments and territory management
  • Computer literate, intermediate proficiency in MS Office Suite including Excel
  • Experience with visual merchandising
  • Staff management skills including recruitment, succession planning, coaching, training, mentoring, performance management
  • Strong sales, negotiation, influencing and merchant skills
  • High level of business acumen and experience around strategic planning
  • PowerPoint, Excel, and generally tech savvy

Attributes:

  • Demonstrates the ability to provide clear direction, setting appropriate standards of behaviour, delegating work fairly and providing development opportunities and coaching when appropriate/required.
  • Displays superior communication skills, listens proactively, consults, supports and cares for others and recognises and rewards great performance, achievements and ‘wins’ in an appropriate and consistent manner.
  • Consistently demonstrates the ability to set clearly defined objectives, plan well, manage time effectively and work to deadlines.
  • Is able to analyse numerical and verbal data, probes for further information when required, makes rational judgements and produces workable solutions to a range of problems.
  • Is commercially savvy, keeping up to date with competitor information and market trends, identifies business opportunities and demonstrates financial awareness around costs, profit, loss and adding value.
  • Displays enthusiasm around tackling demanding goals, working hard, embracing development strategies and training opportunities required to achieve progression and career goals.
  • Is customer focused.

We are looking forward to welcoming you!

Interested applicants, please click Apply Now with your detailed resume and expected salary.

Please understand that due to large number of applications, we regret that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

525,tech project manager,/en/job/vice-president-project-management-officer-transformation-office-9364261,9364261,"Vice President, Project Management Officer, Transformation Office",False,False,,,SGD,United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB),9-Mar-22,False,,30 days,193500026Z,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 . Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
UOB GWB Transformation Office is the central GWB function that plans, mans, executes and implements GWB strategic and transformative initiatives. We collaborate and work with all GWB Business Functions and enterprise wide functions to deliver the initiatives.   GWB Transformation office is mand under GWB Chief Operating Officer, covering all GWB businesses, products and markets globally. The team works with senior stakehers across the Bank offering project manment support, operational excellence as well as overall GWB business strategy implementation.
Job Responsibilities
The individual would be leading and ensuring successful delivery strategic projects under GWB Transformation office to. The projects vary from strategic initiatives in the regions, productivity initiatives to digital transformation.   The primary responsibility will be leading project executions, stakeher alignment as well as to be a thought partner to the manment team. These activities aim to drive strong organizational collaboration, executable strategy/ solutions between various functions in GWB and the Bank globally.   The individual will be responsible for the full Project Lifecycle core activities such as  
  • Manment for planning and execution of key project phases: discovery, design and implementation
  • Project issues identification, discussion and resolution at the project working groups and escalation to manment, where appropriate
  • Owning formulating business analysis, operating model and problem solving for the respective projects representing the team in certain discussions
  • Ongoing project manment and execution for key strategic initiatives by working closely with other GWB functions such as Cover, Products along with Group HR, Compliance, Tech Ops, Finance, Risk across all UOB markets
  • Supporting GWB Heads and COO in building GWB strategy
Job Requirements
Given the function position at the forefront of change within GWB, you will have the opportunity to work on the most important initiatives across GWB. The work is project-based and broad ranging, spanning across divisions and geographies.    You will work closely with the seniors within UOB, owning and executing your projects. We are focused on growing talent, providing learning opportunities and exposure to grow your technical expertise, domain knowledge and visibility within UOB.  
Job Qualifications
We are looking for an individual with project manment or banking process experience or consulting experience. The candidate is also expected to have sufficient financial services knowledge with at least 8 of experience with a reputable firm and/or transformation division of leading financial institutions.  
  • 8 of experience in consulting, banking or other financial institutions with experiences in project manment or banking process or consulting
  • Strong and proven project manment capabilities, with the ability to man both our internal teams and coordinate with our client partners
  • A presence with excellent and persuasive oral and written communication skills 
  • Strong relationship skills: the ability to influence manment and the ability to work across all levels of an organization
  • Self-driven achiever with ability to work effectively 
  • Flexibility and proven ability to diagnose and resolve complex issues
  • Excellent analytical skills both in terms of logic of reasoning and analysis of numerical and financial data
  • Demonstrated value for diversity, excellence and integrity in all that is done
  • Working knowledge of Excel (business analysis), MS PowerPoint (slide writing)
  • Proficiency in / Bahasa Indonesia/ Thai will be an advant (in order to build and maintain good relationship with / Bahasa Indonesia/ Thai speaking counterparts)
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's , race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

Senior Content Specialist, ASEAN
  • Contract up to end July 2022 with a possibility of conversion to perm afterwards
  • Work location: WFH until further notice / Central
Our Client
  • Our client is one of the leading IT enterprise cloud computing company
  • Ranked as Fortune ""100 Best Companies to work for""
The Opportunity
We are looking for a self-motivated, analytical and talented content specialist to join our client's customer marketing team.
You'll be instrumental in planning, content strategy, SEO, editing, publishing, operations, and process development. You'll spend your days working with writers, editors, marketers, our social, digital & creative teams, and other internal & external stakeholders and agencies to make sure that every piece of content speaks to its audience and represents the best in Asia.
Your Background
  • Familiarity with Adobe Experience Manager and Google Analytics is a priority, and an understanding of HTML, CSS, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Datorama, WordPress and Kapost (or other CMS programs) is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of the CRM world and holds a pivotal role in it is key. (If you just had to Google CRM, this job is not for you.)
  • This is a role for someone with a keen eye for creating content that serves a purpose. We're looking for a team-mate who shares our passion for technology's role in our changing world. We aim to show how tech affects businesses and customer relationships.
  • This position requires a team player with excellent stakeholder management skills who is a disciplined editor, as well as a calm, detail-orientated project manager who can work fast, with accuracy.
  • Someone who can bring fun elements to their daily work will be a good fit for the team, and this will be to their advantage in our longer term hybrid office + work from home environment.
Interested parties please click ""Apply Now"" or contact May Anne Ramos (EA Reg no: R1110127) at mayanne.ramos@peoplebank.asia for more information.
Peoplebank Singapore Pte Ltd, EA Licence Number: 08C5248.

column1: 528,tech project manager,/en/job/it-project-intermediary-manager-9334184,9334184,IT Project Intermediary Manager,False,False,,,SGD,Citibank N.A.,2-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200309485K,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Citi is more than a global financial services company. It’s an engine for progress. Join us, and you’ll have the chance to get involved in progress in all its shapes and forms, right across the world. From the micro to the macro, from Australia to Zambia, the work we do has real positive impact. Wherever you are and whatever you do, progress starts here.

Mission: Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. We are Citi, the global bank – an institution connecting millions of people across hundreds of countries and cities.

column1:
","
The IT Project Tech Lead is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.
Responsibilities:
  • Execute and deliver infrastructure projects and programs in a matrix environment.
  • Coordinate with Infrastructure work streams and business partners to achieve project objectives.
  • Define project or program schedules and plans and socialize with project stakehers.
  • Juggle and prioritize multiple deliverables across multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Maintain and track project financials against budget, and occasionally coordinate funding approval.
  • Lead project meetings via ndas, publish meeting notes and track action items.
  • Man Stakeher communications including status reporting.
  • Proactive risk mitigation and change manment.
  • Issue manment and escalation.
  • Team building.
  • Interfaces with senior project staff and client senior manment teams regarding status of projects.
  • Recommends and oversees process improvements. Has considerable business impact through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes and industry standards.
  • Provides expertise in area and an advanced level of understanding of the principles of IT project leadership.
  • Possesses a comprehensive understanding of how own area and others (i.e., architecture or infrastructure) collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business objectives.
  • Persuades and influences others through and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
  • 3-5 of relevant experience
  • An understanding of key Systems Development Lifecycle as well as LEAN concepts and techniques.
  • Strong leadership skills.
  • Ability to multi-task and man multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong planning skills.
  • Project financial manment skills.
  • Strong influencing, facilitation and partnering skills.
  • Strong communications, both verbal and written.
  • Presentation skills.
  • Negotiation and conflict manment skills.
  • Skilled with MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and project.
  • Langu skills in addition to English are an advant.
  • Ability to man virtual teams
Education:
  • Bachelor’s/University or equivalent experience

column2: J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

column2:
The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.","

Responsibilities

  • Part of APAC Branches CIB Markets Technology SG team responsible for technology project planning, management and implementation for CIB market in country local owned projects.
  • To work collaboratively in SE Asia Branches teams to support local business demands and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals.
  • Implement continuous process improvement, including but not limited to policy, procedures, and production monitoring
  • Work with ISM Information Security Manager to ensure proper control and management of local applications/tools
  • Provide application production support and liaise with regional teams, vendors and regulator for application service delivery
  • Support local regulatory system setup and other regulatory requirements from CIB Tech perspective
  • Automation – leading and driving the identification and implementation of automation opportunities across the application and infrastructure environment
  • Keep strong partnership with different business stakeholders to ensure understanding of business requirement, working out project scope/plan and prioritizing time and resource.
  • Keep strong linkage with regional / global teams to leverage good practice, processes, functions and resources.
  • Follow JPMC firm standard to ensure proper control and management of onshore applications/tools.
  • Assesses risks and controls including server hygiene, vulnerability & security management and recognizing gaps in processes and escalating actions plan.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

  • 4 years working in application development, preferably in financial services
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and/or Engineering
  • Technology development/project management/delivery experience, preferably within Banking or Securities financial services sector.
  • Experience of working with internal audit teams and external regulators
  • High level of independence, energy and integrity
  • Tactical thinking and strong analytical skills with high and fast learning capability.
  • Good mindset of risk management and cyber security.
  • Good team player and collaboration.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, team player, with an ability to remain calm under pressure while prioritizing workloads to meet business expectations.
  • Knowledge and experience in the following:
  • Operating System (Window Server, Redhat Linux)
  • Database skills (Oracle, MSSQL) including SQL and Stored Procedures
  • Scripting –powershell, html, sftp, phyton
  • Web Server skills – IIS, Tomcat, Apache
  • Monitoring Tools Geneos – able develop and contribute to new monitoring technique
  • Networking / Infrastructure working knowledge is a plus

About Us

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

About the Team

Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You'll develop solutions that help the bank provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk, and extend liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

column1: 530,tech project manager,/en/job/30074-settlements-product-engineer-187052-9402506,9402506,30074 - Settlements Product Engineer - #187052,False,False,,,SGD,Credit Suisse (Singapore) Limited,22-Mar-22,False,,30 days,197702363D,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column2: The Credit Suisse Group purpose is at the core of everything we do. It underpins the value we create and has powered our progress for more than 160 years. It captures the essence of 'why' we exist as an organization. It motivates us when we come to work every day and serves as our North Star when we make decisions. Ultimately, it serves to define who we are and what we should be doing for our employees, clients and stakeholders.

Our strategy builds on Credit Suisse's core strengths: our position as a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities and our strong presence in our home market of Switzerland. We seek to follow a balanced approach to wealth management, aiming to capitalize on both the large pool of wealth within mature markets as well as the significant growth in wealth in Asia Pacific and other emerging markets.

We serve our clients through three regionally focused divisions: Swiss Universal Bank, International Wealth Management and Asia Pacific. These regional businesses are supported by an integrated global Investment Bank. Our Asset Management business is managed as a separate division, emphasizing the strategic importance of the asset management business for the bank and its clients. ","

Your field of responsibility

Technical Lead responsible for delivery of the application components in the Securities & Settlements domain within GOSD. You will be expected to

  • Be proficient in Technical stack/tools such as Perl/Python, Unix, Linux scripting, Sybase DB; JIRA, Maven, SharePoint
  • Experienced in leading and managing environment configurations for AD & QA teams
  • System Analyst qualities required to create and maintain application architectures, flow diagrams & data architecture
  • Ability to dive into existing application code base to resolve functionality
  • Effectively communicate with project managers, business analysts and Tech Leads
  • Utilize the latest tools to finish the steps of SDLC stages
  • Develop solutions for portfolio of applications in the respective domain area in the Securities Settlements space
  • Collaborate with globally diverse developers (CS, contractor and external vendors) including leadership of offshore and outsourced development teams regardless of time zones
  • Required to work in a complex and dynamic environment
  • Work embedded with well-established vendor team and ensure that key Domain Expertise is retained in CS
  • Clearly communicate complex technical solutions to non-technical partners across multiple regions
  • Ensure high-quality component-level design and implementation of strategic components through the entire software development process using multiple delivery models
  • Adhere to standard coding practices and deliver defect free product
  • Plan and conduct successful unit, performance, system, integration and acceptance testing, ensuring applications are able to meet stringent functional and non-functional requirements

Your future colleagues

Group CIO Chief Operating Officer (COO) team provides the leadership and operational processes necessary to deliver financial discipline and operating efficiency. It ensures that GCIO has the proper operational policies, controls, and governance, administrative and reporting procedures, communications strategy, and human capital programs in place to effectively grow the organization. It accomplishes this through a process driven approach guided by the strategic objectives of Group CIO.

The department values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values.

Your skills and experience

To excel in this role, you should possess:

  • You have Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering with equivalent experience.
  • You have minimum 8-10 years of IT experience. Investment Banking Operations IT background ideal.
  • You have extensive expertise in distributed technologies required – Perl, SQL, Scripting, Sybase DB experience; Unix/Linux experience is required. Sound knowledge of version control & debugging tools
  • You have experience in SQL* Plus, PL/SQL and stored procedures with various databases especially Oracle on Unix/Linux
  • UNIX/LINUX Scripts (SHELL/BASH) and Sybase database knowledge is required
  • You have knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle
  • 2 or more years of Financial Industry/banking experience
  • You have good communication skills oral and written
  • Good analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills
  • You are diligent and dedicated team-player with good interpersonal skills and multitasking abilities.
  • Knowledge on Open Source tools used in development process (like Subversion, Git, STAF)
  • Ability to analyze business problems and devise effective IT solutions.
  • Extensive practical software development experience with a “best-practices” mind-set
  • Outstanding incident diagnosing skills/Incident management
  • Comfortable working across a number of different technologies
  • Be able to work in global teams and adapt to an agile environment.
  • Previous experience in handling Front Office, Middle office and/or Back office Book-of-Work & as well as production support including business user communications is helpful
  • Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

Your new employer

Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training.

We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. We will consider flexible working opportunities where possible. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.

column1: 531,tech project manager,/en/job/tech-support-vendor-manager-%5Bsea%5D.-9426364,9426364,Tech Support Vendor Manager [SEA].`,False,False,,,SGD,Apple Inc.,30-Mar-22,False,,30 days,198903166R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2: We’re a diverse collection of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what’s possible to help us all do what we love in new ways. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with the Mac, iPhone, iPad and Apple Watch, as well as with services, including iTunes, the App Store, Apple Music and Apple Pay. And the same innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Every new product we invent, service we create or store we open is the result of people working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","

The AppleCare Vendor Management team is seeking a Vendor Manager (VM) to drive the operational performance of outsource contact center partners!

An AppleCare Vendor Manager leads Outsourced Support Vendors to deliver on the Apple brand promise and promotes a relentless pursuit of outstanding customer service experiences.

This role is responsible for timely day-to-day completion of business requirements, cascading information, and setting the strategic direction of their Vendor/Partner in alignment with AppleCare business priorities and Credo. Vendor Managers monitor and steer performance, develop, and tenaciously influence the achievement of AppleCare objectives in an efficient and procedurally compliant manner. Vendor Managers balance the best interest of AppleCare with a mutually beneficial business outcome for the Vendor/Partner through business strategy, execution of tactical programs, innovative projects, and accountability. Focus on outstanding customer service, operational execution and accountability for achieving goals, and the cultivation of an unquestioning business relationship are the cornerstones of effective Vendor Management.

This position is based on-site in Singapore.

Key Qualifications

  • Extensive contact center experience of five years or more.
  • Ability to interpret complex analysis and business information.
  • Effective negotiation skills and the ability to inspire change are also critical attributes.
  • Strong leadership, general eye for business, influence and negotiation skills.

Description

LEADERSHIP EXPECTATIONS

  • Facilitate and encourage creativity that enables and empowers Vendors to build strategic plans and operational execution to successfully accomplish AppleCare business goals and meet or exceed detailed key performance indicators.
  • Cultivate relationships and guidelines that prepare Vendor/Partners to lead their business and support their organizations to be successful in achieving current and future AppleCare goals.
  • Communicate in a concise, clear and consistent manner. Represent their results to senior leaders.
  • Partner well and share overarching vision and goals with other AppleCare Vendor/Partner support groups.
  • Champion motivating environments that support development, and be a motivation for innovation within Vendor organizations.
  • Be responsible for the direction of their Supplier(s) and counsel on plans/strategies to drive performance. Hold sites and suppliers accountable for all key defined AppleCare business priorities.
  • Dedicated emphasis on employee engagement that lives up to Apple culture and embodies the Apple Support Credo.
  • Evolve performance through utilization of business levers such as analytics, reporting, workforce management, talent management, quality, industry expertise.
  • Ability to lead and collaborate with resources (people, time, support sources) to avoid pitfalls and get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities and creatively overcome obstacles to accomplish a goal.

OPERATIONAL EXPECTATIONS

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

",[],Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Casual (e.g. T-shirts)', 'Weekdays–Saturday–Sunday']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9426364&advertisement_id=9424735&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

The AppleCare Vendor Management team is seeking a Vendor Manager (VM) to drive the operational performance of outsource contact center partners!

An AppleCare Vendor Manager leads Outsourced Support Vendors to deliver on the Apple brand promise and promotes a relentless pursuit of outstanding customer service experiences.

This role is responsible for timely day-to-day completion of business requirements, cascading information, and setting the strategic direction of their Vendor/Partner in alignment with AppleCare business priorities and Credo. Vendor Managers monitor and steer performance, develop, and tenaciously influence the achievement of AppleCare objectives in an efficient and procedurally compliant manner. Vendor Managers balance the best interest of AppleCare with a mutually beneficial business outcome for the Vendor/Partner through business strategy, execution of tactical programs, innovative projects, and accountability. Focus on outstanding customer service, operational execution and accountability for achieving goals, and the cultivation of an unquestioning business relationship are the cornerstones of effective Vendor Management.

This position is based on-site in Singapore.

Key Qualifications

  • Extensive contact center experience of five years or more.
  • Ability to interpret complex analysis and business information.
  • Effective negotiation skills and the ability to inspire change are also critical attributes.
  • Strong leadership, general eye for business, influence and negotiation skills.

Description

LEADERSHIP EXPECTATIONS

  • Facilitate and encourage creativity that enables and empowers Vendors to build strategic plans and operational execution to successfully accomplish AppleCare business goals and meet or exceed detailed key performance indicators.
  • Cultivate relationships and guidelines that prepare Vendor/Partners to lead their business and support their organizations to be successful in achieving current and future AppleCare goals.
  • Communicate in a concise, clear and consistent manner. Represent their results to senior leaders.
  • Partner well and share overarching vision and goals with other AppleCare Vendor/Partner support groups.
  • Champion motivating environments that support development, and be a motivation for innovation within Vendor organizations.
  • Be responsible for the direction of their Supplier(s) and counsel on plans/strategies to drive performance. Hold sites and suppliers accountable for all key defined AppleCare business priorities.
  • Dedicated emphasis on employee engagement that lives up to Apple culture and embodies the Apple Support Credo.
  • Evolve performance through utilization of business levers such as analytics, reporting, workforce management, talent management, quality, industry expertise.
  • Ability to lead and collaborate with resources (people, time, support sources) to avoid pitfalls and get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities and creatively overcome obstacles to accomplish a goal.

OPERATIONAL EXPECTATIONS

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

536,tech project manager,/en/job/kol-marketing-9343001,9343001,KOL Marketing,False,False,4000,5500,USD,NETEASE INTERACTIVE ENTERTAINMENT PTE.LTD.,18-Mar-22,False,,,201931099Z,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"

NetEase Games is the online games division of NetEase, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTES; HKEX: 9999). NetEase Games is one of the largest game developers worldwide by size and revenue, which reached US$9,855.7 million in 2021. Over the years, NetEase Games has always been focused on developing high quality contents and entertaining gamers worldwide.

NetEase Games also partners with other industry leaders including Blizzard Entertainment, Mojang AB (a Microsoft subsidiary) and other global game developers.

For our office located in Singapore, we are in charge of game publishing mainly in Southeast Asia areas and global gaming investments. We closely work with our game development and marketing teams to publish various games from both our own game studios and external game studios. Here at NetEase Games, we offer you a creative environment for your bright ideas to come true. We are looking for talented people who are passionate about games, and eager to bring the best quality games to the world. Join us and work as a team together with integrity, collaboration and responsibility.

Follow Us on Social Media:

Facebook: https://facebook.com/NetEaseOfficial

Twitter: https://twitter.com/NetEase_EN

Official Website: https://www.neteasegames.com/

","

Job Responsibilities

* Have a good connection with MCNs;

* Have good experience in social media marketing;

* Be able to complete the influencer marketing content strategy and implementation;

* Set communication goals and responsible for the communication results;

Job requirements

* A deep understanding of NetEase’s core values and vision.

* 5 or more years of Public Relations, social, digital marketing experience in games, tech and/or entertainment industry.

* 2 or more years of social media and content marketing focused program oversight.

* Clever writing and speaking skills in English, excellent communication and project management skills.

* Team management experience and ability to lead and inspire a team of direct reports in a collaborative manner.

* Good judgment in navigating and resolving sensitive situations online.

* Ability to work with remote/international teams to meet joint goals.

* Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations, Marketing, Journalism, a related field, or equivalent.

column1: 539,tech project manager,/en/job/finance-project-manager-tech-co.-9338999,9338999,Finance Project Manager (Tech Co.),False,False,7000,10700,SGD,Adecco Personnel Pte Ltd.,3-Mar-22,False,,,198500164K,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column3: The Adecco Group is the world’s leading HR solutions partner. We provide more than 700,000 people with permanent and flexible employment every day. With more than 34,000 employees in 60 countries, we transform the world of work one job at a time.

Adecco is Singapore’s leading HR solutions partner. For more than 34 years, Adecco provides a comprehensive array of HR solutions and consulting services which includes mid to staff level talent acquisition, contract recruitment, outsourcing, field sales and marketing as well as payroll services. Our teams are specialized in accounting & finance, administration, banking, engineering, healthcare & life sciences, human resources, IT&T, retail & events, sales & marketing, supply chain & logistics and other corporate functions.
Speak with an Adecco consultant to find out how we may be able to help you in your career and life goals.

column1:
","

The Opportunity

  • This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the leading multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products and mobile payments platform. It is an opportunity for a Finance Project Manager to join the team in their team
  • Office Location: Central
  • Great benefits

The company is a leading multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and mobile payments platform. It is a fast-growing company that is a market-leader across its region and exponentially gained international recognition in the Tech industry.

The Talent

  • Bachelor's degree
  • At least 8-10 years of working experience in related field
  • Excellent people communication skills
  • Past experiences in Finance related systems change projects and/or regulatory change projects is preferred
  • Good time and task management skills to deliver under time pressure

Key responsibilities:

  • Monitor Finance projects timelines and costs,
  • Coordinate with stakeholders within and across the bank, and external stakeholders such as consultants and advisors
  • Escalate and highlight key risks and matters affecting the Finance build projects to the Financial Controller and the CFO.

Next Steps

  • Drop your resume and contact us to follow-up, or send your resume to sarah.ng@adecco.com
  • Email Topic: Apply Finance Project Manager (Tech Co.)
  • All shortlisted candidates will be contacted

column2:

That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","

The AppleCare Vendor Management team is seeking a Vendor Manager (VM) to drive the operational performance of outsource contact center partners!

An AppleCare Vendor Manager leads Outsourced Support Vendors to deliver on the Apple brand promise and promotes a relentless pursuit of outstanding customer service experiences.

This role is responsible for timely day-to-day completion of business requirements, cascading information, and setting the strategic direction of their Vendor/Partner in alignment with AppleCare business priorities and Credo. Vendor Managers monitor and steer performance, develop, and tenaciously influence the achievement of AppleCare objectives in an efficient and procedurally compliant manner. Vendor Managers balance the best interest of AppleCare with a mutually beneficial business outcome for the Vendor/Partner through business strategy, execution of tactical programs, innovative projects, and accountability. Focus on outstanding customer service, operational execution and accountability for achieving goals, and the cultivation of an unquestioning business relationship are the cornerstones of effective Vendor Management.

This position is based on-site in Singapore.

Key Qualifications

  • Extensive contact center experience of five years or more.
  • Ability to interpret complex analysis and business information.
  • Effective negotiation skills and the ability to inspire change are also critical attributes.
  • Strong leadership, general eye for business, influence and negotiation skills.

Description

LEADERSHIP EXPECTATIONS

  • Facilitate and encourage creativity that enables and empowers Vendors to build strategic plans and operational execution to successfully accomplish AppleCare business goals and meet or exceed detailed key performance indicators.
  • Cultivate relationships and guidelines that prepare Vendor/Partners to lead their business and support their organizations to be successful in achieving current and future AppleCare goals.
  • Communicate in a concise, clear and consistent manner. Represent their results to senior leaders.
  • Partner well and share overarching vision and goals with other AppleCare Vendor/Partner support groups.
  • Champion motivating environments that support development, and be a motivation for innovation within Vendor organizations.
  • Be responsible for the direction of their Supplier(s) and counsel on plans/strategies to drive performance. Hold sites and suppliers accountable for all key defined AppleCare business priorities.
  • Dedicated emphasis on employee engagement that lives up to Apple culture and embodies the Apple Support Credo.
  • Evolve performance through utilization of business levers such as analytics, reporting, workforce management, talent management, quality, industry expertise.
  • Ability to lead and collaborate with resources (people, time, support sources) to avoid pitfalls and get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities and creatively overcome obstacles to accomplish a goal.

OPERATIONAL EXPECTATIONS

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

",[],Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Casual (e.g. T-shirts)', 'Weekdays–Saturday–Sunday']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9426614&advertisement_id=9424985&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg
