column1: 542,tech project manager,/en/job/first-vp-project-manager-customer-digital-channels-9339295,9339295,"First VP, Project Manager, Customer Digital Channels",False,False,,,SGD,United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB),3-Mar-22,False,,30 days,193500026Z,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column2: United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

column3: In 1935, amid the economic uncertainties following the Great Depression, UOB opened its doors to offer banking services for the merchant community in Singapore.

Since then, UOB has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions. Today, UOB is rated among the world’s top banks: ‘Aa1’ by Moody’s and ‘AA-’ by Standard & Poor’s and Fitch Ratings.

Generations of UOB employees for the past 80 years have carried through the entrepreneurial spirit, focus on long-term value creation and an unwavering commitment to do what is right for our customers and our colleagues.
At UOB, we believe in being a responsible financial services provider and we are committed to making a difference in the lives of our stakeholders and in the communities in which we operate.

Just as we are dedicated to helping our customers manage their finances wisely and grow their businesses, UOB is steadfast in our support of social development, particularly in the areas of art, children and education.

column1:
","
First VP, Project Manager, Customer Digital Channels, Group Retail & Channels T&O
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Project Management and Governance
  • Manage a portfolio of complex initiatives that impact one or multiple lines of business
  • Manage all aspects of project and program engagement from planning, external vendor engagement, resources planning and budget, change management, risks and issues
  • Prepare overall implementation plan taking inputs from all stakeholders including technology, business, operations, regulators, etc., and co-ordinate execution by respective owners
  • Ensure that projects are proceeding according to scope, schedule, budget and quality standards
  • Manage the day-to-day project activities, including chairing project management working committee meetings and facilitating steering committee meetings
  • Monitor, track and control outcomes to resolve issues, conflicts, dependencies and critical path deliverables
Stakeholder Management
  • Manage project stakeholders, e.g., escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes
  • Manage relationships with stakeholders and ensure teams work in a collaborative environment
  • Manage stakeholders expectations through governance processes
  • Deliver appropriate and effective executive level communication
  • Understand interdependencies between technology, operations and business needs
  • Provide status reporting regarding milestones, deliverable, dependencies, communicating across leadership and business stakeholders
Job Requirements
Basic Qualifications
  • 8+ years of experience in IT Project Management
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum environment and framework, e.g. sprint planning, sprint review, backlog grooming, etc
  • Minimum 8-10 years of retail/digital banking experience, and exposure to banking systems, products, operations, processes
Preferred Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline
  • Experienced of having direct responsibility for project with budget size of $10 to $20 million
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II Certification is preferred
  • Exposure to Lean/Six Sigma or process re-engineering
  • Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals
Other Experience/skills:
  • Executive level communication skills with excellent written and verbal communication
  • Experience in full end-to-end project management in a lead role
  • Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions in the bank
  • Technical domain expertise is an advantage, but at minimum is tech-savvy
Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

544,tech project manager,/en/job/smb-sales-senior-associate-services-singapore-9346074,9346074,SMB Sales Senior Associate (Services) - Singapore,False,False,2000,2800,SGD,Carousell Pte Ltd,19-Mar-22,False,,,201300296D,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"

 Carousell is a classifieds marketplace that makes selling as easy as taking a photo, buying as simple as chatting. Launched in August 2012, Carousell began in Singapore and is now one of the world's largest and fastest growing marketplaces. We have market presence in eight markets (Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Taiwan, Myanmar, and Vietnam) and three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India.

Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, and Sequoia Capital. The Carousell marketplace has a diverse range of products across a variety of categories, including cars, lifestyle, gadgets and fashion accessories. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell.

","

Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India. 

As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen.

The Merchant Services team at Carousell is responsible for establishing Carousell as the to-go online marketplace platform for all kinds of businesses ranging from retail, ecommerce, business services, home services & many more. The primary objectives of the Merchant Services Team is to acquire new businesses to be on Carousell, promote and educate Carousell advertising tools and ensure a long lasting relationship with Carousell.

We are looking for an experienced Sales Senior Associate to acquire & support businesses, brands, stores etc. to on-board & advertise with Carousell. This individual will drive sales of media and internal products (e.g. Carousell Coins) and manage advertiser accounts to ensure they are successful & using Carousell’s ad product. The scope will include all categories and sectors in Singapore, excluding cars and property sectors.

This role will report to the Sales Lead.

 You Will:
  • Drive sales of assigned category/territory, acquire & on-board new merchants onto Carousell and achieve individual sales & revenue targets through your efforts.
  • Proficient in prospecting through cold calling, canvassing & cold emails/LinkedIn etc.
  • Able to articulate clearly & confidently the USPs and value proposition of advertising on Carousell and follow-up through the sales process.
  • Experienced in managing sales pipeline and able to accurately forecast weekly sales and implement GTM sales strategies to achieve monthly targets.
  • Build lasting business relationships with advertisers, ensuring they are successful in their business objectives when using Carousell ad products and media.
  • Develop and maintain strong partnerships with clients establishing themselves as trusted consultants at all levels.
  • Advise on client’s digital strategy and educate advertisers on Carousell ad platforms across channels and devices.
  • Optimise accounts to improve performance for the advertiser.
  • Aggressively grow sales and track retention of clients and/or agencies, negotiating additional budgets along with up-selling new Carousell products.
  • Run performance reviews with clients to iterate and improve on Carousell’s effectiveness for clients and get feedback to further strengthen Carousell’s products and services.
 You Have:
  • A general diploma in business administration, marketing or a related field
  • Passionate for sales and able to cold call, canvass, lead generate etc. and clear understanding of sales process and pipeline management
  • At least 2 years of experience in media sales or B2B small business management
  • Proven track record in identifying new opportunities and closing deals with small and large companies with a solution-based approach for clients
  • Strong and in depth understanding of mobile, online business, ad tech, marketplace, e-commerce and/or classifieds
  • Have exceptional communication skills and an ability to build excellent rapport with strategic decisions makers. Experience working in a highly collaborative environment with internal and external stakeholders
  • Project management experience, including multitasking to run, lead or execute multiple time-sensitive projects in parallel
  • Resourceful, driven and a team player
  • Bonus if you are a Carousell user
  • Bonus if you have experience working in a startup environment before or in eCommerce

Note: Due to the high volume of applicants. Only shortlisted will be notified.

Agencies: Please do not call or email any employee of Carousell Group outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, to the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property/ownership of Carousell Group and, in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

By clicking on Submit, you are accepting to our PDPA policies. In case you are interested to know more, read about our Candidates Personal Data Privacy Statement [https://support.carousell.com/hc/en-us/articles/4410378144537-Candidates-Personal-Data-Privacy-Statement].

",[],Junior Executive,,1 year,Not Specified,,Full-Time,,['Casual (e.g. T-shirts)'],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9346074&advertisement_id=9344445&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,701799,Central - Others,sg

  • Cultivate relationships and guidelines that prepare Vendor/Partners to lead their business and support their organizations to be successful in achieving current and future AppleCare goals.
  • Communicate in a concise, clear and consistent manner. Represent their results to senior leaders.
  • Partner well and share overarching vision and goals with other AppleCare Vendor/Partner support groups.
  • Champion motivating environments that support development, and be a motivation for innovation within Vendor organizations.
  • Be responsible for the direction of their Supplier(s) and counsel on plans/strategies to drive performance. Hold sites and suppliers accountable for all key defined AppleCare business priorities.
  • Dedicated emphasis on employee engagement that lives up to Apple culture and embodies the Apple Support Credo.
  • Evolve performance through utilization of business levers such as analytics, reporting, workforce management, talent management, quality, industry expertise.
  • Ability to lead and collaborate with resources (people, time, support sources) to avoid pitfalls and get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities and creatively overcome obstacles to accomplish a goal.

OPERATIONAL EXPECTATIONS

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

column2: We’re a diverse collection of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what’s possible to help us all do what we love in new ways. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with the Mac, iPhone, iPad and Apple Watch, as well as with services, including iTunes, the App Store, Apple Music and Apple Pay. And the same innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it.

column1: <div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
Every new product we invent, service we create or store we open is the result of people working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","

The AppleCare Vendor Management team is seeking a Vendor Manager (VM) to drive the operational performance of outsource contact center partners!

An AppleCare Vendor Manager leads Outsourced Support Vendors to deliver on the Apple brand promise and promotes a relentless pursuit of outstanding customer service experiences.

This role is responsible for timely day-to-day completion of business requirements, cascading information, and setting the strategic direction of their Vendor/Partner in alignment with AppleCare business priorities and Credo. Vendor Managers monitor and steer performance, develop, and tenaciously influence the achievement of AppleCare objectives in an efficient and procedurally compliant manner. Vendor Managers balance the best interest of AppleCare with a mutually beneficial business outcome for the Vendor/Partner through business strategy, execution of tactical programs, innovative projects, and accountability. Focus on outstanding customer service, operational execution and accountability for achieving goals, and the cultivation of an unquestioning business relationship are the cornerstones of effective Vendor Management.

This position is based on-site in Singapore.

Key Qualifications

  • Extensive contact center experience of five years or more.
  • Ability to interpret complex analysis and business information.
  • Effective negotiation skills and the ability to inspire change are also critical attributes.
  • Strong leadership, general eye for business, influence and negotiation skills.

Description

LEADERSHIP EXPECTATIONS

  • Facilitate and encourage creativity that enables and empowers Vendors to build strategic plans and operational execution to successfully accomplish AppleCare business goals and meet or exceed detailed key performance indicators.
  • Cultivate relationships and guidelines that prepare Vendor/Partners to lead their business and support their organizations to be successful in achieving current and future AppleCare goals.
  • Communicate in a concise, clear and consistent manner. Represent their results to senior leaders.
  • Partner well and share overarching vision and goals with other AppleCare Vendor/Partner support groups.
  • Champion motivating environments that support development, and be a motivation for innovation within Vendor organizations.
  • Be responsible for the direction of their Supplier(s) and counsel on plans/strategies to drive performance. Hold sites and suppliers accountable for all key defined AppleCare business priorities.
  • Dedicated emphasis on employee engagement that lives up to Apple culture and embodies the Apple Support Credo.
  • Evolve performance through utilization of business levers such as analytics, reporting, workforce management, talent management, quality, industry expertise.
  • Ability to lead and collaborate with resources (people, time, support sources) to avoid pitfalls and get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities and creatively overcome obstacles to accomplish a goal.

OPERATIONAL EXPECTATIONS

  • Establish and conduct a regular cadence of performance review with Vendors (Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly) to ensure results are in line with business priorities and expectations. Conduct regular one to one with all key partners throughout the suppliers organization to ensure clear understanding of development, planning, expectations, and goals.
  • Engage various supporting functions such as Business Analysis and Reporting, Quality Program Managers, Training Program Managers, and Vendor Alliance Managers, to understand Vendor performance and proactively identify successes and opportunities.
  • Connect with compassion and ensure suppliers are supported and aware of performance goals and contractual obligations - Prepare and present performance updates to VM staff and AppleCare Leadership at all internal business review meetings.
  • Attend all meetings that are important to understanding and executing the role at a high performance benchmark.
  • Ensure that Site Directors and Senior Operations Managers are analyzing their business to quickly identify trends and resolve critical focus areas, evaluate their strategy so that it effectively drives performance improvement and executes on a plan consistent with Apple values.
  • Regularly evaluate the performance of Vendors and sites which culminates to a high quality annual performance review. Counsel suppliers on preparation and presentation of Annual Business Review.
  • Deliver on all other commitments as it relates to projects, people or agreed deliverables.
  • Identify, own and cultivate relationships within the broader AppleCare organization with particular focus on upstream partners.
  • Coordinate with Support Programs teams to ensure the efficient roll out of new initiatives, driving ongoing improvement of Advisors tools, resources, processes, and procedures.

Education & Experience

  • Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

549,tech project manager,/en/job/hydraulic-engineer-9382536,9382536,Hydraulic Engineer,False,False,,,SGD,Axial Hydraulics Pte. Ltd.,15-Mar-22,False,,,202038173K,,,,,,,"

Responsibilities 

  • Troubleshooting, Servicing, Overhauling repairing all hydraulic equipment.
  • Remote Troubleshooting
  • Project Management (Marine, Port, and Offshore crane installation and overhauling).
  • Technical and practical knowledge in Control Systems/ Mechanical /Electrical / Hydraulics and Structures of various cranes. Independent attending on board and leading the service team as well.
  • Troubleshooting and break down repairs.
  • Leading in Installation/commissioning and de-commissioning. Offshore, Marine, and Port HarbourMobile Crane (LHM 120 to 500) and Lifting Equipment (“A” Frame, Stringer Structure, etc.).
  • Bromma Container Spreader (twin/single) commissioning/Troubleshooting and PMS/regular servicing.
  • Supervise and hands on taking part of Control PCBs/ Electrical / Mechanical /Hydraulic components(valves/pumps/motors/cylinders etc..)repairing/Calibration/Testing in shore workshop
  • OEM and equivalent Spare Parts outsourcing (Worldwide) for cost-effectiveness and urgency.
  • Knowledge and practice of various Marine and Offshore Class Societies’ requirements and standards.
  • Conducting Maintenance and operation training to Port, Marine, and Offshore Personnel (concerned).
  • Technical Staff leadership and Performance Enhancement.
  • Teamwork, Planning, Coaching, Mentoring, and HSE Risk assessment Procedures.
  • Work-site Environmental sustains /Safety and Cleanliness.
  • Reporting to top management and customer for daily project progressing and final report for job completion.
  • Proficient with MS office.
  • Provide detailed reports of the jobs/repairs carried out.
  • Keep track of the stock inventory and place orders for necessary upon approval.
  • Able to contribute to the development of the new hydraulic wing by providing field knowledge and backend work when necessary.
  • Attend Vessels in Anchorage, dock, and Sail if necessary.
  • Conduct Hydraulic training sessions for technicians and lead them into projects.
  • Able to work with other specialists of the same or lower skill level and successfully complete projects.
  • Fully Committed to the goals/plans of the company and will not engage with Freelance or other jobs during the period of employment with us.

Requirement 

  • Diploma in Mechanical/Electrical or Hydraulic
  • 3  to 5 years
  • Marine experience

column2:
Every new product we invent, service we create or store we open is the result of people working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That happens here because every one of us strives toward a common goal — creating the best customer experiences. So bring your passion, courage, and original thinking and get ready to share it. This is where your work can make a difference in people’s lives. Including your own.","

Summary

This role is part of the Pacific Ops System & Process Function to lead complex, global & regional initiatives supporting various areas within Pacific Operations. Pacific Operations include the areas of Reseller operations/channel management, Online store fulfillment operations, Retail fulfillment logistics, Supply/demand management & execution, Logistics and Product Launch Readiness. You will be responsible for leading cross-functional and cross-organizational teams to define, build and roll-out innovative technology and business process solutions that increase efficiencies, improve customer satisfaction, and drive revenue. You should have subject matter expertise in fulfillment supply chain from manufacturing and distribution centre sites, exceptional project management skills, a good grasp of process management, a maniacal attention to detail, and a proven ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.

Key Qualifications
  • SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:
  • Good understanding of supply chain and planning concepts
  • SAP System and process savvy
  • Good process re-engineering skills
  • Experience in Change Management is a plus
  • Strong Project Management experience with attention to detail
  • Excellent operation issue resolution skill
  • Excellent people and communication (written and spoken) skills
  • Excellent presentation skills, including developing high quality slides to articulate complex concepts
  • Ability to facilitate brainstorming sessions and workshops to gather requirements
  • Excellent listening skills
  • Good teamwork attitude
  • Ability to work with ambiguity
  • Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working in a global, fast-paced environment
  • Proficiency in developing detailed optimization models is a plus
  • Ability to “sense the moment” for when details vs executive communication is required
  • EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
  • Proven track record of leading strategic projects combined with the ability to execute at tactical project-level activities and tasks
  • In-depth knowledge and experience in project and process management
  • Minimum of 8-10 years of global supply chain management experience, preferably in high-tech / consumer electronics / retail industries
  • Proven experience as a change agent having effectively implemented change in large cross -functional organization
  • Large Cross Functional project implementation experience
  • Proven experience working effectively in a matrixed, global organization
  • Experience working on projects with teams based outside of Singapore, e.g. virtual teams
  • Past experience of working on industry standard Demand forecasting and Supply Planning systems and processes as well as retail partner management is a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail and high comfort in working with numbers
  • Ability to remain focused and efficiently work under pressure while handling multiple simultaneous projects
  • Ability to assimilate and learn complex processes in a changing and dynamic work environment on a steep learning curve
  • People management experience is essential to lead a team with in depth technical knowledge and experience
Description

AS A TEAM MANAGER:

  • Lead a team of experienced BPR managers to deliver Pac Ops priorities
  • Lead by example in sustaining the Apple Culture within the team
  • Provide guidance, mentoring and coaching to the team especially in terms of growth and development
  • Lead resourcing and balance between members and ensure exposure to opportunities

AS AN INDIVIDUAL:

  • Develop partnership with key partners across the organisation and upkeep an understanding of Operations’ core business processes
  • Understand each function’s interaction with their key partners and the corresponding processes
  • Leverage industry trends, best practices, and groundbreaking technology and process improvement ideas, working collaboratively with IS&T and business teams.
  • Lead and implement process and tool change initiatives within Operations across all Apple’s product lines, influencing decisions through collaboration, leadership and a customer-focused approach.
  • Understand and assimilate detailed and complex business processes across multiple functions, especially between Reseller Operations & Supply Demand Management. Proactively identify key changes in processes required to enable accuracy, scalability and efficiency.
  • Responsible in driving and implementing Change Management to accompany the business during project implementation
  • Garner support from senior management for the proposed changes through clear and concise communication of time bound benefits.
  • Develop a detailed project plan for all approved initiatives within the constraints of resourcing and time.
  • Project-manage cross-functional process re-engineering implementations.
  • Ensure process integration across organization, both regionally and globally.
  • Ability to use relevant project/program management approaches for different types of initiatives (e.g. waterfall vs agile).
  • -Ability to lead a team of BPRs + Business Support in terms of resourcing and personal growth & development.
  • Monitors market / industry trends and emerging technologies to identify areas for competitive advantage
  • Lead change; Implement new ideas effectively within the Apple culture
  • Measure and track results; Help deliver business benefits.
Education & Experience
  • Bachelors degree required, Masters degree or MBA preferred.
  • Minimum of 8-10 years experience in project management
  • 8-10 years of Supply Chain Management or Industrial Engineering experience
",[],Senior Manager,,8 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Casual (e.g. T-shirts)', 'Weekdays–Saturday–Sunday']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9366178&advertisement_id=9364549&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

column1: 551,tech project manager,/en/job/e-commerce-digital-manager-9416263,9416263,E-Commerce Digital Manager,False,False,,,SGD,GroupM Singapore Pte Ltd,25-Mar-22,False,,,199600288D,,,51 - 200 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: GroupM, the world’s leading full service media investment management operation, was created by WPP to oversee its assets in this sector.  These assets include Mindshare, MediaCom, MEC and MAXUS.  The focus of GroupM is the intelligent application of volume and scale in trading, innovation and quality of services, in order to bring benefit to clients and the companies it operates.

WPPis the world leader in communications services.  It comprises of leading companies in all of these disciplines: advertising; media investment management; consumer insight; public relations & public affairs; branding & identity; direct, digital, promotion & relationship marketing; healthcare communications; and specialist communications.  There are more than 150 companies within the Group.  Between them, our companies work with 336 of the Fortune Global 500; 29 of the Dow Jones 30; 61 of the NASDAQ 100; and 35 of the Fortune e-50.  Collectively, over 146,000 people work for WPP companies out of almost 2,400 offices in 107 countries.

column1:
","

3 Best Things About The Job:

1. Working with a high performing integrated media team to drive best in class digital channel planning and ROI

2. Hone leadership skills through building and leading operation excellence for the team

3. Work with counterparts across all of APAC

Measures of Success

In three months:

• Fully up to speed with the platform analytics and strategy frameworks for existing clients at Wavemaker

• Be the point person for clients’ ecommerce consultation

• Take on maintenance of proprietary Wavemaker tool on marketplace competitive intelligence

• Actively participating in agency updates, Group M working group on analytics, data and tech

In six months:

• Be seen as the go-to person for ecommerce on-platform tools from the Wavemaker local teams

• Actively support APAC Ecommerce lead on tools and capability developments for the region

• Support in deployment of Wavemaker’s proprietary Wavemaker Illuminate with the business leads

• Recommend processes and innovative ways to improve existing ways or working or streamline workflow

In twelve months:

• Actively steering the ecommerce pitches and credentials to clients

• Work with APAC Ecommerce lead to drive new projects and revenue on analytics and tech

• Have the ability to lead client projects and meetings independently

• Be an active member of Wavemaker’s consultancy hub offering

Key Areas of Responsibilities

• Competent in planning all digital channels and managing digital integration within the bigger communication plan.

• Own project management, ensure smooth workflow and get clients and team members up to speed on all tasks.

• Formulate performance media plans based on campaign objectives and GMV targets, working with paid social, paid search and programmatic specialists

• Responsible for planning and executing on-platform marketplace paid search campaigns with team support, including end to end setup, optimizations and reporting

• Tracks performance in reporting and dashboards

• Analysis and optimization of the campaigns

• Works with global ecommerce client practice lead to update on regional performance and share best practices

• Identifies long-term trends and insights, connecting it to the wider touchpoint planning approach

• Leads WIPs and quarterly business review, providing analysis and recommendations

• Main point of contact for regional clients, media partners and agency partners

Required Competencies

• Experience in conversion-led campaigns for ecommerce

• Understanding of digital platforms across paid search (Google Ads, Google Shopping, Google Shopping with Shopee), paid social (Facebook Collaborative Ads), programmatic (DV360) and other relevant digital channels

• Experience in paid search for Lazada and Shopee. Will be an advantage if candidate has familiarity with other marketplaces and D2C ecommerce.

• Knows know to use MSP and seller center for marketplaces

• Be up to date with new and upcoming performance and ecommerce formats

• Possesses strong analytical skills to analyze data and turn them into actionable insights

• Proven ability to independently manage multiple priorities in a fast paced and deadline driven environment

• Shows strategic ownership of key projects or topics and works across channels to find key points of success

• At least 4-5 years of overall experience in managing performance campaigns, of which 1-2 years of experience in the ecommerce marketplace space

column2: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's ""AA-"" and ""Aa1"" credit ratings are among the highest in the world.

column3: DBS is at the forefront of leveraging digital technology to shape the future of banking, and has been named “World’s Best Digital Bank” by Euromoney in 2016 and 2018. The bank has also been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by several publications including The Banker, Global Finance, IFR Asia and Euromoney since 2012. In addition, the bank has been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for nine consecutive years from 2009 to 2017.

DBS provides a full range of services in consumer, SME and corporate banking. As a bank born and bred in Asia, DBS understands the intricacies of doing business in the region’s most dynamic markets. DBS is committed to building lasting relationships with customers, and positively impacting communities through supporting social enterprises, as it banks the Asian way. It has also established a SGD 50 million foundation to strengthen its corporate social responsibility efforts in Singapore and across Asia.

With its extensive network of operations in Asia and emphasis on engaging and empowering its staff, DBS presents exciting career opportunities. The bank acknowledges the passion, commitment and can-do spirit in all of its 26,000 staff, representing over 40 nationalities.

column1:
","
Business FunctionAs the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. The data function sits within the business and is a key enabler of transformative change to deliver incremental value and outcomes for the Consumer Banking and Wealth Management Group. Responsibilities
  • Team lead role, responsible for driving incremental value for the wealth management franchise through use of data - accountable for financial outcomes.

  • Identify and enable delivery of use cases to drive business outcomes.

  • Drive continuous improvement through adoption of test and learn and experimentation to increase effectiveness of data driven engagement with our customers. Set metrics, framework and governance to drive continuous improvement.

  • Drive adoption of a data driven operating model and control tower build out for key lines of business, to enhance the way we operate the business.

  • Work with front office, business managers, product managers and customer management teams to create data solutions, address business challenges and identify untapped opportunities.

  • End-to-end data solutioning which includes translate business problems into data requirements, data discovery and data processing to deliver outcome.
Requirement
  • Min 8 years' experience in financial institution or top tier consulting.

  • Experience working on cross-functional data projects to solve business problem and drive business outcomes.

  • Prior experience or exposure to private bank or wealth management domain.

  • Proficient in SQL/Python/SAS programming, MS Excel and be comfortable with processing large volume of data.

  • Experience in delivering complex initiatives working with both cross functional stakeholders across business and tech team.

  • Self-starter, good communication and presentation skill.
Apply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

553,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-java-developer-9408415,9408415,Senior Java Developer,False,False,,,SGD,OneAston,23-Mar-22,False,,,201204934H,,,201 - 500 Employees,,,"<div>

With our corporate head office based in Singapore and offices in Hong Kong, Australia, the Philippines and Taiwan, OneAston is established as an Asian based financial IT services company dedicated to the delivery of quality wealth management solutions.
Our mission is to provide value added function and services to leading industry software platforms and in-house solutions across the wealth management industry.

Backed by an experienced management team, a wide knowledge of the local markets, agility and creative solutions, OneAston is helping many financial institutions extend the value of the investment they receive from their wealth platforms and keep pace with the ever changing competitive landscape.

The founders and key members of the OneAston team have spent extensive time operating in the Wealth Management and Private Banking markets. Our team has worked extensively on the implementation of Wealth Management solutions for large international and regional banks alike. OneAston is currently engaged on wealth management projects across Asia and therefore is in a unique position to provide consultancy services based on long term practical experience with current project exposure.

","

OneAston specialises in the implementation and development of technology for financial institutions. We are looking for motivated professionals to join our fast growing and successful organizations to forge a career in the growing wealth management technology sector.

We have experienced 30% growth over the last two years and are rapidly expanding our consultancy teams worldwide, setting footprints across Asia Pacific, Europe and the Americas. We are one of the fastest growing financial services IT companies: we provide our clients with the most innovative and technical expertise to bring success to their projects. In line with our expansion plan, we are looking for creative, entrepreneurial and tech-driven individuals who are looking to develop their career.

Responsibilities

· Contributes in all phases of the development lifecycle

· Works with project managers and analysts to understand the requirements

· Writes well designed, testable, and efficient java codes

· Ensures designs are in compliance with specifications

· Prepares and products releases of software components

· Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review

· Handle the client directly to understand the requirement

· Handle the development and train the team

· Assists in testing and resolving issues

Requirements

· Degree in IT/Technology related disciplines.

· Minimum 10 years of specific experience in Java development and debugging

· Proven hands-on Software Development experience

· Hands on Experience Work experience on Java6/11, J2EE, Java EE (JSP, Servlet, Struts, Spring MVC), Java WebSocket, XML, JSON, Hibernate, JPA, MyBatis, Web Services(SOAP/REST)

MVC based JavaScript Frameworks – jQuery, JSON, OOJS, Angular JS Or React JS

· Demonstrable experience with the Spring framework components - Spring Boot, MVC, Integration, Security, etc.

· Database handling in Java, SQL, NoSQL.

· Knowledge of SQL tunning

· Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, SOAP, REST and open system in Java

· Experience in Online banking development

",[],Senior Executive,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,"['Dental', 'Medical', 'Regular hours, Mondays - Fridays', 'Business (e.g. Shirts)', 'Group Hospital and Surgical Insurance']",https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9408415&advertisement_id=9406786&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

554,tech project manager,/en/job/senior-accounts-executive-regional-9335514,9335514,Senior Accounts Executive (Regional),False,False,4500,7000,SGD,Copperleaf Technologies (Asia) Pte Ltd,17-Mar-22,False,,,201805171H,,,,,,"

Copperleaf provides enterprise decision analytics software solutions to companies managing critical infrastructure. We leverage operational and financial data to empower our clients to make investment decisions that deliver the highest business value. What sets us apart is our commitment to providing extraordinary experiences, shaped by people who care deeply, products that deliver exceptional value, and partnerships that stand the test of time. Copperleaf is a patron of The Institute of Asset Management and actively participates in shaping the future of asset management standards, including ISO 55000. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our solutions are distributed and supported by regional staff and partners worldwide. Together, we are transforming how the world sees value. 

","

Location: Singapore- Remote working

Role: Permanent Regional Role

Copperleaf’s software helps some of the world’s largest organizations make better strategic decisions. Join our team as we continue to enable our clients to build more resilient and sustainable infrastructure.

As the Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) team continues to expand, we’re looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our team. You ’ll have a key role managing revenue timelines and software license renewals. You’ll be working with both internal and external stakeholders to provide cost estimations for our professional services team and be a person who enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and taking on new challenges!

Responsibilities:

As a Revenue Analyst/ Accounts Executive, you will be involved in some of the following tasks:

  • You will be reporting to the Global Revenue Manager and dotted line to the APJ Finance Business Partner
  • Review contracts to understand and document timing of revenue recognition, revenue classification, and invoicing requirements
  • Create and manage renewal opportunities (SaaS, Support and Maintenance, Hosting)
  • Create and manage custom reports in Mavenlink (Professional Services Tool)
  • Work with Copperleaf Project Managers to produce estimates of professional service revenue to recognize each month
  • Provide an excellent level of customer service to customers
  • Work closely with the Copperleaf team members
  • Carry out duties using internal accounting systems (Netsuite, Salesforce, Mavenlink)
  • Regional AP and AR responsibilities
  • Provide support to the accounting/ finance team
  • Other additional projects and day-to-day responsibilities as required

Your background:

You have one or more of the following attributes:

  • You are a CPA or aspiring CPA (or equivalent)
  • You have ASPE, US GAAP or IFRS experience
  • You have 2 years’ progressive experience in a similar role
  • You understand contract/legal language and can explain the meaning to a board audience
  • You understand revenue accounting standards and can apply this knowledge to determine timing of revenue recognition
  • You have strong Excel and Word skills in Microsoft Office
  • Prior experience using Netsuite, Salesforce, or Mavenlink is an asset

About you:

  • You are detail oriented, organized, and efficient - you can compare data from a variety of sources for accuracy and completeness
  • You’re dynamic, proactive, self-starter; naturally inquisitive
  • You like to self-manage – able to resolve most problems independently and know when to seek help
  • You enjoy multi-tasking and able to juggle many priorities while meeting deadlines
  • You’re a great communicator both verbally and in writing

We recognize that talent comes in many forms, so we’re looking for passion, enthusiasm and transferable skills!

What’s it like here?

At Copperleaf, we’re committed to building a great culture because we know it sets us apart. Culture is at the very core of everything we do, and it’s what makes people want to be part of the market-leading company we’re building. We are a global team of world-class innovators continually pushing the limits of what’s possible to deliver exceptional value and extraordinary experiences to our clients. To do that, we actively cultivate an open and supportive team environment, where diverse ideas and perspectives are encouraged and respected.

Headquartered in Vancouver, Copperleaf is building a better world, one decision at a time. As one of the Fastest-Growing Companies, winner of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures and the BC Tech Association’s Tech Culture of the Year, we are a dynamic and disruptive organization offering exciting opportunities for growth and innovation.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are at the heart of Copperleaf’s culture and play a vital role in our growth strategy. We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels a sense of belonging and can contribute to their maximum potential. Our differences are the reason great things happen here. If you are an applicant in need of accommodations or special assistance throughout the interview process, please feel free to let us know during interview and we will provide you with further assistance.

","['Work Life Balance/ Attractive Benefits', 'Attractive Compensation Package', 'Great Culture']",Senior Executive,,3 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://myjobstreet.jobstreet.com.sg/application/online-apply.php?job_id=9335514&advertisement_id=9333885&s=20&AdvertisementSource=1,70000,Singapore,sg

556,tech project manager,/en/job/facilities-assistant-manager-casino-operations-9369970,9369970,"Facilities Assistant Manager, Casino Operations",False,False,,,SGD,Marina Bay Sands Pte Ltd,11-Mar-22,False,,,200507292R,,,More than 5000 Employees,,,"<div>

column3: Marina Bay Sands® is Asia’s leading destination for business, leisure and entertainment delivering once-in-a-lifetime experiences. The landmark building is situated in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District and transforms Singapore’s skyline and the country’s tourism landscape.

The destination offers a luxury hotel, state-of-the art convention and exhibition facilities, theaters, world-class entertainment and the best shopping and dining in the region. The three hotel towers are crowned by the Sands SkyPark® on the 57th story.

column1: <div>
<div>

column3: Conveniently located in the heart of the Central Business District and 20 minutes from Changi Airport.

• Hotel: The Marina Bay Sands hotel has three 55-story towers with 2,561 luxury rooms and suites. The three towers are capped by the Sands SkyPark, which offers 360-degree views of Singapore’s skyline. It is home to restaurants, lush gardens, an infinity edged swimming pool and the world’s largest public cantilever housing an observation deck.

• Expo and Conventions: The Sands Expo and Convention Center has 1.3 million square feet of flexible convention and exhibition space. It can host over 45,000 delegates, 2,000 exhibition booths and 250 meeting rooms. It features Southeast Asia’s biggest ballroom, which can accommodate 6,600 people for a banquet, and up to 11,000 for an auditorium-style lecture.

• Shopping: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands has 800,000 square feet of retail and dining space. Luxury retailers include Bally, Cartier, CHANEL, Ferragamo, Franck Muller, Gucci, Hermès, Hublot, Hugo Boss, Louis Vuitton, Miu Miu, Omega, Patek Philippe, Prada, Tiffany & Co. and Yves Saint Laurent. New brands include Anne Fontaine, Henry Cotton’s, Leviev, Marisfrolg, Moiselle, Rabeanco, Stefano Ricci, and Wolford.

• Restaurants: Dining at Marina Bay Sands is a gourmet experience with over 50 dining choices. These include celebrity-chef restaurants helmed by Mario Batali, (New York), Daniel Boulud (New York), Wolfgang Puck (Los Angeles), Guy Savoy (Paris), Tetsuya Wakuda (Sydney) and Justin Quek (Singapore). Marina Bay Sands features signature restaurants, modern bistros and a premium food court.

• Entertainment: Marina Bay Sands energizes the entertainment and nightlife scene in Singapore with nightclubs, world-class entertainment, a museum and a casino. The museum, which has a lotus-inspired design, will feature blockbuster exhibitions from around the world. Two state-of-the-art theaters will open with a total of about 4,000 seats. The Broadway hit The Lion King will debut in Sands Theater, with Le Theater presenting shorter-run shows such as concerts, award ceremonies and gala events. The outdoor event plaza along the promenade next to Marina Bay will host audiences for watching events on the bay or on the plaza.

column1:
","
Job Responsibilities       
General
  • Lead a team of technicians/engineers to maintain the facilities in the Integrated Resorts (IR), which includes Casino, Hotel, MICE, F&B, Entertainment, Attractions, and the associated systems of mechanical, electrical, plumbing, air-conditioning, fire protection etc. and other related equipment.
  • Plan and implement corrective and preventive maintenance program in accordance with the code of practice, authority requirement and guidelines.
  • Assist the Manager and/or Assistant Chief Engineers in planning of job duration and assessing manpower, materials, tools and equipment, special services required for the job.
  • Direct and allocate work to the technicians on routine maintenance and urgent repair in accordance with sound engineering practices and occupational health and safety regulations. Closely monitor the effects of servicing and maintenance on their condition wherever possible. Ensure that all records of maintenance and testing are kept.
  • Enforce all safety programs and training with regards to WSH
  • Perform all duties in compliance with the policies / standards of MBS and directives of parent company LVSC.
  • Manage Human Resources responsibilities for assigned department(s) to include creating a work environment that promotes teamwork, performance feedback, recognition, mutual respect, and employee satisfaction; quality hiring, training and succession planning processes that encompass the company’s diversity commitment; adherence to the company’s status quo; administering progressive discipline in accordance with MBS guidelines.
Corrective Maintenance
  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest and internal department requests such as ad-hoc breakdown and ensuring Maximo job chit are closed promptly and accurately.
  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest services within assigned department(s), consistent with the company’s core service standards and brand attributes.
  • Conduct daily on-site physical inspection and monitor the work progress of all defects rectification; identify and follow through for any repair.
  • Preventive Maintenance
  • Manage and carry out required preventive and predictive maintenance program.
  • Advocate improvement on work processes and areas to achieve excellent customer services, improve the maintenance standard and efficiency.
  • Conduct regular meetings and coordinate with the maintenance contractor to resolve and improve the service of relevant systems.
  • Coordinate and supervise external contract works as assigned by immediate supervisor to ensure their works are compliant with the required specifications and standards to meet objectives.
  • Work closely and liaise with all departments in property and contractors in project and maintenance coordination to minimize disruption to the hotel operations.
  • Coordinate and manage contractors and sub-contractors for any repair or Testing and Commissioning (T&C) of equipment along with contractors and other Team Members.
Resource Management
  • Provide and review training for Team Members under supervision
  • Conduct performance appraisal of all team members under supervision.
  • Ensure effective manpower planning for the required O&M activities with optimal productivity and budgetary control.
  • Plan, manage, select, and procure consumable materials.
  • Review and streamline all purchase requests with procurement department.
  • Manage customer driven quality program and improvement initiatives.
  • Support MBS Sustainability and CSR efforts
  • Perform ad-hoc tasks as required directed by the manager or above.
  • Project Management
  • Manage and executed the assigned capital projects, A&A, and improvements projects in accordance with the Company’s policies and guidelines.
  • Prepare tender documents, scope of work and specifications.
  • Manage /support the project hand-over and/or pre-opening program, including on-site physical inspection and defect rectification.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education & Certification
  • Relevant Employment Certificate or Work Testimony, any specialized Certifications will be an added advantage.
  • At least High School or equivalent, diplomas and degrees are an advantage. Candidates with less qualifications but more years of working experience can be considered for the position of Assistant Managers.
  • Have a basic command of English.
  • Computer literate
Experience
  • At least three to five years of solid hands-on practical working in any Hotels, MICE, Retail or Museum providing Customers Service, Operations supports, and maintenance on guestrooms’ services, finishes, fit outs and furniture.
  • Understanding of local regulations, standards and ordinances on Facilities operations and maintenance
  • Be able to work outdoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to fatigue, noise, dust, and be able to access all areas of the property including those at height.
Competencies 
  • Possess good communication, interpersonal and supervisory skills, with an eye for detail.
  • Possess good understanding of Mechanical & Electrical system.
  • Get along with fellow Team Members and work as a team.
  • Be able to work with minimum supervision and at times independently, as well as under pressure.
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced, busy, and somewhat stressful environment. Maintain physical stamina and proper mental attitude while dealing effectively with guests, management, team members, and outside contacts while working under pressure and meeting deadlines.
  • Meet the attendance guidelines of the job and adhere to Departmental and Company policies
  • Be willing to work any day of the week and any shift, long hours when necessary.
  • Withstand various activities such as frequent walking, sitting for long periods or prolonged standing, stretching, bending, and kneeling without restriction.
  • Have a well-groomed, professional appearance.
",[],Junior Executive,,2 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://careers.marinabaysands.com/en/job/497694/facilities-assistant-manager-casino-operations,70170,Central,sg

Summary of Job Responsibilities
  • Assist the Manager and/or Assistant Chief Engineers to lead the Operation and Maintenance Team to manage and maintain Hotels/Podium/Casino facilities to meet the business and operational needs.
  • Assist the Manager and/or Associate Director in planning and implementing corrective and maintenance programs, improvement works, A&A and renovations projects etc. in accordance with company’s policies, service standards and authority requirements.

General
  • Lead a team of technicians/engineers to maintain the facilities in the Integrated Resorts (IR), which includes Casino, Hotel, MICE, F&B, Entertainment, Attractions, and the associated systems of mechanical, electrical, plumbing, air-conditioning, fire protection etc. and other related equipment.

Closely monitor the effects of servicing and maintenance on their condition wherever possible. Ensure that all records of maintenance and testing are kept.
  • Enforce all safety programs and training with regards to WSH
  • Perform all duties in compliance with the policies / standards of MBS and directives of parent company LVSC.
  • Manage Human Resources responsibilities for assigned department(s) to include creating a work environment that promotes teamwork, performance feedback, recognition, mutual respect, and employee satisfaction; quality hiring, training and succession planning processes that encompass the company’s diversity commitment; adherence to the company’s status quo; administering progressive discipline in accordance with MBS guidelines.
Corrective Maintenance
  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest and internal department requests such as ad-hoc breakdown and ensuring Maximo job chit are closed promptly and accurately.
  • Manage the delivery and measurement of guest services within assigned department(s), consistent with the company’s core service standards and brand attributes.
  • Conduct daily on-site physical inspection and monitor the work progress of all defects rectification; identify and follow through for any repair.
  • Preventive Maintenance
  • Manage and carry out required preventive and predictive maintenance program.
  • Advocate improvement on work processes and areas to achieve excellent customer services, improve the maintenance standard and efficiency.
  • Conduct regular meetings and coordinate with the maintenance contractor to resolve and improve the service of relevant systems.
  • Coordinate and supervise external contract works as assigned by immediate supervisor to ensure their works are compliant with the required specifications and standards to meet objectives.
  • Work closely and liaise with all departments in property and contractors in project and maintenance coordination to minimize disruption to the hotel operations.
  • Coordinate and manage contractors and sub-contractors for any repair or Testing and Commissioning (T&C) of equipment along with contractors and other Team Members.
Resource Management
  • Provide and review training for Team Members under supervision
  • Conduct performance appraisal of all team members under supervision.
  • Ensure effective manpower planning for the required O&M activities with optimal productivity and budgetary control.
  • Plan, manage, select, and procure consumable materials.
  • Review and streamline all purchase requests with procurement department.
  • Manage customer driven quality program and improvement initiatives.
  • Support MBS Sustainability and CSR efforts
  • Perform ad-hoc tasks as required directed by the manager or above.
  • Project Management
  • Manage and executed the assigned capital projects, A&A, and improvements projects in accordance with the Company’s policies and guidelines.
  • Prepare tender documents, scope of work and specifications.
  • Manage /support the project hand-over and/or pre-opening program, including on-site physical inspection and defect rectification.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education & Certification
  • Relevant Employment Certificate or Work Testimony, any specialized Certifications will be an added advantage.
  • At least High School or equivalent, diplomas and degrees are an advantage. Candidates with less qualifications but more years of working experience can be considered for the position of Assistant Managers.
  • Have a basic command of English.
Computer literate

Experience
  • At least three to five years of solid hands-on practical working in any Hotels, MICE, Retail or Museum providing Customers Service, Operations supports, and maintenance on guestrooms’ services, finishes, fit outs and furniture.
  • Understanding of local regulations, standards and ordinances on Facilities operations and maintenance
  • Be able to work outdoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to fatigue, noise, dust, and be able to access all areas of the property including those at height.
  • Competencies
  • Possess good communication, interpersonal and supervisory skills, with an eye for detail.
  • Possess good understanding of Mechanical & Electrical system.
  • Get along with fellow Team Members and work as a team.
  • Be able to work with minimum supervision and at times independently, as well as under pressure.
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced, busy, and somewhat stressful environment. Maintain physical stamina and proper mental attitude while dealing effectively with guests, management, team members, and outside contacts while working under pressure and meeting deadlines.
  • Meet the attendance guidelines of the job and adhere to Departmental and Company policies
  • Be willing to work any day of the week and any shift, long hours when necessary.
  • Withstand various activities such as frequent walking, sitting for long periods or prolonged standing, stretching, bending, and kneeling without restriction.
  • Have a well-groomed, professional appearance.
",[],Manager,,5 years,"Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree",,Full-Time,,[],https://careers.marinabaysands.com/en/job/497678/facilities-assistant-manager-hotel,70170,Central,sg

Lalamove is disrupting the logistics industry by connecting customers and drivers directly through our technology. We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it.

Currently operating across SEA, China, LATAM and United States, our aspirations don’t stop there as our model has the ability to transform how goods moved in any city worldwide. ","

Lalamove is disrupting the logistics industry by connecting customers and drivers directly through our technology. We offer customers a lightning fast and convenient way to book delivery and moving services whether they are at their home, at work or on the go. People talk about O2O, we live it.

Onto our seventh year as a start-up, now operating in Asia, United States and LATAM. Our aspirations don’t stop there as our model has the ability to transform how goods moved in any city worldwide. Backed by a team of experienced entrepreneurs, Lalamove offers a great place to add real value because you get real ownership of what you do. Come work with energetic, dynamic individuals, and play a critical role in disrupting the entire logistics market in a cutting-edge tech company.

We are looking for an Account Executive to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Account Executive’s role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities.

What we Seek:
  • Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships
  • Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
  • Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to client needs and objectives
  • Come up with strategies to cross sell and up sell Lalamove's solutions
  • Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders
  • Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas
  • Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)
What you'll need:
  • Work experience in Sales / Account Management or relevant role
  • Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs
  • Skilled in data analytics tools
  • Proven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail
  • Min Diploma in Business administration / communication.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Experience in matrix reporting
  • Ability to work independently in an ambiguous situation and is a self-starter

Industrial Engineering

Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam.

column3: ABOUT COMAEA CONSULTING
WE BELIEVE IN PARTNERSHIP

Comaea Consulting is a market-leading, knowledge-based, technology-oriented Strategic HR Consulting team. Our objective is to build long-term partnerships and to create value for our clients. Comaea Consulting was started with a belief that rapidly changing technology, industrial shift, and changing demographics of talent would demand stronger external partnerships on Strategic HR issues. This would in turn need to integrate full spectrum of Strategic HR services on a single platform. With one of the most competent consulting teams we are here to support our clients as a true HR Business partner. Typically on their Recruitment, Competence Management, Organizational Design, Individual and Team Development initiatives. With our IT capabilities we also help companies achieve state of the art and a cloud-based talent management platform.
OUR SERVICES

Recruitment and selection: Recruitment of mid to senior level executive primarily in South East Asia. Large-scale project recruitment for start-up teams. We use variety of IT tools for handling of such projects and depend a lot on our capabilities to find right candidates including headhunting and advertising.

Competence Management: Assessment of individual vis-à-vis job requirements. Building of benchmark competency models. Assessment of gaps and design of development plans. We use a variety of methods including psychometric assessment to deliver these services.
Individual and Team Development Programs: Individual coaching of executives. Team coaching especially of sales and management teams. Running leadership and team building workshops.

Organizational Design: Help our clients build right organization with right people capabilities to achieve their business objectives and strategies. Helping our organization formulate their vision and mission strategies through workshop. Employee opinion surveys and customer perception analysis.
OUR CORE SKILLS
Assessment methodology using psychometric tools and assessment centres
Executive coaching using International Coaching Federation methodologies
Interviewing techniques
IT infrastructure for full spectrum HR consulting
Comaea Consulting Pte. Ltd.
www.comaeaconsulting.com
EA Licence No: 15C7642

Our client is a global manufacturing company, a market leader in maritime sector manufacturing marine capital equipment. In order to grow the organization and strengthen its Technical and services team our client wants to recruit:
Technical Manager (Service)
(Based in Singapore)
ORGANISATION
This role manages a team of highly qualified and experienced service and installation engineers and reports directly to the regional director based in Singapore. You will be responsible for providing both onsite and offsite service and support to customers to resolve any operational issues on the company installed equipment’s.
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive services business: Introduce and maintain best practices in services, repair, materials planning, inventory control and logistics of people and resources across a number of repair projects in company workshop in Singapore, and client sites and shipyards across Asia and internationally.
Operational leadership: Manage and direct more than ten highly qualified services and installation engineers and provide capable leadership for the planning of on-board installation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of capital machinery onsite.
Project management: Deliver service and installation projects profitably, take initiatives focused on increasing productivity of the team, and implement working practices that build technical capabilities of engineers and technicians.
People management: Coach, train and develop the engineering and workshop teams, raise the performance bar by inspiring autonomy and confidence in the workforce, and effectively deploy manpower resources on multiple worksites.
YOUR PROFILE
  • A diploma/degree in marine engineering or related discipline such as mechanical, electrical, or naval architecture.
  • You have over 12 years of experience working in a comparable repair and installation environment in the marine/shipping industry.
  • You are passionate about machinery and engineering and strive to achieve operational excellence.
  • A proven operations manager with experience in leading and developing multi-disciplinary teams of engineers and technicians.
  • Excellent people management capabilities, able to demonstrate a significant contribution to the development of teams while improving performance.
  • Dedicated service mind-set with strong commercial sensitivity and customer focus.
  • Proficiency in English, with the ability to lead and motivate a culturally diverse workforce.
OUR OFFER
  • A rare opportunity to take on the operational management position in a well reputed marine company known for engineering excellence.
  • This position offers unlimited scope for new initiatives and leadership.
  • It provides unlimited opportunity to grow in an international organization to a person who has a desire to succeed.
  • A competitive remuneration package.

562,tech project manager,/en/job/grip-programme-manager-9347911,9347911,GRIP Programme Manager,False,False,,,SGD,National University of Singapore,4-Mar-22,False,,30 days,200604346E,,,More than 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div style=""text-align:justify"">

column2:
A leading global university centred in Asia, the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers a global approach to education and research, with a focus on Asian perspectives and expertise. It is driven by its mission to transform the way people think and do things through education, research and service. The NUS community is distinctively global with talented students and faculty from more than 100 countries. We invite dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of this vibrant hub which is dedicated to delivering quality education and undertaking research for the betterment of society.","
Job Description
The post is to support: -
  • NUS ILO's Research Innovation Programme (GRIP) which aims to promote and support students and researchers led start-up creation in NUS
  • Commercialisation of inventions developed by NUS research communities, through developing partnerships and collaborations with stakehers within and outside NUS
Duties and Responsibilities
  • Serve as Programmer Manr to man NUS GRIP - a deep tech new venture creation programme.
  • Oversee the administration, finance and procurement requirements of the programme.
  • Assist the Programme Head in carrying out his or her responsibilities, including but not limited to day-to-day manment, curriculum administration, budgets, operations, marketing and outreach, mentor manment and liaison functions.
  • Develop technology translation and commercialisation partnerships with key internal and external stakehers of Singapore innovation ecosystem. These include NUS faculty and students, government ncies, funding entities, industry technology seekers, accelerators and related new venture creating entities.
  • Coordinating communications, marketing and public relations efforts in conjunction with corporate partner and NUS marketing teams.
  • Identify and scout for deep tech projects of high innovation and start-up potential.
  
Qualifications
  • Her with at least 5 of relevant experience.
  • Experience of working with start-ups, investors, research institutes, researchers or technology innovators is critical.
  • Passionate about entrepreneurship.
  • Good experience working with and managing multiple stakehers.
  • Good understanding of start-up ecosystem and strong network with innovation communities ly or overseas will be an added advant.
  • Demonstrate strong skills in project manment, communication and presentation.
  • Possess strong leadership and people skills. Is driven, entrepreneurial and resourceful.
Covid-19 Mess
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.
More Information
Location: Kent Ridge CampusOrganization: NUS Enterprise AcademyDepartment : NUS Enterprise AcademyJob requisition ID : 12534

column1: 563,tech project manager,/en/job/music-director-%7C-987fm-9364250,9364250,Music Director | 987FM,False,False,,,SGD,Mediacorp Pte Ltd,9-Mar-22,False,,30 days,199201312E,,,2001 - 5000 Employees,,Singapore,"<div>

column3: Mediacorp is Singapore’s leading media company with the most complete range of platforms, spanning television, radio, newspapers, magazines, movies, digital and out-of-home media.
It pioneered the development of Singapore’s broadcasting industry, with the broadcast of Radio in 1936 and Television in 1963.
Today, Mediacorp has over 50 products and brands in four languages (English, Mandarin, Malay and Tamil), reaching out to all adults in Singapore every week.
Initiatives in the new digital space include Internet TV-on-demand, High Definition TV broadcast and Over-the-Top (OTT) interactive services.

column2: Beyond Singapore, Mediacorp is an active regional player through co-productions in TV dramas and movies, magazines publishing, as well as Channel NewsAsia International, one of the first Asian-owned English news channels.

column3: Our financial and strategic relationship in the region includes International Media Corporation in Vietnam, which was set up to develop and produce television entertainment and economic news content. Mediacorp also has a stake in Singapore-based retail firm Reebonz, one of the region's fastest growing luxury online retailers and a majority stake in Cubinet Interactive, a Malaysian digital games publisher.

column2: Winner of numerous international awards and accolades including Asian Television Awards' Terrestrial Broadcaster of the Year, Mediacorp’s mission is to engage, entertain and enrich audiences by harnessing the power of creativity.
